description:
Absolutely LOVED the vibe in this bar. Bookshelves everywhere, right up my alley. Great drinks, another score. Then good service and fun/friendly bartenders, win all around. 

Highly recommend if you are in SF. I went after a Giants game and had the best time. Will definitely be back next time I am in SF.
author: Cara B.

description:
Novela has aged well, and still has the same feel over the years. It's a bit inconspicuous from the street, but inside, it resembles a posh library, with literary drinks to match. The menu changes regularly, and on this occasion I got an Ellie Satler ($13) and Leopold Bloom ($12). Drinks are well prepared, and each has a distinct flavor. 

I wasn't a big fan of bourbon in one of drinks and asked to sub it for a scotch. Bartender said subs are not possible, because they use pre-made mixers for their drinks--- so they couldn't do it. Wow! A bit of a shocker here, but I guess it fits in with the theme and crowd of this place, which to me feels a bit mainstream and hits the crowds. 

Also surprising, all though the place wasn't packed there wasn't anywhere to sit. Most of the tables were filled, or reserved, and I ended up having to stand by the bar. 

Overall, I think this is a solid bar to visit if you are in the area and want a uniqely themed, and changing menu. Call in advance and get a reservation for a table!
author: James S.

description:
They had a salesforce event (free drinks) from 6pm to 9pm, and at 9:00pm I tried to order a drink with my credit card (attempt to pay), the server told me I could order in 5 mins. And then at 9:05pm I asked them if I could order drinks and they told me "no orders for 15 minutes."

I asked another server at 9:07pm and she said "we serve at 9:30pm."
author: Max M.

description: Been here enough times to know I like it!!! Depending on the night, it's a more pleasant experience. I like going to get-togethers at Novela. Lots of seating and it's super chill. However, I don't like the fact that you have to go to the bar to order food, and at the end of the night you have to go to the bar to close out. Weird much? Yea I think so too...
author: Ali R.

description: I come here often for work happy hours, and it's a really cute cocktail bar with delicious, novel-inspired drinks. My only suggestion is to MAKE A RESERVATION. This place is super packed all the time, and you will struggle to find even a place to stand if you come during peak hours. Otherwise - the drinks are strong, the servers are as nice as they can be for how crazy hectic it is in there, and it's a beautiful bar! Really it is a lovely place for happy hour (the deals are decent too), but it's so popular!
author: Alice L.

description: Super fun place to go for happy hour! My group made a reservation beforehand which is key since this place gets pretty packed during the week. I love the cocktails (like the Leopoldo Bloom) and their happy hour bites are great like the oyster Monday specials! I would definitely recommend this spot!
author: Helen F.

description:
My parents always told me to stop watching TV and read books as a kid.

So many many years later I decided to go to the local branch of the San Francisco public library to check out some books. It's been a long time since I went to a library, but I didn't know they had bouncers in the front now.

I walked in and ordered a large pitcher of the house punch to share. It tasted delicious at first with its special blend of 11 herbs and spices, and it was the right mixture of strength and sweetness. But something was off, it smelled like something was burning. Oh no, was the local library on fire?

Like a true hero I pulled out my phone to call 911, then I realized the smoky smell was coming from the pitcher itself. The secret ingredient was burnt wood, which they blended and mixed into the drink to give it the final smoky aftertaste. The drink was amazing up to this point, but I wouldn't recommend this one. Only you can prevent forest fires.
author: Wesley H.

description:
We came here on a Saturday night, and even at the most crowded there was still plenty of room to be comfortable. Granted, it was also Outside Lands weekend. The actually space is spacious with lots of seating and stellar decor. Even though they keep the lights dim you can still see who tf is talking to you.

The drinks though. Phenomenal. They take a while to make, so ordering was a somewhat slow process. But the wait was totally worth it, and that's not something I say easily. I got the Severus Snape, which had egg whites done right (creamy, not frothy, not heavy) and was topped with ground pepper. My friends got the Pippi Longstocking (refreshing) and the Jay Gatsby (for people who like the taste of bourbon)

Staff were also super helpful when I lost my bag. Overall, one of the best bars in SF I've been to and get the Severus Snape!!
author: Rachel L.

description:
My best friend and I stopped by here for drinks and appetizers before going to an event in SF. I really loved the ambiance of the place with the eccentric design. Novelas would not be complete without a library collection of books nicely arranged by color! I really enjoyed the rustic set up of the logs and wine barrels. Also, with the classiness of the chandeliers and zig zag flooring. There are chairs and lounging areas all over the place and the bar stool seating area. We opted for the high stools with the wine barrels serving as tables. 

I enjoyed my drink of the leopold bloom! Once our waitress had brought it out, I was mesmerized by the beautiful addition of the orange hibiscus flowers. The taste was divine with a great mixture of hibiscus gin, pineapple, mint, and grapefruit. It was more of a slushy consistency, but very refreshing and tasty. My best friend had the Sayuri, which was a nice blend of bourbon, miso, and plum bitters. The drinks were on the smaller side of portions and much pricer, but the serving and alcohol content were pretty good. 

We also had the Novela meatballs and habanero hot wings. I thought the appetizers were okay. The meatballs were warm and drowsed with red marinara sauce. The hot wings weren't too hot and it was more of buffalo style wings. They also have weekly $1.25 oysters! We grabbed about a dozen that came with different sauces and nuances, they were pretty good. The staff was pretty friendly and our waitress had checked up on us frequently. I would recommend if your looking to make a quick stop for some drinks while in SF.
author: Christine N.

description:
This bar is so cute! It's a book-themed bar, hence its name; their drinks are all named after authors/books/book characters, and the bar itself is decorated with shelves of books.

The ambiance is nice - it isn't too loud and there's a decent amount of seating. For large groups, there are comfortable booths and you can make reservations for them. 

I ordered the Pippi Longstocking, a drink off the seasonal menu. It's a bourbon based drink with rhubarb, thyme, strawberry, tonic, and lemon in it. It was really good! I usually don't like drinks that taste too alcoholic and prefer fruity ones, but this one started off tasting strong and ended with a fruity flavor. Definitely an interesting drink to try!

My friends ordered a 32oz pitcher of the House Punch (Code Hero). I had a sip, and it was the opposite of my drink, where it started off sweet and ended with a strong aftertaste (a little more on the bitter side). They split it among 6 people, and each person had 1-2 cups. 

Overall, this place was really cool! I've never been to a themed bar before, and the environment was a nice place to sit and talk to friends. Their drinks are pretty strong but taste delicious! I will hopefully come back to try more of their drinks and maybe some of their appetizers/bar food.
author: Claudia L.

description: This place is so pretty inside BUT super loud and the drinks weren't as strong as I'd prefer.
author: Diana L.

description:
Loved my happy 2.5 hours at Novela this past Friday!

Made a reservation via yelp a few days before, which was super convenient. I'm glad I made the reservation, since this place was crackalackin' on Friday afternoon.

It's very cute inside, sort of dark, but I love the book theme. My gal pals and I ordered the special slushee and some punches. I ordered the punch flight and loved it! Really good deal for $16. I ordered a full sized punch for only $12 after. We also ordered the cheese platter. Good cheese, not really enough bread to go with it.

Would definitely come back because it was fun and drinks were good. Love the glorified jungle juice
author: Julianne A.

description:
Novela exceeded expectations! Being new in SF, I am definitely not the go-to guy for bar suggestions. However, a friend was visiting and wanted to grab drinks after work, so he forced my hand to make the pick. Boy oh boy, did I impress (jk Novela and Yelp did all the work)!

The decor is beautiful yet casual, the cocktails were strong and creative, and the good vibes were flowing. Novela has handcraft punch on tap and to-go! This is a major game changer - you can even bring the party home if you wanted to. Novela was super packed during happy hour time but died down slowly throughout the night. The waiters were super nice, but attentiveness could be turned up a notch. The only other thing to note is that they do have a good bar menu for some small and large plates, but you're better off somewhere else if you plan to come for the food.
author: Claire W.

description:
If Ernest Hemingway were alive today, he would love this place. 
If you make reservations and time it right, it can be a great place for a date or after work meet up. 

I went on a Saturday night at 7:30pm. While everyone else was at dinner, I was sitting comfortably at a table, without any noisy drunk people around. 

Our server came to take our order and showed us the drink menu- most drinks are named after great writers or memorable characters in books. He also pointed out the Punch options available on tap!

My friend ordered the Jay Gatsby (from F.Scott Fitzgerald's "The Great Gatsby") which had Bourbon, Calisaya, Nocino, Amaretto, and Islay Scotch. 

I couldn't decide on all the wonderful punch options so our server recommended a flight. This suited me just fine. I ordered these 3:

Tequila: Mango, Kumquat, Blood Orange, & Lemon
Gin: Papaya, Raspberry, Chipotle, Bianco Vermouth, Orange, & Lime
Rum: Strawberry, Banana, Honey, Jasmine Tea. 

Each one was better than the next- but I loved them all.

The place was so beautiful- set up as a library with a bar in the center. It was dimly lit so it was a bit tricky taking pictures, especially since I didn't have a tripod. So it might be hard taking pictures here unless you want to use flash, which may not fully capture the essence of the place. But that's ok... It's a place to be enjoyed with the senses, not with a camera.
author: Mitzi G.

description: I was very disappointed in the customer service but the place is super cute and trendy. The cocktail selection is pretty cool. I loved the decor of the place.
author: Mia W.

description:
I dropped in here with some friends at the tail end of an otherwise great night, its bookish/literary image implying an intimate spot for a relaxed cocktail or two. The reality was quite different. 
There were lots of young urbanites trying to get lucky - not a problem as such, but it wasn't what we were expecting. 

I had a drink with miso (!) named for a character in Memoirs of a Geisha - it was pretty odd, served out of a tiny bottle with a flower poking out the top. Nobody else in my party was impressed with their drink. 

There was 90s rnb playing the whole time we were there, which was a fun touch. 

All in all Novela has a bit of an identity crisis. It might be great if you go in with the right expectations, but don't be fooled - it is not *actually* like a library you can drink in.
author: Sebastian M.

description:
Love the ambiance and drinks here! 
Cute decor and vibes.  They have different areas of the bar, great for large groups and intimate enough for a date.  My favorite seating is in the back, which if you want guaranteed seating, I would recommend making a reservation.  

They are known for their punch, and offer a flight.  The best thing about their punches, they offer every kind of alcohol.  Vodka, Bourbon, Tequila, Rum, and Gin. I hear it's good but I usually stick to the craft cocktails.  They have seasonal cocktails, which is nice because I come here a few times a year, and the menu is different.  

If you're a gin drinker, try the LEOPOLD BLOOM: Hibiscus Gin, Pineapple, Mint, Grapefruit.  It's not only beautiful but tasty.  For the Vodka drinkers, The MISS MONEYPENNY: Mulled Vodka, Drambuie, Pear Honey, Lemon is great.  It taste like the perfect  Hotty Toddy, but on ice.  Cocktails are between $11-13.  They also have some bar bites that look pretty tasty, but I have yet to try them
author: Adrianna P.

description:
Okay cocktails, a bit of slow service, but good fries. 

Went here for a work happy hour and liked the ambience and abundance of seating available.  The cocktail was good (I forgot what it's called, but it was frozen), but on the super sweet side.  I followed it up with a bottle of cider which was nothing special. 

What I really liked was the French fry. I unfortunately only got a single piece to try though.  Tried to order, but the bartender was super busy with mixing their complicated cocktails (reason for slow service) that I never got a chance.
author: Joanne T.

description:
Such a cool place, with books everywhere on the shelves and the cocktails being named after authors! The atmosphere automatically gets 5 stars, in addition to the craftiness of the bartenders. Like whoa. They know how to work it. They are SO fast, but so diligent in making every single cocktail. 

The only reason I would give this place 3 stars instead of 5 is because of the incredibly rude attitude one of the bartenders gave me and boyfriend. This couple at the bar just left and we were going to take their seats. The bartender then told us, "Get out of the seats, we need to move them to the back to the tables!". We were pretty shocked by this reaction, and were really confused because there were a few other people at the bar who had chairs. He honestly could have informed us in a kinder and more polite manner. My boyfriend was really pissed about this so he left a note on the receipt, "Ask your chair for a tip ;)". Unfortunately it seems like the bartenders share their tips, for we wanted to give the bartender who served us our drinks a much higher one, but she wasn't the one who gave us the bill at the end. 

This place is definitely a must to check out, and I really do want to go back there sometime. However, I hope I won't have to encounter what my boyfriend and I did last time.
author: Christina W.

description:
My husband is a huge fan of books and libraries and we'd been talking about coming here for a while. We absolutely loved the theme and the vibes/ambience here! It's definitely an insta-worthy bar but it tends to get full pretty early in the evening, so be sure to make a reservation! 

They have some original cocktails named after literary characters (which is pretty cute) and a number of beers both bottled and on tap, too--so no worries if you're not a big cocktail drinker. We unfortunately didn't have a chance to eat here this time around, so I've got nothing to say about the food, but the menu looked pretty sufficient.
author: Rie U.

description:
My friend and I had a Thursday reservation at 7:30pm to ensure we got a table (highly recommend doing this). It wasn't super packed, just an average kind of busy for an after work crowd, but super helpful we had the table secured. 

When we got seated, none of the waitresses paid any attention to us, even after repeated eye contact. It took me 15 minutes of waving them down for anyone to acknowledge us. This would've made more sense if they were busier, but they were just walking past us every time. 

We both got punch flights (you get your choice of 3 for $16): tequila, bourbon, and rum. The bourbon was our favorite, followed by rum, and then tequila. 

Atmosphere is nice, super loud like everyone else has mentioned, so not a good place to have a first date or anything of the sort. 

Overall, not a terrible experience, but probably wouldn't go back unless my company decided to have a happy hour event there or a friend wanted to go.
author: Jessica J.

description:
Drinks with a lot of alcohol that taste good: score! 

My friend Michelle and I got the: 

DR ELLIE SATTLER:

Jurassic Park, Michael Crichton (1990) $13Pineapple Rum, Agricole, St Germain, Lime, Orange, Sparkling Wine  *Served Frozen

^ HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

Your girl aka ME also got the chance to score free food here last night.

The back was reserved off for a private event (for a tech company) and these people asked if my friend and I if we wanted to sit in their area. 

^ Most of their co-workers had already left and there was so much food still left.

I got to try:

-mini mac & cheese: super good

-sliders: really good, and the tiniest pickle on top was just a nice touch

-bread: great

And the staff ended up taking some of the food back before the rest of those coworkers left. O_O
author: Lilian L.

description:
The door was broken and we couldn't open it from the outside and it was POURING rain.  When we finally got inside, the hostess looked as us like we were crazy .... and then 5 minutes later another employee arrived (guess what, she couldn't get inside b/c the door was locked) and she went straight to her tool kit to fix the door.  Known issue.  

We couldn't decide on which punch to get, so we got all of it and did a taste test which was fun.  The ones I ended up liking weren't necessarily the ones I would have ordered from the menu.  I like the vibe of the place and will probably try to go back for the Monday Oyster Happy Hour.
author: Kathleen W.

description: While the bar has all types of alcohol, Novela has a great list of signature cocktails as well as punch. I had the Alice White, which is gin-based and has a refreshing watermelon taste to it. Their menu has great shareable items; try the french fries!
author: Jeanette R.

description: Decent cocktails. I forget which one I ordered but it had Suntori bourbon and some plum bitters. It was a little sweet, but it was still good. We reserved an area in the back for our party and it was perfect since we were not fighting with the other patrons for a drink. Otherwise, it would have been a super long  wait for one.
author: Simon S.

description:
The drinks here were excellent. I got the Ana cubillas ($12), which is a must-try. Made with rum, ginger, coconut cream, cinnamon, clove, evaporated milk, and nutmeg, it is absolutely delicious. I love the coconut flavor and the ample cream added. The spices also complimented the creaminess well. My boyfriend got the Miss Moneypenny ($12), which had vodka, pear honey, and lemon. It was also good but a bit on the tart side. We also tried their wines which were not bad but not the best I've had either.

The ambiance is very cute, with many books lining the shelves and lots of comfy armchairs.
author: Amy C.

description:
This place reminds me of Paper Planes in San Jose! Awesome, unique cocktails, and delicious cocktails on draft as well.

Super chill vibes and seating if you get here early enough. Gonna be back soon!
author: Michael K.

description:
I came here with a friend and thought the bar was very well kept. Drinks were decently portioned, and the staff was extremely friendly. They also had a huge selection to choose from. 

The place is gorgeous, decorated with books along the walls. 
I was curious and wondered if the books were real. Turns out, they were! Their attention to detail is amazing here, from the drinks to the decor. I was a little drunk so don't remember how long we sat there, or if I was too loud or not, but I do remember the bar starting to clear out and staff didn't rush us out. Overall, a very pleasant experience.
author: Monica B.

description:
After having Novela bookmarked for over a year, I finally got to try it out. It did not disappoint!

The interior is super cool, quirky, and fun, and their menus are creative (literally and figuratively); they're bound as a book to stick with the theme, and both the food and drinks sounded great.

We popped in after dinner, so we didn't get to try the food, but we ordered a couple drinks -- Miss Moneypenny and a blue moon. The cocktail was great, and I definitely want to come back for more.
author: Nic Z.

description: This bar is simply stunning! Novels has plenty of sitting room, wonderful staff, great drinks, and they even have alcohol filled slushy drinks!! If you are ever in SF and want a cute, quiet, speakeasy vibe kinda bar, this is the place to go. All drinks are named after books too! I have been several times and each time (different days and different times) it has never been super crowded. The bartenders are super friendly and flexible with drinks. For example I went to the bar and asked for a light and refreshing drink and they delivered. This is also a great place to take some Instagram pics too for the socialites :)
author: Reena S.

description: Great place if you're going for a mellow night out. If you're into the fruity/refreshing thing, I recommend the Violet Beauregarde - a cute, pink concoction with just the right alcohol proportion.
author: Jen T.

description:
Novela, Novela! Tell me a story, why don't you? By the looks of it, you could tell me many stories! With all of those glowing novels that fill your walls, the possibilities are endless.

Sexy... elegant... beautiful! A wonderful time is to be had here at Novela! Walking in, you will instantly be struck by the beauty of its unique decorum. The walls are lined with bookshelves full of novels that are lit up by colorful backlights. Gorgeous chandeliers hang low and provide most of the minimal light in the dimly lit bar. 

The front bar is the star of show as it is strategically placed smack dab in the center of the room. High tables and chairs conveniently surround the outer perimeter, and there's a smaller bar located in a secluded area in the back with the most adorable booths and lounge chairs.

The cocktails are quite lovely! They change seasonly and are dressed to please the eye. Wine and beer are also offered as an alternative. They have a daily happy hour from 4-6, but you must come for the $1 oysters special on Monday! They also have a bar bites menu if you get a little hungry. The meatballs are divine and well seasoned, but I would pass on the Mac and cheese. 

This place gets busy in the evenings and during happy hour so if you're not sitting at the bar, be prepared to a wait a bit longer for service on busy nights. They have table service available if you don't want to sit at the bar counter. The bartenders are really friendly and they play an array of great music. Novela is a fun spot to get together with friends or even for an intimate date night. If you're looking for a great cocktails and a mellow time, I would highly recommend it!
author: Shayla B.

description: Charming Gatsby ambience lounge bar. Walking inside... Greeted with wood and gold and literary selection... Taking sip of classic mixology Leopold bloom was refreshing.  Cozy and upscale with friendly service. Posh ambience. Definitely speakeasy kinda night...
author: Wen L.

description:
Really cute book themed interior, delicious drinks and good service. The vibe is classier; the kind of place you'd go to just talk, not dance, and the prices reflect that. 

Nice bathroom too. I kept admiring the sinks.
author: Connie L.

description: Love this place, usually visit it every couple of weeks. Sadly it ends to get empty around 1-ish.
author: Jennifer F.

description:
This bar/lounge is my fave to go after work! Super chill vibes, good lighting, can get packed but dies down after a while. 
They always have drink specials on their menu, cleverly titled after books/movies and also to note, their decor of bookcases is so classy! 
Never tried their food, but top of mind on my next visit. Great place to have in the midst of a barhop around the city.
author: Julia T.

description:
Fun vibe with literature themed-decor as promised, and not too busy on a Friday night. The drinks were okay- the Leopold Bloom involved a lot of ice, but the bourbon/rum/gin flight was deemed good. Go for the ambiance!

Also note: reservations at night aren't really honored, since it was difficult to find the hostess and she just stuck us at the (closed) back bar.
author: Alice Z.

description:
Novela provides a unique concept for a bar and it extends beyond the name and the decorative bookshelves into their menu which consists of drinks named after literary characters.

The decor is not only different for the sake of being different but it actually works and it provides an upscale vibe to the place. I believe big tables only work with reservations but there is plenty of seating at the bar or at the small high top 2 person tables on the side. The bar itself is nicely laid out but probably the most efficient set up for delivering drinks. 

I've been here quite a few times and while the service has tended to be rather slow, it's always been positive and great. Their staff is friendly and knows how to make drinks. 

The drinks themselves are actually quite delicious and addicting and they make you want to try more of them. Their fun names also add to the intrigue. 

Overall, I'd highly recommend Novela for drinks.
author: Mario B.

description: The colors are vibrant and the cocktails are elegant. When you step into Novela it's like walking Into a library of liquor, books, colors, lights, chandeliers and more! I've only been once but I'll be going back again soon!
author: Lani A.

description:
Excellent! 

I went with my coworkers on a Friday for the happy hour. We got the Summer Slushie drink and it was a little over half of the glass. Literally like 5 minutes later, I saw the table next to us got the same drink and it was a full glass! So I asked the server about it and she was explaining that the bartender made extra and filled it up and It was accident. Ohhhhh that was an unacceptable excuse. I was not happy about it. But after few minutes, she bought us the extra! Thank you! This is what I called good services! 

The atmosphere is very nice, I love how they decorated the wall with books and the lighting! And the service actually made everything perfect!
author: Tammy V.

description: Fun decor but usually crowded after work which can make it hard to get a table. Drinks on the pricey side but that's the cost of drinking in downtown
author: Jonathan O.

description:
Nochellllllla weekend! It's been quite a few months since my last Novela visit. 'Twas a packed Saturday with all the Asians that don't Coachella! I was expecting a quiet night but nope!

Pros:
+ Hello flyyy Asians!
+ Bartenders are creative, made me something off menu
+ Security is always friendly
+ Clean and functional bathrooms
+ Next door to a 7-Eleven, late night noodz wassup!
+ Great music selection on a Saturday night (J. Cole!!)

Cons:
- N/A

I used to frequent this spot before I adopted the hermit life. Great spot for mixed drinks, a place to sit and lounge with friends, or to check out the crowd. I still feel like a baby when I'm here since the crowd is usually mid 20s to mid 30s. I might be in that age group, but...Asians don't raisin so haaaay! But the crowd can be a hit or miss. BUT tonight was happeninnnnnn! See y'all in a couple of months!
author: Fanny W.

description:
We came here for a coworkers birthday after the bar we wanted to go to originally was too jam-packed with people for us to comfortably move around in.  I suggested Novela because I had them bookmarked on Yelp for ages and it was walking distance from the other bar we were at.  Everyone agreed and we had a great time.  I wish it was possible to get seated at the cuter tables without a reservation, but we eventually took over most of the large community table near the entrance.  

I thought the service from the cocktail waitresses and the bartenders was great.  Really friendly and were working their butts off on a busy Saturday night.  I was indifferent with the bouncer (who honestly didn't believe my ID was me... give me a break bro, I'm 32 years old and I just retook my ID photo) and the hostesses.  The host/hostesses seemed to serve absolutely no purpose but to take up space by the door. 

Their drink menu was popular.  All of my friends were ordering punches and cocktails, but they were all too sugary for me and I opted for my alcohol plain. 

I also loved the interior decor.  Was classy but not obnoxious.  I also think they did a really good job at keeping the bathrooms clean on a busy night. Loved the sink.
author: Jessica F.

description:
Decent place. The interior is nicely decorated. The food menu doesn't have much options. The hummus plate wasn't that great/satisfying. It was a little overpriced for its worth. 

"Atticus Finch" drink was pretty strong. I enjoyed those. Drinks were good. Made strong per your request.
author: Cecile ..

description: I went here for the first time today with Z. He likes to go here for the Super Bowl. I kept avoiding it, but stopped by and I did like the atmosphere and interior. I had the pretzels and those were pretty good. I think this is a great place to hang out at and it's lively. Lots of screens and the service is decent and helpful.
author: Denise C.

description:
Wonderful bar from its interior decor to its refreshing cocktails. 

Novela...as if the name doesn't give it away, borrows imagination from literary works. The menu includes drinks named: Gatsby, Curious George, White Alice, Howard Roark...etc etc.

My favorite was the White Alice! Watermelon lovers, you're welcome :)
author: Emily T.

description:
I love this place for cocktails because they have seasonal cocktails as well as their staple cocktails. I am really missing the seasonal Howard Roark though, it was my favorite! I love that everything is so fresh that they use like the fresh fruit and fresh juices, it really takes the cocktail up  a notch. 

The service is a little slow even when they aren't super crowded which is probably the only reason for the 4 stars. If you are heading over during happy hour times be warned they get super crowded, I often have a hard time finding a seat during happy hour. 

I can not wait to try their Oyster Monday special, they have a buck a shuck, it is definitely on my to do list. 

The atmosphere is swanky and it is definitely a good spot to take a date for a before or after dinner cocktail. I love the couches and chairs that they have throughout the bar and the bookshelves and bookcases definitely add a nice touch to the overall ambiance.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Stopped by here to meet for drinks with friends in the city and was definitely not disappointed! SUCH a unique concept for a bar. Some might say it's... novel! Down to the clean and classy decor of books on books stacked on shelves to the cocktails named after famous novel characters, definitely worth a drop-by if you're nearby!

Environment can get a bit loud (as any bar does) but I was surprised since it appeared like a larger space but still somehow was super loud. Also not many tables unless you reserve a table prior. Totally can just chill at the bar though!

We ordered the Jade Whitehouse, Ophelia, Leopold Bloom, and Jay Gatsby cocktails. All cost around $11-$13.
Jade Whitehouse: Gingery, kinda watered down as you sipped and didn't taste strong at all 
Ophelia: YUM. Tasted like cranberry juice but richer in flavor. So fruity and sweet! 
Leopold Bloom: Tasted like a floral sangria.. but not my favorite... 
Jay Gatsby: Hella strong but surprisingly smooth! Perfect if you like bourbon! 

Overall would stop by again when I get a chance to!
author: Tina T.

description: I've been here a few times and have never been overly impressed, but the location is convenient and the decor isn't bad. Last night, I visited with a few friends and stayed for around 2 hours. Our bartender (I don't recall his name, but his hair was dyed red at the top), seemed annoyed every time we interacted with him. My friend ordered the first two rounds and then closed his tab. When we realized we wanted to order a third round, I offered to pay. When I handed my card over, the bartender made a point to say, "Do you want to leave it open or close it AGAIN?"  I made clear to him that I hadn't opened a tab previously. The comment was unnecessary and snide. Nothing amazing enough about this place for me to return again and be talked down to.
author: A J.

description: Fun bar we happened upon on our recent trip to San Fran. Large area with big bar on one side. Cool decor with books all around. Small high tops and tables lined around the bar. Drink menu was interesting. Spoke to the bartender who created the seasonal menu. Had cool whiskey cocktails that were very creative. Was packed during happy hour but started fizzling out before dinner time. Would definitely come back the next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Pavan P.

description:
Cute! Not spectacular.
Ordered a flight. Very strong drinks!
Went for happy hour - casual!
The atmosphere was 10/10
author: Nabiha J.

description: Very nice drinks and ambience. Good for conversations, talking to strangers, having group parties and just having a nice time. They sometimes got live music and/or rock theme.
author: Saumya A.

description:
Am I just catching on to this whole 'library' themed whiskey bar slash lounge slash bar?

...like let's not absolutely rid ourselves of real libraries but just recreate them, fill them with spirits of sorts and replace life with Microsoft and Macs. It'll work they said, and I'd have to agree that they were right. 

Preservation in its truest form.

The Battery set it off for me followed by MWL in Portland. The mystere (is that even a word) of the dark, glowy inset of couches, 'actual' shelved books and mood lighting all throughout is utterly romantic yet all the while comforting. Bar staff is pleasant despite my coming in at such a late hour - before closing. Beer on tap - enjoyed my Racer5, liqueur, wine and bar bites. Kitchen closes at 930p so be sure to get in here before that hour if you've got some cravings to quell. 

Most definitely making my way back in at a decent hour to try their food as well as to enjoy their fine library landscape. Maybe I'll wear my glasses next time, bring my backpack and a laptop - look a little studious since I guess bookworms are the business.
author: Cat V.

description: I feel torn about giving a low rating, but my personal experience turned me off.  I probably won't be returning.  As my cab drove by, I noticed the sophisticated exterior with a bouncer outside @ merely 5:30pm.  I thought it must be exclusive & swanky, I was intrigued.  Only to be disappointed by a crowded atmosphere that smelled as though I were walking into a locker room vs the posh lounge I was hoping for.  The atmosphere was extremely overwhelming, & I felt like I was roaming around at a party in which I knew no one.  I finally found the bar at the back.  The bartender was very polite & took care of my order.  I got the Leopoldo Bloom.  Very sweet, strong, & mostly ice...eh?  Under impressed
author: Joby W.

description:
Novela has an unique concept for their bookshelves decorations and drinks named after characters. Both their seasonal drinks and classic drinks are pretty good. Their seasonal drinks are definitely fun to try. 

During weekend nights, the service gets pretty slow as the bar is packed. Without reservations, it's also difficult to find seating at the bar and sofas.
author: Shelley L.

description: If you're ever here ASK FOR ANDRE! His old fashioned's are second to none! Will be back and will only have him make my drinks.
author: Ladan H.

description:
What a great little bar themed in books! The aesthetic of this bar is amazing! 

The service on the other hand was not so great. Upon arrival there was no bouncer so it was a walk in type of place. My party and I made reservations so we had a little corner with comfortable and stylish seating. The server had given us menus, but fail to realize that she gave us two menus with different drinks on it. Therefore, when ordering there was a confusion. Instead of looking at the wrong menu, which seemed like an older menu,  that she gave us she gave us an attitude and clearly stated that the items were not on the menu when clearly it was on one of the menu she gave us. 

The drinks took quite sometime to reach us and the quality is average. 

The ambience was intimate from the lighting. The noise level grows throughout the night. The bar space is quite limited but there seems to be ample
Standing room. 

My advice: come early for a guarantee seat!
author: Daw M.

description: Fun lounge to come together with friends. Food was pretty good ( small plates) and the pitcher drinks were out of this world. I think the bourbon was the tastiest. At 50$ a pitcher it better be! Facility is chic and clean- the servers were attentive and the night was fun! Good job. Highly recommend. Oh yeah.. love the bathroom wallpaper.
author: Eva C.

description:
Cute quaint place with books on the shelves and paintings of old authors.  The decor was nice and the place was ambient.

The drinks are named after authors or characters.  My friend and I tried the Raymond Shaw ($11) and we did not like it.  We thought it tasted like soap or perfume, yuck.  At one point, it straight up tasted like alcohol.  My friend loved the sphere ice cube with the flower in it, but the drink just wasn't doing it.  Though the ice sphere was nice, it took up most of the glass so we felt a bit ripped off.  I was disappointed so I went up to the bar to see if I could try something else instead or have some changes made.

The bartender was very accommodating and listened to my preferences.  I wanted fruity but not too citrusy.  He recommended the Alice White ($12) and the Corina Springfield ($13).  The Corina Springfield was actually one of our initial choices.  He allowed me to have a sample before pouring a glass of the frozen slushee.  This one tasted much better and was sweeter.  Thank you to the bartender for switching it up for me!

I've been back a couple more times and I feel like their service is good because they are always willing to make the drink to your taste.  I also tried the Hiram Bingham ($12), and enjoyed it!  My friends who tried it also liked it!  It included pisco and matcha!

3.5 stars if I could!
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
Really wanted to like this place. It's super cute inside- walls lined with books and wood logs, good crowd, positive energy, great music (though a bit hard to hear above the noise of the crowd). The drinks have clever book-themed names and sound good, but the two we tried were both bad. 

I'm pretty sure that they forgot to add the booze to my too sweet watermelon flavored Alice White. B tried the bourvon/amaro/cherry liqueur combo called Howard Roark and the flavors all just seemed to fight against each other in this unbalanced cocktail. 

Though I loved the scene, the drink quality just wasn't there.
author: Ryen B.

description: I was told by a friend that this was a must stop spot for cocktails and it delivered. Awesome charcuterie cheese board and wine to go along. Staff was inviting and the decor was beautiful. Prices were a little high but I guess that's the SF theme.
author: Jasmin G.

description:
I liiiiiiike it. 

Cozy atmosphere. Nice upholstery! 

Limited bar space, but who cares when you have a La-Z-Boy to sit in (or sit with, if you so prefer). 

Would return. I spent a portion of Super Bowl Sunday here, and while it's not a traditional sports bar, that's exactly why I chose it.
author: Spartevan V.

description:
Novela is an opportunity to curl up with a book in all the right ways: sipping carefully crafted cocktails in a warmly lit ambiance. Its a novel approach that combines sitting at home curled up in a blanket with a glass of wine and book in hand. Toss the book, order your drink, and find a new novel to read based on your order. If Amazon & ebooks are the new Barnes and Noble, Novela is the future Amazon of Goodreads. For banana and rum lovers, try the Curious George. For sweet & blended frozen drink lovers, try the Corina Springfield which has yummy fruity flavors like guava, apple, and lemon. Ok drinks, A+ aesthetic, ambience, and concept. 

Not novel enough to accept Apple Pay.
author: Amy D.

description:
I can here on a Saturday night to celebrate my partner's birthday! We originally had reservations for a table, but since we were in a rush (more events to go to) we decided just to stand at the bar.

This bar is super cool and enough room even though it was packed. The drink we had was beautifully presented and had great aromatics which I love! We'll be coming back with friends for sure!
author: Samantha L.

description: Looks fancy on the inside but didn't end up coming in because every table was reserved - seriously?? Came in around 5:30 pm on a Thursday night and there wasn't anywhere to sit so I left pretty abruptly. Don't come here unless you have a reservation I guess. I don't think I'll ever come back. Nobody helped us and crowd was pretty pretentious.
author: Hazel Q.

description:
Great Cocktail bar in SF

My friend lives at The Paramount which is down the street from this place. I went to go visit him and then hit up this bar at around 10 PM Saturday.

First impression. The Decor and lighting was astonishing. The place smells good and the vibe was very positive. Classy people here so it was easy to approach strangers and chit chat a little. The noise was average so you don't have to shout for someone to hear you. 

This is just a cool chill place to come and grab a drink and get to know your friends. And to get to meet new people, if you're like me, who likes to wonder off and start conversation with random strangers hahaha. 

Will definitely bring my other friends here next time I'm in SF.
author: Allen Y.

description:
This is a fun spot for a crowd maybe ranging from ages 25-35 if you have a job in the Financial District, coming from work to unwind, or are meeting and mingling with people you haven't seen in a while. 

I on the other hand, with my group of friends ranging ages 21-24, wasn't too impressed. It's a clean and lively place, drinks (according to my friends because I don't drink anyway) were okay but nothing mind blowing, and the staff was friendly enough. We had a Curious George (OK - just tasted like a glass of rum), a few Moscow mules (can't go wrong), two Raymond Shaws, and a few other fruity drinks that were OK. 

We made reservations around 10pm, arrived early and went to the bar, then we were seated in a half couch half lounge chair table area. There's nothing much else to say about this place besides it's a good place to take pretty photos, in my opinion. But of course, it's a different crowd this place caters to - people with FiDi type jobs.

Guess I don't fit in, but that's totally okay. I'd be more comfortable in a dingy bar or 3 star restaurant, and actually be able to snack on something past 9pm. (Yeah. No food past 9 here so eat before you go.) Not a bad place, but definitely not for everyone. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
author: Cassandra K.

description:
We've been dying to come to Novela for a much needed date night after reading all of the Yelp reviews.  Making a reservation was easy, and we were seated quickly upon arrival.  I LOVE libraries, and the library theme made it extra special.  

Although Novela wasn't recommended for the food, we opted to go here anyway for the drinks.  Because this was a much anticipated night out, we ordered based on yelp and waitress recommendations.

- Punch flight: I chose (you can pick 3), the house punch (whiskey), and the tequila and gin.  They were all really good, and my wife loved the tequila punch, but after the flight I ordered the house punch.  It had a "smokey" flavor, it was smooth, and the flavors mixed well.  The gin and tequila punch were also very smooth, but had more of a fruity taste.  If you're in a "fruity mood", I'd recommend getting one of these.
- HIRAM BINGHAM - my wife loved this drink, and it was her drink all night.  I took a few sips, it was sweet, smooth, and had a unique taste. The whip cream on top was a bonus, and the way it tasted mixed with the drink was extra special.   Definitely a must try! 
- Mushroom Croquettes - I don't normally like mushrooms, but I loved these.  They were crisp, hot, and delicious.  The sauce on the side just topped it off!
- Habanero Hot Wings - Nice kick, not overly fatty, and a little dry.  The flavor was good though, and the cream on the side offset the spicy.  Probably wouldn't order these again.
- DIY Spanish Tomato Bread - This was probably my favorite.  The tomato jam was amazing, and I loved how it was "DIY" so you could choose how much jam to put on the bread, and sprinkle just the right amount of salt.  The jam isn't like a sweet jam, it's more like a tomato sauce.  It's yummy.  My only complaint was that there was a lot of jam left over after the bread was done.  We were offered more bread, but the bread was thick, and we didn't want to get overly full on bread.  Boo.  Can crackers be an option too?  We felt so wasteful.  
- Truffle mac & cheese - we ordered this based on the waitress' recommendation because she said it was the "most popular".  I was thoroughly disappointed.  I'm pretty sure this wasn't supposed to be cold in the center, but ours was.  It was heavy, and very rich.  We couldn't finish it all, so instead we left our cold mac & cheese and opted for more drinks instead.

-1 star because we lost our waitress a few times and had to wait a while to order more drinks and get refills on our waters.  And, because the truffle mac and cheese was cold and underwhelming.  I should note that we wanted to stay and drink and eat more, but we didn't want more of any food on the menu after our first round.  So, we kept drinking, and then had to leave because we didn't want to carry each other home.  I wish they had a few more small plates to mix up the variety.

Final thoughts?  I'll be back because we dug the modern decor, trendy vibe, and the music.  The drinks were unique, and I'll be honest, I kind of want to try every cocktail on the menu (on separate trips of course).  The staff were super friendly and welcoming, and the seating was nice, especially if you have a larger group.
author: Ashley S.

description: Lovely bar with great drinks and a nice atmosphere. Wonderful bartenders who will tweak your drink until it's just what you like. I will definitely be back for drinks again!
author: Katrina J.

description:
ABSOLUTELY ADORE THIS PLACE! New hot spot for sure to bring friends for drinks!

PROs:
1. The ambiance and rustic decor of this place is above and beyond. 
2. I am a huge book nerd, so the fact that this place is covered wall to wall with novels in all colors is pleasing to the eye
3. The place is big enough to handle larger parties
4. Tables and seats to sit and enjoy your drink without a reservation
5. Their wine and beer selection is lengthy, but recommend a great cocktail from their special list
6. It is bright inside so it is easy to have a conversation with people
7. Perfect after dinner drink spot or a happy hour spot
8. Easy to get to from Montgomery Bart

CONs:
1. I wish there was one in Oakland, so I wouldn't need to cross the bridge to get to it!
author: Eunice Y.

description:
Drinks are okay and service is just alright but it's a spacious place and great for large groups. Lots of comfy lounges and seating. Conveniently located near Bart. 

Didn't have the most amazing experience but willing to give it another try if I am in the area.


Setting: date night
Day: Monday
Time: 9:30 pm
Music: 80s pop! Yes!
Service: okay
author: Song C.

description:
I've been to Novela a few times to grab a drink with some friends after work and the earlier you go, the better, especially if you want to snag a seat. The place really seems to start filling up around the 6PM hour where it's standing room only, and your drinks may take a little bit longer to come out.

It's a very roomy lounge with dim lighting and interesting decor to look at while your sipping your beverage. If you're on a time crunch, I'd recommend actually going to directly to the bar and ordering as they can get backed up if you order directly from a server. Because it's hip and a place that seems to be popular among the locals, I try to avoid it on the weekends as it's pretty packed with people. 

They have a good variety of spirits to choose from and their list of signature cocktails is nothing to scoff at. The Manhattans and Old Fashioned I've had here have all been great, and is definitely a great way to unwind at the end of the day or before dinner!

I haven't had their food, but the small bites coming out to the tables looked great, and I think I'll have to reconsider the next time I'm in the area!
author: Ryan C.

description:
Clearly they will not care about this review.
If they had any concerns about service, not customer service, just service, they'd have more then one server with an attitude.  
It's no wonder why so many restaurants come and go in the city.  They get hot for a minute and soon service suffers because everyone has an attitude.  Unemployment is so low in San Francisco, if you're not happy being a server, go find another job.
Life is to short to be doing something that you're not happy doing.  
It will be the owners that will suffer in the end, because the end will come if the service doesn't improve.
author: David E.

description: The first bar I visited in San Francisco. The bartenders were really great and so was the atmosphere. Bathroom was clean, drinks were good. Will definitely be returning in the future.
author: Chisom O.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night to celebrate a friend's birthday! The place was pretty packed by the time we arrived around 11ish but not so much so that it was obnoxious. I absolutely love the theme - the decorative bookshelf and the menu with the drinks named after famous literary characters is a creative touch. The drinks themselves were amazing, Paris Scott being my absolute favorite (mezcal, egg white, ancho reyes verde etc). Also tried the Cinderella which was a little too sweet for my taste and the Sam Spade which I enjoyed. 

10/10 would come back to try more cocktails! If only this place didn't close so early..
author: Chandani D.

description:
Great vibes - cool cocktail bar that didn't get crazy crowded but was packed enough to be fun. Reserved a space for my 30th birthday and was nice that friends could spill over into the bar area. Reserved lounge areas didn't seem hella exclusive which was nice. Solid energy, nice mood lighting, and the books decorating the entire bar gave it a chill vibe. 

Also - great cocktails with a variety of liquors. These are the main reason to visit! 

Pros:
Cocktails
Service
Bartenders
Vibe

Cons:
Lights on at 1:30 am
author: Vyshak C.

description:
I want to love this place... the theme books I love books! The location near BART stellar!
The service ?? Whomp whomp.... we waited a long time in the well (I set at timer) and when I asked the bartender if he could make my drink "less sweet" ( it had honey ) he said "no" we can't change any part of the recipe... isn't a craft cocktail supposed to be an individual choice??? Who cares anyway... we get our drinks and some douche bag bumps my friend and spills my friends drink all over my leg .. instead of apologizing he laughs and turns around when we flag the bartender he shrugs.. I tell him " I'm pretty sure you should make my friend a new drink since that guy spilled it all over my leg" and he did...
author: Angela W.

description: The best bar in SF. Awesome location for events at Moscone, happy hour after work, and only fun place in the neighborhood on Friday and Saturday night. Great cocktails. Cool atmosphere.
author: Sam B.

description:
The short: cool place for post-work drinks

I met up with a friend who has been here before. Head to the back to order drinks. The bartender handed out a drink list, though I got a non-alcoholic drink (don't know if it's on the menu or not). I couldn't hear what the bartender said, so I said yes to whatever she was about to make. The result was really good! The drink was a spritzy red drink with mild sweetness and a couple sprigs of mint on top.

The decor was really cool: color coded books and logs of wood underneath. We gazed at the massive three large black and white photographs occupying practically the entire wall.

Luckily, we were able to sit down on a couch. Otherwise, come early to grab a seat, though most tables are reserved.

Bathrooms were multi-use. Same sink area with individual doors to the toilets.

Verdict: wouldn't mind coming back
author: Catherine W.

description:
I first came to Novela with friends on a Friday evening, and as I'd expected, it was loud and packed with young professionals who'd come straight from work. Even so, ordering was a breeze; the bartender handed us a menu over the heads of the people sitting at the crowded bar. The menu had symbols next to each cocktail describing whether the drink was fruity, frozen/slush, or stiff. Based on the icons, I ordered a Jay Gatsby, which was bourbon-based and very strong--perfect for kicking off the weekend, if you ask me. We sipped our drinks standing up because it seems like most tables and booths required reservations. After one drink, we got tired of standing and shouting to each other, and went to a different, quieter bar so we could sit down, as no seats opened up in the 45 minutes we were there.

The second time I came to Novela, I made a reservation for Saturday at 6pm because I was entertaining some out-of-town friends and wanted to make sure we could sit. Wow, the vibe on a Saturday was nothing like my first experience. The place was quiet and mellow. The only people there were seated at a table or booth, leaving the place feeling very spacious. Our waitress was extremely attentive, coming by to take our next order right when we finished our current drinks. This time, I had the Leopold Bloom first. Though gin-based, it didn't taste like a cocktail at all. It tasted more like a fruit punch. My second drink was the Ms. Moneypenny. If you like sour citrus drinks, this is perfect for you. Our group also ordered a hummus platter to share. It came with some pita and vegetables to eat with the hummus.

I think Novela is a great place on the weekends if you like a low-key bar. Otherwise, come on a Friday night.
author: Yuki P.

description:
Drinks here are beyond expensive, though they have that cool designer feel to them that hipsters in the city love. The ambiance could be described as old-style sophisticated with a touch of new-school. It's almost speakeasy style. 

There are a ton of better places to spend your money and time than here, but for a large gathering of friends or coworkers, it's a good spot because it's spacious.
author: Jessica D.

description: I loved the ambiance, relaxed nature, and people are so dressy! Great place for lounging and small talk! :)
author: Ron M.

description:
Venue is pretty cool. Nice interior. Good vibe. Staff seemed a little over the place. Not very friendly but they def got the job done. 
Drinks were pretty good. Food was mediocre at best. Meatballs are loaded with fillers instead of meat, and mushroom croquettes came out barely warm. So overall, three stars for a "blah" experience.
author: Dave M.

description:
Awesome place in a location of over priced drinks. The average cocktail will cost you $10-$12 which is not bad for the area.
They also serve food until 9pm (I have yet to order food). The decor is decadent with a good mix pf people. I was there on a Thursday night and it was not overly crowded but enough to walk around without rubbing up against people.
I will be back!!!
author: Calvin N.

description: Nice speakeasy that's opened earlier in the evening if you want to stop by while avoiding crowds and reserved tables. We sat at a lounge chair area with a table and were waited on quickly by the server. I went with the seasonal drink that was similar to egg nogg but with even more alcohol. I also got the Leopold Bloom, which was refreshing and fruity!
author: Jen L.

description:
I am really sad to write this review because I really, really wanted to enjoy our outing to Novela... and I pretty much almost completely did, except for one problem... the place smelled like a sewer!!! 
So my fiancé and I came to visit the city for a long weekend away and we planned to meet up with a group of friends for drinks one night. I searched high and low on Yelp for a good place to meet up for drinks and was so excited to find Novela! It was cute, you could make reservations for groups, and the literary themed drinks just pushed it over the edge in terms of amazingness. When we got there they seated us right away, the server was a bit slow about refilling waters and getting us drinks, but nothing super serious. All the drinks were really good and the ambiance was great. 
Sadly about half way through the night, one of my friends pointed out a smell... having worked in restaurants in the past I immediately recognized it. It smelt like a dirty mop that they were using. I literally watched one of their staff mop up some stuff and the second the mop came near our table, it smelled SO bad. What was just a mild smell quickly became a severe smell. Then slowly it got a bit better, but literally we basically left and went to a nearby bar instead. Its a common mistake places make, using dirty mops, and when I walked over to the other side of the bar to go to the bathroom the smell was gone, but the entire other half of the restaurant was really, really bad. Maybe it was just a bad night, and if that is the case, I would highly recommend Novela to others, but it was really a big problem for our table and caused us to have to leave immediately.
author: Karen G.

description:
Stopped for a quick drink after work and I was pretty impressed with Novela. The first 10 minutes I struggled with what to pick. As person who is very indecisive, their menu didn't help because their creatively named drinks all sounded so good.

After time, I ended up choosing the Christopher Robbin. A play on gin and tonic and carrot juice. At first, I though the carrot juice would make it taste different, but I was hella wrong.

I don't know if it was the bartender or what, but this drink was so refreshing. 

Didn't spend much time here due to time, but I do see myself returning to try other signature drinks!
author: Adrian B.

description:
Hand crafted cocktails in a pitcher, aka grape Kool Aid back in the day.  Yes, it works, and I'll gladly put down my scotch to have another pitcher.

I came here to watch a game, but if people around me don't even know who Step Curry is, then they are either lost or drunk.

Good place to chill after work, don't miss out on the flight of punches.
author: Ron L.

description: Disgusting food... something was wrong with their crispy chicken sandwich.... it was rubbery and nasty.. no flavor but also texture was weird... ended up not eating it. It was also very poor service and just not worth it. The drinks were good but that wasn't worth the experience. It looks like a  classy place but really isn't... everyone there felt they were barely 21. Never again.
author: tinno A.

description:
Great spot for cocktails! Nice theme but like most places in downtown gets filled up and loud super fast on Fridays.
Worthwhile to make reservations if you are a small group of 2-6 people since the place is otherwise jam packed. Full points for decor and vibe though.
author: Ellie P.

description: You can never go wrong with choosing to have cocktails at Novela. The walls are surrounded by all types of literature and books. Yes, they are all real books. If you ever get bored, pull a book from the shelf and start reading...I doubt the boredom will arise though. Their seasonal and catchy names of their cocktails are always fun to taste and try. How clever?! The to-go pitcher of punches are always good for a larger party. There's one center bar and back bar. They have the usual drink concoctions if you choose to forgo what's on the menu. Try, go, and know what you want to order before heading to the bar. It does get crowded. It empties out around midnight. Always a great place?!
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description:
Swanky lounge. CLEAN. Not overly crowded or loud. (Wow, I don't really have to scream at the person standing directly next to me?!)

Decently priced and well-balanced cocktails. And a variety of different punches on tap? SOLD.

Crowd is about mid-twenties and fairly diverse both in terms of ethnicities and dress. Almost as 'LA' as you can get in San Francisco. Meaning.. wow, people actually dress up to go out here? Yes. Quite uncommon in the city nowadays.
author: Emily C.

description: I was so excited to check out this place, but I was heartbroken by the experience. I came here around 6 pm on a Tuesday after work. I stood at the bar for about 15 minutes until someone finally acknowledged me and took my drink order. Upon paying, I noticed a total charge well above my one drink: the barman swiped someone else's drinks onto my card. When I pointed out the mistake to the barman, he became irritable and antagonistic as though I was at fault. I refused to pay for anything at which point the barman grabbed my drink and spilled it out in the sink... Totally unprofessional and bizarre. I would never return and don't recommend anyone to try.
author: Maks Z.

description: Very cool interior and was pretty packed on a Thurs night, but I really was not impressed with my drink. I ordered the vodka punch on tap, and found it to be OVERWHELMINGLY too sweet- and I'm someone who generally likes sweeter drinks. After nursing it for over an hour, I couldn't bring myself to finish the sugary concoction. If I return, I will definitely try something else.
author: Catherine S.

description: This lounge/bar is super close to my workplace in soma. Pretty hasslefree, my teammate didn't bring his id and they let him in looking at his copies on mobile(thankfully) unlike another business which refused to let him in without a physical ID proof. I highly recommend making a reservation. However, if you r into last minute planning, then the bar area is always at your rescue. There are two bar areas, one with bar chairs which is at the very end of the lounge where we hung out. It's pretty cozy and really warm ambience. The music here is very mild, therefore gives u a chance to have conversations at normal decibel level. Haha. There was this one bartender named Terry who made our drinks. He was too good and very cordial!
author: Kalyani R.

description:
I liked this place. It was my first time here and we had a reservation so we easily got a place to park our butts after a tiring day. 

Their punches are good, do try the gin one , it's amazing. I also liked their white beer , it was pretty close to a belgian beer. 

The staff is nice, our server was hella cute and I loved her. The music was nice giving the whole place a nice vibe.

It's a nice place to chill with friends after work and to use as a pit stop before you head for dinner or your next spot.
author: Ramyata M.

description: Beautiful lounge/bar. Hundreds of books that are lit with different colors, hanging chandeliers, friendly bartenders and whimsical drinks that continue the book theme. My choice of read; "The White Rabbit" an excellent concoction of watermelon and spirit. Definitely a unique place to check out!
author: Allie P.

description: Hip, great drinks and can get loud. Take the time to call and reserve a table. Friendly service a plus!
author: Anthony P.

description: Super friendly staff. The perfect place to drop by if your in the area. Really cool vibe, ask for Dina if you drop by she makes a good strong old fashion and a tasty also equally strong naked and famous cocktail.
author: Michae A.

description: Enjoy some decent cocktails in a modern bar with an old school twist, alongside the rest of the fellow, fancy SOMA residents.  They have slushee machines which is totally random, btw.
author: Rob M.

description: Love this spot. Mainly because I live for alcohol and  charcuterie. Drinks are decently priced for SF plenty of seating if you arrive early. Parking is not available so best to take and Uber or walk. Will definitely return. They do take reservations so that's super helpful.
author: Michelle F.

description:
So Novela has turned into one of my consistent bars that I go to in the city for happy hours after work. It certainly helps that it is less than 3 blocks from my office. This is a great cocktail bar with a library theme to it with books all over the wall and little sections of the bar where you can gather your group of friends and all chat about life for a bit.  The joint itself is always packed during the week so make sure to grab a spot that will fit your group size as you will quickly run out of space. 

The crowd the ventures here is a good mix of financial guys, tech guys, and general start up guys which is what you would believe to be common for any SF bar but this joint seems to bring this consistently where as other bars may be hit or miss based on the night. This is a solid/classy bar to hang out and the drink selections are plentiful so you will have no problem finding a solid drink. The bartenders are on point and extremely friendly without being snooty like some cocktail bars can be. This is also a bar where I have seen people dressed up but also dressed down with no one batting an eye. This is a great bar to pick up a few drinks no matter the type of night and enjoy with friends.

This will continue to be one of my "go to" spots in the city.
author: Dan M.

description: Some of my best nights were at Novela...  Sexy, Sheek, Great Gatsby- Library themed bar.  The drinks are creative and the crowd is cool.   But my favorite is the location.  It's located two doors away from 7/11.  After a couple of cocktails, i find myself at 7/11 ordering up a pizza, chicken wings, or a polish dog.  The toppings, cheese and chili are all free.   No better way to end the night than hopping into Uber with a handful goodies!
author: Melanie N.

description: Clean , cool , trendy space - strong kick-ass punch. Takes reservations, great food too ! what more do you want? the tequila punch is a little sweet for me but everything else is great
author: Anju J.

description:
This place is definitely great at making drinks that taste like juice, but leave you buzzed. I recommend ordering two flights of their punch on tap in order to try each drink.

The ambience is pretty good, it's a big open space with colorful lighting that's not too garish/distracting. The furniture is cute and funky, and if you have a large group, you can ask to reserve a corner of the place to yourself. It's perfect for lounging with a group of friends who just want to sip on cocktails and make small talk.
author: Sao B.

description:
Beautiful, spacious, and classy looking place, complete with chandeliers and fake bookshelves. Great for get togethers or birthdays.

In this case, I was here for my friends going away party. We had a reservation for about 10 and had a nice cozy booth to ourselves. 

Drinks were okay. We ordered a punch pitcher which was surprisingly good. The drink that I expected to be good, the Leopold Bloom, wasn't that great and tasted pretty strong.

Service was okay, and I would come again.
author: Corinna T.

description: Love this bar! I came here on a Friday night for a quick drink and it really reminded me of the bar scene in London as it was quite nice. A lot of tables were reserved so we ended up asking the hostess if we could sit at a table until the reservation came up and she said yes which was great. We didn't try the food but we did get a few drinks and I loved my Moscow mule so I'll definitely be coming back here.
author: Mira B.

description: Right when you walk in, the upbeat energy is pretty present. A large area with plenty of seating and very clean bathrooms. Our group grabbed a table towards the back. Really nice decor, bookshelves everywhere, strange wallpapers, and every imaginable type of wall covering you can imagine. Service was decent, but we got drinks and headed to a table so not much interaction. I do imagine this place to be very hipster-ish. 3 stars are really because on a Friday night, I don't want to be sitting at a sad little bar with a few people. This place was packed, which just makes me feel better inside. Pricey just ok drinks.
author: Anjelica C.

description: I've been to Novela many times but never have I had cocktails that were so cloying sweet there before! I had the Leopoldo Bloom and then some gin drink that has watermelon in it. Both were just way too sweet for me.
author: Hayley H.

description: Good drinks and good atmosphere. Nothing super special about the place escape the good service and the clever names for the drink. Solid choice for a weekend spot.
author: Sarah W.

description: Went here for drinks before dinner and we loved it! The cocktails were delicious, strong and unique. Love the book decor and lighting. Buzzing with energy! The bar was a little understaffed - there was only one girl for the entire thing - but she was so nice and apologetic about the wait that it didn't make too much of a difference to us. Would definitely go back!
author: Alexa S.

description:
Making a reservation for a group was the best decision ever! Highly recommended if you want to be able to sit down. 

The place is classy and I love the book decorations. Parking is difficult- take a an uber/lift. 

The place gets pretty loud!
author: Leandra D.

description:
The Good News: Novela has (or had - due to their ever-changing menu) a drink named after my favorite fictional boyfriend, Severus Snape. 

The Bad News: It has a very strong pea-flavored base. 

So I had to spend the evening with Frank Carmody instead. It's okay though, he was an alright date - though he lacked the dark sarcasm and brooding presence of my dear potions master. 

Novela is sexy, if it were a library it'd be the kind of library that begs for you to sit and read in your Louboutins and red lipstick. It can be a bit crowded and rather loud but if you can find one of the sofas to sit at with your friends you'll do alright. It also seems like the type of bar that is great for meeting people either in groups or even singles if you're looking. Despite the busyness, my group didn't wait long for our drinks.
author: Amanda I.

description: The atmosphere is great; very unique looking place. Got here around 8:30pm and luckily found seating, but started getting really busy half an hour after. The drinks were great, I had the "Miss Moneypenny" which consisted of Mulled Vodka, Drambuie, Pear Honey, Lemon.
author: Adrina A.

description: Could I just live here? The theme and decor was just fabulous. Can't wait to visit again. The staff was accommodating and our event was perfect. Thank you for a wonderful time!
author: Jen G.

description:
I wish I could rate zero star. Totally judgmental waitress who says rude things to customers who tipped more than she deserved. Bad vibe and bad service. 

Totally offensive!

Drinks are ok.
author: Austin J.

description:
They have a great decoration, music in the background, full bar and some special cocktails. 

I wish the music were louder.. you only hear people talking, but I guess is more a talk place than a party place.

They have manly kinds of cocktails and also a different section with "Punch Cocktails".

I tried the deal of 3 small punchs for $10/$12 (don't remember exactly). 
They are very particular cocktail with vodka, Rum, whiskey..  each friend had a different opinion about the taste, but is definitely not our favorite drink in the Bay Area. Even though I love strawberry and Rum, I thought too sweet the Strawberry Rum Punch.
author: Renata S.

description:
Amazing lounge with really nice settings and ambience! All the books along the wall! 
All the drinks are really nice: we ordered a punch flight (seems like the menu changes regularly?), and Leopold Bloom. Love the punch flight! Recommended if you are not sure what to get! Not all of the punches are fruity (some are, and those are our non-alcohol drinkers' favorite :P), and the flavors are very distinct!
The bartender is pretty friendly and patient. 

We left before it gets crowded (around 10pm), but the noise level is still acceptable, though seats are running out. A very nice place to catch up with friends!
author: Ya K.

description:
Cool little place for craft drinks.

Nice feel to this place. Bartenders were attentive. Drinks were great. The decor revolves around books, which was cool.

I think their drink menu changes. So I can't really remember what I got, but it resembled a Manhattan.

Great place to unwind.
author: Sedine S.

description:
This place is very spacious, with two bars and large booth areas. Upon entering on a Friday night, the place was packed at 7:30pm. If you plan on showing up with a large group, you can book a reservation ahead of time. Highly recommended. 

The back bar is smaller and has only hard alcohol and wine. Draft beers are only at the main bar. I was not aware and stood in line at the back bar, but the bartender was kind enough to go grab the beer from the main bar for me. Cocktails are $11+ and beers are $5+. Expect a long wait to get a drink as most people order cocktails. I had the Boont Amber Ale, so I don't know how good their cocktails are. They also have bar bites if you are hungry, but it is a bit pricey. 

Decorations are really cool. The walls are bookshelves with books arranged by color. Lights shine directly on the books, creating a glow from the novels. They also have fancy looking chandeliers. It's definitely a modern, trendy feel. They have several single room unisex bathrooms and a modern style automatic sink area. It's slick and clean. Overall, a nice bar to chill at.
author: Julia K.

description:
Let me start by saying WOW. I was a bit skeptical about about this spot. I visit the Bay Area a lot and thought that this might be your typical San Francisco cocktail bar.

I was visiting from Los Angeles. I went with my gut, and gave it a try. We first got approached by the manager Abigail. She was attentive and helpful!  She just so happened to be from Los Angeles. Connection instantly - not bias, promise! Anyway, I love bourbon , so she recommended the house old fashioned, which was delicious! 

Customer service is everything. Deena was our bartender and all of our drinks were incredible and poured just the right amount. Not only did she make great drinks she was super personable and informative. We had a great time hanging with her. 

I recommend this place! We will definitely be coming back in the future. 5 stars from me!
author: Melissa S.

description:
Great place for Thirsty Thursday's. It's crackin' but not ridiculously over crowded. 

Love the dark and sexy ambiance. The walls are lined with books. 

Nice place to lounge and have a specialty cocktail to socialize and meet with other young working professionals in the city. 

My gf's each ordered something different. Can't remember the names but we sipped off of each other's and all was good.
author: A Z Flor H.

description: Love! Came to this bar in a group of 3 on a Saturday night in December. Drinks were of good quality, great service and trendy decor and ambiance. We had no trouble finding a place to sit. Music was also good, lots of old school R&B if you're into that.
author: Abby K.

description:
This is one of my go to bars in the mission district. It's nice for lounging with drinks and catching up with friends.

The drinks are just okay, none of the really stand out to me. Most of them are loaded with tons of ice and syrupy sweet which I'm not too fond of. 

I love the decor and the music they play! They usually play I bunch of 90s throwbacks. 

Bathrooms are clean and that's always nice. Bartenders are just okay. The ones I encountered are not the nicest. 

DO NOT get the Leopold Bloom. It tastes like straight up robitussin cough medicine. Unless you like that. Then get that.
author: Leah A.

description:
Novela is a great spot right in the heart of the Fidi.  It's a large space with seats at the bar and plenty of tables all around, and a smaller bar in the back that can be used for a private party in the corner.  The decor is awesome, the walls are lined with books, it's funny reading the book titles and seeing the classics next to a cheesy romance book or something.  The lighting is low but not so dark that it's annoying.  I can't recall if there's music or not, but that's probably a good thing as it means it wasn't drowning everything out.  We can actually hear each other talk.  

Excellent drinks and food.  Mostly smaller plates, but you can have a couple to make a meal.  I've had a great salad, meatballs, cheese plate, and a few other things.  Excellent service as well.  


I had a birthday party there.  Abbey helped me with all the details.  It was perfect!  She set us up in a large, semi private space in the back where we had access to a small bar right there.  We had plenty of seats and tables for food.  I ordered some platters for sharing and everyone got their own drinks.  I didn't have to pay a deposit or a bar minimum or anything, we just paid for what we had.  The large cheese plate and a couple of smaller apps were perfect for my group.  The service was awesome!  They checked with me often to make sure everyone had what they needed and were around for any orders that were needed.

Definitely check it out for after work happy hour or call to book an event!
author: Stephanie J.

description:
Novela was my go-to spot when I used to live in the city. I'm surprised how much it has changed. First of all, their bartenders were not friendly and inattentive. We waited over 10 mins to order our drinks and none of them gave us any eye contact nor acknowledged that we were waiting. The bartender ended up helper the girl next to us who came after us. Even she knew that we've been waiting before her and asked him to take our orders first. 

The drinks are not as good as before. My friend got the vodka punch on tap and it was too sour. It tasted like a strawberry lemonade but more lemon than strawberry. I went with the classic Lolita because you can't go wrong with that.

They also have a dance floor now. They were playing mostly 80s music. I miss the old vibe at this place where it's more chilled.
author: Maggie L.

description: Love this place! Amazing cocktails and service. The ambience is gorgeous and the crowd is classy, yet fun. My favorite spot in SF!
author: Ashley F.

description: Novela's a cool bar! Even though I did poorly in high school English and was never a big reader, I know a good cocktail when I drink it. And drink, I did! My only beef with this place is that it gets packed sometimes, which sort of ruins the whole "intimate library" motif. On a busy night you and your friends will probably have to stand. But at least you'll be standing with some damn good drinks.
