author: Shawn W.

description:
Cute bar with well made cocktails! It can get crowded late at night on the weekends, but still worth checking out! Love the themed drinks, and the prices aren't too high. 

They also serve light bites until 9pm.
author: Noelle H.

description:
-UPDATE-: Novela's gracious GM Suzanne contacted me regarding the overcharge and offered to refund our whole transaction. I really appreciated them reaching out and making a point to make the situation better. 

--
Beautiful bar, delicious drinks, creative menu, helpful and attentive staff. Okay, now that I've gotten through all the great things, let me talk about the one thing that caused me to give this a 1-star review. 

My friend and I went in early October last year and had a great time. The total came out to about $36, and we split the bill. No worries, they can do it! Wrong. I was charged $18 on my card TWICE. My friend was charged $18 on her card once. I called them at least 4 to 5 times, but there was no response (I called during the day as well as during the night, but assumed that they would be more attentive in the afternoon or just as they opened because people were just starting to come in). 

I just feel like it wasn't fair for us to have to pay 1.5x the actual bill, and then not have anyone contact us back. I'm over it now, but saw the bar pop up on my Yelp feed and had to post a review. 

Buyer beware -- keep your receipts, check your bank statements! This may have just been a one time incident, but it can happen to anyone. 

If I do end up going there again, which doesn't seem likely, I will definitely be paying with cash.
author: Swaja K.

description:
So unfortunately, this bar has good cocktails, but horrible service and customer control. They allow so many people to stand in the well with their drinks that it's almost impossible to find the order "line" and the bartenders have absolutely no clue what's going on. 

Once I was finally able to get a bartender's attention, I asked if there was simple syrup in one of the mixed drinks, a Violet Beauregard, and he responded with a tort, "I don't know. We can't change our drinks, so whatever you see on the menu is what you get." I ordered the drink anyways and decided to risk having an overly sweet drink. Luckily, it wasn't too sweet! It was actually an excellent drink. But after my first sip, someone behind me knocked into my back and spilled half of my drink. 

Neither the guy nor his friends apologized for bumping into me and the bartender I told about the situation responded with zero emotion and did not remake my drink. 

So unfortunate.
author: Jeff W.

description: Super awesome looking bar. The books on the walls is a nice look and provides a relaxing setting. The books are all real which adds a great feeling to the atmosphere. The drinks all looked super fancy. I didn't even want to drink them. The taste, however, was just okay. They were either too sweet, or tasted way too much like alcohol. I felt like there options needed a bit more balance.
author: Amanda S.

description: Good ambiance, very casual. Nice location in the city close to Yerba Buena Gardwns and the Metreon. Met there for a date at 5:00pm on a Thursday. Worth making a reservation as the open seating fills up fast. Awesome drink menu with mostly cocktails and fun names. I had the Severus Snape and my date had the Jay Gatsby. Definitely would visit again.
author: April A.

description: TALK ABOUT STORYBOOK BAR. It's like if i were to have "a study," I'd aim for it to look something like this. Maybe without the colored lights shining on the books but it is so on point. It is super packed if you're trying to go on a Friday night - so keep this in mind. Basically - packed to the door, drinks spilled everywhere, broken glasses (which gets cleaned up really, really fast. You'll hear the point of contact, the shatter, but you won't see it unless you're the one who dropped it. They are that fast). Customer service - they are quick but they really need more people to help out because it's some fast paced, high capacity stuff. The drinks have cute little names and look cute as well!! But don't be fooled, they are indeed alcoholic beverages!
author: Kimm H.

description: Tasty drinks and food! I liked the atmosphere but I have to admit that the music was too loud to have a conversation! Nice people on staff and interesting drink cocktails.
author: Tram L.

description: Such a cool spot if you're looking for unique drinks! My boyfriend got the drink that most resembled an old fashioned, I think it was the Jay Gatsy, and WOW that was strong but delicious!! I got a drink with gin, egg whites, lemon, etc. in it but I'm unsure of the name. Both were awesome but super strong! The price obviously being in SF was pretty high but worth if you want to try a unique drink! Definitely recommend coming here. We didn't have a reservation either but they had an empty table and sat us down anyways. Service was a bit slow which was why it was 4/5 stars. Will be back!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Awesome service. I complained about getting double charged, left a voicemail didn't hear back so I emailed them and they were on it ASAP. Manager was super quick to respond and resolve. Great customer service!
author: Marie D.

description:
Props on the real books! As a literary lover, I was immediately drawn to the decor and also The Raven artwork in the restroom. 

Novela is definitely swanky with major LA vibes and also definitely on the pricier side. I had a Miss Moneypenny and our group split a pitcher but all the drinks were a bit too sweet for me - I wish they had more of a punch. They do have interesting drink options though, so it's a great place to lounge if you can get a reservation.
author: Amanda K.

description: I live right next door and always love coming in or bringing guests from out of town to sip fancy cocktails. The bartenders are talented and often times have wonderful suggestions on what to order. They keep their menu fresh with seasonal artisanal cocktails. Love love love the decor. It is much larger inside with ample seating than you'd suspect just walking by. Staff is delightful and friendly, atmosphere is chill and relaxed with low lighting.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Upon walking into Novela, you welcome yourself into a fancy, upscale bar. There's definitely a Vegas vibe mixed with the walls of books from Beauty and the Beast --very elegant and enchanting.

I met up with an old high school friend here and thankfully, she made reservations so we had somewhere to sit and chat. I'm so thankful that she did because otherwise, we'd be standing around. Although there's a variety of specialty drinks named after literary characters, I opted for my go-to Jameson and Gingerale. The servers are incredibly attentive and coming back to refill your drinks, which also led me to one too many drinks here for the night.

This is a lovely spot for meeting up with friends or date. I'd love to return and try some of their specialty drinks next time though.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Have walked past this place a million times and never stopped in before last night. Such a fun bar with a really wide cocktail selection! As the name suggests, this place is literary themed, with drinks named after characters and authors. I was with a large group so we made a reservation which seems to be your best bet if you don't just wanna chill at the bar. 

My favorite thing here is that they have six different alcoholic punches on tap. Sounds weird, but the vodka punch was so refreshing and good that I got two. 

Heads up on the unisex restroom, and enjoy reading all the book spines that are decking the shelves. They organize the books by color and it looks super cool. Can't wait for another chance to go!
author: Kristen T.

description: I love the interior and the ambiance at Novela and the service is good too. The food is just so-so and a little more on the expensive for what you get. We tried the cheeseboard. We did enjoy the cheeses. I think it was blue, Brie, and manchego. They were strong in flavor, which I love, and they came with a good jam. I didn't like the bread it came with though. The bread was super soft and on its own, would be good, but it doesn't pair well with cheese because it's too soft and just blends with the texture of cheese. Crackers or a bread with more texture would pair better. The hummus chicken wings were just mediocre and the pitta bread served with the hummus wasn't soft.
author: Lexi R.

description:
UNIQUE DRINKS!

This is one of those bars where they are "mixologists" rather than bartenders because they got a unique set of drinks here! 

2 drinks came to be around 25+tip. Which is LA standard and a little more expensive than Temple Nightclub; but it definitely earned it! The drinks are pretty delicious the vibe is nice. (Not really a dance bar) and I liked the fact that people dressed up because it does feel like SF does not dress up as much as LA.
author: Anh L.

description:
The decor was not as cool as I thought it would be. Sure there's open space for standing it wasn't too busy on a Friday night around 8PM. Tables were packed of course but only lined against the wall so naturally you mostly need to stand and talk unless you make reservations.

Personally just wasn't impressed. It seemed like some pseudo experiment between upscale bar and library? Lol, I didn't really enjoy it that much.

although bathrooms were clean and general bar is clean.
author: Mimi T.

description: Have been here several times, for both alumni event & hanging out with friends. Usually I don't like cocktail but they have some good ones
author: Lily Z.

description:
Lots of yummy girly drinks. Doesn't take long to get a drink, either. 
Don't think there was music here but it's really nice and chill inside
Young group of people vibe. 
Not so much of a "date" place in my opinion. I'd rather come here with a group of friends.
author: Amy V.

description: I came here with my sister who was visiting from out of town. Since we're both major book nerds, we were pumped about the premise -- cocktails named after authors and books! Whee! When we arrived, it seemed to be mostly an after-work crowd...lots of business attire and business talk around us. We enjoyed the book themed decor and menu, and the bartender was very gracious even though he was slammed. Points off because it was super noisy (we could barely hear each other talk!), hard to find a seat, and our $12 small plate was reallyyyy small.
author: Sara F.

description:
Novela is probably one of my favorite lounges in the city.  The crowd can vary depending on the day and the time of day you go.  I came here on Halloween with a self drawn face mask that was pretty awesome if I say so myself.  I came here for a fund raising event where I met some pretty cool people.  I came here on random Friday/Saturday nights and the crowd was always diverse, mature, and classy.  Some friends dislike this place because they feel the crowd can be somewhat bougie but I never got that feeling.  

The cocktail drinks are good, says my friends.  I like my beer.
author: Linda N.

description: Great spot!  Our bartender. This shorter gal was awesome.  She was fast and real good.  She was very clean, always washing and cleaning.  The drinks were original and fun to try.
author: Dorothy G.

description: I am not sure what the bad reviews on customer service are about. The Novela staff (hostess, server, bartender) really went over and beyond to provide us with the best experience. The drinks were interesting, aesthetically pleasing and moderately priced for the city. The bar is gorgeous but the service was actually what stood out the most. Thank you Novela!
author: Gracie A.

description:
Very cute bar in Union Square! I lovvvveeee bars with a theme, so Novela was the right place for me. :) Novela is a book-themed cocktail bar, it is absolutely adorable because they have hundreds and hundreds of books along the walls and the books are all lit in different colors, making them look really really pretty. 

They have a huge menu of cocktails, all of which are inspired by characters from specific books. Each cocktail is named after a character, says what book the character is from, and is made from ingredients what they believe the character would like or what destined the character! I found this extremely creative and cool. 

If you would like to get a table for a group, I would recommend calling a few days in advance and booking that because they do get quite busy on weekends after 10:00. The vibes are great here and I always have a really fun time everytime I go! There is not really any dancing, but it is a nice place to catch up with friends and have a great drink too!
author: Anisha K.

description:
I love the literary theme of Novela and that they have seasonal drinks to keep the menu fresh. The drinks have never disappointed, including the Esteban Trueba (from Isabel Allende's House of the Spirits), which made me laugh to myself because it's served in the same Tiki style mug Pagan Idol uses.

It's definitely more of a happy hour joint, and clears out earlier than most bars. During happy hour Novela is usually pretty crowded and loud, but not so much that you can't still have a conversation and a good time. Unless you're stalking the bar to swoop in, don't expect to get a seat but you can make reservations for a table.
author: Cristina S.

description: This place is so incredibly beautiful and well themed tons of books lined up on every wall cascading in rainbow colors. You will LOVE it here if you are a book worm or just looking for an aesthetic place to get drinks. I came here on a Wednesday night with a group of ~8 people. There was plenty of seats at the bar and tables. They have a wide selection of drinks - with cocktails ranging from ~$10-$13 dollars. The bartender was friendly, quick and fast - with a remarkable memory!! She took like 6 drink orders at once. I was pretty surprised. I ordered from their main cocktail menu and ended up getting the "Jade Whitestone" for $10. It was a very sweet drink, I couldn't really taste the alcohol.. which I personally like! There were a bunch of other drinks that my friends also got - like the "Jay Gatsby", "Curious George", and "Alice White". The Curious George drink had a really weird consistency - because it does have bananas in it - but defiantly an interesting drink. I think they also have a different slushy special every night too, the day I went it was a "Jack and Coke" Slushy for $9! Overall, loved thought this place was a very cool, and relaxing bar.
author: Anna L.

description:
Novela was recommended as a post-conference option, so a friend and I ended up there this past Saturday at around 6:30.  At that time, it was about 1/3 full but all of the non-reserved tables were already full.  We were able to score a comfy table, though, and the servers were friendly and incredibly helpful.

I ordered the Scout Finch (being a sucker for anything law-related) and my friend had the Leopold Bloom.  Both went down easy--maybe too easy!  The music was not so loud so as to make conversation difficult, and as folks have noted the library decor made things comfortable.  We split the charcuterie plate and the waitress was kind enough to find us extra toast for the chicken liver mousse.  

4 or 5 texts later, in rolled about 5 other women from our group, and the Novela team helpfully accommodated all of us.  About 30 minutes later, we were joined by at least 3 of our party and yet the Novela team acted with grace in making us remain welcome.  So my hats off to this wonderful bar for their flexibility in making a traveling working girl feel comfortable in San Francisco!
author: M.J. C.

description: Have been here several times for work happy hours, and love the ambiance inside. It is pretty loungey. Drinks have been pretty good, but food is ehh and small portions.
author: Shabnam E.

description: Adorably themed place, very original. If you are looking to have dinner definitely make a reservation. I went here with a coworker at 4:45 and within 30 minutes the place was packed. We sat at a high top table (which I found to be extremely uncomfortable, but I'm really short). Thankfully the service and the food mostly made up for it. We both got the lamb and beef burgers and they were fantastic! The sauce that goes on them is delicious, you may want to ask for extra like we did. They came with what were supposed to be spicy potato chips, but they fell short. As others have said drinks are great. I would go back again just for that burger.
author: Lori M.

description: Lovely place! We reserved an area a day ahead and needed to add more people. I called a few hours before and they were able to modify it. Great place to (somewhat) talk. However the night we went there were some wasted people who threw up all over the restroom. It was dirty for the rest of the night
author: Nancy V.

description: Decor is nice, and service is good. Atmosphere is alright, cocktails are too sweet with a lot of overlapping flavors from cocktail to cocktail. There's complexity in the layers yet always seems to infuse a big vanilla, honey like note.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Love this spot!  Came in here for an early drink (or two) on a Saturday, and was very impressed.

Because it was so early (around 5PM) we were able to easily get our own table tucked away against the wall of logs and books.  The whole ambiance of this place is what really won me over, aside from the cocktails being fabulous.

You can tell the drinks are handmade with care, and they're appropriately named to match the theme (there's even a drink called the Holden Caulfield!).  I preferred the ones that were less strong tasting (denoted on their menu with a special symbol), and my boyfriend ordered the ones that had more of a kick (denoted with a different symbol).

I think between the two of us, and our two drinks each, we spent around $50.  This was pretty reasonable considering we left pretty happy and didn't feel like we'd wasted our money on weak cocktails.

We were very well taken care of, and I don't know if this was just because the place was empty.  I would love to come back here with a small group of friends to have some drinks a bit later in the day to see what it's like!
author: Kenna H.

description:
Very cute spot although the theme isn't that strong, aside from decor and some aptly named drinks. They have great punch here and you can get a big pitcher for the table. 

My personal favorite was the $1 oysters though. Sure, my drink was good, but it wasn't so special. I loved the Monday oyster happy hours! The oysters I got were pretty small yet they were delicious and oddly creamy. I'm excited to get more oysters next time
author: Ke D.

description:
Came here after local edition to finally check it out. We tried going before but there was an event so we decided to come later. 

When you walk in you're greeted by the beautiful decor of books lining the walls. There's a big table in the middle which is nice especially since we grabbed two seats. If you want a couch space I think you need to reserve those. 

The place does get pretty packed so I recommend getting here early. The drinks here are tasty and are very creative being named after different authors.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
A great cocktail bar with amazing drink concoctions. Decided to celebrate my birthday here and it was ideal considering the literary theme. The bar tenders were a little snooty, but the drinks were top notch. 

Highly recommend the flight as you get to try a little bit of everything.
author: Henna S.

description:
Novela has unique cocktails and a pretty cool vibe (the library theme and lights are awesome), but it's hard to get seating there unless you have a reservation and it always seems like the bar is packed. The food is just okay, nothing special and on the pricey side. If you're with a group and you do manage to snag a table, order a punch bowl - you won't regret it. 

If you're going out, it's a fun bar. But if you want a chill spot to grab a drink after work, go elsewhere.
author: Ada C.

description: I was super excited to go get oysters and have some bartenders that know there stuff. I work in hospitality and the red headed bartender did not make us feel welcome at all. My friend and I are bartenders ( louder goofy bunch as well) and know our cocktails the drinks we ordered the bartenders could not make a simple green point cocktail very disappointing. We came to eat and just felt so unwanted by the bartenders that we had to leave! Overall I don't get to go out much and will never go back. Even if they had oysters for a quarter.
author: Dan D.

description:
I wish this could be a four star review. the space is beautiful, but the bartenders aren't great. I've only been here twice and I'll probably come again because it's close to work but I wish it could be a better experience

both times I was there long enough to make an informed judgement, at least IMO

when it's busy (when wouldn't it be after work in SoMa?) there aren't enough bartenders. people are 3 deep waiting to get a drink. and the bartenders are slooooow. yeah they have specialty cocktail menu and I know those take more time than pouring a beer, but the bartenders mix them so slowly, measuring each ingredient with a jigger, and taking their sweet time doing it. they need to speed it up, and learn how to measure without having to use a jigger.

and they're not helpful. my friend asked which ryes they have and the bartender just pointed to the shelves behind her. there should be a list and she should know what's on the shelf

so three stars because it's nice inside and convienient to FiDi and SoMa, but service is equal to two stars
author: Bob U.

description:
So pleasantly surprised! Came here for an engagement celebration. You can reserve the back room, which is nicely decorated with books making it look like you are in a study/ library. So beautiful. 

The drinks were absolutely amazing but rather strong so be aware. I had the Juliet drink. Tried the Romeo, the punch which they are known for and I have to say they were a tad too strong for me. The drinks are named after literary authors and characters of books. The bartenders take their time making the speciality drink and the quality transpires in their creations. The lighting is dim and it feels very cozy. 

We got there at 7pm so by 10pm it became rather crowded. So if you like more of a chill cozy place to have some good drinks and catch up with friends... come early. 

At around 11pm, we got quite hungry. We inquired about the appetizers and they do not serve them on Saturdays but they offered is guacamole and chips and salsa and chips. Ugh... The only negative experience at this place was trying to eat the "just removed from the fridge" bottled salsa and processed Guac. So my recommendation: skip it. 

Novela was a good find and I look forward to going back and trying other drinks.
author: Monique T.

description: Came here from LA for the super bowl and we loved it. Suzanne was amazing and super accommodating and  we cannot wait to come back!!
author: Kailee P.

description: Great spot for drinks. Friendly service. Order the flatbread - great tomato jam! Good vibe.
author: Vicki L.

description:
We like the drinks and decorations, but we are extremely disappointed about their service. I really do not recommend having any sort of event for a large group (10+) there. 
 
My team is around 15 people, and had reserved a table for our holiday party there. It was very crowded on a Monday at 6pm. They definitely lack servers and bartenders to accommodate such a crowd. There were not efficient in taking our orders or serving drinks. At our table, it took forever waiting for the waitress to order foods and drinks. My team had been sitting there for 20 minuets, and nobody came to us to take our order. I asked the waitress to help us order food at least 5 times. They were always saying that someone was going to help us to take our order, but we ended up waiting endlessly. Thus, we end up going the bar to order our drinks. However, because there were only two bartenders, we spent lots of time waiting to order and waiting for our drinks. It was a very painful experience for us. After waiting for 40 min, the manager finally showed up and helped us order subsequent drinks. I would like to go there again if they have better service. Otherwise, it's not a good idea to go with a large group.
author: Li-Hua L.

description:
This bar is on my list of top 10 bars in SF. In my opinion, it's more of a lounge than a bar. 

Novela provides a classy atmosphere for people looking to have a conversation with their friends over a couple cocktails. It's located in the Financial District of San Francisco, so their clientele mostly consists of people working in the city. It seems like the ideal after hours place - the music is tasteful and not too loud, the atmosphere is pleasant and in a way romantic, and the drinks are worth the price you pay for them. 

Your average drink costs between $10-$13, which is standard for most bars in SF. They have a decent sized list of cocktails, and a section for Novela specialties. I usually order the Leopold Bloom, but have also tried the Jay Gatsby and the Ian Malcolm, both of which were good. They also have a good selection of wines and beers on tap. 

The decor is definitely upscale - this bar reminds me of bars I've seen in some movies. The walls are lined with "books" which is a unique touch, and the lighting is dim but adequate. There are a lot of places to sit in groups, which makes it convenient if you're going with friends or coworkers. They also have some more personal areas, which is ideal for a date. This is definitely a good spot to start or end a date if you're looking for a classy bar that doesn't strain your wallet. 

The clientele at this bar seem very well behaved - it seems like most of them work in the financial district and dress accordingly. This is definitely a bar where you'd feel out of place if you dressed too casually (sweats, sports attire). I've never seen anyone get rowdy or belligerent, which is nice if you're just trying to have a good time. 

Overall, the drinks are good, the decor is great, the restrooms are well maintained, and the bartenders are friendly and efficient. The only reason this bar gets 4 stars instead of 5 is because SF has some truly spectacular bars that set the bar pretty high. 

This bar should definitely be on your list if you're looking to kick back after work, or enjoy drinks with your friends.
author: Ankit G.

description:
Great cocktails as always. On the pricey side. It gets quite crowded at the bar (~10pm on a Friday), but you can find space at the entrance or the back corner pretty easily. We even got seats for 3 of us!

See my photos for additional details.

THE COST: $37 total for 3 cocktails.

CHAPTER 1: SEASONAL COCKTAILS
* Robinson Crusoe (dark rum, lemon, housemade ginger syrup, soda. $10)

* Phileas fogg (bourbon, tobacco infused sherry, maple syrup, lemon, housemade anise tonic. $11) - 3 stars
My boyfriend didn't like this - it was too boozy and didn't have very interesting flavors.

CHAPTER 3: PUNCH
* Rum Milk (spiced rum, clarified milk, pineapple, allspice, lemon. $10) 4 stars
Good for a sweet drink to me. My boyfriend thought this was too sweet (but his tastes are very different from mine and he would never have ordered this in the first place. I found this nice and light, and I liked the nutmeg sprinkled on top.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I like this lounge.

The cocktails are delicious.
The bar is beautiful and sexy. 
I also noticed that it was a bit more diverse than most SF places. 

I've been here a couple of times and would bring out of towners again.
author: Priti K.

description:
No doubt, Novela oozes w/chic and trendy. It's the primary appeal to this bar. In fact, I wouldn't venture to say it's a bit overkill but it clearly gets away with it.  It has a lot going on decor wise and is the epitome of a trendy lounge. I dig the literary theme with the bookshelves on the wall and cocktails named after famous characters. On a side note it kind of gives off those, "I bet lots of bachelorette party's go here" vibes.

They have a big craft cocktail menu that's on the pricier side. Nothing too crazy but I was in the mood for something more casual and Novela isn't the place for that. One and done. Overall a solid choice. It was a little difficult to get bar service despite it not being very crowded but it seems like that isn't out of the ordinary for Novela. 

I probably wouldn't come back but if you're looking for something unique it's worth a shot.
author: Aaron B.

description: Love this little library/book worm themed bar! The service is great and it doesn't seem to get empty on weeknights, which is what I love. Great place to have a happy hour after work.
author: Tika O.

description: BEST. DRINKS. EVER! The service is incredible. Andre is the one you want making and handing you your drinks. Fantastic experience. Favorite bar I've been to!
author: Francisco Y.

description: Came here on a Saturday night. Soon as we got there the bouncer politely asked to check our IDs. When we got inside we were greeted by the bartender and wait staff right away. You can make reservations or you can just walk in and take any table that doesn't have a reserved sign on it or hang out at the bar. We didn't make a reservation but we found a table that wasn't reserved very quickly(we got there around 9p). I would suggest reserving if you're coming with a big group. The decor was swanky-meets-library. Clean bathrooms. The music was good; they were playing a mixture of everything R&B, Alternative, Pop, Hip-hop, 2000's, etc. There was always staff walking by clearing tables of empty drinks for us and asking us if there was anything else we needed so that was nice, most places just ignore you and you have to demand some service. They make really good cocktails. We ordered the Jay Gatsby, Leemet, Leopold, & flights of Rum, Pisco, & Gin. They also offer beer, wine, & food. We didn't try any of the bar bites because we had just eaten; maybe next time. Overall I enjoyed my time there and would definitely come back.
author: Cristal F.

description: Good (and strong) drinks. Absolutely love the literary decor. Definitely worth checking out this place! Didn't have a problem finsing seating or standing place on the Friday night I went.
author: Nina H.

description: Nice hip bar on mission street. Very cute and chic on the inside.  I recommend as a place to gather with friends.
author: Shenna J.

description: Great place to hang out after work or to download after visiting the area museums nearby. Nice whiskey selection and in house specialty cocktails are a must to try. I'll definitely recommend place to check out while in the area. Service can be slow but drinks are worth the wait.
author: John N.

description:
Great ambience, nice decor and good drinks! We had a great time at novela ordering their $8 cocktail specials and wine. The service was great as well. 

The only issue was that our server had no knowledge about food allergies. We wanted to make sure that their tacos are gluten free so we inquired about that. Our server told us that "they aren't gluten free and that In fact they have cheese and stuff on them! " 
I'm not sure what she meant by stuff, but cheese is okay for gluten intolerants. We then found out that the tacos are gluten free and they were quite tasty. So hoppy that we got to order those!
author: Ghazal P.

description: USUALLY I love this bar, but it's my friend's birthday - she got on the table for literally BARELY 2 seconds and this random waitress comes by and she could have asked nicely but instead she chooses to come by and say "Stay classy." She could have simply asked politely to get off the table, but instead she chose to be judgy, rude and unprofessional - absolutely unnecessary.
author: Ragini T.

description:
We stopped by here on a random bar hop twice, once on a Saturday at 7 PM, the bar was quiet and tables were available and it was nice for a date and drinks. It was still buzzing with people but you could have a conversation. 

We stopped by on a different Saturday around 10 and the place was teeming with people! Interesting and lively!

I love the theme and leafed through a few books on the shelf. 

I had a Leopold Bloom a hibiscus gin based cocktail that was refreshing and tasty!
author: Y J.

description: This place is hip and has lots of character. As the name implies, the walls are lined with bookshelves filled with books. The drinks are named after authors and characters of books. I ordered the punch flight - Sangria, Hemingway's "code hero", and Pisco. They were all amazing! The meat and cheese tray and the hummus plate were delicious as well. Service was on point. Overall, great place to grab unique drinks!
author: Vai P.

description:
If you love oversized reading chairs, books beautifully organized by color, and having a very well handcrafted drink in your hand, Novela is the place to be. It's a great place to bring friends. It's a well lit bar/lounge and doesn't get too loud. Friendly tip: make a reservation beforehand. 

Came here on a Friday night and the place was busy, but not overly crowded (all seats were occupied, and maybe two parties were standing around). We grabbed the last table for two and started the night off with Miss Moneypenny ($12) and egg nog. My tastes lean towards the sweeter and fruitier side of cocktails. With that said, Miss Moneypenny (mulled vodka, drambuie, pear honey, lemon) was perfect for me and I thoroughly enjoyed it. The egg nog packs a punch but is quite delicious. 

The drinks are seasonal and are named after famous characters. Look through the menu and see how many you recognize.
author: Katie C.

description:
Came in for a couple quick drinks post dinner. This is a perfect setting for that! 

I must admit I have always been a lounge fan. I just prefer conversation and drinks over loud music and sweaty gross people bumping into you in a dive bar or "club" setting.

The setting is great. Dim lighting, spacious, and comfortable. It definitely has an original theme/setting. 

The crowd is mixed. Prob a mix of age range and maturity. I'd say 28-35 is the average here. Given the age, expect a lot of pseudo intellectuals pretending to be more literate and interesting than they are. People ordering drinks named after people they know literally nothing about. 

Speaking of drinks, they were fantastic. Original and complex enough to enjoy, but not complex enough to take 10 minutes to "craft". Nonetheless, the modern faux mixologist would enjoy and be able to try and articulate. 

As far as attire, it's somewhat casual SF stylish. I rocked a sportcoat and chinos and felt perfectly comfortable. Some people were more dressed down, but don't be lame, dress it up a notch guys. 

100% would come back!
author: Sean M.

description:
Would definitely come back just for the Calvin O' Keefe - strawberry pisco, raspberry honey, lemon, verjus, brut. Best part was that it didn't even taste like there was alcohol, and the ice - cube (more like a sphere) was strawberry infused. Great presentation!

On a busy night (Fri/Sat) it can be a little difficult to flag down the bartender - make sure you know what you want! Part of the reason why it's so difficult is because they really take their time to make their drinks, so you know it's good quality. 

Venue is large, but the bar takes up most of the space so it can be hard to find seating - esp if you're with a large group. Consistent with it's name, Novela has a library theme to it, so it has a bit of a sophisticated vibe to it as you're basically surrounded by hundreds of books. No dance floor, but they do play music - so could be a good place to pregame if you're trying to rage after. 

Would definitely come back and excited to try some of the other drinks they have!
author: Megan K.

description: Drinks aren't bad but their service structure isn't any good. Worthless hostess sitting around, rude waitress, overworked understaffed bar.
author: Rharrison79 ..

description: Beautiful space. Mediocre drinks. Even more mediocre snacks. Meh.
author: Henna S.

description: I had the best Sunday of 2018 at this bar. Was treated with the utmost hospitality and kindness by a staff member named Lakayla. She made the bar feel like home, she was a quick server, we bonded, we chatted, truly a girls night out. Also doesn't hurt that I was given a mini Oscar at the bar for best dressed by a big group that saw I was werkin' it. Definitely a hot spot to go to in the city.
author: Brennan A.

description: One of my favorite bars in SF. It is very beautiful and suffisticated.
author: Azar H.

description: I wouldn't really know how this place is seeing how it was too packed to ever make it all the way to the bar. Some of their cocktails sounded interesting and I was eager to try them.... But after standing in the crowd slowly inching our way to the bar we gave up. After about 15 minutes of standing and being pushed around by other guests in their dimly lit bar, I was dripping in sweat. Annoyed beyond belief and absolutely disgusted with the amount of people they allowed in. We left and went elsewhere. This place looked like a cool spot, perhaps I'll come back on an off night and hope for a better experience than last time. The two stars earned are for ambiance and location, which were both great. Everything else about my experience here was terrible.
author: Iris J.

description:
Novela, I like how you look. It reminds me of my home. Beautiful books on display, but have they ever been read? Perhaps not. Those illuminated colored shelves are pretty snazzy. Enormous Ernest Hemingway portraits in the back. All good things.

Go for the punch. It's special. The tequila one packed some punch, eh heh. We went big... the 32oz. Which FYI serves more than 3 people. We each sipped two glasses to finish her off. And before dinner that will leave this lightweight with a buzz. It was just sweet enough, just tart enough, and just enough tequila to loosen you up.

I love everything about the appearance of this place and also a fan of their oyster menu. If I lived in SF, I'd probably be here often. So those of you who do live here, enjoy it for me and tell me about it. Cheers!
author: Breanna B.

description:
Really cute space for some fancy cocktails + bites.  The decor is beautiful: high ceilings and towering bookshelves with hundreds of color-coded books.  Cocktails are on the high end...$12-$13 but they are pretty delicious and made with care and attention to detail.

Taco Tuesdays are pretty awesome, too because they have a deal on their taco plate.  $10 for three tacos (pork, shrimp, and avocado)--usually it's $10 for only two tacos.  Although they are small tacos, they are pretty delicious and flavorful.  You can also upgrade to the $16 combo which includes a delicious hibiscus margarita!

The bar staff were super friendly and attentive.  My friend ordered a glass of wine, however, and somehow during the middle of the night, a fly found it's way into the glass.  She told a server who did not actually say any words but took the glass away.  We were a little perplexed, but then a few minutes later, the bartender came out with a fresh glass of wine, explaining that they had opened a new bottle to make sure that it was clean.  Great customer service, even if it was a little bit confusing for a moment.

I would definitely return but I might make reservations next time!  It was a little challenging for our group to find a place to sit as all the tables had "Reserved" signs on them.
author: Jess Y.

description: Decent option for happy hour. Nice selection of cocktails. Location is not that great(street smells like urine)  but then again, it's SF, 80% of the city smells like that.
author: Jimmy C.

description: Great bar, great music, great crowd! One of my favorite bars in San Fran. Order the Queen of Hearts drink! Very smooth and pretty ;)
author: Katrina Y.

description:
Most of my favorite bars in San Francisco seem to be ones related to books or studying. Maybe it's my nerdy side screaming for alcohol. Anyways, I'm a sucker for drinks that are creatively named and it's awesome when the drinks are good/strong too! Novela is a nice large bar with plenty of seating at the bar, along the sides, and even at some couch areas for bigger groups. This place just says SEXY to me. Great place for a date, especially if you are looking to test someone's literary knowledge.

My friend and I came here for Monday Happy Hour. Little did we know that includes $1 oysters on the menu! YUM. Their sauces are delicious, even though the oysters are tiny. I would definitely come back Monday after work just for these. I wonder what the other Happy Hour deals are?

I was overwhelmed by all the dazzling cocktails. They all sounded so good, I could not decide! I started with the Jay Gatsby ($11) which has bourbon, calisaya, nocino, amaretto, and islay scotch. Honestly I got this just because of the name. Excellent choice if you like a solid strong drink. Next I got the James Henry Trotter ($12) which has rye whiskey, white peach, grapefruit, egg white, hellfire bitters, and mint. This is a good drink if you are feeling fruity. I like that there are seasonal cocktails to mix up the menu every once in awhile.

I heard that the punch is a highlight of Novela, though I did not get around to trying that. I'll have to come back for that. Very conveniently located between FiDi/SOMA so what are you waiting for? Let your story begin here!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Love love love this place!

It's beautiful and cozy inside and a very relaxed atmosphere. Came here on a Monday night and there was surprisingly a bit of a crowd. Not anything crazy, but just enough to make the place feel alive.

I tried the frank Carmoody cocktail and loved it! All of the drinks seem very unique.

I'd definitely come back here with friends.
author: Anastacia W.

description:
Well, let's start with the good...the bar itself is beautiful and provides many different places to sit down and enjoy a nicely crafted cocktail.  The bad...the service is terrible!  It took entirely too long to even get a server to come by and then she spilled water all over our table and put in the wrong order for our cocktails.  This lovely bar should have top notch service!

The vodka punch and the Leopold Bloom cocktails were well made and quite tasty though!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Drinks were good.  Bartenders were good considering how busy they were later on in the evening.... BUT the general service here SUCKED!  The hostess would not acknowledge us for a good 10 minutes while we waited at the front of the place even though when we walked in the place was pretty slow...  It was only to kick us out of various standing room areas to tell us we couldn't stand there any more... Not to mention this place was filled to the brim with douche clientele... I've been a frequenter of Bourbon and Branch since they opened and loved in general this companies bars but this one is WAY on the bottom of this their list... do yourself a favor and go to another less douchey spot where you will be treated better!
author: J M.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite bars. The environment of this bar sets the mood for sure, I love the bookcase theme, it gives it a elegant feeling.

I came here multiple times with friends and co workers. It get's pretty crowded near the end of the week and apparently Saturdays is asian night so all of you guys that have asian fever ayyyyyy. This is a great place to hang out with friends, have team outings and most importantly I have seen many tinder dates LOL so online daters give this place a try. 

Oh and can I say $1 oysters??????? YUS
author: Natalie L.

description:
Surprisingly large bar and lounge that, as the name implies, has a literary theme to it, with bookshelves all over the place and drinks named after literary figures. 

As for the drinks, the cocktails are generally strong and well-portioned enough to be worth the price, and there's a nice selection of punches as well. The bar bites are also quite decent, and service is fast and friendly. 

The space is large enough to accommodate a variety of purposes, whether more rambunctious revelry up front at the bar or more intimate chats at small tables in the rear. All in all, a good addition to a stretch of Mission that's gradually seeing new activity.
author: Vincent L.

description: Novela is fun at the off times. Happy hour is so loud you can't hear the people next to you and the bartenders get so overwhelmed the cocktails come out inconsistent
author: Kara A.

description:
Super cool atmosphere, great to go for a drink after work. The books lining all the walls is very unique, and the range of titles is impressive! Everything from Dickens to Davinci Code. If you don't feel awkward drinking a cocktail and reading in the midst of a crowd, then I would even say come just to browse the titles and sip on something tasty.

BUT if you are looking for a more social outing, this place still delivers. The drinks are delicious (and I'm not really a cocktail person, more of a wino/beer hound). I especially like that you can do a flight of 3 cocktails, and they have plenty of punches to choose from. The drinks are not watered down, and the servers take their time and are willing to make recommendations. As far as bites, I've heard they have good burgers (but I don't eat red meat, so I can't say from experience). Their nibbles list is pretty pathetic. I prefer standards like fries or bruschetta or brussel sprouts - the new "happy hour" food. This place has stuff like arancini balls, croquettes, or chicken salad. Not really what I want to nosh on while I'm getting tipsy, but others might like this.

If you're looking to chat up other professionals in SF, this is probably a good place to people watch & approach. A great date spot, as well as good for friend outings. Plenty of options for seating (high top, sofa lounge, small tables) but get there early to snag a spot.

I'll return for sure!
author: Becky M.

description: Excellent rotating cocktail selection. Their drinks lean towards the sweeter side which I really enjoy. The Bourbon Punch was excellent. I really liked the ambience as well. Music was a bit loud but the place wasn't too crowded and there was a decent selection of seating. I might reserve one of the cushioned lounge areas next time
author: William A.

description:
Cool place. The lighting on the books makes it feel modern and smart. Negroni is made with care. Youngish crowd. Stevie Wonder is the music as I type.
Squeeze through the crowd to the back for some space.
author: Ken K.

description: Great mixology and drink choices and ambiance. However, when I want fast service and a bargain drinks I go elswhere.
author: Joe S.

description:
Wine, beer, scotch, rye, whiskey, tequila, vodka, things you never herd of before and a HUGE ice cube....CHECK! 

Seating hard to find, CHECK. (Make a reservation). 

Service and staff friendly and attentive, check! 

Really fun place with a modern and fun hipster vibe, check. 

I plan to go back. It was a REALLY COOL bar and I loved their selection of alcohol, along with some of their happy hour app specials. Will make sure to make a reservation though. Otherwise, there is nowhere to sit.
author: Tanya C.

description:
Great cocktail lounge with a nice ambiance! They also serve food here now that they've installed a kitchen. I'd make a reservation if you want to guarantee yourself a place to sit because it gets pretty crowded and rather loud here.

If you like sweet tangy with fruit hints like me, you'd definitely enjoy the Calvin O'Keefe (Strawberry Pisco, Raspberry Honey, Lemon, Verjus, Brut) and Tom Ripley (Amaro Nocino, Lime, Pineapple, Grapefruit, Peychaud's Bitters). These 2 drinks are unfortunately seasonal cocktails but my goodness so yummy. I'm pretty sure the bartender can replicate this if you just give them the ingredients listed.

I hear their classical cocktails are great too and that is why they're a stable at this bar. Can't wait to try the Leopold Bloom (Hibiscus Gin, Pineapple, Mint, Grapefruit) the next time I'm here.

In terms of bar bites, we all shared the devil eggs, charcuterie plate, pork shoulder sliders, and shrimp & avocado toast. I definitely would get all this again though nothing too special.
author: Kathy L.

description: Their punch is realllly strong and delicious, and for some reason, every single table is always reserved. But if you talk to the nice hostess, they let you take a seat if you're gone before the reservation shows up. I like the book themed drinks - very creative!
author: Christina S.

description:
This place is BEAUTIFUL on the inside, but from the outside you might walk past it! So at 3:45 on a Friday  my co-workers decided to go for an impromptu HH and I was scrambling to come up with suggestions. I called Novela and the manager was totally cool with the late notice, and even roped off an area for us. The bartenders were nice, quick, and helpful, and I got a sense everyone there was genuinely satisfied with their jobs.

My co-workers and myself were very impressed. I'm not usually a fancy drink girl but I had to try something so I went with a margarita and it was soooo good. My friend got some kind of adult slushie but it was way too sweet for me. I wish the drinks weren't so pricey :/ 

Since coming here it's now become the office HH spot and it's only a block away. Supes close to BART as well so you can stumble home.
author: Alyssa J.

description:
Beautifully designed bar. The cocktail menu is extensive and makes full use of all the de rigeur hipstery ingredients- artisan bitters, ginger, lemon- what have you. The lighting on the inside is super colorful, though it seems like it can get really crowded- just on a Sunday the line was 3 deep and it took a while to be served. Apparently all the books on the shelves are real and I would love to come in on a weekday afternoon and sip on a cocktail or whiskey and read.

PS- keep an ear out for a douche trying to sound smart and saying lesss mizzerabless
author: Samir K.

description: Novela is a fancy smancy bar that is nicely hidden in the concrete jungle of San Francisco. You can dress casual here aswell as fancy. I came here with a group of about 10 for a birthday party on a Friday. Checked out the menu and was very surprised to see yummy looking punch pitchers that they handcraft and ON TAP. Seems like a lot of bars have been doing this lately. We first had the Hemingway's Code Hero pitcher and wow it was good. its Has 3 kinds of whiskey marachino and pimms ( which is one of my favorite liquors). The pitchers can only pour about 5 glasses of my thirsty party so we also bought another pitcher. So we got the Rum pitcher which has two rums strawberry orange chai and tarragon. This pitcher I really didn't mind because of all the complex flavors, i began to be very sweet after awhile I couldn't bare it anymore. All in all I would defintely visit this bar again maybe to try the food menu.
author: Troy R.

description: Went here for my best friends birthday. Definitely love the design of this bar/lounge and its so spacious and it has a very cosmopolitan/city vibe. If you make a reservation you get a table area that fits around 9 people. Prices aren't bad either. $45 for a punch bowl that pours about 8 glasses. Wasn't crazy about the appetizers.. We had sliders and a salami plate and the sliders barely had any meat in them-just bread. All in all I'd definitely come back to Novela.
author: Imani O.

description: I have been trying to get in touch with the staff for weeks after our team visit. We did a work happy hour, and I need an itemized receipt from Novela to show back to my company. After 4 emails, and multiple messages, still have not heard back from anyone there.
author: Tanisha G.

description: Really nice spot. The ambiance is novel themed with a ton of famous books and the cocktails are really good. The cocktails have cute names. I've gone to three New Year's Eve parties here and they are really good as well.
author: Nick Y.

description: Love this place! What a great atmosphere. If you love books, you will love the deco. The bouncer was a cool guy. Chill. Nice place to meet other cerebrals. But if you were like us looking for a fun place to go on a girls weekend after leaving the View at the Marriott down the road, this place was not loud or crowded so we could enjoy. We went on a Thursday night in torrential downpour. We were having fun regardless.
author: Kiran C.

description:
I like the theme, and the bar itself is beautiful. With book cases lining one wall filled with books and accent lighting.  You get the feel that you are in someone's study. Someone who is OCD about who they organize their books by the color of the bindings, which is pretty cool.  The bar is in the middle, but only serves to one side as a giant glass panel serves as a backing.  It is mostly lounge seating with the exception of the high communal table in the middle, the bar seats, and a couple of high tops directly in front of the bar.  

Drinks are named after characters from popular novels.  Classics like Moby Dick, Great Gatsby, Cather in the Rye and other American Classics are well represented.  There are some more recent entries as well, such as the delicious Severus Snape concoction.  They also have a selection of pre-made punches and a daily bartender's choice.  

Could take a while to get a drink on a busy night since most of the drinks have to be shaken, stirred, spun, flipped and blessed a couple of times before being strained and garnished, but hey, what bar isn't doing that these days.

As with most high end SF Bars, expect the drinks to be around $11-$14 now.  Good for a classy round or two, but not if you want to go on a bender...
author: Veasna H.

description:
Wow, the inside of this bar is stunning! It's themed as a library with books decorating the walls and drinks named after the literary greats. This is not a "turn up" bar but rather a classy place for groups of friends to relax or date night. I came here on a Tuesday and since it's located in the Financial District the crowd is a little older (I'm early 20's) and most people were in their work clothes - suits, etc. 

The drinks are VERY strong. I was a little disappointed because I like bars with creative mixologists, and I did ask for a custom drink with certain flavors but the bartender didn't seem in the mood to come up with something. She instead suggested the vodka punch and told me it's a fruity, light drink but even then I thought it was quite strong! So be prepared if you're a lightweight. Unisex bathrooms were very clean and lots of space to lounge around. Ambient lighting - light enough to see other people but not too light to create that unattractive fluorescent glow (just an FYI for those first date people). 

4 drinks was $57 w/o tip.
author: Allison L.

description: Came here for the first time and loved it! Really good drinks, unique decor, and a really fun post work vibe. Hidden gem - will definitely be back.
author: Myra Y.

description: This seems like a popular yuppie after work spot. I like the decor in here. Reminds me of a swanky library! Crowd is not so much like a library. Ha. It's definitely busy and loud in here but I didn't really find that to be a problem. They have drink specials that are 5 small drinks of the same thing. We tried to get them to pour it into one large glass but they insisted on giving us 5 small glasses. I'm sure this is a regulatory thing but we looked a little silly. However, this is perfect for groups and I would definitely recommend stopping by Novella.
author: Ninette C.

description:
Hipster bar with a book theme in the Financial District, who knew? Staff was very helpful as I arranged a small cocktail thing for attendees of a conference. We had a reserved table in the front with comfy seating around 5:30.  The place opens at 5 and it was packed by then.

Hard to get to the bar so do order a pitcher for your table.  Their punch doesn't pack a punch but it is yummy. I'd go back to meet friend in the area.
author: Dina L.

description:
I'm not a FiDi night type of gal--I usually find myself in Mission if I want a fun night with my friends.

But I was playing tour guide for my two out of towner friends, and after exploring Union Square/Fisherman's Wharf, we wanted some drinks before watching a movie at the Metreon. Yelp lead us to Novela, and we were all very pleased with the recommendation!

Enter Novela. It was a tame Tuesday night, and we were looking for some chill drinks at a respectable space. Novela is pretty dark with a lounge-y feel for after work hangouts. Yelp told me that their punches were pretty good, but the boys got some redbull vodkas--basic. I decided to get us some Negroni (where my gin lovers at) because of SF Negroni Week! They had three drink choices, and we settled with two Negroni Punches and one Negroni Bitter. The bartenders that night were ALL on point and very classy. Shoutout to the super pro bartender lady who had rad tattoos and a girlcrush-worthy septum piercing! She was kind enough to educate us on the ingredients of the Negroni (gin, vermouth, campari, and a twist) and how they made their Punch and Bitter. 

Shoutout to the male bartender that night as well for being so friendly, sweet, and caring for our crew. I tip my hat off to bartenders who know their shit, but keep their egos in check. Yes, the whole world knows that y'all know your alcohol, but it's even more admirable when you can educate and spread the wealth of knowledge. Novela is your place if you want sincere bartenders and beautifully crafted cocktails. 

I see that people complained about pricing. No doubt drinks are well over $10 a glass, but you're getting hand-crafted pieces of art, so no shit it's gonna cost a pretty penny. Plus, don't complain because you're in FiDi. If you're looking for $2 pints and cheap well drinks, you can walk to another bar a few feet away. I can't wait to come back to the book-theme'd Novela. Their restrooms are also very spacious and beautiful. The whole damn place is a fairytale!
author: Jodi H.

description:
Super attractive and trendy. idk about the people, but the decor is amazing. As you walk in, your right side is a wall of illuminated colored books on shelves running all the way to the back of the bar. The glowing colors are a great contrast to the large black windows and white washed brick walls on the left. The bar itself is a wall of glass with a yellow under glow. Everything is just so classy. 

Definitely try out their house "punches" which rotate seasonally and grab a pitcher to share with friends. Each pitcher serves about 6 people for only 4x the cost of a glass. They also have their own signature cocktails that are named after story characters (how cute?!). I've also been told that Novela has the best greyhounds in SF from a random guy who took a lyft with me. 

The crowd ranges from super dressy to more low key casual. It's definitely fun to just people watch. Beware though that the main bar is one sided and so it's get really really crowded there. There's a small bar also in the back but it's only about 5 ft wide. If you're in front of the bar area or near the communal table, you'll feel a little like you're in a can of sardines. So I would highly suggest grabbing reservations, especially if you plan on showing up prior to 12. There are some "opening" seating, like communal table and a few side tables in front of the books, but those are tough to snag. 

Stop by and you'll see how great it is!
author: Liza X.

description:
Absolutely LOVE the decor here! High ceilings, classy booths, and hundreds of real hard-cover books organized by color on under-lit bookshelves along the wall. Almost all tables are reserved before midnight though, so finding seating is basically impossible. 

This is a fun, classier cocktail lounge to hang out at with a group of friends. They have signature, seasonal punches by the glass or by the pitcher. These are often pretty light and refreshing. If punches aren't for you, they also have a frequently updated menu of ~15 specialty cocktails, with creative literary-themed names, divided into sections by strength. There is usually a section for lighter, fruitier drinks and another for stiffer drinks, allowing you to choose based on your mood for the night.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked for a while and I was excited to finally come for happy hour one afternoon after work. 

Not impressed. I went up to the bar to order and waited 15 minutes for 2 drinks and the place wasn't even full. The cocktails were expensive and small for the price. Tasty and unique, but not worth the $32 I paid for 2 cocktails.
author: Olivia B.

description:
To be honest, this kind of place just isn't my type. I'm not looking to spend $10 for a beer and scream at the person next to me because it is so loud and crowded.

It's the place for you if you're looking for a classy cocktail lounge that is filled with tons of people. You can reserve tables there if you call ahead of time (but do so quickly and far in advance).
author: Jennifer C.

description: Very nice ambiance, somewhere in the middle of a traditional speak easy like Wilson and Wilson and the typical bar. Drinks are very good. Food is OK. Make a reservation before you go!
author: Shalini C.

description:
Literary-themed bar + strong, creative drinks = be still my heart!

I recently went to Whitechapel Gin Bar and our server informed us that it's Novela's sister bar. I'm not surprised, as both are great but also pretty different.

Novela caters to the FiDi crowd. There's plenty of comfy seating (bonus points or being able to reserve a table online!) so this is group-friendly. Although it gets quite loud later in the evening, it was fine at 5pm on a weekday.

My drink, Christopher Robin, was superb. It had a carrot juice, gin, ginger, and lemon, and the combination was surprisingly great and had just the right amount of sweetness.

This is a $12-13 cocktail kind of place so expect to drop some money, but the ambiance and caliber of drinks makes it worth a try!
author: Valerie L.

description:
A great cocktail bar, love the literary theme. I'm a sucker for good names, so I like to order the drinks here based on how much I like the character. Sometimes the drinks don't quite seem to match up with the character they're named after, but it's all good.

Fair warning: if you're a guy and you order the Gatsby hoping to impress someone with your masculine-looking drink, you may be out of luck. It comes in a cute rounded glass with a stem (not a martini glass, don't know what it's called) as opposed to the short Don Draper glass you were probably expecting. Perhaps it's Novela trying to move us away from outdated notions of manliness though, and so that's great.

The ambience is really nice, but make a reservation (you can make them through Yelp) if you're on a date and/or hoping to get a table. It can get very crowded on weekend nights and starts to feel more like the busy bars/clubs you were hoping to avoid rather than a quieter literary-themed lounge.

A star comes off for playing Warriors games. I would think if you're coming to a place like Novela you're often looking to avoid sports crowds. Wish I had been there for Game 7 though to feed on salty tears!
author: J.P. M.

description: Great bar, great decor. On the quiet side and great for a quiet place to chat and have a cocktail. Lacking in food options. Go for a drink!
author: Leo M.

description:
Who would've thunk?

Drinking on a Sunday evening with some fruity tooty fresh and fruity punch flight could make a group so happy dandy. Those punches were a GOOD creeper. 

We tried all the punches flavors. My favorite was the pisco and the Hemingways.

Did you know, The Great Gatsby was one of my favorite books to read in high school? The color symbolism of my favorite color; yellow mean money, money, money, and something negative...

I dig this place. Skip the crowd on Friday-Saturday night and come on Sunday if you can. Who cares if you work the next day, it's not like you're bingeing on the drinks. 

I hope you give this place a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: Everyone agreed and we had a great time.  I wish it was possible to get seated at the smaller tables without a reservation, we eventually took over most of the large community table near the entrance.  and got wasted lol
author: Matt V.

description: Nice bar with a great vibe. Also has a good variety of drinks. Service can be a lot better as they seemed short staffed. Despite making a reservation, it too me 15 minutes to find someone who could guide me and my guests to our table. Nice for a post work drink or two but be prepared that nobody is in a rush to serve
author: Vin M.

description:
This is a cute little bar & if I'm being corny it's a novel concept. I went on a Sunday night & it was pretty empty--there was plenty of seating. 

The bartender was really helpful. I was feeling pretty indecisive that night & she walked me through all the speciality drinks. I ended up getting the Corina Springfield, which tasted very sweet as promised. Now all that's left to do is read the book my drink was named after.
author: Dierra L.

description:
A pretty nice bar but I didn't have a great experience ordering drinks. The atmosphere and decor is lively, pretty and in a great location.

Unfortunately, the service could be improved. I asked some questions about two drinks but it was clear the lady at the bar was annoyed answering. I ended up ordering a cocktail (one of their specials) that I didn't enjoy. The bar lady did seem very skilled at what she was making but didn't seem interested or enthusiastic at all.

I think it might be fun to come back here with a bigger group but it wouldn't be my first choice. I think part of the experience of going to a cocktail bar is speaking with someone knowledgable (and enthusiastic) and getting the right drink for you. This didn't happen here.
author: Michael C.

description:
Cool place. Drinks are okay but pricey. Good customer service. 

But should improve the music. It gets kinda boring and flat at some point
author: Rim K.

description:
Love the decor inside this bar-- think old school library. They've got the usual list of interesting cocktails. I tried the leopold bloom which was really tasty but probably 1/4 of my glass was actually filled with a drink with the rest of the glass being just ice. Not really worth my money if you ask me.

But, it's still a great spot to hang out with friends and you can bring a large group here since its quite spacious. The cocktails are pretty and the scene is lively and fun inside. Definitely will be back for a drink.
author: Renu A.

description:
Novela is a very attractive bar which has a very Vegas-like look to it.  It's decorated with bookshelves which definitely give it character and keeps it true to it's namesake.

Their drink menu is full of seasonal cocktails and are all named after famous literary characters.  The Jay Gatsby is their signature drink which is made with bourbon, calisaya, nocino, amaretto, and islay scotch.  It's a smooth drink for sure but it's good enough to nurse through the night if you're a lightweight like me.

They don't normally serve food here but on occasion they have a food truck parked outside which Novela allows their food to bring inside.  And they also have special nights where they serve raw oysters for happy hour.

And like other bars in the city, the place can get ridiculously crowded, especially on weekends as expected.  So if you don't have a table reserved, you're pretty much going to find yourself standing the whole time.  This place is really popular so don't be surprised if you come in on a non-busy night and see everything reserved with parties booked.

Overall, Novela is a nice gem in SoMa for gathering with friends or co-workers and enjoy some cocktails.
author: Rodney H.

description: Drinks here are pretty good. Cocktails of different alcohol. Sparkling champagne was good. Would like to revisit
author: Ann L.

description: Always a good place to relax and have a drink with friends. Service isnt as attentive as I'd expect. It started getting better later in the evening. The house punch was absolutely DISGUSTING, but the lovely bartender was so kind to replace it with a different type of punch. The cocktails here are delicious.
author: Rose G.

description:
The Jay Gatsby is delicious. The servers are great.

But there's more to an experience than those two things. This place isn't a spot to drop in: make a reservation. Most of the seating is reservation only. And the hostess was rude and passive aggressive. It was a late afternoon reservation and she came an hour before it ended to make sure we knew we had to leave in a hour. I wasn't impressed with the experience for an upscale spot.

This part is just preference, but this space gets LOUD after 7pm. Another time I went, my group wanted to stay longer, but the volume got so loud we couldn't hear each other across the table, so we left.
author: Dani S.

description:
I like this place a lot!! This place is really swanky, both chill and elegant, and fun! I really liked the atmosphere. It gave a calm but fun vibe. Many people looked like they had come out of work. It's a nice place to check out if you are in the area or you want to catch up with some friends. Or if you want to meet someone out for a nice date. ;) The Hemingway House Punch is delicious!!

With grapefruit, lemon and three whiskey's--this will be sure to quench that thirst you may have! I liked the atmosphere and that the drink names were based off authors and books. Such a cool location. Definitely gotta check it out again.
author: Natalie M.

description:
We happened to walk right by here and stumbled in as a way of getting out of the rain. Novela turned out to be a pretty chill spot to hang out and enjoy some drinks with friends. Although we went on an off night, it was still a nice ambiance and fun. Nice loungy seating and hooks for purses at the bar (that's always a plus). 

I didn't want to drink, so the bartender offered to make me a mock-tail (fake cocktail). Don't ask me what it was, but it was all sorts of delicious! The bartenders are definitely the old-school/speakeasy type that look at cocktails like a true art form. 

There's also a small bar menu with shrimp tacos! I didn't order them, but good to know for next time.

If you're looking for a good cocktail, or a night on the town with some friends (or even a date night with a random someone) then swing pass this place and check it out!
author: Tracy T.

description: Nicely designed place... I really likely their couches. Anyway, went there for a work happy hour. There were only 8 of us this time, and the bill came to $700 (before tip), so it can be pricey. Food was good, drinks were good, didn't like the waitress though, but maybe it was just because it was busy.
author: Sam S.

description: This bar is perfect for the pregame. Novela is a place for having drinks with clients, co-workers, friends or just to meet someone new. This is a beautiful bar, very classy, drinks are great and the ambiance low key. I would recommend Novela!
author: Trey R.

description:
When this space was Fluid, I used to spend almost every Friday night here drinking and dancing. Now that those years have passed, this space seems to have grown with me. No longer are the dirty clear floors and the drunk club crowd. Instead, in it's new incarnation Novela, it's a little more sophisticated, a little more smart. Plus, the inner geek in me loves the library feel of this space.

Last Friday, I met up a group of friends for a quick drink. Peter L, who's been here more times than I can count, suggested we get a punch bowl. Since I've been into whiskey lately, we ordered the Hemingway's "code hero" - 3 whiskeys (dickel rye, bushmills, ardbeg), maraschino, pimm's, earl grey, grapefruit, lemon. This definitely packs a punch so be ready for a boozy drink! And it's not too sweet, which I love.

The place was bustling when I got there on a rainy Friday night, but not overly crowded. My group had snagged a table before I got there, so we had a place to put our stuff and drinks while we all stood, chatted and caught up.

I'd love to come back for happy hour one day. I hear they do HH oysters? Yes please!
author: Elena N.

description: As a New Orleans native, gotta shout out Terry for making one fantastic sazerac. Staff is great, decor is beautiful. Just wish I would've found this place sooner.
author: Jessica M.

description: Beautiful decor. Awful service. I rarely write reviews, but I was so disappointed by the apathetic service last night. Came for a celebratory happy hour with coworkers and our waitress Kseniya was awful. Maybe she was having a bad day, because I hope this is not reflective of the management group of Novela. My favorite excerpt of her service was when asked what's on tap she directed, straight-faced, my coworker to read the menu. Also bonus: when we asked for the check, she ran the card without asking first. Absentee, indifferent, deficient in basic hospitality servicing.  We've come here a few times, but totally off rotation until they get more experienced, present servers.
author: Lili M.

description:
Came here with some co-workers for an early happy hour on Wednesday. We arrived around 4:30pm, and the place was half empty. The hostess asked us if we had a reservation. Yes, my friends, it's THAT kind of bar. When we were told that we didn't, she replied, "I'll see what I can do." We tried hard not to laugh at the absurdity of this dog and pony show. 10 seconds later she came back and said that she found a booth for our party of 4.

Our server checked in with our table 10 minutes after we sat down. We placed our drink order. 20 minutes later, our drinks were still nowhere in sight. And finally, at 5pm they arrived! Almost 30 minutes to get one round of drinks.

Novela - there's no question that you're a sexy, trendy bar that serves tasty libations. But there's no excuse for making your thirsty customers wait that long (especially when the bar is half empty). I can think of a number of other cool spots within a 6 block radius that would gladly take our business and deliver our drinks in a timely manner.
author: Kevin B.

description:
I was pretty excited to try this place, because of the literary theme, but I had a terrible time, and I feel I need to write a review to warn others.

First, it took forever to get anyone's attention at the bar. That happens though, so I'm not that upset about it and was willing to overlook. The part that really made me salty is that the bartender (larger blondish woman) was definitely trying to scam me on paying for drinks. She overcharged me $1.50 for my drink (I paid with cash), and when I mentioned to her that it was only $11, she claimed that it was extra because of tax. I am pretty astute at math, so I know that sales tax is not 15%, but fine. When I asked for a receipt, since I paid cash, she claimed the machine was broken. This is incomprehensible to me, as she brought out bills for other customers. In the end, I decided that since she wanted to overcharge me and refused to take ownership of that, I wouldn't leave the $4 tip I had intended. I am a former bartender (through college), so I know how stressful it is, thus I tip well. It left a truly terrible taste in my mouth (besides the fact that I could barely taste the alcohol in my punch), but I wanted to mention this in case this particular bartender was actually stealing money. I have worked at bars before and tax is ALWAYS incorporated into the written price. I didn't feel like arguing with her because I was trying to have a good time with my sister, but this was appalling. For $1.50, I will be sure to never return, and I was even planning to rent out the whole venue for a holiday party. They pretty much lost several hundreds of dollars for one bartender's greed. 

Most importantly, if you don't print a receipt, there's no record of theft, as I suspect she was doing. The owners may want to take a look at it. More than anything, I had really hoped to have a fun night here and was looking forward to this place, but it really disappointed me. I'm not a particularly picky person, but I do want to warn others so that they do not end up disappointed like me.
author: Catherine B.

description: Cool place to have drinks and get the night started. Barely didn't make it to five stars.
author: Serg K.

description:
Having just recently graduated and entering the adult world, I'm still not completely used to going to bars where people actually purchase craft cocktails instead of throwing back $3 wells and AMFs. Not to say that I'm above that now..because let's face it, I'm not (LOL still a broke college student at heart) but a change of scene is always interesting to say the least. 

Checked out Super Bowl City last weekend and ended up bar hopping around the area on a whim. Decided on Novela for our 3rd stop of the night because it had been sitting in my bookmarks for awhile and as an avid reader, the whole library ambiance and drinks named after literary characters thing reeled me in. Got there around maybe 930-10ish and there was no line yet! So glad that there was no cover and that they weren't super strict on the dress code because I came in there in a scarf, boots, and parka looking like I was in high school and they didn't give me a hard time. 

Only tried one drink while I was here, which was the Princess Leia ($11). It was a mix of vodka, gin, and some other fancy ingredients..but the kicker was that it was topped with a grapefruit meringue and then lightly torched to perfection. It wasn't super strong but it was delicious and as a featherweight drinker, that was perfectly fine with me. 

I'd definitely want to come back here again for a celebration, a date, or a GNO, albeit a little earlier because it was mostly standing room only by the time we rolled in.
author: Gabrielle S.

description:
I've recently discovered this place and it's probably one of my favorite bars in the area! I was amazed right as I walked in at the decor. Everything looked absolutely amazing and the colors and atmosphere of this place made me fell in love with it right away. We came here around 8 and luckily grabbed a table as someone else was leaving. I have to say that it's pretty hard to find a seat here though. 

(+) Onto the drinks. Definitely a bang for your buck. $10 for a cocktail but they were delicious! My favorite of the night was the Miss Moneypenny! I love lighter drinks and this one was perfect for me (though not the same for my guy friends who thought it tasted like syrup). Whateves, more for me! Will definitely come back to this drink. 

Great staff, great atmosphere. Don't skip out on this place!
author: Tram N.

description:
I don't know if I'm spoiled from growing up in Vegas or what, but I found Novel to be lacking in many ways, except for the decor and location, which were indeed excellent.

SERVICE
