was practically nonexistent. The bartenders look classy and all but they made no moves to be nice to the customers. It was literally like a drink-making machine (and a slow one at that). Even on the busiest club nights in Vegas, the bartenders would make friendly or nice remarks while busting out drinks in 5 seconds flat. 

There should have been more staff, such as bussers or greeters besides the also-not-friendly doorman. If there were bussers, then I didn't see them. Tables were left messy for quite a while.

ATMOSPHERE
I felt very uncool and underdressed, although that may be my fault for not looking the part? I loved that the place was all classy and originally chose Novela due to my fascination with books...However, the patrons did not seem like the type at all to enjoy a nice night in reading and I was sorely disappointed by the vibes. Novela is very loud and crowded and not relaxing and cozy like I thought it would be.

DRINKS
Had Jameson and ginger ale. It was pretty good. 

TIP: MAKE A RESERVATION OR YOU WILL NOT GET TO SIT.

Would I come again? Spontaneously, no. With a reservation, yes. Seems like a good start for a raucous night out with friends, not a place to have a nice conversation over a drink.
author: Pim Y.

description:
Absolutely appalled!!! Incredibly rude!!!

I walked in after they had opened, as the doors were open and I was literally shooed out by a woman with red hair who literally came at me like she was try to corral me with her arms! Apparently they were closed for an event, but her demeaning attitude was totally uncalled for!!!
author: Kelly D.

description: Atmosphere is awesome. Drinks were pretty good but the food was awful. Don't go here for food. Drinks only. We got three items that all tasted like cardboard.
author: Kerri D.

description:
The only reason Novela is getting 2 starts instead of 1 is because the place looks and feels trendy and the drinks look tasty. Note that I said looks tasty because I never got a drink. The hostess, while fake friendly, was not helpful and seemed to discourage my patronage. Although I was there earlier than my two friends at 5:15PM, the hostess told me that we could not be accommodated nor put on a wait list for a table because the reservations were fully booked. This was said with a straight face while half of the tables stood empty with "reserved" signs. My friends were late and I noticed the the tables were never completely occupied when I finally left with my 2 friends at 5:45PM. Lesson learned: Make reservations in advance for a bar?!

What I did because I was annoyed and disappointed with the hostess: Spoke with the manager, Suzie. She apologized and mentioned that the hostess was new. We actually could have been put on a wait list. Fancy that. We didn't stay. Instead, we went to another bar for drinks and food nearby. We weren't disappointed and found a comfortable place to talk while enjoying our over-priced tasty drinks. 

Moral of the story: Maybe we will try Novela once the hostess and staff are properly trained, but I highly doubt it because there are so many other great bars in the city.
author: Michon P.

description:
It's kinda strange when a  fellow bar customer had to tell the server to take our drink order. We had been sitting down at the communal table for several minutes and was waiting for someone to take our order.  Not sure why she had to wait until someone had  to tell her that we needed to order.

The people who work here are not the friendliest.  When we came in, the hostess was not present and I had to ask one of the servers where we could sit.  She said to find something that's not reserved, knowing full well that everything but the bar and communal table was reserved.  She could have been more informative and helpful.  Luckily, a couple left the communal table, so we grabbed the seats right away.  When we finally got to order, things were fine.  We got to talking to the couple across from us though, and they told us about their weird experience ordering drinks.  When they ordered their drinks, the bill came before the drinks. They were given the bill 5 minutes after ordering, but their wine and cocktail got there 5 minutes later. Wow.  I'm just flabbergasted by that. 

Needless to say, we will not be going back to this place. You go to restaurants and bars for the ambiance and service, not just for the food and drinks they offer.  I love the decor, but the lack of a friendly vibe is a major turn-off.
author: Hazel C.

description: Came here after a birthday dinner and this place is definitely interesting.  They are a bit pricey but the décor is what makes this place.  It has books everywhere and the lighting is bright and nice.  A little pricey for drinks but worth checking it out for a drink or two.
author: Christina M.

description:
This is known for there cocktails . THEy aren't cheap they have happy hours tho. They definitely put the pizazz into them. THe fanciness and the flare seen so many  torches coming out and so many different collaborations of artwork type things in cups and sways of fruits ran across the cups.
with some of the drinks you very much get  your moneys worth.
IT can be quite an experience.
The crowd is friendly.

They have some great craft beers . I like the beers. 
THey have THemed karaoke once a month with Glenny Kravitz.

This place is very big with a long bar and lots of seating area.
The location and area in general is in a great part of the  city.
ITs a very safe area.
The bathroom is nice.
I stepped in the  room surrounded by porto potttys. 
I had hella nice options .

The bartenders are cool they came up too me quick. 
THey had two which helps.

This place seems like a very romantic place.
It was still very comfortable singing love stinks tho.
I am just saying wow I saw at least three couples practically getting it on at this place so it must set the mood.
I dug it tho, it wasn't  quite mushy . IT wasn't too wild . IT was like they were in a music  video but getting it on. I mean really getting it on ha  this wasn't no danching.

My friend loved this place and this guy really needed some relief from life.
He didn't wanna leave this place he had soo much fun.

 YO this place rocks
author: Luke S.

description:
My friend brought us to Novela after having dinner in the financial district. Loved the walls of books and the cool decor of this place. The bartenders were friendly and it was easy to get served right away (don't be passive!) 

The place was pretty crowded and we didn't have a reservation so we had to stand but we found a table to stand around. The drinks were tasty - I just hate paying SF drink prices. But for the price, this place would be at the top of my list for places to grab a drink with friends in the city. 

Pretty noisy but a nice place to meet and have drinks. Lots of bachelorette parties and groups seemed to meet here.
author: Courtney P.

description:
more of a lounge than a bar, tbh, but great nonetheless. 

I was there on the night before NYE, which is possibly why it wasn't as crowded as it usually gets on a Friday, apparently. However, I enjoyed not being crammed against a hundred people trying to order a drink.

We got there around 11 and it was a fairly easy entry. Headed straight to the bar, where I tried the Leopold Bloom. I enjoyed the fact that it wasn't crazy strong!! The bartender definitely made a good recommendation, which I appreciate.

I loved the ambiance. It was like walking into a super sexy library, with soft lights, comfy couches, and groovy music. It was great cause it felt like a bar in LA, which is where I'm from, so it was definitely comforting seeing that in SF. This isn't much of a dancing bar, or at least it wasn't the night that I went. Definitely not a bar that you want to dress down to either. Everyone there looked put together, which made it super appealing. 

The place was clean, the drinks were great, and the people were classy. It was a really fun experience and I'll be back the next time I'm in SF!
author: Malvika T.

description: Being under staffed and even though this place was super busy on a Sunday night the lead bartender Moe took excellent care of me!! Thank you Moe!!! Great drinks!!
author: Sara W.

description:
As you know from the other thousand reviews, the place looks like some surreal library with pretty cool color changing lighting - oh and a bunch of bars.

The drinks have about a dozen ingredients each, so they take awhile, and their rather high labor cost means they are $11 (or more) each.   Which also means you don't wanna order the wrong one.  They have some favorites with familiar names like Gatsby and Finch, but the one you really want is the Princess Leia, which might be my favorite "girly" drink yet - mildly tropical, with a rather wonderful creamy sweet write foam on top.  Definitely has sugar in there, but it's not cloying. My guess is that it's not that stiff because it goes down so easy.

UPDATE: I should've guessed that the Star Wars-themed drink was temporary.  So you can't get it anymore.  But my new jam is the Dr. Aziz.  Mildly fruity pure joy.
author: Aaron M.

description: Good cocktails. Great place if you like to stand around without even a table to put your drink on.
author: Orion P.

description: The amazing decor is definitely worth a visit. I came on a Friday night after work and ordered a cocktail with hibiscus gin, mint, lime juice, and I can't remember the rest (or the name). The cocktail was delicious and the rest of their menu, especially the seasonal cocktails, looks really good. The big downside is that this is a very popular place and it felt like a place where people go to be seen. The noise undermines the cozy bookish vibe you would otherwise get from the decor. I wonder what it's like when it's less crowded. Could be a cool place to stop by for an afternoon drink.
author: Connie K.

description: Definitely a pretty happenin' place. I came here Saturday night with a coworker who lives in the area - I was just out that way for a few meetings. It was pretty crowded but we were able to get drinks almost immediately which was nice. The bartenders were nice, not overly friendly but just getting the job done. And doing it well, the Curious George with rum and banana was delicious. A bit expensive but nothing out of the ordinary for DT SF. We weren't able to find anyplace to sit so that was a little disappointing but overall a pleasant experience.
author: Dee B.

description:
Had a great time here with my uncle a few weeks back. We came in after a full day of exploring SF, wanting to grab a quick drink before heading home on the Bart. 

I LOVED the ambiance. The color coded books catered to both the OCD and book lover within. The menu was also so much fun. I opted for the Pisco punch, while my uncle opted for the vodka punch.

Both drinks were extremely well made and delicious. My uncle thought his was a bit sweet, and mine had some kind of savory pepper aftertaste. We both enjoy the experience though. 

The crowd definitely leaned young and professional. It was definitely on the expensive side for drinks - a place I would come to feel grown and classy but not a local watering hole type place.
author: Courtney C.

description:
Fav spot. It's really cute. And the food and drinks are great. Went on a Saturday night and had an incident with the hostess, she lied to my friend about a reservations when she asked to be switched to another open table. She made it pretty uncomfortable telling my friend that we'd have to limit our reservation to a half hour. The whole hour and a half the seats around were empty... Thankfully, we had the best service from the waitress who not only took great care of us but gave the most excellent suggestions. Seriously, she was wonderful.

As a bar it's a really fun place, and a good crowd, not rowdy or crazy. If you enjoy details in pretty decor, you'll eat this place up
author: Nazee M.

description: Punch drink was sickeningly sweet, service was fine, ambiance is pretty cool. Will go back
author: Shannon D.

description:
TL;DR - No happy hour but I left pretty happy!

Usually, I'm a happy hour girl. I love trying what a bar has to offer without committing to the large portions.

The girls and I decided to check out Novela for after shopping drinks. We loved the presentation of the drinks as well as the ambience of the place. 

We will definitely be back!
author: Crystal Z.

description: Nice place. I was there on my bday. interior looks cool, just the amount alcohol in drinks ... is so invisible...
author: Emilia K.

description: Literary-themed bar with upscale 1920's vibe. The drinks are on par price wise with other SF bars, but they're really unique and crafted beautifully. Each cocktail is named after a different author or literary character. It seems like they switch out the cocktail menu, as it was different than the pictures I saw on Yelp. It gets really busy with the after work crowd, so definitely try to get there early if you want to grab a table. Fun place to go as a treat.
author: Rachel K.

description:
Wonderful concept bar in SOMA, close to Yerba Buena, the Westfield Mall and Moscone Center (which is why it's soooo expensive). Novela really embraces their literary concept, from the decor - the books on the wall to the little antique book catalog that greets you when you walk in - to the adorable menu named after literary characters and authors.

Novela is big, open and air-y, with a good number of chairs, though it gets crowded during Happy Hours and when there are conferences/events nearby (which is, like, all the damn time). The best time to go is on the weekend before 8pm. 

One of the best/worst things about Novela is that you can reserve the seating lounges in advance (which I can see some patrons being annoyed by, since the "reserved" signs make you feel a little unwelcome). However, they did allow me and my friends to sit in one of the reserved lounges until the people who reserved it showed up, which was nice. 

The cocktails are phenomenal. Really creative, tasty, perhaps a bit too sugar-y and certainly not anything a brown spirits purist would appreciate. But goddamn, they are so expensive. Most cocktails run $11-$13 PLUS tax PLUS Healthy SF fee! I personally really dislike bars/restaurants that charge you the Healthy SF tax. I'd rather they just bake it into the price. It almost feels like they want you to blame Healthy SF for the increased price rather than the fact that the employer isn't paying for it. Healthy SF is an amazing program so I have nothing but love for it, but I don't like the restaurants that almost make you feel bad for it.

In any case, a cocktail that says $13 on the menu turns out to be $14.57. But you are paying the price for a talented mixologist to make you a tasty drink, for the lovely decor and the bright setting, central location and creative concept. Worth it? I thought so. Would you get completely sh*t-faced here? Only if you had tech money. 

Oh, and for people who complain that it takes too long to get a drink - gurl, you are ordering a cocktail with multiple ingredients. If you want a quick fix, order a beer or a whiskey and coke, or walk over to the Irish bar down the street. Don't come to a cocktail bar and complain that it takes too long for a cocktail. There's a reason they take long to make. And I gotta say, Novela makes them right.
author: Logan The H.

description:
What an awesome, laid back spot. The atmosphere really carries the weight of this place, with enough light to see but with a dim, sultry lounge hangout feel.

We tried their punch because it's their claim to fame - I had the Scotch punch, and while the flavor was solid, I'm just not into the sweeter drinks. That being said, what should I expect from a "punch?" It's supposed to be sweet!

They had The Graduate playing on a couple dropdown screens while we were there, oh, and free popcorn. A definite spot to hit if you're looking to kick back with a cocktail.
author: Adam S.

description: One of my fav bars in the city. I love the themed space and the drinks. They're strong but well balanced. I've been able to reserve a booth without any issues but mostly have hung out by the bar or able to get a seat at one of the communal tables. I love that they have a water station and the bathroom area is pretty cool and promotes a social environment. There are individual stalls but one large hand washing area :)
author: Yin H.

description:
Wednesday or Thursday are my favorite nights as it's not too crowded (that would be Fri-Sat when it is crazy packed), and not too empty (Sun-Mon when it is sparse and quiet). So, highly suggest making reservations if possible.

Note they are starting new "event" nights (Sunday night movies or the Mad Men season premiere, and Monday oysters HH (http://novelasf.com/stirred-shaken-shucked/)).

My go-to cocktail lounge as it is a good, roomy meeting up place. Lots of chairs/sofas and tables. The location is near work, yeah so fifth star. But, Novela is also easy to find, is near parking lots (drink responsibly, yo), and is near all types of mass transits. Note there are many bars nearby if want to switch away from here too - like when the place is crowded.

The cocktails are seasonal and the menu changes in the Spring and late Fall. Drinks are pricey but quite good and you'll find something based on your alcohol preference. Something strong is the Hemingway's Punch which uses 3 whiskeys. Other punches I liked are the gin or tequila base though those don't seem as strong. If enough people, get a pitcher as that's the best bang for your buck (with ice it's 8-12 pours). You can also get as a flight of three or just a glass.
author: Peter L.

description: I've been to Novela twice so far and I've enjoyed myself each time. Th  first time I came was on a Friday night and it was packed, however great service was consistent. The second time I came, it was really mellow and chill - perfect to me and again great service. What I love most about this spot is that it has a lounge feel to it - there are actual chairs, sofas and stools to sit on which are super comfy and beautiful. The place is literary themed from the names of the drinks, to the decorations inside. The lighting is perfect and colorful. The staff has always been extremely nice, helpful and courteous (from the hostess, to the waitress and the bartender). The drinks are awesome and pretty unique . My favorite is the vodka punch! Order a punch flight and you will get 3 different drinks for $15. I haven't eaten much food here but I ordered the toast with tomato jam before and it was EXCELLENT. So good with my drinks! I highly recommend Novela - Try it out!
author: Angel R.

description:
Novela, an awesome modern and beautifully complex bar that attracts a very big crowd almost every night. I love how this place makes you feel fancy but isn't too fancy! 

Jay Gatsby, Atticus Finch, Daisy Buchanan - all drinks inspired by a novel character! Personal favorite is the Daisy Buchanan as it is like a Pisco Sour but has more of a kick to it.  For 11 dollars, these craft cocktails are great to sip during the night. 

Despite how nice this place is and how tasty their drinks might be, their bar tenders are super rude and it is also way too crowded. The bar tenders tend to converse with Novela regulars and don't tend too much attention to all people. This is a huge thumbs down as out of all SF bars, they are one of the rudest! I would go here again but not anytime soon!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
Growing up in Miami when you hear "Novela" you think drama, bad acting, evil mother-in-laws, slapping and the always present love story - that will eventually get really rocky, but usually ends on a happy note.

There was no drama here - and I doubt many people speak Spanish. All together, aside from the bartender being a jerk, this is a pretty cool spot.

I'll admit I don't usually do cocktails - I prefer a cold beer over liquor - but on a hunt to get a drink we ended up here after wandering around a deserted downtown for about 30 minutes. I was thirsty.

It's a really nice looking spot - there's a large bar in the center - and it's surrounded by bookshelves, exposed brick and various little seating areas for you to pow-wow with your friends. It was pretty empty on a weeknight - but I have a feeling this place gets packed on the weekends/happy hour.

Cocktail was alright....I went with the Christopher Robin. Two gins, ginger, fresh carrot juice and lemon. I got it mainly for the carrot juice because, well...carrot-orange juice is my secret jam. This was solid, the flavors were good, and it was properly made.

Back to the bartender - being a jerk. First, he had the personality of a cauliflower. Second we asked him to split the checks and he rolled his eyes - brought us the bill...no split check? HUH? I busted out some cash, paid my part and my friends put down various credit cards...I don't think we exchanged 2 words with this dude.

While in the area it's comfortable, cool menu, nice look, and was one of the only places open late...so I have a feeling I'll end up here again next year when I am in SF.
author: Blue A.

description: This place could be good except the people who work here are extremely rude. All they care about is getting you to leave for the next reservation which would be fine except when they do so 30 min before you're time is up. When we asked for another drink she said we didn't have time... seems like an idiotic sales lady to me. Enjoy your snobby literary bar!!
author: Chelsea A.

description: Novela SF, named after the literary genre longer than a short story shorter than a novel, has the stylish, kinda' trendy, hip, ambience to match its name. Met my girlfriend there for a drink about 6pm on a weeknight. Thankfully we reserved a table because the place was packed!  If you want to ensure that you have a place to sit, call in advance for a table. All the tables are high tops and intended for a cocktails and appetizers. Seemed to attract a good looking but young crowd. Hehe.. fortunately, I didn't stand out too much.
author: La Morena B.

description: I love all the spunky cocktails they have and the crowd is great.  Very modern clean looking place!
author: Chris L.

description:
1st time experience from this place. cocktail waitress was not helpful or friendly at all. She seemed irritated when we asked her questions about their drinks since we've never been there before.  Poor service. Not very attentive towards our needs. Over-priced cocktails; they served their martinis on a VERY small glass! what a rip off! 

I also thought from checking at their website that this place is classy & upscale, not the case however...and the waitress dressed like a bum!  i know they had theme night but c'mon now, I'm not saying the servers need to wear a cocktail dress (even though it won't hurt their reputation by wearing something nice), but you cant wear a run down over-sized t-shirt & jeans that's very unflattering to the eye either. 

Our 1st time there and it was our last.
author: April V.

description: I love this place. Great drinks, friendly service, and very hip. The fact that they take small group reservations makes them one of the most customer-friendly happy hour bars in town. It's my go-to for business meetings.
author: Matthew T.

description:
I so wanted to like this place. 

Books, organized by color, line the walls. Chic, interesting chandeliers hang from the ceiling, casting off a moody vibe. And the drinks have literary names, like "Juliet Capulet," "Jacob Marley" and "Dorian Gray."

The book nerd in me was in bar heaven. 

But several things turned me off to this bar, and my group and I ended up staying for barely one drink.

First of all: the drink prices. I ordered the "Mary Poppins," which is made with apple spirit, cherry wine, ginger liqueur, clove bitters, maple syrup, soda and lemon. The tab came to $13. 

The drink was tasty but definitely not worth the price tag. (And after leaving and trying other nearby establishments, we soon found that not all bars have such expensive cocktails.)

My group came to this bar on a Monday night, when it was barely busy. This spot isn't very large, but it still has the feel of a cocktail lounge where servers come up to the table, as opposed to customers having to go to the bar to order. 

But after waiting a bit, we went up to the bar, which was -- again -- not busy. Yet, it took us quite a while to get a bartender's attention. (Yes, the drinks take a bit to make considering they all have lengthy ingredient lists, but still. The wait was excessive.)

And when we finally did get a bartender, our drinks came with a side of attitude. We weren't rude to him, but he shoved the drinks toward us and seemed to be muttering things under his breath. 

We took our drinks back to our table, where we quickly finished them and then promptly left for another nearby bar -- where we bought several drinks, drinks we could have bought at Novela. 

And again, this is a shame. Novela definitely has lots of potential, but the price tags and customer service could use some work.
author: Emily H.

description:
My friend had a table reserved for 10:30pm on a Friday night to celebrate a friend's birthday. We started off the night with several pitchers of Hemingway's Punch (dickel rye, bushmills, ardbeg). Hemingway's Punch was really good, and even my friends that didn't like whiskey enjoy it.

This place was quite spacious and felt classy. It has a large selection of whiskeys for all the whiskey lovers. I'd definitely come back here.
author: Edward W.

description: Great ambience and cocktails - a nice place to hold a classy gathering and allow people to interact.
author: Despina L.

description:
Absolutely LOVED this bar. Came here on a Tuesday and it was packed which was a pleasant surprise. This bar is super trendy and fun with an obvious book theme. 

I ordered the gin punch and it was soooo goooood! Gin is my go-to drink and it was refreshing (both literally and figuratively) to try something other than my usual G & T 

Great ambiance, friendly staff and decent prices.
author: Ilana B.

description:
My friend and I got there before 5, to grab cocktails before moving on to dinner and the theater. Most seating was already taken or reserved. However, there was a ton of room to stand at the bar and we were served promptly. It got quite crowded by 5:15 p.m., not surprising for post-work on a Friday, I suppose.
 
We both started with the Lolita Haze, from the Seasonal Cocktails menu. Not cheap at $11, but pretty standard for speciality cocktails. The Lolita Haze is very refreshing, with vodka, blueberry, dimmi, lemon, and sage soda. For our second round, I got a vodka martini and my friend got the Christopher Robin ($10) from the Novela Classics list. Her drink was more on the savory side with gin, ginger, fresh carrot juice, and lemon. It was good but I think it would have been better before the sweeter Lolita Haze. 

This is a keeper as a fancy, pre-dinner cocktail location. 

Only a few minutes walk from Montgomery BART.
author: Emily J.

description:
The theme really makes this bar fun, with hundreds of books organized by color lining the walls on floor-to-ceiling shelves. The lighting is dim but colorful, and the music is a little loud for conversation with anyone but the person sitting directly next to you. The chairs and couches are loungy and large, but seating can be a bit awkward for bigger groups. It wasn't too crowded when I came on a Saturday night.

The cocktails are all based on book characters: I got the Jay Gatsby, which was a little stronger than I typically go for, but I couldn't resist the name! Drinks are a bit pricey for the size, hovering around $11-12, but they were tasty and the presentation is well done!

Overall, the ambiance in Novela is spot on, with every aesthetic detail pinned down, from the presentation of the bar to the cute wallpaper in the bathroom. I'm interested in going back for happy hour or one of their theme nights!
author: Olivia H.

description:
"Can you hear me now?"

The ceilings of Novella, is too low and much of a condense room, to hear beyond your own voice.  You would be exercising your lungs out at this place.

They serve up pricey, creatively named cocktail drinks and this bar lounge offers a speakeasy vibe.  They also have fruit punch bowls too!

They have chic lounge seatings and actual books that serves as their theme and if you desire to read here.  With the noise level, however, I wouldn't be able to comprehend.

Novella, doesn't have a cooking kitchen, but you can bring food in from the convenient food truck, Me So Hungry, outside.  They serve up the basic American food, such as fries and sandos.

Novella is a place for the ideal young, working professionals to mingle at!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
"I drink to make other people interesting."

Ernest Hemingway was a wise man and I'm pretty sure I've said these words at some point or another.

Novela is like your nerdy, bookish friend but really, don't judge the book by its cover. This place oozes sexiness and is swanky through and through. I love the numerous plush couches (so much space in the SOMA!) , retro lighting, the bookshelves lined with real vintage volumes (To Kill a Mockingbird, anyone?!)  and the floor ... it's a gorgeous black and white zigzag patern! 

The literary theme is evident in the cocktail menu. Try the Atticus Finch (bourbon, earl grey honey) or Leopold Bloom (gin, pineapple syrup). No matter which cocktail you choose, it'll be well made and delicious. 

I couldn't help but notice the scene here on Saturday night, def the spot if you're on the prowl. But if you're not into it, just keep drinking and everyone will eventually become interesting. Hemingway knows what's up.
author: Janice C.

description:
June 17, 2016   
Me: "Hi can I order a Gin and -"
Bartender in white bunny dress: "I can't hear you!"
Me: "HI CAN I ORDER A GIN AND-"
Bartender: "No, I mean I can hear you but I'm not listening!"
Me: "Oh..."

I was then helped swiftly by two gentlemen bartenders at the other end of the bar. Sorry that this review might indirectly harm those two as well, but the experience was already ruined by the rude one. I wish I took a picture of her to post here.
author: Henry H.

description:
A trendy lounge with a twist.  This place welcomes you to a modern appeal with books as the center of the decorations.  I do like the theme of classic novels incorporated into the drink menu.  You can have your taste of your favorite character in a book.  The menu does change, so you can look foward to the next creative cocktail name as well.  Be sure to guess which book the name comes from. :-)

The old-fashioned is extremely tasty.  You can expected a quality prepared cocktail with fine conversations with friends.  Just becuase it's your favorite character from a novel, it doesn't mean it'll be your favorite drink as well.  No matter your taste, you'll have a great experience and wonderful ambience at Novela.
author: Shirley C.

description:
After an awesome Monday, sometimes you need a cocktail to really top it off. A few of us headed here for early evening drinks and got a table easily. 

The decor is pretty glam - it's like a blinged-up library which I really liked. The drinks menu is surprisingly short and there wasn't a whole lot of choice. I went for the Lolita Haze ($11) - vodka, blueberry, dimmi, lemon and sage soda. For a group of 4 we didn't have to wait long for our drinks (even though we all ordered different things) and I was pretty pleased with mine - nice and sweet, and nicely topped with a sage leaf. For a one-drink bar, this was a perfectly good experience and the waitress was pretty helpful. I'd definitey go back.
author: Briony C.

description: Nice decorations, environment and good location. We reserved table as it is pretty busy but slow service. Got Macallan on the rocks but took so long the waitress comped it. Nice of her.
author: Gus H.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday night, so we definitely didn't have the it's-too-loud problem. I love the ambiance here - super classy and chill at the same time. The crowd was more young and professional if anything. I'm sure they all came here to hang out after work! (Pretty sure if I worked in the city, I would want to come here after work.)

Their tables are big enough for groups, which is pretty nice. Since I'm on a no hard alcohol diet, I ended up getting a beer, but everyone else in my group got the fancy drinks. Reading over the Yelp reviews, they look like they have some awesomely-named and delicious drinks. I'll definitely have to come back to try them when I can drink hard alcohol again! ;)
author: Christine S.

description:
Came here for the first time last night. Service was slow and hard to get ahold of but the drinks themselves were pretty good. Some really unique options like a Winnie the Pooh inspired cocktail with ginger and carrot!
 
Unfortunately, I (and the guy I was with) spotted a rat scurrying across the floor by the tables. Some other guys who were seated behind the bar noticed it too. I don't think I'll be back.
author: Ravital S.

description:
I've been here several times mainly after work on Fridays. A little too crowded most times. Spoke to Will, the security and he was super nice and chill to talk to. Said the best time to come to where it's not overwhelmingly crowded is pretty much every weekday but Friday. He runs the show pretty well and doesn't treat you disrespectfully like other security guards do at other bars and clubs in SF. He gets done job done with manners. Go Will!

It's well lit and the colors they use for the walls are very pleasing to the eyes. There's also several bathrooms you can use that are pretty clean. The walls are also covered with books as decorations and they're REAL books, which was super neat!

To get a drink, you'll have to wait a while so just make you're ready to order and maybe order a lot at one time to avoid wasting time in line again. We ordered a Pisco pitcher. There are others to choose from like tequila, rum, and vodka. The pitcher is $45 and we split it amongst 3 people. We each had 2-3 glasses. Not a bad deal at all! It was also made very well as the flavor was very tolerable.

If you want to sit, probably better to keep an eye out when people leave since this is a good starting point or end point for a drunken so people generally end up coming and going to and from here.
author: Melanie G.

description: Love the ambience...classy n good looking peeps..cool vibes n great delicious cocktails n reasonable prices n awesome music is flowing n no shame if u dance
author: Lokelani M.

description:
Drinks: 
Severus Snape    13
Gin, Dimmi, Snap Pea Juice, Egg Whites, Lemon, Honey     

*AUTOMATIC 5 STARS* No, seriously. Novela has a drink named after my favorite fictional character. This bar and I, it was love at first sight. Their drink menu has an extensive range of choices. All very different from each other. What I loved most was that they all were named after fictional characters in 

Service:
Met up with a friend on a Wednesday night for drinks around prime dinner time and Novela was starting to get lively. The hostess seated me right away (I had made reservations for a table earlier that morning). She noticed that there was a large party next to me who was being really loud, so she asked if I wanted to move. I really appreciated her thoughtfulness! She was so sweet and so were all the other workers at Novela.

Atmosphere: 
Dimly lit, roomy enough for large parties, sophisticated libary-esque decor. Can get loud, but they also have tables for couples, away from the crazy if looking for a more intimate setting.
author: Stefany Z.

description:
I admit I'm not the best reviewer of bars since I'm not that much of a social drinker. Neither is Jamie W., so we were surprised to find ourselves at Novela one evening after having burgers and fries at Sliders in the Castro. It was a Sunday just after sunset, and as we walked in, it was not as crazy-busy as I have seen it passing by on a weeknight. We secured two of the high-backed chairs in the area opposite the bar (photo: http://bit.ly/GNmoqG). The house music was so loud it was hard to concentrate on the small "Cocktails with Character" menu (photo: http://bit.ly/GNmqPv). It took us a while to figure out a waitress was not coming, so Jamie got all gentlemanly on me and ordered our drinks at the bar. The heady decor is meant to evoke the library of some manor (photo: http://bit.ly/GWzUJo).

But mind you, this is a hipster's version of a library since the books are fake and so are a lot of the trend-obsessed customers. These are people who live by their smartphones and cannot read anything more than a glowing four-inch screen will allow before having the need to text someone back right away. The female bartenders, on the other hand, are professional and hard-working, tolerating all sorts of pomposity from the suits who feel entitled to step in front of others to get their drinks. Our drinks have finally arrived. Mine was the $11 Huckleberry Finn, a slightly sweetened tumbler of Aged Rum, Grapefruit Marmalade, Angostura Bitters, Tonic and Lemon. Jamie's was the $11 Sherlock Holmes, oddly named since it contained atypical non-British ingredients like Kappa Pisco and Zucca Amaro.

There was also Laird's Apple Brandy, Birch Beer and Lime to complete the concoction (photo: http://bit.ly/1gdV0Cl). We downed those quite swiftly, so it was my turn to go to the bar. I decided we would share a flight of their House Punches, three come for $14. The red pepper-accented Tequila and the ginger-habanero-twisted Cognac ones were tasty, but their signature punch turned out to be the best, Hemingway's "Code Hero" which features three whiskeys along with Pimm's, Earl Grey, Grapefruit, Maraschino and Lime (photo: http://bit.ly/1bq5fxs). It made us want a pitcher of that one in particular. But alas, we knew our limits. Besides, to quote Katharine Hepburn when asked if she ever gets drunk or high, she snapped back, "Cold sober, I find myself absolutely fascinating."

COCKTAILS - 4 stars...intoxicating punches beat our the literary cocktails
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...lots of poseurs and awfully loud despite the supposed library setting
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...no waitresses but the bartenders deliver the goods
TOTAL - 4 stars...worthwhile for the Hemingway punch...a pitcher please
author: Ed U.

description: I like this bar! Pretty spacious for SF and even got lucky enough on a Friday night to get seats for the 5 of us. Classy drinks and atmosphere, punch bowls, walking distance to Local Edition. I like :)
author: Raquel Y.

description: Who doesn't love a good novela... or drink for that matter? We decided to hit up Novela around 8 pm on a Friday night and it was packed. Luckily we had made reservations so we could grub on some nibbles. We had the manchego croquettes and a burger. Both were cooked perfectly. The burger was a true medium and very flavorful and the croquettes were crispy and melted cheese perfection. Who would have known that bar bites were so decent. I decided on a very slightly dirty gin martini and hubby had the Atticus finch. Well crafted cocktails, finally someone who can make a good martini! Will be back again. Vibrant, bright decor. Crowd ranged from late 20s- 40s or so.
author: Allison K.

description: Bought a table for New Years. Bottle service girl was busy. Thought we'd help her out. Took my self to the bar to get my own drink.... Dude with pink bangs bartender. Literally the worst bartender ever seen. Kept skipping everyone with drink tickets with dudes for cash. Called him out and he gave us a "GFY" look. Well bud same.... last year at Novela for New Years.... 3rd one and last. Deuces!
author: Stephen J.

description:
Amazing place to grab a drink!  We were able to grab seats at the bar and had the best experience you could have.  We had our own private bartender that attended to us, as if we were the only ones in the bar.  

The drinks are made awesome and the bar menu was fresh with great options!  You can't go wrong grabbing a drink at Novela.
author: David C.

description:
Atmosphere: Perfect for bookworms and those who want to watch sports, this place has space for those wanting a quiet catch-up, the drinkers, and the sports fans. The couches are comfortable and the library-ish decor makes a bookworm like myself very happy.

Drinks: Drinks were tasty and there was a specials menu to choose from. My friend did order a specific drink (hot toddy) that he has had there previously but was told by 2 bartenders that they have never made that drink. Don't know whether they have taken it off the menu or don't know how to make it. The other drinks were fun, I tried to the Severus Snape, Christopher Robin and Hibiki.

Service: A-ok

Price: Reasonable for SF, the cocktails were around $11-12 each.

I like it and would visit again.
author: Feren Y.

description: Stopped in for a quick cocktail and found the Sophie Asher - it was perfect! Smokey and sweet but enough alcohol to keep me from chugging.  Place was packed and the back bar was closed for a private function.  I typically hang out back there so I had to find a new place.  Was hoping the RNC would be on T.V. so I could be entertained; however, they were off which was fine because I know I didn't miss anything worth while.  Loud atmosphere as you would expect for a packed bar but the place is romantic enough to allow for a close conversation.  If you have never been I would recommend a visit - the food is great as well which was a pleasant surprise!  Great staff whom are always friendly and professional.
author: Aaron H.

description:
I was here for a 7x7 event last Wednesday and this is a really cool bar. It has a bit of a library theme to it. All along the wall are books backlit with different colors. The bar is a good size and they have a smaller one towards the back. 

It was pretty busy in there. And I think I may have waited 20 minutes or more to finally get a bartender to make my drinks. The bartenders were making specialty cocktails so it really slowed down the bar as well as the lack of bartenders. My friend ended up going back later to get more drinks. I think I didn't see her for another 40 minutes. 

All of their drinks are named after well known characters and they have punch on tap! I didn't get to try any of the punches, but they all sounded good. I want to come back here again. Hopefully during a time when it's not so busy.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Inlove with this place. Drinks were on point and service was definitely 5 stars all around. 

I went with a group and we all agreed that this was a very elegant feel and friendly feel. 

I would go again and recommend all my friends and family to come joint!!
author: Cristina R.

description: Just okay; but there is something that bugs me about the place. I feel like it's faux-swanky, if that really is a thing. I'd go again if friends wanted to, but it's just not going to make it in to my regular rotation.
author: Leo I.

description:
Goodbye Fluid, HELLO SWANKINESS!

Many people are probably glad that Fluid is gone. I'm not gonna lie, the cracked clear floors were hella tacky but I have very fond memories of Fluid. At the height of my liberation period, I spent every Friday night at Fluid: bowing to the porcelain throne, sprawled out on the coach or on the sidewalk outside bowing to the concrete floor. Hot mess aside, Fluid was like home sweet home to me.

Although I was sad that Fluid closed last year, I was ecstatic to hear that they would be doing a major renovation and changing it from a club to a bar/lounge. 

As we walked into Novela for the soft opening yesterday (official grand opening is today), my jaw dropped to the ground as if I saw Channing Tatum in a thong.

Wow. Just wow.

A stunning transformation to a library themed bar, Novela boosts two bars with plenty of seating on plushy vintage furnishings, textured ceiling with chandeliers encased in metal spheres and an chic bookshelf stocked with illuminated colored books. I expected nothing less from the people behind Gitane and Maven; two of the most beautifully designed restaurants in San Francisco.

Novela's artisan cocktails ($10-$12) are named after characters from American Classics like The Great Gasby, The Catcher in the Rye, and Huckleberry Fin. They also have handcrafted punches on tap that you can order by a drink ($10), by a flight ($13) or by the pitcher ($45). I wish they had happy hour specials. 

*Cocktail menu: http://bit.ly/116VBs1
*Punch menu: http://bit.ly/11trtqF

Novela has one attractive staff and very smiley at that. Ernon (I hope I spelled that right), our bartender was awesome and friendly. He remembered me from when he worked at another bar in the Mission. Talk about having a good memory when I can't even remember what I ate for lunch yesterday.  

Mr. NSS gave me the evil eye when I wanted to order a pitcher of punch (yes, ALL for myself) so I instead opted for their cocktails. Both the Leopold Bloom ($10): http://bit.ly/11HiVTa and Daisy Buchanan ($10): http://bit.ly/10NjWUY were beautifully made cocktails by Ernon. The sophisticated Daisy Buchanan was my favorite because the egg foam gave the cocktail a creamy finish. 

I hope they have bar bites in the future even though if it's just charcuterie and cheese platters as it would make it a great date place to come for pre-dinner snack and drinks. 

Ohh, and the restrooms. Gone are the janky stalls, you know the ones you had to hold the door close when you popped a squat. The bathrooms are now unisex and are lined with sexy wallpaper: http://bit.ly/143efXd.

Everything about Novela just oozes swank so this will definitely be the new "IT" bar/lounge to go to in FiDi/SoMa. *CHEERS* to new beginnings...
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
This place is really really neat.  It gets pretty packed around "happy hour" when everyone's getting off work - can be really loud - however I've been in at many other times as well, when you can grab a seat or hear your friends voices! haha.  The decor is to die for.  Talk about a theme-bar done right.  The interior is gorgeous and fun and full of surprises, inspiring and interesting and let's be honest, pretty sexy! ;D  Sometimes the service can be a tad slow, but that's because it's freakin busy in there.  Generally really like this place and recommend!
I would also recommend calling ahead to make sure they'll be open, because lots of times they have private events there, so make sure you can actually go in!  
Cheers!
author: Gillian K.

description:
Novela was probably the first San Francisco bar I was introduced to back then and it never lost anything of its sexiness. Cozy leather couches, dimmed lighting, a long-stretched bar. Funky wallpaper and book shelves. 

Great drinks too. I give kudos to the bar staff that need to please a large crowd over the weekend nights - this place gets jammed! You can book a table or come early, both is necessary to secure a place to sit.  

A sexy bar in the Financial District - best nights are weekdays (Happy Hour, $1 Oysters!) or weekends if you like the scene.
author: Sebastian F.

description: This review is for renting out one of the private areas at Novela. We needed a spot for a small company holiday party, about 35 people, and reserved their Hemingway Room. Julie on the events team was awesome to work with, super responsive and helpful. The space was great and the whole staff was fabulous. Small plates were well-timed to our group's arrivals and Terry, our dedicated bartender, made fantastic cocktails.  I highly recommend reserving a spot at Novela for a company event of any size!
author: Miriam T.

description:
Cute place! Had the punch by the flight (tequila, black, and gin). Gin is my favorite. Strong punches with a kick. Little pricey but average for the city. 

You can not beat the atmosphere here. The ambiance is what makes me keep coming back. And the fact that I live 10 minutes away. Great place to grab a drink and chat it up.
author: Shellie H.

description:
Another cool bar... this was our last stop of the night and we got here right before last call.  This seemed to be the newest, trendy bar.  Diverse crowd, plenty of seating area, plenty of bar top area to get a drink.  

It looked like a good place to take a date but also a good place to come with a larger group.  

I had the Romeo Montegue cocktail and it was ok.  Not too big a fan of the flavors in it but didn't see anything else on the menu that sounded any better, and it was close to the end of the night.  

Vibe was pretty chill.. Only stayed for a bit.  

This place reminded me of Library Bar in downtown LA with the book shelves along the walls.
author: Sennett L.

description:
A swanky large space, delicious and strong cocktails, & free pass to wear jeans and not look out of place? I have definitely found my go-to bar near the Embarcadero bart station! 

I love Novela! The idea of having a literary-themed bar excited me the second I heard about it, and the execution of this theme is absolutely perfect! The interior design and furniture looks like I'm at one of Jay Gatsby's parties. But if you're not for that bourgy life, you can scout out the Harry Potter novels stacked on the walls (yes, there are actual books on the wall - how SF is thatt?) 

DRANK tips: get the Pisco punch, do it do it do it! Think masala chai spice (from the cardamom), with a yummy pisco sour tasting cocktail, and not ultra sweet to remind you that you're still taking in alcohol. This drink also educated me. Apparently, punch came from the Hindi word for 5 ("paach"). Gosh, love my people. Second drink, get the Sherlock Holmes! I mainly got it because I wanted to say "I'll take a strong Sherlock Holmes," and I was so happy with my choice! It's a perfect pisco cocktail, which comes in a very tall glass. In retrospect - I probably didn't need to ask for it to be extra strong but hey, made for a fun night. Next drink on the list (if I can get past the Pisco)- the gin-based Babette sounds delicious! 

PS yes it's loud so maybe not the best place for a first date... but idk, if I were taken here for the first time - I would definitely give my date +2 points for finding such a cool spot (and discovering the beauty of the Pisco).
author: Aradhana V.

description: Novella's a bit of a SOMA scene and I'm a bit of a Mission Bar kinda guy.  On the plus their drinks are strong, and the wall of books is cool.
author: Ivan L.

description:
I went here for for Stirred, Shaken & Shucked l Oyster Happy Hour on Monday. Oysters were $1 a piece, which is a great deal. The first person in my group got there at 6 and they were running order so she ordered 2 dozen for 7 of us, and thankfully she did otherwise there would have been none left. I enjoy oysters so they were really good and a great price. They also had 20% off bottles wine so we got a Red wine from Australia which I liked a lot. My friends got the shrimp and avocado toast which they said was delicious (and looked delicious). 

It's also a really cute environment with lots of space and not too crowded. I would say the only downside is that there isn't really food there, just appetizers which are really expensive ($12 for a small plate).
author: Jenna G.

description: Novela is a classy library themed bar with a great ambiance. There is no cover and no line, that is the best part of this place. We always wind up here close to closing when all the other bars get too crowded and ratchet. The crowd is diverse, ranging from maybe mids 20 to late 30s, and is always dressed very nice (this is becoming more and more uncommon). It's the perfect place to have a cocktail and hang out with friends, the music is good and not too loud. Novela is definitely a chill vibe so it's probably better to start your night here and head elsewhere after. If you are coming with a group, make sure to make a reservation so that you can get a table, or you will be standing. The bartenders have never really stood out, so not friendly but also not rude and the drinks are usually on the stronger side, regardless its beautiful and I will keep coming up since it's a more upscale venue.
author: Anita S.

description: OMG, this place is amazing..whiskey on the rocks..sweet..the ambience is nice, clean bathrooms, people were friendly, wasn't packed..got here around 9:30pm on a Thursday night..would definitely come back. My favorite was esteban trueba!
author: Minerva L.

description: Super cute spot. I really like the colorful library decor, nice for an intimate date. However, the bartender was the rudest most unwelcoming ass$0l3! I ordered a manattan up, that tasted like straight buorbon, $15 drink, he started challenging me over and over again with what was wrong with it? How do you make a good manahattan? ' I told him I wanted it to be a bit more sweet so he grabbed the bottle of sweet vermouth $ dumped it into my glass which spilt all over the counter, and no cocktail napkin, so my glass was sitting in a huge puddle of sweet vermouth. The girl next to me politely asked for a menu and he just put his hands up in the air and stared at the stack of menus up against the wall. Really????? Is this how you are going to treat your customers? Get some decent bartenders that can mix a drink, handle their shit, and make it an enjoyable place to go.
author: Karina E.

description:
I was fortunate to have my company holiday party here. So, I may be biased when it comes to the service and (free) drinks since it was open bar and we had the whole place to ourselves. This place is beautiful and has sophisticated decor. Since we had a private event, I didn't have to deal with strangers, waiting in line to get my drinks, or finding a place to sit. 
I'd be curious to know how my experience would change coming during a regular night. But for now, I had a wonderful evening!
author: Mimie L.

description:
Novela pays homage to classic literary heroes in design and spirit.  The old Fluid lounge gutted and remodeled.  They opened up the front with big windows and brought this place back to life.  

Currently the hot spot downtown and a lot better than that dungeon around the corner called Comstock.   They get a pretty good looking crowd after work and on weekends.

The drinks are all made with fresh juices and garnishes.   The bartenders are fast and can crank out drinks so you don't have to wait 15 minutes.
author: James H.

description: Came here for a GNO and had a table reserved for about 10 girls.  One of us had been there before so the rest of us were newbies.  We were able to get inside hassle free (not much of a line outside) but it was packed inside!  The bar is in the middle and there are tables around the perimeter.  Their drink menu is extensive but apparently they are known for their signature punches.  We got the Pisco Punch in the 32oz pitcher.  This ended up being enough for our party of 10 to each have a glass with some to spare.  The service was pretty decent for table service, but it would've been nice to see what it was like up at the bar.  The atmosphere is homey and comfortable but has all the details of a typical bar (loud music, lots of people and mostly standing room).  Would definitely come back here if I'm in the area.
author: Reena P.

description:
I live nearby and I come here because its convenient. The more I come here, the more I realize that the service is rly bad. Every Time I've come here it takes me a really long time to get a drink. If I'm waiting at a bar it takes super long because the bar area is soooo crowded. Even if I have a table, the waitresses are slow!!! Its too loud here! It's not a lounge or a club. It's a super loud dance club that nobody dances at. 
But I really love the interior design and the atmosphere!this is why I keep coming back here. 
Because of the convenience, I decided to throw my bday party here. They had a nice bday package but the seating arrangements weren't ideal. I ended up having to put tables together myself n the area wasn't private.  There wasn't a table prepped to put my bday cake so It was across the room...
I think for some people if u come before the rush, its good for happy hour.
author: Anudari K.

description: This place as a really great feel to it! 25-30 people was a bit awkward to start out because seats are very limited but throughout the night people stood more and it got busier so it was fine. drinks are not cheap but are decent in taste. Gin/Sake was way too sweet , so don't get it if you weren't expecting a sweet lemonade! The rest of the cocktail menu was creative and enjoyable. I would recommend a more intimate crowd here maybe up to 8 people. Ambiance is great! Thanks novela!
author: Felicia C.

description: I love the book themed decor and drinks. I have the Ophelia and is was delicious! We got there at 8:30 and were able to get a table but it started getting crowded quickly after that. I would def come back.
author: Tara C.

description:
Hi Classy-pants, I finally caved in and got haters happy hour in the city for the first time in years. Not sure if we can be friends, because dayum, i don't think I can afford you. 

I mean, you are like the guacamole at Chipotle that I am not supposed to have because you will make my cheap lunch cost more than $10, when your average drink cost $13 and I haven't given you a nice tip yet. 

Strong? Not too much. Bold? Definitely, you have the mad men in you alright. But hey, that is the average price for a drink in SF. Great drinks, great staff, beautiful venue, however Novela, you are only for special occasions.
author: Phuong V.

description:
Gin Sake Punch is all I have to say.

Just kidding, but for real, it is probably the best cocktail I've ever had. You can't even taste the alcohol...! IT'S A MUST HAVE. My friend got the Scotch house punch and that definitely was too strong (if you're tryna turn up, that's a go-to). We all got on a pretty good level that night from the drinks here, haha.

When you walk in you'll see lights coming from the bookshelf-ed walls! Pretty neattttt! I felt like it was too fancy at night, but it's not that kind of ambiance. Around the walls are reserved private seating for parties. There are random island tables for people to sit and chill, but it can get pretty crowded in Novela. The bathrooms are to the far left opposite corner of the entrance.

I would definitely come back here to try the other house punches because they all sound so good!!
author: Nicole C.

description:
I can't think of a more aptly-named location to host a book club. I can already picture it. As a new month unfolds, we would convene to select a book off the shelves. Two fortnights later, we would reconvene to discuss poignant literary themes and symbolism whilst sipping on delicately detailed cocktails.

Orrr we could just nix the books and stick to debaucherous drinking while being surrounded by books to give the impression that we're classy, though we're actually just chortling over the punniness of "cocktails with character" when it's technically cocktails named after characters. Oh gosh, those preposterous prepositions!

Ahem. Now that I've tossed my monocle in the trash, I can actually describe my novel experience at Novela. Which actually wasn't that novel, though we had just come from the IMAX experience of "Interstellar," which made for some novel drinking discussions.

I tried 2 seasonals and 1 classic: $11 OBERYN MARTELL made with calvados, curaçao, allspice, and cranberry, which indeed was stiff; the $11 OPHELIA made with encanto pisco, blackberry-blueberry jam, egg white, Peychaud's bitters, and lemon, which was my favorite; and the $10 MISS MONEYPENNY made with mulled vodka, pear, honey, drambuie, and lemon, a close second favorite. I definitely prefer their refreshing & juicy drinks over their stiff & spiritous selections ahaha.

Random note #1: the bathroom stalls here are all individually partitioned and maintain the classy feel of the entire venue. A small thing, but duly appreciated.

Random note #2: our female bartender was very attractive. And yes, I said that before the drinking commenced.

Random note #3: I'm becoming a huge fan of weekday night drinking. No wait and plenty of available seating boooooyaaaaaah.

Thinking on it, I bet there are San Franciscans who host regular book club meetings at Novela. I need to get in on that. As well as their delicious-sounding seasonal and house punches. Flights of pitchers, anyone?
author: Adele F.

description:
Cool atmosphere (I am a sucker for bookshelves) 
Friendly and timely service
Fun bar concept with literature-inspired drinks
Seems like a nod to Classic San Francisco 

Drinks aren't amazing and are average priced. It was ~$15 for a 3-flight tasting and about $10 for a cocktail. It can get a little crowded Friday nights but my friends were seatless for less than 5 minutes.
author: Tammy T.

description: This is a really nice place. The decor is unique and the drinks are amazing.
author: Mel B.

description: This place has a cool vibe and was my first of three bar hopping places around the Mission. Look at me speaking like I am from SF. Ho Ho Ho. There isnt really a place to sit down so you can just stand and linger by the books. People are usually in jeans, nice top and jacket or what not but you may see some girls in classy dresses for that reserved table space. I am not sure what drink I got but I asked for barely any alcohol and he did it for me. Thanks dude. I came around 10:30pm and after 11pm is when the line forms. Cool hip place
author: Amy H.

description:
Novela is a fun, classy, and slightly whimsical place to do happy hours or evening weekend outings in the FiDi area. Seriously, how can you go wrong with a place that serves Elizabeth Bennet and Emma Woodhouse drinks?! As a girl who has read her Jane Austen books more times than she can count, Novela has defaulted to one of my favorite bars in the city. I just can't believe it's taken me so long to finally visit.

You can't check out the books, but you can certainly check out all the DRINKS. The PUNCH FLIGHTS will probably get you the most bang for your buck; it's almost like getting three drinks for the price of one. The Fall Harvest, Pisco, and Gin + Sake punches were all delicious and packed a...punch! For a drink that's sweet but still has a lot spice, just like my favorite Bennet sister, I would try the ELIZABETH BENNET. For the fans of more "stiff and spirituous" drinks, you can go the route of scotch with JAY GATSBY. Novela's menu provides a handy key to guide you towards drinks which fit your taste palate. 

I absolutely love, looove, LOVE the interior of Novela. The lighting and ambiance is great for a date or group gatherings. As the crowds come in later in the night, it does get more noisy. However, I had no problem talking with friends in the couch corner. 

If you plan on coming with a larger group, you can call or use Yelp to create a reservation--highly recommended if you come during the evening hours as it does get super crowded. For groups you can grab a large table or sit in the couches by the corner. Ask for the loungey corner if possible! The couches and pillows are very comfortable and cozy.

The SERVICE at Novela is pretty attentive. The drinks came out quickly and we never had to flag down our server. Just double check your bill at the end because they added an extra flight but left out a cocktail on our receipt.

If you are curious, yes those are REAL BOOKS on the shelves.
author: Bonnie Z.

description: made opentable reservation , show up, ops private event. They take zero responsibility for closing their reservation desk. Very disrespectful to people who make advance reservations
author: Ola K.

description:
Now that I'm back on the dating scene, I've been thinking that maybe I should just hang out at Novela everyday. I think my chances are good if I want to meet an Asian techie who makes a decent amount of money. The question is: Will he be tall, handsome, and single (probably not). 

Just to clarify, I'm kidding and I'm not that shallow (or am I).

I like that Novela is within walking distance to where I live so I can easily get home when the evening is over. I don't understand why the main bar doesn't wrap around. It leads to very long wait times for drinks that are too labor-intensive. I just realized that there's a back bar that is not as crowded if you walk straight, past the main bar.

There is a decent amount of seating but it can still get crowded later in the evening on weekends. That's ok though, because my bed time is early.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Novela recently turned one, so happy b-day to them! Running a successful bar in the heart of demanding young techies ain't easy.

As the name suggests, Novela is literary-themed, both with the decor and drink menu. If you didn't pick up on that by the name itself, hopefully the books on the shelves or the cocktail named "Catcher in the Rye" brought the point home.

Lots of craft cocktails to choose from, but if you can't pick just one I recommend the house punch. Always something a tad different, a glass won't break your bank account. Read: it's less that $15 per drink, a steal in SF.

Getting a seat during happy hour can prove tricky since Novela takes reservations. Chances are you'll be smushed somewhere near the right side of the bar. But that's ok since it's roomier than many small time joints.

Come here after work and let loose a little bit! Chances are you will see your co-workers and peers doing the same.
author: Abby S.

description:
I'm kind of a 3.5, but dear god the crowds. I will never go on a Friday again! Mark my words! 

Novela was a cute place to go - my friend wanted to go to a lounge, and we looked up Novela. Thing is...though I would call this a lounge, the huge amounts of people here bump it to really a bar. So...wear comfortable shoes people, you're going to be standing a while!

Drinks are aptly named. I had the Sherlock Holmes, which I blame 90% on Benedict Cumberbatch (season 3, I wait eagerly for you!). The drink itself was pretty good, and quite strong. Bouncer was very nice, and there was no line to get in at the time (around 6PM). I parked nearby, and when I passed it again at 11:30, it was still line-less. But somehow PACKED inside. How...do you do that?

Guy-girl ratio...guys, this is your place to be. I'd hazard a guess that it's a 2-1 ratio for you...maybe 3-1. I couldn't tell...just felt like the odds favored the males more. 

Maybe I'll come by on a different weekday and see how much I like it...might bump it to a 4 then.
author: Lily W.

description:
I had a lot of fun at this chic, classy spot.

Our little group were very newly acquainted and were hunting for a quiet spot to grab a drink and get to know each other! Tomas R. suggested Novela so we headed over.

The decor is beautiful - the floor is a kind of herringbone black and white, the bar is super stylish, and there were dropdown screens playing The Graduate. I could have done without the distraction of the TVs, but it was fun to have a classic movie on rather than sports or some such. I loved the bookshelves lining the walls, too.

I grabbed a flight of punches - the house, the Thai, and the Scotch, and they were all quite good. The Thai was a little milkier than I was expecting but worked well, the Code Hero was probably my favourite though - the Ardbeg added a delicious smokiness to it. The scotch was good but a little sweet.

I loved my time at Novela, it was quiet but the atmosphere was still great, and I can't wait to make a return trip!
author: Ayla C.

description: I like the atmosphere and books on the shelves. But may be they put to much ice in the cocktails,  though, if  you like to have a frozen snack while you are drinking
author: Mariana S.

description:
Never been to Fluid, but Novela was so pretty!  I decided to stop by Novela on a Saturday night last month to have a low key birthday get together.  I actually originally wanted to go to Hawthorn but didn't want to pay cover, so Novela it was!  

Handcrafted delicious cocktails, though it can take awhile to get a drink, not to mention the attention of a bartender.  I ordered the Ophelia ($11) which was a pisco based blackberry and lemon drink.  It was very refreshing.  I had a sip of my friend's punch which was good too.  Given the fact that it can take awhile to get a drink, you may just want to split a pitcher of punch with your friends.  

I was surprised at how packed it was on a Saturday night.  Unless the tables are marked, seating is first come first serve.  This place doesn't have a dress code and draws in a mix crowd, from those wearing sweats and Hawaiian shirts to the casual to the super glammed up crowd.  And of course, what place wouldn't be complete without a d-bag or two?  Totally met one who's friends let me sit at their table.  I'll definitely have to check out Novela sometime after work for another go around.  Security wouldn't let my friend back in to tinkle after last call.  Parking is a pain in the ass, so you will probably have to park several blocks up...if you're lucky!  3.5 rounded up.
author: Cat C.

description:
Came here for birthdays twice, and every time was a great experience! 

My fiancé and I decided to come here to celebrate our birthdays with a small group of friends after dinner. We had made a seating reservation for 10 people through Yelp and were seated immediately. Definitely make a reservation if you and your friends want to try the place out on a busy Saturday night as seating is limited.

The decor and ambience was as amazing as we had remembered it with small intricate details lining every wall. The atmosphere was definitely lively and the music kept it going. Our waitress was friendly and attentive and quickly took our orders soon after we had a chance to glance over the menu. 

Novellas menu is comprised of many interesting drinks as well as sporting an assortment of "punches" on tap which came in a variety of sizes - the 32 oz goblet is a nice share for a small group. There are definitely more drinks than hours in the night, and something for everyone from fruity cocktails to whiskey on the rocks and if you're not sure, the wait staff are glad to help you create a drink of your own.

Overall it's a great place to hang out with friends and if you're down for something a little out of the ordinary.
author: Yang L.

description:
Novela is decorated with reading chairs everywhere and shelves of books on the side. The place is very loud and with all the books you see around you, you would think the Main Library was throwing a house party.

The bar theme is pretty awesome, and they made sure the awesomeness extended to their menu too. You can order a Holden (not sure if he'll consider this phony) or a Jay Gatsby among many other famous literature characters. When I saw that, I was sold.

The bartender girl was very nice, and she didn't mind that I was a noob at ordering. Watching her fix the drinks was quite a scene. She filled my order of 5 drinks with speed and efficiency. If there were a Guitar Hero Bartending Version, she would be pretty expert.

My 'Holden' was kinda strong, but the garnish made it pretty good. I hear the Pipey Longstocking tastes just like orange juice. 

Novela's drinks are definitely up there in quality. Pair that with their creative bar theme and you got yourself one fantastic hangout spot.
author: Ringo M.

description: Came here last week for a HH after work event and I'm very impressed with the layout.  Love the book shelves with the real books.  I didn't get to order my own drink as we ordered as a group.  We had the House punch(Whiskey, pimm's & grapefruit/lemon) which was very tasty.  I'm not a big fan of whiskey but I really like the taste of it.  We'll definitely be back for more HH events.  Not sure why this made it into the not recommended list but I'll try posting it again.
author: Jon L.

description:
Not a huge fan of the drinks, but I like the atmosphere of the place and the cocktails are VERY reasonably priced so I'm rounding up from 3.5 stars.

I came for a friend's birthday and we had a table reserved for us. It's a pretty loungey, trendy bar with a library theme. The place is decorated with shelves of books and they have unique cocktails that are named after literary characters. My group and I ordered different cocktails so that we could try more of them. The drinks weren't very strong and again, I wasn't a huge fan, but some of them were better than others.

Service was good. Our waitress came by several times to check on our drinks and even jumped in on our game of Heads Up/Charades with a pretty good Australian accent.

==========

-CHRISTOPHER ROBIN $12 (no. 10 gin, king's ginger, carrot juice, bitter lemon soda, lemon)
The cocktail I ended up ordering. It came in a tall cone glass, like the shape of a carrot, and was topped with a sprig of parsley, so it looked like a carrot. I wasn't a huge fan of the drink, but it was okay. I think the carrot juice left a little weird aftertaste, but it wasn't anything terrible


-OBERYN MARTELL $11 (calvados, curacao, allspice, cranberry)
A very stiff cocktail. My group and I all weren't a fan of this one. The allspice is very overpowering.


-ELIZABETH BENNET $10 (kappa pisco, plum, rosso vermouth, lemon, chili)
I really wanted to order this drink because I love Pride & Prejudice, but I was hesitant about the chili. I like light and refreshing cocktails and was right in not ordering this. At first sip, the drink was pretty nice and refreshing, but then the chili kicked in as an aftertaste. Wouldn't recommend if you don't like chili in your cocktails.


-OPHELIA $11 (encanto pisco, blackberry-blueberry jam, egg white, peychaud's, lemon)
Probably my favorite that we tried. It's sweeter than the other drinks because of the jam and sweeter than I'd like my cocktails to be, but not overly sweet. I thought the egg white was going to be mixed in the drink, but it's actually a foam on top and it definitely tastes like egg whites.
author: Jessie L.

description:
You walk in and see a large hall filled with wood, books, and fancy chandeliers.

I really enjoyed the evening at Novela.  The walls are lined with shelves and on those shelves are thousands of books.  The books it turns out are real.  Check them out next time your there. 

Novela's flagship drink is the "Leopold Bloom", but my party was more fascinated by the fact that they have Punch on Tap!  Yes, that's right - punch.  One person in our crew tried it and it reminded them of tropical cocktail due to the sweetness.

Only constructive feedback is that it is very loud in the place, so can be difficult if an intimate conversation is needed. 

TIP #1:  Try the "Esteban Trueba".  Its a cocktail they've truely mastered.  Its some combination of Cachaça, White Rum, Lime, Maraschino, and Absinthe.

TIP #2:  This is a weekday spot, due to its proximity to FiDi.
author: Joel J.

description:
Novela is hella sick. That is all.

No, I kid, I kid, I have more to say, but that's a good tid bit. After having a terrible Old Fashioned and a terrible Gin and Tonic and eating terrible Parm Truffle Fries at Pink Elephant with my homeboy Ramon, we needed something to lift our spirits. He'd been raving about Novela's Old Fashioned for a few weeks, so we popped over.

The ambiance has a chill, upscale, library bar vibe to it with cool books on the walls, clean, chopped light firewood lining the shelves offers a rustic feel. The warm Edison bulbs are encased in giant metal birdcages, suspended overhead. Oftentimes, there's a foodtruck parked out front so you don't have to get bent over by the high prices Novela unfortunately has.

I sipped on my delicious Old Fashioned($11) and enjoyed the solid tunes filling the room. I went back on Monday this week for $1 oysters (from 4-7pm) and 20% off bottles of wine, but the wine prices were a little steep for my party, so we opted for 3 dozen oysters and random beers and cocktails. 

Service is a little slow, even on a Monday when it wasn't too busy. I've had better service on a busy Thursday, so they seem to know that people come for the oysters and aren't really in a rush to bring them out. Either way, I'm a fan and will most definitely be back for more.
author: Crystal C.

description: Nice cocktail bar near the museums I stopped by a little after hey had opened on a Saturday and watched fill up seats fairly quickly . I had an esteban trubena , which was fairly strong and good. I shared some a]'s including a hummus plate, which was good. It is a well dressed cocktail bar with black and white zig zag floors and comfy couches for small or large groups.  Nice for a date, group, or solo cocktail enthusiast
author: Jean L.

description:
I like this place, but maybe not for the right reasons.

My friends and I enjoy the occasional night out on the town. However, I have a very different approach to it than them. I prefer having my first drink being a nice cocktail or beer. Once the alcohol has taken an edge off of my ability to taste, I usually follow up with cheaper drinks and shooters. 

My friends enjoy the first cocktail, and the second cocktail, and the third cocktail. This lead to a point of tension between my lowbrow tastes and their sophisticated palette. But have no fear, Novela is here!

They have their own home made fireball mix, which is a bit sweeter and doesn't have the same burn as that handle you passed around in college. Their old fashions are a bit on the fruity side, which I personally like. It still have that smoke, but you can definitely taste the orange. At the same time, they have Tecate for $3! Miller High Life for $4. I did laugh, as the subtitle for Tectate is "Premium Mexican Lager."

This may be every man's dream. Classy setting, classy drinks, and the option to not break the bank.
author: Jake B.

description: Great cocktail bar with nice small plate food selections. This place has amazing interior decoration and in case you are wondering the books are REAL! Their punch on tap is good too. I tried their vodka punch and it was tasty. I would certainly recommend Novela for drinks.
author: Ray G.

description:
The hostess here last night was just awful. A few friends and I sat at a reserved table prepared to leave at any time, but the hostess made such a fuss about it. As if it were such an ordeal to simply say "Sorry, but the reservation has arrived." It is generally not appropriate to piss off your customers, but it's worse when that person you are pissing off has an open tab for four.

Definitely the last drink I'll have at Novela.
author: Simon L.

description:
Charming little spot. The decor is classy and the drinks are delicious. Their drink menu rotates (weekly?) so get ready for some delightful experimentation. And if you get your heart set on a drink they're no longer serving when you come back? Well... there's never harm in asking. 

The one downside: Novela could use a little more seating. It's fine most of the time but finding a place to sit or set your drink down can get tricky on Thursday evenings and weekends.
author: Sophie B.

description:
Novela...how I love (and loathe) thee... *sigh*

Location: fantastic SOMA location close to Market/ Metreon/ Yerba Buena. It's in the center of everything, which is why everyone and their coworker/boss/mother/brother/cousin/second cousin twice removed goes here after work.
