Ambiance: great decor with the wall of books organized by color (my inner OCD freak thanks you, Novela). Seating is a struggle as half the place is reservation-only. Friday nights you can count on being two to three-deep at the bar elbowing  for space and fighting for the bartender's attention. In short, it is LOUD LOUD LOUD. So if you hate that sort of thing or are on a date I wouldn't recommend coming here. I'm okay with tuning it out most of the time because the cocktails are 100.

Drinks: gahhh please more thank youverymuch. The skills of the bartenders here are top notch. I haven't had a bad drink yet because they are all so delicious. These will keep me coming back even to fight the throngs of people here for the same thing.  

Clearly, it's a love/hate thing for me, but my love for convenience and tasty cocktails will keep me coming back to Novela.
author: Liz G.

description:
Came here on a cold Friday night after dinner with a friend to complete our girls' night out. It wasn't very crowded, but the seating was all taken. We ordered our drinks and got them relatively quickly. 

The thing with Novela is, you come here for the atmosphere and the décor. The crowd consists of people who are in their late 20s to 30s, so if you're a 20-something, I don't know if this is the place for you. It's a classy place and I personally wouldn't come here in jeans. It's a place you come to dressed up. 

I got the Huckleberry Finn and my friend got the White Punch. Both of our drinks were extremely strong (although mine was well presented). We didn't get tipsy, because I took a while to finish my drink, but my friend decided against finishing hers.
author: Deepti N.

description:
3.5 stars, and with the right drink order, an easy 4. Very lovely decor and ambiance, but there could be more seating (and more comfortable seating). Our group of 7 perched around a small table that had 2 stools at it. 

I was pretty into the "books" theme, and the walls are lined with them. The only one I grabbed off the wall was Glenn Beck's - I enjoy how ironic it is that his books have ended up lining the walls of a fruity cocktail bar in San Francisco. There are small justices in this world, after all. 

The main event at this bar are $45 pitchers of various punches - pisco sours, whiskey-based things, something with sake and gin in it... they were WAY too sweet for me, and sickeningly strong, depending on who made it. The prices were fine, as one served all 7 of us, but it's just not something I would ever want to drink again - I'd be better off with a $30 pitcher of margaritas. Great for the sugar-loving alcoholics, kinda rough for the beer crowd. 

Pretty packed for a Tuesday night - I have no idea why tech nerds feel obligated to get hammered during the week. I guess we just never learn. Ugh. 

With a better game plan, I'd return. Definitely worth a visit.
author: Laura B.

description: Loved the ambiance of this place! Very classy. Being a Harry Potter fan, I had to try the cocktail called the Severus Snape. It was interesting!
author: Divya S.

description:
Stopped in for a drink after work before dinner and was greeted with a spacious and luxurious library-themed bar. I loved the decor (though the red and green lighting was a little odd) and thought that the entire venue was really well designed.

Their cocktails ($12) are named after literary characters, and I went with the Severus Snape - a gin based drink with snap pea juice that made it taste like green juice! I loved how not sweet it was and strongly recommend it. 

Bartenders are friendly too. Wish there were happy hour prices, but there aren't.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Staff was friendly, attentive and so accommodating. 
The drinks were great.
We had a reservation for a small group and it was the perfect spot. The hostess was wonderful.
If you are visiting to enjoy the "Novela" theme, best to go early when it isn't as crowded and it is much quieter.
Later in the evening the music and crowd picks up. Still fun, but not much of the "Novela" theme included later into the evening.
My only request would be to serve food a little later for simple bar nibbles. The kitchen closed fairly early.
author: Fawn B.

description:
NO-VELLLLLLAAAAAAAAAAAAA!! 

A bar popularized by the 20- early 30 somethings of the great SoMa district of San Francisco. You can certainly expect to find great drinks (get the house punch for ~$11), a friendly staff, and a VERY nice ratio (about 50/50).

There's tons of seating but arrive early because the place fills up! It's also a frequent / ideal location for club / alumni / meetup events because you can reserve space for your party. 

There's usually a food truck out front on Fridays to satisfy those drunchies but I usually end up at the ever-so-delicious Tropisueno which is about a block south, towards the mall.

Come check this place out and stay thirsty, my friends.
author: Chris W.

description:
me:  "Would it be too loud inside tonight for me to read my book?"
Bouncer (unamused):  "Yes.  We're having a private party in half of the bar tonight and it's going to be loud.  In fact, I would never recommend reading a book here."

This place is posh.  On a Tues night, it wasn't too loud.

My friend and I got two girly drinks:  the Ophelia, and Scarlett O'Hara (which tastes like sparkling gingerbread), and they were delicious.  I'm coming back here again, and I'm bringing a book.
author: Letitia L.

description:
Trendy bar in soma...many of the drinks are inspired by fictional characters from novels (the theme of the bar...) such as 'Jay Gatsby' and 'Daisy Buchanan.'

My friends ordered two pitchers of their cocktails, and told me that the bartender allowed them to sample the cocktails for free before deciding which ones they wanted. Greatly appreciated before ordering a $50 pitcher :) We had one that was tequila based (sorry that I don't know more about this cocktail) and this one was decent, but we all really liked the one that was sake based with some sort of lychee flavouring.

There are many places to stand and chat and also larger tables for bigger groups. They also have small intimate tables with fewer seats (approximately for groups of four).
author: Theresa L.

description:
Wish I could've spent more time at Novela, but girls kept hitting on me non-stop to the point it became unbearable and we had to depart.

Ok, no one believes that.

What really happened is we were doing 2 drinks per place then moving to the next spot, and I fancied the drinks so much here that before I knew it I had already finished them!

My friend and I liked checking out the impressive interior design of Novela, as it is an attractive lounge with a book/literature theme, complete with lit-up bookcases. We had been at Local Edition (vintage newspaper theme) right before coming here, so this seamlessly ended up being the next logical destination. A sophisticated night, indeed.

Although there were no available seats/tables when we arrived, there was enough space in the bar area to comfortably enjoy our time here. The staff was welcoming and even the bouncer made conversation.

I had the Miss Moneypenny (from the "Cocktails with Character" selection) and then Hemingway's "Code Hero" Punch (this is their handcrafted punch on tap), which features 3 whiskeys, earl grey, grapefruit, lemon, etc. I appreciated how their punch is made from fresh ingredients with the fruit being "carefully zested, juiced, blended, and strained by hand" (yes, I got that from their website). Almost makes me feel like I was juicing. Miss Moneypenny is vodka based and included pear and honey. Really, I don't think you could go wrong with any of their cocktails or punch.
author: Brandon C.

description:
Love the decor, the atmosphere, the service, and definitely the drinks!!

Came upon this place to catch the last quarter of the Warriors game, and thankfully they had the projector on.

My overall experience was great!
author: Erica C.

description:
This place is brilliant. What's better than being surrounded by young, good-looking professionals of SoMa and drinking delicious cocktails made by bartenders who clearly love their craft? Being surrounded by all that and impressively back-lit books. 

Novela's theme of literature appeals to pretty much everyone - the real bookies who let their inner nerd squeal when they see this place for the first time and the yuppies who don't have time to read anymore but still need to maintain a well-versed perception. This place felt more like something I would have seen out of Manhattan and yet it was completely normal that I found it instead in SoMa. The drinks are top notch - I would recommend any of the classic cocktails on the bottom of the menu - the Dread Pirate Roberts especially is a treat. Everyone should go here at some point!
author: Manosai E.

description: Interior is cool, walls are bookshelves with books, there is a light shining directly on the books creating a glow. Fancy chandeliers also make it look modern and trendy. Interesting to see a unisex bathroom so don't be alarmed. Place is very noisy however since it was packed with people. Cocktails are pricier 12+ which is expected. Overall nice bar to chill with friends.
author: Yoomi C.

description:
One of my new favorite places to drink (I don't even like alcohol) and hangout. 

The ambiance is very nice - very bougie but in a good way. It's filled with "books" - hence the name. Their drinks are also named after famous characters. 

I had the gin-sake punch and it was dangerously delicious. I couldn't taste the alcohol delicious. The Scarlett was also really good. 

I highly recommend this place to chill, grab a drink and take in the ambiance. ;)
author: Stephanie W.

description:
I'm a fan of Novela. It rides a blurry line between schmancy cocktail bar and fist bump, evening lounge and does it well. Sure the library-esque room is somewhat strangely supplemented by glowing neon lights and various literary characters identify drinks from cocktails to punch bowls but there is a lot of space, costs are fair and most of all..
...drinks aren't horrible. 

For a place that doesn't require a reservation and you have to wait in line 5 deep to order drinks and wondering if you should unbutton one more, the drinks are decently crafted and the vibe is chill. I would easily come back if I was in the area.
author: Jonathan Y.

description: Went there for happy after work.  Decent ambiance but terrible service.  I ordered a sparkling water and I had to follow-up multiple times before it was delivered to my table.  I also asked to close out my credit card- but instead of giving it back right away, they kept it and I walked out without it after signing the bill.  Two weeks later I figured out what happened.  No reason to support a business with such crappy service.
author: Maggie B.

description:
This place is swanky!! I fell in love from the moment I walked in. There are shelves of books all over the walls and they're all in bright beautiful colors. Part of it may be from lighting as well. I didn't get close enough to really see. None the less the decor was beautiful. There was lots of seating and big leather chairs everywhere. 

The bar is in the middle and they had a nice list of fancy cocktails. I got the Scarlett O'hara which was delicious! It's sweet and lemony and was beautifully garnished. I felt pretty fancy. The cost of the cocktails were about $10. You don't have to order off the menu but they offer some really delicious drinks that I would never think of ordering. I was told the punch bowls are good too. There was music playing but it wasn't too loud so I was still able to talk with my friends without screaming. The place is dark but it gave a good feel to it. 

Definitely a great place to check out. We came after dinner to wind down with drinks before calling it a night. I was in a group of about 10 and we were all able to sit together and talk while enjoying out cocktails.
author: Eva C.

description:
Crowded. EXTREMELY loud. Can barely hear the music playing in the background or what the person right next to you is saying.

Good thing my friend reserved tables for our party of 10 because standing by the crowded bar would've sucked.

The waitresses were useless as we had asked them several times if we could order drinks and we were told each time they would "be right back." You literally each just checked on the party next to us two or three times, can one of you just take our drink order?

In the end we went to the bar to get our drinks and pitchers.

Upon leaving, my friend even had to go up to the register to track down a waitress to settle her bill after waiting 20 minutes for her check. She should have walked right out instead.

Awesome service here -_____-

I wanted to like the place for the hip crowd, awesome setup, yummy punches,  and amazing decor, but the incompetent waitresses killed my mood.
author: Bonnie S.

description:
A name like Novela sounds wannabe novel, but it exceeded my expectations and can be deemed truly novel.  

The decor is a mixture of intellectual, modern, and vintage--which, as much an oxymoron as it seems, created a flawlessly trendy ambiance.  The books lit under multi-colored lights comes off with a fresh and energizing vibe, unlike Library Bar (both SF and LA) which I personally find a bit too literal and almost geeky.  

Drinks were excellent and matched the novelty of the ambiance.  The cocktails are creatively named after characters and all have a complex array of ingredients (and good alcohol, I might add); it's a little bit intellectual in that it's been well thought-out and you need some time to ponder over the selection.  

Roy Hobbs (bourbon, rhubarb tea, cocchi americano, amargo chuncho): on point and sophisticated.  It reminded me of the Negroni, only much better.

Dread Pirate Roberts (sta. teresa claro rum, diplomatico rum, miller amaro, strawberry,  balsamic, cherry bitters, absinthe, lemon): admittedly slightly more girly than the Roy Hobbs--I bet strawberry was the culprit--but still very good, with notable overtones blended into the dark rum.  It's served in a metal Moscow Mule-esque mug and it's funny that you can't even really see your drink because it's under a pile of shaved ice.  (Yeah, adult shaved ice....)

Interestingly, the drinks took awhile to make, which is probably why they were so good: not like your average bar where they just whip up stuff without much attention or precision.

The downside is that it's rather crowded and noisy on weekends, so it can be difficult to find seating.  (I guess the crowd and noise level is the only thing not novel about Novela.)
author: Edna C.

description: Only wished I lived in the area so I could come here all the time! The seasonal and classic cocktails are great. The Therese was more tart while the Juliet Capulet was subtly sweet. Plenty of space, classy drinks, classy attire
author: K C.

description: We wanted a nice cocktail after going to the beautiful sfmoma. We eventually got nice cocktails, so that's why they get a star. Also the atmosphere/the lighting is nice. The service however is atrocious! We waited 10 minutes at the front for the hostess, who was waiting on some people, but paid no mind to us. After approaching the hostess she was rude and told us to find our own seats. So instead we went to the bar. Which we waited 15 more minutes. There were only 3 other people at the bar. After 25 minutes of being there we finally had our drinks. We dare not order another one because who knows when we would have gotten it
author: Marcus J.

description: I walked by this place several times before actually going in. The decor is very nice, and it attracts a large after work crowd from SOMA. They make some good craft cocktails with pretty reasonable prices considering the quality. The bartenders are very nice, but due to the complexity of the drinks you often have to wait a bit to get things made. We didn't try the food.
author: Jonah K.

description:
I had the chance to visit Novela on my latest SF trip. I was attracted to this bar because of the decor. The whole wall is lined with books and the place has a classy feel to it. My friends and I went there late on a Saturday and there was a short wait to get in.

Novela is definitely the place to be seen in SF. Everyone was dressed to the nine and the bar was super crowded. The cocktails were fancy with a price to match. They take reservations for tables but you have to reserve way ahead of time. I tried to book it over 2 weeks ahead and nothing was available after 7pm.

I would also recommend trying to go later in the evening. We went after midnight and a lot of the tables were leaving so we were able to get a table to sit down at.

The crowd is nicely diverse but a little bit snooty. It was a little difficult to get service but our bartender was nice enough. Overall it's a bar that I would visit once for the experience but probably wouldn't make it a point to go back again.
author: Natalie K.

description:
The place feels a bit too feminine at first but it's cozies up just fine. I like how it's spacious enough that you're not constantly trying to dodge other people. Good drinks with creative names.

The service there is aloof to say the least. I was at the bar when the bartender lost someone's credit card. They weren't all that nice or feigning nice (or apologetic for that matter) to that customer. I won't be leaving my tab open there or anywhere else for a while.
author: Yad L.

description:
Good drinks
No cover charge.
Most people are from different tech companies.
Weird to see many men with backpacks... is that the fad now??
Lots of seats to lounge around which I like.
Not overly crowded.
Good mix of people.
author: Claudine V.

description:
This place tries hard and has a good selection of spirits but I found all of their cocktails to be on the sweet side. (Not balanced). And the bartenders are nice and trying hard but also don't quite cut it. I specifically ordered my drink (not too sweet) and the honey in it still masked the flavor of the other ingredients. Then I ordered a really aromatic gin all of whose character was drowned out by the overwhelming amount of citrus they added. They were trying really hard so I didn't send the second attempt back but I won't be expecting anything with subtle flavors here.  I would expect a place like this to have a happy hour, but they don't hence it was kind of empty at 6:30p on Saturday. 
On the plus side. They don't play music so loud that you can't talk and there are lots of nice places for groups to sit. And they have a slushy machine with daily specials. It was Jack Daniels and Coke when I was there but I feared it would be too sugary for me so I avoided it.
author: Priscilla C.

description: Upscale lounge in SoMa/FiDi, very Vegas like theme. The whole place has a classy feel to it with books all over the place and drinks named after some of the more well known fiction characters. Cool spot for happy hour,gets really crowded just like most other bars in the area so you probably won't get a table unless you go early or make a reservation. They don't have any specials for happy hour but I would definitely recommend checking it out!
author: Teju S.

description:
Great place to grab a pre-dinner drink or spend an afternoon for happy hour. The bookshelves surrounding the bar add a real "library" feel. Nice armchairs, cozy tables and leather furniture give this bar a very welcoming vibe. They serve delicious cocktails that are subtle twists on old classics. And all of the cocktail names stem from classic novels. For example the Jay Gatsby is a combo of bourbon, amaretto and scotch. The Romeo Montague is rye, coriander and allspice dram. 

Although I did not try them, I'm told the "punch" is what they are known for. They serve different cocktails "on tap" including old fashioned, and other vodka and pisco drinks. Looks tempting, I'll be sure to try these when I come back again.  What a clever idea.
author: Chelsea R.

description:
This place is definitely worth a visit.  Very cool ambiance and interior design.  The interior itself will make me come back.  The drinks were good, and its a nice place to have a few drinks.

My only thing is that the bartenders/waitresses are a little snooty...nobody helped us for a good 20 minutes and they all were sort of just hanging out and socializing with each other...and then they acted surprised when we went up and asked for a drink,

Other than that...the ambiance is totally worth it.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Novela has managed to win me over throughout the last couple years. I went here shortly after they opened and was not a fan. It seemed like a slightly above average dive bar (bouncers, unfriendly bartenders, sponsored bar mats) with an upscale facade. After ending up here with a group over a year later, I was pleasantly surprised, and now it is on the regular post-work rotation.

The drink that won me over was the Leopold Bloom. Hibiscus infused gin, which is made in house, gives it a wonderful blood red hue. Served over crushed ice, a few of these is a great way of taking the edge off at the end of the day. Given the tasteful decor and location, they are also reasonably priced. The only complaint on the interior decorating is some of the sitting area feels too open and underutilized. There is almost an uncomfortable amount of distance between people.

The friendliness factor is still a little hit or miss with the bartenders. Some of them are nice, some of them are rather unaccommodating. Luckily I only order one thing here now, and since it is a house special there is a much lower risk of having a bad run in over drink orders.
author: Michael S.

description:
Basically the NorCal/San Francisco version of Library Bar in Los Angeles, this novel/book/library themed bar is a great place to meet up and have some drinks with friends.

We stopped by here after heading to nearby Local Edition, which was extremely crowded and even had a line to get in, so it was a pleasant surprise that although it was also somewhat crowded here, we didn't have to wait to get into the bar.  The rainbow-colored lighting and decorations really set the atmosphere here, and the drinks seem reasonably priced and the name are pretty entertaining.

Would definitely come back if around the area, although it is kind of loud, if you're trying to have a deep, philosophical discussion with someone, this might not be first choice.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Love the vibe here and will definitely be back! We came here to celebrate my friend's admission to UPenn, whoohoo! She made a reservation and it was a good call since that reserved us a table. We were thinking of bar-hopping but decided to stay here because (1) it was raining and (2) this place is where it's at!

The shelves of colorfully-lit books are REAL! They're real books. We pulled one off the shelf to have a look. Not sure if this is allowed though... When we did this a second time, an employee kindly asked me to put it back. Haha, whoops!

With the table/reservation, we also had a server, which was pretty cool because we didn't have to fight our way towards the bartenders. We were debating between three punches (gin, scotch, and black) and the server recommended and offered us samples of the three before we committed to a pitcher. Thank goodness we all tried it first because we ended up choosing something different after the tasting.

The pitcher ($45) was enough for 5 people, 2 drinks each. As it got busier/later, the server disappeared... She came back only once or twice and we had already gotten two drinks at the bar by then.

Novela is a great place with a mix of people and ages. Dimly lit but awesome decor of books and chandeliers. Has an upscale feel to it. Definitely want to come back to try the Mary Poppins cocktail!
author: Sandy T.

description:
Notes from the morning after:

- Their "Jay Gatsby" was one of the better old fashioned's that I've had. At least I think it tasted like an old fashioned - but hey - cocktail noob here, so someone correct me if i'm wrong.
- Monday dollar oysters did not disappoint.

- Asked for some extra pieces of bread for the extra cheese and avocado/shrimp dip left on our plates. Waitress asked me, "Would you like crostini or bread". Looked at her blankly and said, "um...  ... both". 

- Learned the difference between crostini and bread
author: John Y.

description:
We'll see if they can improve...bad acoustics, trendy in a scene-y way, and the incompetent waitress can't even tell us which punches they still have. We order punch one. She comes back 5 minutes later: oh, we don't have that. We order a second punch. She comes back 5 minutes later: oh, we don't have that. We order a THIRD punch. Yeah. She comes back 5 minutes later: oh, we don't have that.  

The crowd is bridge and tunnel.

On top of the crappy service, one of the employees gave my coat away to another group.  Then lied to me about her mistake.  We were standing by the door.  She pointed to a guy on the sidewalk outside and said he had it.  I asked him if he had an extra coat or took a coat.  He was polite, but said no.  He also said they hadn't even been inside Novella.  

The person who ultimately had my coat was a very nice middle-aged couple who bore no resemblance to the 20-something single man the employee pointed to.  The employee took my coat and stuffed it in the middle-aged man's bag, who left not realizing it was in the bag.  Thankfully, he was a Good Samaritan, and my security badge (in the pocket) had enough information for him to track me down to return the coat.  

So many reasons never to return here.  So many reasons not to recommend this place at all.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Okay, I must say they really made up for the faulty "Yelp Seatme" online reservation system. On Friday, we were given the private seating area in the back of the bar for my friends and I.  Usually a paid area, she gave it to us for 2 hours, which I reserved through the Yelp Seatme. They definitely made up for it and I really appreciated it. 

I highly recommend hosting your party or happy hour here with friends. The side group seating areas are free to reserve, but the main one in the back with a bar area is paid, which is also the best seating area. On a crowded Friday night, it's nice to use their reservation system to book a spot. 

My friends were so impressed with the place and I was given so much props for it. Of course, it wasn't me alone. Thanks to the hostess at Novela for making it all happen! I will be back for their delicious drinks! 

On a side note, I've never been charged for drink tax here before or anywhere else, but I was charged $1.25 extra for one of my drinks that already cost $12. I don't know what gives, but I just didn't tip. But to the bartender, it was a nice carrot infused drink.
author: Moua L.

description: This bar is actually really cool. They have like a library theme going on. Can't explain. Drinks are really good.
author: Autumn M.

description: Great place to hang out with friends or bring your date here. All the cocktails are named after classic literature characters and the amazing decor: walls full of colors coordinated books!.I want this to be my apartment. Seriously! Monday night $1 oyster bar and the cocktails are about $10-12 dollars. Very reasonable for such s fancy bar.
author: Claire Y.

description:
I mainly love Novela because the decor is absolutely beautiful.  Sadly, I'm not a huge fan of their drinks - I stick with the same punch every time.   Beware, because it gets ridiculously crowded! If you're smart, you'll book a table in advance - no fee, and you won't have to wait forever (literally F O R E V E R) at the bar, the waiters will come to you. :)

Love this place for a drink after work!
author: Suki B.

description:
Hands down, one of my favorite bars in the city.  This place serves cocktails crafted for and named after characters in well, novels. From the drinks I've tried, the Daisy Buchanan and the Atticus Finch, I would say Novela does a fantastic job of creating drinks that these characters would have.  The Atticus Finch was bitter and stiff, the Daisy Buchanan, nice and fruity.

The bar itself is nicely decorated and situates itself slightly on the higher end of the spectrum when it comes to class. This place is good for events like girls' nights, birthday parties, company functions, and others of the like.
author: Patricia K.

description:
Novela and I have an "its complicated on Facebook" type relationship. 

Its lengthy, its layered, its dark, its complex. Yet, I keep finding myself going back.

I have been coming here since it was fluid (dating myself here). I have spent tens of thousands here, I have been tossed out a back door into an alley and I have made some great (sometimes fuzzy) memories here. 

The atmosphere of this spot is a lot like me. 
Back then, I was ratchet, I wanted to be seen with a bottle in the corner whilst avoiding conversation with substance and I regretted everything the next day.
Now, I keeps it classy (or so I think). The atmosphere is open and elegant, the service is great, the drinks are reasonable and I'm usually tapped out and ready for Netflix after happy hour. 

Novela (or as friends call it, (BROvela), is nestled in SOMA so you tend to get an influx of business professionals and techies in their northface vests and dark washed denim. The crowd tends to be cliquey (see: after work hh) and dies out after the allotted time. TV's are plentiful for game days and there is an abundance of couches and places to sit, should that be your preference. 

Novella, I am proud of the man you have become. You had us worried there for a while as fluid, but you shaped up and are a force to be reckoned with in SOMA.

And anyone in tech, we are on to your vests, flannel, dark denim and clarkes. Time to get creative!
author: Ryan L.

description: My first lounge experience in SF and loved it.  Nice drinks and ambience and decent crowd. Friendly, accommodating and  professional hostess and waitresses.
author: Gloria T.

description:
Came here around 6pm on a Friday to have a few drinks with my colleagues. It was super packed which wasn't too much of an issue. We came in with a party of 9 or so we definitely wanted some space. After we got our delicious drinks we were just venting away about work and what not in circles. BUT EVERYWHERE we stood or sat the waiters had a problem with it. I have never been to a bar in SF with such RUDE customer service! 

On the bright side,they played Beyoncé and other hit grooves so I'll give them 2 stars instead of 1 Ha! 

Nevertheless, never going back again.
author: Reet R.

description:
Came here with some of my relatives from socal for like after party/drinks after a wedding couple weeks ago. 

Crowded so seats can be limited since some of seatings were for the people with reservation. 
They played loud/average music plus a lot of people talking so it might be hard to talk to your friends

Bar is in the middle

Kinda low dim light but it has that Trendy/colorful feel to this place. You might as well dress semi-casual or dress up nicely when coming to this kind of place. There were some people who dress very casual.

Its cool that this place actually has a bookshelves wall with books as part of their decoration.
 
Decent drinks. So-so price. It is a cool place if you want to come here for a cocktail or whatever drinks and hang out with your friends
author: Julie N.

description: This is a nice place for an after-work drink. Kind of upscale, but also down to earth, not too loud, and a good drink menu, with lots of good whisky based drinks. All in all, a winner.
author: Andrew K.

description:
This is a really unique idea for a lounge. All the walls were lined with actual books and have neon back lights to make the place colorful. I know this because i pulled a few of them out to check haha. 

The cocktails were creative as well which were named after characters from books. for example they had a drink (I think a marg) called Veruca Salt (she's one the bratty kids from Charlie and the Chocolate Factory) and I ordered an Emma Woodhouse from Jane Austen's Emma. While the cocktails are a little pricey, I loved the unique names and they definitely do not skimp on the alcohol, let me tell you. Most of the tables were reserved so I'd reserve a table if you have a large party. I also liked that you could actually have conversations here and you weren't shouting over the music to talk. Overall a fun ambience and place to spend a thurs or fri night.
author: Miriam M.

description:
I love this spot...mix of sexy & chic plus delicious drinks...and well men in suits...yes please. 

They have a great selection of drinks...bartenders take much time in creating those delicious monsters...thank you :). 

Vibe...i dig it, I'm totally into the lounge, good music, great decor and of course the delicious drinks. Place is on my top 5, will be back for many happy hours.
author: Priscilla N.

description:
I found my new fav Happy Hour spot in SF in the heart of SOMA! And no, it's not a dive bar!!

Stopped by Novela after a big meeting and I couldn't have asked for a more perfect place. A colleague called in advance to reserve a few tables, and upon sitting down, we had a server ready and willing to take our drink orders. 

Novela offers a great variety of cocktails, from their house made punch, along with their seasonal punches, as well as their own crafted specialty cocktails with character like "Juilet Capulet, Romeo montague, Alexander Supertramp, etc.,  For those who are not as adventurous with their cocktails, wines by the glass (and bottle) are available as well as bottled and draft beers. Unfortunately, there are no Happy Hour prices at Novela, but drinks are moderately priced from $5 to $13. 

The ambiance is cool and sophisticated without being stuffy. I love all the details from the lighting to the fixtures to the wall paper inside the bathroom!

I'd imagine Novela is packed on the weekends, so your best bet is to come right after work on weekdays. It's a great place to sit back and unwind after a long work day or afternoon meeting (like me) with cool cocktails and great company.

Until my next Novela outing!
Cheers!
author: Gill C.

description:
What a fun place! Went with a group of friends on a Friday night after dinner. I got a table reservation which was really nice. WE had a nice lounge area that we sat around and talked and drank. We got the gin-sake punch which was absolutely delicious!! I don't know how strong it was because bigger drinks are usually weaker and there was a lot of ice, but  I mean bars are bars.

I love bars like these that have literary themes since that is what I am into. But drinks were goooooooooooood. I would definitely go again! Also if you don't get a reservation theres good music and lots of floor space to chill
author: Bori B.

description:
You either love this place or hate it.

-very loud
-very crowded
-drinks take long (craft cocktails), but are tasty

it's great if you come with 3-4 or more ppl.  but don't come here with one other person if your goal is to talk and have a nice conversation.

I gave this place 3 chances, and 2 for 3 i left early for 25 Lusk  or Press Club.
author: Angelica C.

description:
The vibe and atmosphere of Novela is great. The couches are comfy, cozy, and very fun to cuddle up on. The lighted books, beautiful chandeliers, and cool furniture no doubt make this a really cool place to hang out at. Also, the bartender (and I didn't get her name, but I think she's also a manager) is really nice, funny, and knowledgable.

That being said, I made a reservation for 10:45pm on a Tuesday and there was no hostess at the stand. Apparently they forgot about my reservation and had already cut the hostess and lounge server for the night- it wasn't that crowded so totally was not an issue for me at all, just was a little unprofessional. 

Most importantly though, my date (who's a chef) and I were not fond of any of the 4 drinks we had: Juliet, Gatsby, Pisco Punch, Fogg. They were unbalanced and it was difficult to taste the nuances of the ingredients that the one would hope for in a craft cocktail. It might have just been a missed night. Apparently their menu changes seasonally, so perhaps we will try again during a different season.

TL;DR- cute spot to hang out, drinks are meh.
author: Rachel M.

description: Love this lounge/bar. The decor is beautiful, it's roomy, the bartender are talented and friendly, and their drinks are strong. Try the "Jay Gatsby" if you're a fan of Bourbon.
author: Katie P.

description:
As a self professed craft cocktail connoisseur, Novela is definitely at the top of my list of crafty cocktail places. We got the Hemingway's "Code Hero" Punch bowl. Don't be fooled by the pitcher it comes in, there is plenty in there for like 8 people. We shared among 3 people, which was a challenge we happily accepted. The punch was definitely not watered down and had the right balance of alcohol and sweetness. I definitely want to come back to Novela to try the seasonal cocktails.

The decor was super trendy. I love the library theme especially with the books are arranged in a rainbow. Even on a busy Saturday night, most people are here to get a drink and move on, so you'll eventually find a seat. With the constant flow of people, it makes Novela a great place to people watch or meet a new friend.
author: Melissa M.

description:
I hosted a birthday get-together here and really enjoyed everything about it.

From the reservation process, follow-up, welcoming me to the space and ordering drinks, everything was great.  The customer service was really amazing.  We ordered several of the "Punch" pitchers and they were awesome.

The space itself is great since it's unique and chic, but still on the casual side.  Most people were dressed well, but with a casual edge.  It got pretty packed around 11pm or so, but it was still manageable.

This is a great place and I will definitely return.
author: Ken G.

description:
A modern twist on literature.  This loungy/bar is known for their seasonal specialty drinks.  We came for a friend's birthday and had three small tables reserved for our party.  Not saying that I'm getting that old, but it is definitely nice to be in a place where the crowd is older - you don't have to worry about crazy drunks pushing and shoving their way around the bar.  Another plus is that with table reservations, there is no minimum.  

The servers were really attentive and took our drink orders on a schedule, however, it did take quite some time for them to actually bring the drinks back.  Overall, a nice, classy evening at a venue that wasn't overcrowded.
author: Sophie L.

description: I came here after work with some colleagues. Nice atmosphere, good food and imaginative drinks. Somewhat expensive, noisy, and crowded (but most trendy bars are). Friendly and reasonably attentive service.
author: Jethro B.

description:
As soon as I walked into Novela, there was a certain glow to the space that felt comforting with a dash of sophistication. The lighting was well done and created an amazing ambiance that I can't find the right words to describe. We lucked out and found a table without reservations but even if we had not found a table there was plenty of space to maneuver around and stand.

Novela is the only place I know that serves punch on tap so definitely A+ for that. I will definitely have to head back soon to try their flight of punches =) 

I had the pleasure of trying the Alexander Supertrump-no.209 Gin, dolin genepi liqueur, cranberry, lime and thyme 

The drink was clean, refreshing and well balanced. I loved the use of the cranberry and the freshness of the thyme because it helped to accentuated the dolin genepi perfectly and for the icing on the cake they used no.209, one of my all time favorite gin's! This drink was made for me =)

I will say that because their drinks are so innovative they do cost more on the higher end but to me its worth it for the experience! 

Overall Thoughts

Gorgeous space, well crafted novel drinks, punches on Tap, need I say more?
author: Eddie W.

description: Great drinks - I mean really great from their punches to the gin and tonics I had. The bartender made each one with a different gin at my request just to taste the differences from which botanicals were used. Food was very good as well. Great place for an event!
author: Mark R.

description: I spent over a hundred dollars with my friends on January 11, 2017 and they kicked us out because "'more important" people came to sit where we were. Feel free to contact me for receipts as proof. They were very rude and accused us of serving drinks to underage friends when that was not the case.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Horrible service. I came in with a huge group of people on a pretty empty night and it took them forever to get one to us. Plus while we were still drinking and buying alcohol they were trying to kick us out of the tables.
author: Ruby D.

description: Amazing $1 oyster happy hour, super fresh and the three mignonettes are delicious. Tasty beer and wine pairings. Cute atmosphere, trendy, and a little loud. Love that you can (have to?) make reservations for drinks.
author: Mirabella Y.

description: 194. Dropped by on a Thursday night.  No line outside and it wasn't crowded inside.  We managed to grab a couple of tables without reservations, but we did come here fairly early on a weekday.  I tried the whiskey punch, which is a good deal if you're coming with a crowd.  Didn't really like the taste, but hey, it was pretty strong.  That's always a good thing (:
author: Katherine C.

description: I found this place earlier in the week on yelp and I knew from the pics that it was a must see place. I got there around 9ish and the place was pretty busy but not crowded, which wouldn't have been a problem because this place was pretty big for its location in downtown sf. The vibe of this lounge was fantastic, I mean they were playing all the right songs and the drink were on point. The bartenders were chill and nice, which can be hard to believe in a lounge like this. Overall I had a blast, the atmosphere was great for meeting new people and the lounge was fun and lively. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to dress up a little, have a drink, meet people, and all while listening to some awesome music. I will definitely be back.
author: Yash P.

description:
Cool spot to hang out with friends after a long day of work.
Great atmosphere and some decent seating if you get there early.
Drinks are around $12 a pop. Hand-crafted which is a nice touch.
They also have pre-made punch which is delicious. If you have a group it's the best bang for your buck.

Definitely check this place out!
author: Angela D.

description: Staff is generally unfriendly and the drinks that take 20+ minutes to make are diluted with juice. Your chances for a better night are elsewhere.
author: Ian W.

description:
For a book lover that enjoys a good and classy night out with friends or a date, I would highly recommend this place.

The venue is awesome, and they were very thoughtful with their interior design and decorations, making this a haven for drinking cocktails that remind you of the old classics you used to read :)

I can't wait to show this place to my coworkers this Friday!
author: Meaghan H.

description: I go to Novela for the variety of clever cocktails, but what keeps me coming back is the customer service. The atmosphere and the staff makes this place unique and welcoming. The Jay Gatsby and Scout Finch are my go-to's and I highly recommend  them.
author: Elmira Z.

description:
Been here just two times this year. Themed, chic, modern. 

Not too hard to find and it's really cute inside. Colorful lights and impressive color coordinated bookshelf. I'm not sure if the books are allowed to be taken from their spot to be read. I know that when I was there, most people weren't there to read. 

The cocktails here are named and inspired by characters from these novels. I remember drinking one inspired by Daisy Buchanan from The Great Gatsby which was very good. The other day ago, I stopped by with my friend and we both got several rounds of the Gin-Sake punch. 

The punches are seasonal and prices vary depending on how much you want at once. Since we got rounds by the glass, it was $10 per glass. The Gin-Sake has nolet's gin, sake, jasmine green tea, lychee, and lemon. On a few of the rounds, the bartender shook some kind of powder on top which I didn't like. 

Though it can get busy and it can be hard to find a table or a seat, I like this spot as a lounge to catch up with friends.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Novela is a cool concept for a cocktail/bar. 

I like that the setting is a classic old-fashioned bookstore or library. You see those book selves? They are actually filled with REAL books, not just props. And yes, I did check by grabbing a book off the shelves. That being said, you probably won't find anyone reading them, unfortunately. 

The drinks here aren't amazing, but can be a little priced ~$12/cocktail. Beer selection is somewhat limited. Literature-named cocktails area cool concept but not sure if they are analogous to the fictional works they are named after. They are known for punch bowl flights. I've tried the Dorian Grey, Mary Poppins, Miss Honey Penny and the Black Punch. All were decent but did not leave me wanting more. Dorian Gray was my favorite. Mary Poppins and Miss Honey Penny tasted fairly watered down. Black Punch was very interesting because the molasses made it almost taste like BBQ sauce. Like I said, interesting but leaves something else to be desired. 

This is a good place for an after-dinner cocktail, especially considering that it is big enough for there to not be a line. There's a lot of big tables and bars to spread out across. So chances are, if you want a seat, you will be able to find one.
author: Jenny Z.

description: library themed bar. if you dont have reservation, you will have to stand. there is a common table though. I had the jay Gatsby cocktail, because he is my fav character. it was strong but i liked it. we spent $150 in 2 hrs. it was a fun night. It was retro night so they were playing Michael jackson. Go there if you wanna socialize and have drinks.
author: Dev B.

description:
Novela is a bar after my book-loving heart. I hear it can get crowded post-work, but if you happen to stop in around 9 on a Monday it will be pretty empty most likely. 

The walls are adorned with books, the seats remind me of something I'd want in my library, and the cocktails are named after famous literary characters. I ordered the Atticus Finch which was drops of deliciousness in a glass. Made with bourbon, Earl Grey honey, and Balsamic bitters, this is a drink I dream of. 

Reasonable (for SF) prices of about $10 per cocktail, surprisingly friendly and fast bartenders, and a quiet atmosphere all make this a new favorite cocktail stop for me when in the city.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Right in the heart of Soma and dangerously close to Soul Cycle, lies Novela. This is a bar after my own heart. You walk in gorgeous black and frosted glass double doors to a long black and white zig zag floor. Running along each wall is a serious bookshelf. Each is color coded so that the books phase through red, yellow, and green. I'd like to steal the whole thing for my house! The bar is intricately carved wood lit with unique single bulb lights. The corner group areas have stunning chandeliers hanging over them. 

Now to my favorite part...each cocktail is craft made and named after famous authors! I enjoyed the Lolita with vodka and cranberry. It was very refreshing! They also serve some food including devilled eggs and avocado toast. Just be aware that the kitchen closes at 9pm!
author: Kari G.

description:
Classy, great service, amazing punch and specialty drinks, and an interior design you'd like to emulate at your place. This area really needed a place like Novela. 

House, Milk and Scotch are my favorite three punches (in that order).

As for cocktails, Romeo (whiskey lovers), Salvatore Paradise (tequila aficionados), and Ichabod Crane (all you rummies).

Great on week nights, especially during conventions, VERY busy Fridays and Saturdays starting immediately after work.
author: Mike V.

description:
Nice atmosphere,  I went there a couple of times and like the place. However the last time, we were unfortunate due to a very rude server. Well my friend saw a cocktail just near us,  but she didn't know the name (which is understandable). She asks to the bartender if she could have the same (he just served the other cocktail), the bartender answer in an agressive way :"what's the name?? I need a name!! ". 
My friend was a bit offended and me too.. I can understand sometimes in fast paced environment,  you can be stressed, but that's not a reason for being rude with smiling clients. Despite of that,  I tipped him.
author: Lino M.

description:
Novela, upon walking into this venue you can breathe a sigh of relief as you enter the space were it is spacious and also cozy. The decor matches the vibe of the space, classy, cool and a breath of fresh air to city where it is crowded, full of people and there is no space to let loose. This is a space where you can.The decor of the venue is a mix of modern ballroom and a awesome classical library. It's a great space for both socialites, intellectuals to gather for a cocktail. 

Highlights- my drink of choice was the Jacob Marley: Bourbon, Apple infused oloroso, sherry, and cinnamon bitters . The drink was smooth, rich and tasty, the bourbon and the cinnamon bitters gave way to the flavors of autumn season. They had a selection of different cocktails to satisfy any drinkers palate. 

Oysters- came here on a special night from 4-7 pm where oysters were $1 each. That's a win, especially in the city where oysters range from 2.50- 3.00 each. They had both west coast and east coast oysters, and 3 vinegar based toppers to choose from. The only downside is the special runs a few times a month, so you have to check ahead of time.
author: Kimberly G.

description:
I have to say, I sort of love this place!

Yes, despite the fact that we had to wait in a line outside to get in during a cold, cold SF night in August, it was totally worth the wait. I think that this concept is amazing because you definitely get the hand crafted cocktail thing, along with a modernized but funky theme, cool bartenders, and a back story (almost) but without the attitude and the silly secret society thing you get at some of the other bars that serve similar drinks.

I would say this is a little more hipster, upscale version of Local Edition. It's definitely not dark and dingy inside, I enjoy the atmosphere quite a bit. I particularly love the shelves of books which are (gasp) real! And their ... wood. HAHA Yes they have ... huge stacks of wood inside. Real wood. Whattayaknow.

I would say probably come early because of the line, unless you don't mind and lines are your thing ...

Also, someone told me something weird about this place that I thought ... how strange! and then ... it came TRUE! The person said that this place is PACKED between 10pm-12am but clears out after 12 even thought they are open later. We arrived around 10:45 and it was definitely very hard to get to the bar to grab a drink or find a place to chill. However, sometime during the night, it suddenly cleared out and I looked at my watch and it as 12:04AM LOL ... where did everyone go?!
author: Lorrie M.

description:
Great spot to grab some hand crafted cocktails. they're a bit on the higher end price but the drinks are pretty stiff so 2 should get you a good buzz. The place is pretty trendy, the decor is very modern yet a home kind of vibe. bathrooms are co-ed (well at least the hand washing parts are)

We had the Gatsby themed drinks I had the Jay Gatsby and "she" had the Daisy Buchanan. Must haves if you're into whiskey & bourbon! Just make sure your date isn't actually like Daisy Buchanan or you will end up broke and alone after here lol


Will def be back here next time I am in town!
author: Obed C.

description:
So sad to report that my experience here was poor. I love the look and feel, creativity in the drinks and location. However the service was poor and disrespectful. The bartenders made me feel like an inconvenience for ordering drinks. I didn't get the correct order and when I politely asked to add some olive juice, I got rolled eyes from one waitress and an annoyed look from the bartender. 

Every table also had a reserved sign, only to find out we were good for another 2 hours. 

I frequently have client HHs in the area and it's unfortunate I can't confidently choose Novela as a good place to host.
author: Kelsey C.

description:
I'm a sucker for novels--especially beautifully covered, colorfully bound novels. I'm also a sucker for craft cocktails--especially brightly flavored, expertly crafted cocktails. Hence, it would make sense to say that I'm a sucker for Novela.

And you will become a sucker for Novela, too, once you experience the decor and the drinks. It's simultaneously trendy and timeless, contemporary yet quaint... it's a delicious mix of near antonyms. Speaking of delicious mix, the Scarlett O'Hara definitely is. It was a vibrant concoction comprised of citrus, vodka, and ginger beer... reminiscent of a Moscow mule on paper, but completely different on the tongue. Apparently, their cocktail menu is an evolving one, so I'm more than happy to come back later to do some fieldwork research...

Whether at the (standing) bar, while observing the bartenders work their magic, or in plush armchairs by the books and logs of (real!) wood, this is definitely the place to go to grab a drink and soak up some chic. Love it!
author: Eunice E.

description:
Good location. It was only a little crowded when I went there after work on a friday evening, but it took 15+ minutes for them to serve scotch on the rocks! And another 15 minutes to pay!

Place seemed trendy. Would give it another try.
author: Nikhil D.

description:
How could you not love all these swanky places to go to in SOMA, Novela being one of the additions in the mix!  

People are more well-dressed for one thing.  Novela just gives off a classy vibe of friendliness.

The drinks are to die for! and especially the cocktails with character with such absolutely cute names!

Drink of choice: Ms Moneypenny

Highly recommended place!  Round of applause to the makers of this fine establishment.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Not your typical SF lounge... Had a table reserved for my brother in-law's b-day. First thing thing I noticed when stepping foot into the door was how visually stimulating the decor was. That along with the crowd which was lacking 1 thing... Ghetto-ness (if that's a word?). List of drinks was quite extensive & punches @ $45 a pitcher were actually quite a bargain considering the # of crystal goblets they filled... 

I hated to leave this place considering the line we saw wrapping around the building, but the girls wanted to dance & John Collins (though I'm not too big a fan) was just around the corner...

I'll be back...
author: Bryan R.

description:
**************************** REVIEW 902 ********************************

        Gorgeous cocktail lounge in the heart of SOMA, Novela serves cocktails with character. The cocktail program comes courtesy of Bar Stars Kate Bolton and Alex Smith, hand crafted cocktails, and their fruits are carefully zested, juiced, blended, and strained by hand then blended with quality spirits and spices. Think of SPEAKEASY quality cocktails, but the place does get loud in the later hour.

        Beautiful library decor, books from wall to wall, warm, inviting and stunning, so chic just how I would prefer to have a cocktail in the evening before my dinner. 

        Pipi Longstocking, Jay Gatsby, Santiago, Daisy Buchanan are a few cocktails that I really enjoy. Ask for Chris, the bartender, former Michael Mina mixologist, she's really good.

        They only serve drinks now, but the food is in the work, probably another 6 months or so. On Tuesday, they have food truck stops in the front so you can grab something to eat. I only have been here on the week nights and I enjoyed my visit.  Novela can get really packed by 6 PM, and the order can take sometimes.
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
Went here for a birthday on a Saturday night.  Our party reserved a table.  The place was filled with other table parties.  They provided a pitcher of some kind of jungle juice which was nasty.  As stated in some other reviews, Saturday night seemed like Asian night, which is all good.  The service was fine, but the servers seemed a bit slow and a little overwhelmed.  The decor was cool.

It has old cocktails from a long time ago.   It's a mellow place for adults to hang and drink.
author: Funk G.

description:
Probably my new favorite bar in San Francisco.  This place doesn't advertise as a speakeasy but gives the vibe with the art-deco decor and old-fashioned cocktail concoctions. Upon entering you'll be shotgunned into another world.  One of 9-5ers getting their happy-hour break in after a long day at work.  The library is lined with colored coated books so it's sure to tickle all anal attentive OCDs alike.

Got a larger party?  Make sure to grab a reservation because this place gets BUSY.
author: Kevin J.

description: Awesome part of town, cool place, nice decor... but the drinks are just not that great. Aside from the Mattie Ross, none of their cocktails taste balanced or well-mixed. They use too much ice. Would expect more for a 12 dollar drink that takes that long to make.  Having said all that, though, the food is good and is a lovely spot to stop for happy hours with friends after work.
author: Katie W.

description:
I love the ombre colored books on the shelves, lined neatly against the walls. The decor is swanky and modern-- very cute!

I really liked the vibe. If you come early enough, you can snatch a table. Beware that some tables are reserved. Music isn't too loud and the crowd was well behaved, I think :)

The drinks, I can't rave too much about. Dr. Gonzo was no good and the Gin fruit punch with chai tea was an even big NO NO. STAY AWAY PEOPLE! The combination of gin, cranberry, chai tea, and lemon/lime just did not work. Lucky for us, we ordered an entire pitcher! Not one person finished their first pour. We left with over half the pitcher left.

I'd definitely come back but I would be wary of my drink orders.
author: Mindy D.

description:
A Novela is a short novel (well, these days it also means a short drama series, popular in Latin America and Asia), and so this new bar opened in the summer of 2013 with a sort of literary theme to it. 

It is located on the 600 block of Mission, consequently it is a largely FiDi group of customers, but these days, that could mean a lot of Dot Com geeks and nerds in tennis shoes and Timbuktu shoulder bags, rather than many financial pros in suits and briefcases. What ever happen to the briefcase anyway? Are they only used in Asian TV  dramas and the CIA?

The space has got a nice oval shaped design around the main bar in the middle. On either side, there is comfy seating, sort of a reading parlor decor with faux wing-backed chairs to fit the Novela theme, rather than a slick modern lounge motif of most new lounges. 

There is also a small back room and bar, for special events and private gatherings, which I was attending. 

The Literary theme is a little bit off in the drink menu design. Huckleberry Finn Rum drink? Why not Whiskey or Rye? Shouldn't a Rum drink be named Captain Blackbeard or Robinson Crusoe? Maybe even Moby Dick? 

I think the Drink Menu designer was watching those Spanish language Novelas on Telemundo, not reading any classic literature.
author: Wanugee N.

description:
First, thanks to Yelp for existing so I could find this place.

Second, thanks to Novela for just being so awesome.

HH was just getting started on a Wednesday.  Figured we could hop around on Mission to have some fun.  Wrong!  We walked into Novela and stayed here.  For nearly 4 hours!  Loved every minute.  The hostess/lovely petite woman at the door just told us to grab a seat wherever, as it was first come first serve.  After roaming around the bar, literally, two seats opened up.  Yay!

The place was poppin' as soon as we walked in.  High ceilings with funky light fixtures, pseudo library setting (Novela, get it?) with lit up faux books on the walls.  Lounge-type seating all around with the bar as the center of attention right smack dab in the middle, as it should have been because the bartenders were all gorgeous as was the bar structure itself.  Heck, even the drink fixin's were pretty to look at.  On display were things like mint, zested oranges & lemons, mmm... I could just smell the freshness of ingredients of their crafty cocktails... and I hadn't even had one yet!

Speaking of crafty cocktails, they are the reason I chose to come here in the first place (okay maybe I thought the name was cool, too).  I couldn't decide which I wanted, so I got a flight of punch for $14.  Generous flight amounts by the way.  Between the Pisco, the Gin, the Cachaça punch, I honestly was in love with all three.  So in love that I wanted more more more.  So I shared a pitcher ($45) of Pisco with my galpal (her fave from my flight).  FYI on the menu it says this so called pitcher serves 4-6... Wrong!  It served us 9 glasses.  Or was it 10?  I don't remember.  See what I'm talking about...

Service could not have been any better.  I didn't catch my bartenders' names, and my receipt was cutoff a bit, but it could be Suzie V. (? the one with the cool tattoos) and the other was Dimas O.  Loved them both, as they were so attentive and genuinely nice, never rushing us when making orders.

I loved Novela so much I came back the next night, and the Pisco did not disappoint!  Also suggested this place to other friends who were in town with me, and everyone loved it (Pisco included).
author: Carla C.

description:
Ever left your card at a bar?
Ever left your card at a bar for over a week??...

Well thats exactly what happened to me last time I came here and I had absolutely NO problems getting my card back! (why it took me a week to get it back...well they don't open till 7 are are in downtown so getting there was a lil inconvenient) The staff was so funny and friendly when I finally made it back to get my card and there weren't any weird charges or issues with picking up my card and corresponding receipt.

This place is extremely trustworthy, cocktails are delicious & artfully made, and the prices are fair! Drinks aside, the entire ambiance of the bar is amazing. We've all been to those bars that go for the dim lighting...but go too dim, you know what I mean? Well this place was just perfect, the decorations, lighting, music, chairs...everything!

Its a nice place to hang out and talk during the early evening, and the later it get, of course, the more populous and lively it becomes!

So if you're in the area and looking for a nice cocktail to end your night, I'd definitely recommend coming here:)
author: Katie 2.

description:
Fun night. Great wine and cocktails. Good for large groups. 
My biggest problem with this place is that the wait is ridiculous at the bar. Would be nice if they had more bartenders to help with the back-up.
Overall fun place for drinks.
author: Anisa M.

description:
Nothing quite like it! Want luxurious, artisan cocktails without having to make password-only-access reservations? Crave a speakeasy-esque environment with a more chill, ambiance? Look no further, Novela's the spot!

I came here on grand opening weekend and fell in love with it. It's a blend of a lounge, a bar, and an extensive, spacious environment.

The drinks are solid and they are unique in the sense that they serve a specialty "punch" - these cocktails are amazingly deceiving - delicious and easy to sip on, yet rather strong!

Drinks are $9~$10. Great for date night, small groups, large groups, events galore and more. They have the space and can accommodate easily!
author: Veronica S.

description:
Brought here by my SF friends, apparently Novela is the hipster/techie bar/lounge of the moment. I enjoyed the dark 1920s-1930s decor and ambiance. Crowd on a Saturday night was ethnically mixed: white, Asian-Americans and blacks. Most people kept to their own groups, but there was some mingling if you tried. Drinks took the bartenders a little while to serve. Understandable, given the complexity of the drinks and the number of patrons.

Go for the punches, especially the gin one, if you have a group, a cost-efficient and quick way to booze up the party. All in all, a fun venue (if you can get in, the line was looooong during peak hours around 11pm), and worth a visit if you're in the mood for a lounge in the financial district. Hint, it's walkable to Local Edition.
author: Michael C.

description:
A novel themed bar?! Sounds like heaven. =]

As an avid fan of literature and alcohol, this was the perfect bar for me. The walls are adorned with old books illuminated by colored lights. 

The drinks menu was excellent as well. They make a wide selection of cocktails named after literary characters. I got the Lolita and the Leopold Bloom- both were delicious! 

We came here after work and it was quite crowded, so I'd highly recommend making a reservation if you want a table.

Overall, good drinks and fun atmosphere. I will be back!
author: Aimee Z.

description:
Pro-tip #1: if you hate lines, be sure to make a reservation. And this isn't like getting a table at a club, where you're dropping hundreds, no - this is completely freeeee! So, what's a little premeditated planning if you can avoid the ridiculous line that starts forming during prime nightlife hours?

Pro tip #2, don't be afraid to order the punch pitchers, even if there are just two of you. Unlike some of the other bars/lounges in the city, the folks at Novela don't mind if you order one of these, despite these being designed to serve four - six. Now, if you want variety, sure, grab some individual cocktails - but if you don't mind sticking to just one or two, these are MUCH better value for your money.

So, a solid 3.5 stars for a sweet venue, with pretty good drinks. Not quite a four because our punch was actually on the too-sweet side, and also because the place gets unbelievably packed once 11 or so rolls around.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Aside from the usual bar caveats (i.e.: the bar itself is too high to be accessible), there are plenty of accessible tables throughout the venue. If you show up early enough (before 10pm), moving around the place isn't really a problem. After a certain point in the night though, you're definitely going to have to be doing a lot of shouting and tapping to make your way around the place.

Bathroom - Accessible! Well, if you can get to it, anyway.
author: Johnny W.

description: The first time we went it was great - excellent cocktails, great bartender & nice atmosphere. The second time we had a really unfriendly and unhelpful waitress (blonde lady) who also was extremely slow even though the place was nearly empty. She said all their cocktails were premixed (when I asked for the same one I had the first time) even though our bartender made ours fresh on the spot two days prior. I imagine management wouldn't want her advertising that their drinks are premixed anyway! It was very clear she didn't like her job and didn't want to be there and unfortunately really soured our opinion of a place that really had such potential.
author: Kayla K.

description: I love novela - good drinks and cool vibe. also good to get to from downtown etc.
author: David G.

description: An interesting, well decorated bar.  Drinks we nice.  Ambiance was noisy and crowded.   Prices were high, but it was a unique experience.
author: Max K.

description:
This is pretty much a trendy bar in the heart of SoMa. I don't know why, but my first thought is to mention that all the bartenders were of some Spanish descent (at least the Wednesday night I went). So if Spanish is your only language then you may be in luck.

I use the word trendy because you walk in a dimly lit room decorated with modern looking furniture and fake books all along the wall for decorations. This isn't a bad thing, but it's just not original. I mean, the chandelier and lighting is actually pretty nice but I wasn't blown away. I haven't really  heard anyone say, "dang, let's go to Novela because the atmosphere is so unique." Maybe I've just gone to too many bars and I'm be over-analytical.

Drinks were somewhat overpriced and didn't seem in proportion to the skill of the bartender. It wasn't like someone was wearing a bowtie and concentrating carefully on making you drink, it seemed more like people just throwing stuff together and charging you just because of the central SF location and dim lighting.

So, I wouldn't really recommend coming here, but it would be a decent place to check out on a bar hopping night in SoMa.
author: Marlon T.

description: One of my favorite bars in the city, mainly for the ambiance and decor. Colorful with the warmth of a library? Count me in! I love taking friends from out of town here. Drinks are creative and strong. They have a decently sized cocktail menu so there's something for everyone to choose from. They can be expensive but pretty typical for a San Francisco bar. It's not too noisy so you're able to have conversations with your party. Service can be a little slow so be prepared to wait to order, especially if it's crowded. The bartenders make the drinks well, in my opinion, so the wait is worthwhile.
author: Krishna S.

description:
At the front door there is no cover, you're greeted by a bouncer with a friendly smile... and after he cards you (U_U;), you walk into a fancy library that comes with drink service.  I'm a big fan of books and when you survey the room, you're immediately taken aback with all the books lined up and lit with the colors of the rainbow.  It's pretty to look at and the decor is elegant.  The walls are painted black and white with lovely design patterns.

This lounge is great to go to with a group of friends, taking someone on a date, or even to meet new people.  The seating area is intimate and cozy for having deep conversations or to just kick-back.  I do recommend that on busy nights, you should get there early as the seating does fill up rather quickly.  The room can feel tight, but it also allows you to get to know your "neighbor," in which you'll probably start a conversation on Gatsby or Shakespeare or just what you're drinking.  It can get pretty loud inside, so stay close to the individual or group you're sharing a drink with.

The Gist: 
-The service is professional.
-Drinks are fairly priced ($6-$12 for cocktails with character).
-Street parking only.  Meters are free after 6:00 p.m.
-Within a couple of blocks from Metreon and Moscone Center.
-Clean and classy environment.
-Many women's restrooms available with two unisex.
author: Melanie L.

description:
Came by after a day of shopping - were told that my boyfriend who was wearing sandals couldn't come in because of "liability" reasons. First time I've ever heard that! If there's a dress code just say so- we didn't look like street bums btw. 

Shame. What a load of crap.
author: Ewa P.

description:
Great location. Great Atmosphere. Great people.
As crowded as this place gets, all the lounge areas are really comfortable to sit in and just hang out. The drinks take a little while. The Pisco Punch is really sweet but I would recommend against the House Punch- takes like a mixture of medicine and barbeque sauce. 

The interior design of the place sets the mood really well with backlight neon books and hanging chandeliers.
author: Evelyn W.

description:
A bourgeoisie NOVELty bar (hehe get it?).

Location: SoMa near the Montgomery Bart.

Decor: Swanky and lovely... something you'd expect in SoHo NYC but not in SF! The right side of the bar/lounge has the books arranged in a rainbow lined up against the wall. Against the back wall has a bird cage chandelier (swoon) with more rainbow books and a few chairs along with a side back bar. The left side of the bar/lounge has more space to sit & stand but doesn't have the gorgeousness of the books on the wall. 

Crowd: Financial district peeps & their good lookin' friends. Visited this place on a Friday during HH- SO CROWDED! Unless you come right when it opens I'd say this isn't best for a friday happy hour if you want to be able to breathe. I also came here around 5p on a Monday- emptier and better service. No dress code that I know of but people who roll in tend to be dressed nicer.

Drinks: Cute literary themed drinks, but not so cute tastes. Drinks are STRONG. I had the Leopold Bloom (hibiscus gin, pinapple syrup & mint) which was more "girly" but still stronger than other places. I also tried the Jay Gatsby (bourbon, calisaya, amaretto, nocino, islay scotch) and oh my goodness this was strong and deadly tasting (would not recommend it unless you REALLY like manly tasting drinks). 

Good place to impress your coworkers, friends or date!
author: Emily C.

description:
Went on a tuesday night for happy hour after work. Not too crowded but you have to make a reservation. 
Ordered the hemingway punch. $45 for a pitcher and the entire thing was filled with ice. Granted that it was absolutely delicious, it was not worth the price for the amount we got in the pitcher. 
One of people in my part also went to the bar to get a beer and the bartender was rudely texting while he was ordering and completely disregarded him. The service was also extremely slow. Took 25 minutes just to get our punch, 15 minutes to get our order. 

The ambience and idea is great but all in all you want fast service, especially during happy hour.
author: Jocelyn C.

description:
First off, this place is huge -- huge and beautiful. 

But what struck me is how big it is; there's literally room for 20 tables of people. Walk in and grab one of the large tables up front, or keep going for seats at the bar or tables in the back in a fairly tucked-away space.

You want dark woods and slate grays and all those other colors that tell you it's ok to be in here on a Monday drinking? Novela has that. Nice servers who will bring those drinks to you, even though it may not be particularly quickly? Got that as well.*

But what they really have are tasty cocktails for a reasonable (for the neighborhood) price. I particular suggest the punch flights; these are smaller glasses than the chalice of punch you can get of a single punch flavor, but are basically sugary, colorful punches with different types of alcohol in them. There's a gin punch, a tequila punch, one that tasted like suntan lotion but in a good way, and of course, owing to the bar's writerly theme, a Hemingway punch with three types of whiskey in it (which was particular delicious). You can get a flight of 3 for 14, and I think 6 for 24 (or some small discount, don't quote me on the exact price). They're worth doing, even if some aren't fantastic.

There's also a full bar, and a small, eclectic bourbon selection that isn't just the straight B's (Booker, Blanton's, Bulleit, Baker, Beam and Knob Creek (almost all B's)) and includes interesting ones like Johnny Drum and Breaking and Entering.

All in all, this is a really, really welcome addition to the neighborhood and likely to be too crowded from being really good for me to get a seat here for happy hour. So don't ruin it, FiDi workers looking for drinks at 5:30 p.m. -- or at least save some space for me.

* - It's possible because the space is so big that she got lost on her way back and forth to the bar.** Seriously, this place is huge.

** - It's more likely that they'd only been open a week and were busy for a Monday night.
author: Danny P.

description: Like this ambiance, modern but not too annoying and loud. Bartender Simpson knows his stuff. Really enjoyed the White Punch, coconut and (again, I'm on a tour of bars that stock it) Avuá Cachaça. Highly recommend.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Great location, Mission & 3rd St. 
Upscale bar, yet comfortable. Lots of local residents, convention center & hotel guests. 
Speedy craft cocktails & punches.
Average cocktail price $10. 
Fast & friendly service.
author: Jen J.

description:
Loved the interior and decorations. The color coordinated books are a nice touch. 

Drinks are mixologist cocktails. Bartenders are nice. 

Definitely would go back.

One star knock for the crowd. Wished it was a bit livelier.
author: Allie Y.

description:
3.5 stars.  Good if you like a swanky atmosphere playing loud music serving punch/fruity drinks.  Otherwise just OK.  I enjoy stiff whiskey-based drinks so I tried both on the menu, the Roy Hobbs and the Billy Pilgrim.  Both were good, you could taste the individual components, but they just weren't that interesting or complex at $12 apiece.  I know it's just a dollar, but $11 in my mind would have been a fair value.  The Dread Pirate Roberts was more interesting - served like a Moscow Mule, it was a weird combination of rum, absinthe, and fruit juice where the flavors came in layers.  But that type of drink is just not for me.

I guess I'd return if I wanted to dress up and be seen without feeling like I'm standing out like a sore thumb, but if a well-priced complex craft cocktail is my top priority then I'd go elsewhere.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
This place has awesome ambiance, but the cocktails are gross!.

I tried a Sherlock Holmes (too much pisco), a leopold (too much everything), and a Huckleberry Finn (cute but just blegh). I've heard the punch was gross too. 

If I come back to socialize, I'd probably stick with bottled beer.
author: Angela L.

description:
One of my favorite places in SF because of its atmosphere! I adore libraries and books, and so I was in love from the moment we walked in, and I was deeper in love once I saw their literature-themed menu.

The drinks are yummy--I love, love, love that you can get a flight of punch. A flight of punch alone is enough to get you drunk, and all of them are delicious.

The service was a little disappointing; it took a while for us to catch our server when it picked up after work hours, and the dish we wanted, they were already out of at around 5:30. We ordered a different dish, which never arrived and we cancelled it when we asked for the check.

Despite the service, the drinks were great and you just can't get such a great atmosphere anywhere else. Hopefully next time, I'll be able to update my rating to 5 stars.
author: Queenie T.

description: Great cocktails. Gets busy sometimes and could take a while to order drinks, but that's common in SF.
author: Ahmad F.

description: We came here early for a drink before dinner and place was empty but started filling up around 6:30.  Waitress was very friendly but when I tried to talk to the bartender, he was stone faced and didnt want to talk.  Anyway, the drinks we had were really good: Jay Gatsby and Wicked Witch.  We tried the daily special which was some kind of Margarita but that was tasteless.  Used to much better ones in the LA area.  We would definitely come here again to taste some of the other cocktails next time we're up north.
