author: Diane K.

description:
I really like the theme they've got going on here. All the cocktails are named after characters from classic novels and stories such as Romeo Montague, Juliet Capulet, Mary Poppins, Dorian Gray. Each drink has its own unique flair. They also have several pre-mixed punches on the menu. One glass of punch is $10 and you can also order it by the flight--pick 3 ($14) or by the pitcher which serves 4-6 guests ($45). 

The walls are lined with books and firewood logs. I imagined myself cuddling up in one of their big chairs and reading a book in front of a fireplace. However, my imagination didn't last long after the speakers started bumping loud obnoxious edm. 

This would be a great place to socialize. There is no dance floor and most people were just standing around the bar with their drinks. I do wish there were more places to sit. After we ordered our drinks, I wanted somewhere for me to put my drink down so that I could sip and enjoy it while talking to my friend. We stood for about 5 minutes before swooping in on a couple who just got up. 

This would be a great place to bring out of town friends, especially girls. Bookworms would go crazy for this place too.
author: Amy X.

description:
I came here with my coworkers after a relatively unsatisfactory experience at Thirsty Bear.  It's way nice in here, dimly lit, with a retro 19th century classic decor.  It does take a while to get drinks when ordering from the bar since they seem to always be slammed.  There was only one cocktail server from what I saw and she was always on the move navigating the entire place.

I didn't delve too deeply into the specialty drinks as all I had was a shot of Patron then an Allagash White and  one of their specialty punches.   I don't recall which punch that I had but I definitely drank the whole thing.  I wasn't buying the drinks luckily for me because their prices were SOMA price inflated.

I need to go back again as things got a bit hazy after I had the Patron.   I do remember though that there was a food truck parked outside after 9pm.  I was actually thinking about getting some sweet potato fries but wasn't sure if they would allow me to bring it inside.

Had a blast here but still protesting their high priced cocktails in the rating.
author: Ben H L.

description:
Love this place. Anything with a great gatsby reference is a winner in my book. Haha get it? :)

Not overwhelmingly crowded. Good service, good looking people, and near other bars etc. 

Fun night out with the girls or with friends. Great after dinner spot. No dance floor required. 

Great for an out of towner
author: Oaeza P.

description: I am only giving this place 5 stars, because I met my husband right in front of the bar a few years ago. I was hanging out with "a friend" that night and we stopped by her for drinks. My husband was hanging out with his non-profit food and beverage charity group around the same time. My "friend" needed a cig, and I don't smoke. My husband's group of friends were leaving the bar while my friend was hitting each one of them up for a cig. While this was happening: I met my husband, my "friend" did not end up with a cig, and I left with my future best friend and soulmate.
author: Tracy C.

description:
Great place for high-end cocktails if you can afford it.  So, if you don't work within 6 blocks of this place, you should probably move on - no happy hour discount here (I was told, "It's happy hour all the time!", which didn't win any extra points).  $12 for an admittedly good cocktail, but still pricey.  I know it's right in the middle of downtown, so I probably just would avoid it in the future unless it was a special occasion.  

The overall ambiance inside was very nice and themed, but it got crazy loud around 6-7pm.  Please invest in some sound dampeners!  The acoustics in here force you to get close and yell - I only want to do that in a club (and I don't really enjoy it there either).
author: Ben K.

description:
Many, many years ago when my best friend at the time lived at the paramounts & I used to crash at her place days at a time, we decided one very late night we'd grab a drink and conveniently next door was a club called Fluid Ultra Lounge. We screwed up. The word gaudy has never been more fitting. We double fisted our drinks and got the hell out of there never to return. 

Many years later, a friend invites me to his birthday at this location. As I approached the bar I started to get a ill feeling in my stomach suddenly realizing it's "the lounge next door". Only it's not. It's Novela & it's amazing. It has a Don Draper/Gatsby-esque vibe. Lighting is dim but, beautifully lit nonetheless. The cocktails and drinks we ordered were delicious but definitely on the sweet side. Come early, snag a table with good company and order several pitchers of the code hero.
author: Kero S.

description:
Granted, I came on a Sunday to watch Mad Men, so it definitely wasn't their busiest time, but I really love the ambiance of this place. As suggested by the title, it's book-themed. There are books and comfy places to sit everywhere. It's well decorated and well-lit, which is hard to find in a city that prides itself on its dive bars.

I got the "Joan Harris," which is passion fruit and some other goodness. Very delicious. The bartenders and staff were very friendly, and I can't help but love them as they're helpin' a girl without AMC out by showing Mad Men on Sundays. They even serve popcorn.

I had written to them about scheduling a private event, but they still haven't written back. This is my only complaint. Still 5 stars tho.
author: Sam D.

description: The place is very happening and will be a regular waterhole for me. I love their punch pitchers, even though they are more on the sweet side than my preference. The drinks ain't cheap either, but that's to be expected for a bar that names all its drinks after literary characters. I love the decor and vibe here. You have to reserve a table to sit at any of their couch seating, but there's a large communal table up front that's good for large groups. Glad to have another cool artisan cocktail place in the neighborhood.
author: Alice W.

description: Outstanding atmosphere, great vibe for post work day fun with friends or co-workers. Cocktails are unique and vibrant. Definitely would recommend the Raymond Shaw.
author: Terrance M.

description: The inside of this bar was beautiful! I loved the chandeliers!! We had one drink ( I forget what it's called) it was delicious! We had to be somewhere so we didn't get to spend much time here. Wish we could've though! Staff was friendly! I recommend checking this place out! Will definitely be back when I come back into town.
author: Dulce G.

description:
Nice bar/lounge a bit on the loud side, whereas I'd prefer something a bit more low key. Definitely some awesome bourbon menu. 

Try the Juliet capulet! You won't regret it. :) 

Also, make sure you're at least business casual when making your way here!
author: Sophie P.

description:
Swanky, new and awesome sum up Novela nicely with its welcoming vibe, comfy couches and chairs and unique library-esque decor.

The selection of signature hand-crafted cocktails here come very reasonably priced for the quality and I definitely dug the naming scheme inspired by characters from American classics.  My Atticus Finch was perfectly balanced while my friend's lighter Leopold Bloom was a pleasant and easy sipper.  Feeling adventurous, I had the bartender make me his take on a Meat Hook using Lagavulin 16 year - solid, though slightly heavy-handed on the sweet vermouth and not nearly enough of the scotch as evidenced by the weak peat on the nose.

Overall, a great new cocktail bar in SOMA and a top spot to imbibe with friends.
author: Eric F.

description:
Now, I am gonna give them the benefit of the doubt because I attended during a soft opening. So wait times were a little long, but that's to be expected, so I will put up another star as soon as I've attended during normal business hours.

Alright. Let's begin, shall we?

Novela joins the ranks of other hip, hand crafted cocktail bars becoming so prevalent these days- see Bourbon & Branch, Local Edition. You all know the stops. They are dimly lit, the men sport handle bar mustaches, and I learn to pace myself, not by choice, but because the wait my hand crafted cocktail tells me so.

But what sets this new bar apart is the atmosphere. The bar is fairly large for a San Francisco bar, which means I had plenty of walking and sitting room to enjoy my drinks. The music is on point, Of Monsters and Men, Arcade Fire, all things which my spotify would play if I had company over and had to hide all my bad music choices.

The walls are decorated with books which change colors and pulse, art of Moby Dick, and all the drinks are based off characters from classic literature.

Now, here is my only problem, and all my friends agree...the drinks, at least their specials, are strong.

Now I know, I know, I drink with the best of them, all my girlfriends are whiskey drinkers, but these weren't pleasant to sip, every special we ordered was gross.

The Holden Caulfield, for example, tasted like just straight up bourbon. Which is fine, but if I were paying for this drink I would be mighty angry. Phonies.

I would absolutely come back, but would order the old Jameson & Ginger, and skip their craft drinks.
author: Jenny U.

description: This is one of the most beautiful bars I have ever been too.  It's a relaxed environment and not at all high maintenance.  There drinks are good too!
author: Ghazal S.

description:
Came here as the second stop in a night of SF bar hopping for a friend's birthday - arriving from a stuffier and tightly-spaced bar allowed us to fully appreciate the high ceilings and open area of Novela. With tables, sofas, and chairs lining the edges of the place, Novela is comfortable to walk around and stand in with a bar in the middle so it's easy to walk through people to get another drink.

Loving the library-esque theme of the place with vintage books living the walls in little bookshelves all the way to the ceilings, and they weren't fake books either! These were real books, hardcopies with yellowing pages that smelled like a classic library..not that I smelled it of course, but if I had, I anticipate that's what I would have smelled.

The cocktail menu is short and sweet to the point, with a backside for charcuterie and other small bites. I loved how the cocktail drinks were named after literary characters such as Romeo Montague, Jay Gatsby, etc. but I honestly can't recall what my drink was..it was definitely a literary character from a book that I've never read :(

I did notice, however, that my drink and my boyfriend's Jay Gatsby had an excessive amount of ice...mine was like a snowcone in a glass which made it heard to drink throughout the night.

Love this place!
author: Zoe H.

description:
The inside of this place is "novel" themed and looks pretty awesome...like a chic library inviting you in to drink and play.  We only got to try two pitchers of alcohol here: the Hero punch and the Cognac punch.

Let me start it off by saying the punch pitchers are a pretty good deal, especially if you come with a group.  However, that's where the fun ends as you reminisce about drinking jungle juice when you were in college.

Cognac punch: You might as well name it Con-yack.  This drink tastes pretty nasty. The habanero spice takes some of the bite away but you'll be left with a strange flavor in your mouth.

Hero punch: This punch didnt taste great, but it tastes awesome compared to the cognac punch.  I'd recommend you either stick to this or order pitchers of their sangria instead.

The good part about each pitcher is that it fills about 9 full cups so you get a lot of bang for your buck.

They turn on the lights and off the music at around 1:30am, so beware if you order a little bit before that time as you'll feel forced to down your drinks.

3 solid stars.
author: Kelvin C.

description:
Went here due to a recommendation and was surprised that it seemed like Asian Night.  There was very little diversity here..

The venue is swanky and the cocktails were reasonable but not that great.  Choose wisely.  I ordered the Leopold Bloom (hibiscus gin, pineapple, and mint) and could not finish it.
author: Iver N.

description: Nice bar.  Line gets long on a Saturday night.  For large parties make sure to book a reservation.
author: Kristen S.

description:
Yummy cocktails, great atmosphere, cool staff - what else do you need after a long day at work? 

Don't hesitate to stop by this swanky bar for a couple drinks!
author: Juliana K.

description:
I came here on a Friday night and the crowd didn't start coming in until 10:30ish. The ambiance was great as well as the decor. Large couches that make you feel you're in VIP area. Walls were filled with fake books and lighted up on the back portion of it. The lighting was dim with candles in a glass cup on the tables. It had that Gatsby feel to it in a way. Or more like the Rat pack hangout with Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin or Sammy D. Love that era! Waitresses were attentive with my friend and I. The menu had that Gatsby vibe to it. 

Cocktails with character? hmmm kinda comes off as they stole it from Tecate... 

My friend and I arrived early enough to get a table and we were sat down right away! My friend started with the punch.... Kinda soft for my taste. I ordered the Jay Gatsby which consisted of bourbon, calisaya, amaretto, nocino and Islay scotch. Strong drink! A must try if you love bourbon! A good drink to pace yourself and socialize. Then I ordered the Santiago and that consisted of tequila reposado, mezcal, yellow chartreuse, coffee liqueur, habanero bitters, and salt. This was a very strong drink. You could feel it going down your throat as you swallowed it haha. Sore throat? Order this! Cost of drinks were average price.

After pacing myself I had to make a stop at the restroom. The wall paper inside was pretty cool. Legs, legs and legs was the wallpaper theme but in a cool design. Kind of reminded me of the leg from "a christmas story." Ralphie would have loved this! They had a little shelf by the urinal to place your drink! Awesome! Where you wash your hands was shared with the ladies. Can be a little annoying when all you're trying to do is wash your hands and the ladies are occupying all the space by applying any sort of make up or facial products. I understand ladies have to look nice but a shared vicinity is not a great idea at a place like this. I'm just trying to wash my hands, a lot of people just get in the way hogging up the mirror haha

The bar seemed packed but I didn't experience the wait of time to get a drink. The music was good for the most part. Not much dancing space. I'd go again just to sit down and grab a drink or two on a low key night. Give this place a try. 

The only bad part is that well... The crowd could have been more diverse. It was at first, but by the end of the night it was not the case. 

Tip: get there early to grab a couch or table. Unless you call ahead to reserve one for a special occasion.
author: Ernesto D.

description:
Novela is a fun, cool bar in a convenient location. As a former English major, I am obviously drawn to the theme of this bar. Drinks are cleverly named after literary characters, the menu is divided by "chapters", and bookshelves line the walls! What an English nerd's dream.

My group headed over at around 8:30 on a Friday night, expecting it to be impossible to get a table or seats. We got super lucky and saw a group leaving as soon as we got in, so we nabbed a table! A server warned us that a group might be coming for a reservation, but later told us the table was ours. Sweet! 

I'm a huge fan of the punch here, and it seems like the punches are a crowd favorite. We ordered a bowl of the Pisco Punch which was extremely good. We could hardly taste the alcohol! There was also a Thai Milk Punch which I tried and enjoyed a lot! It was like thai iced tea with alcohol (tasted better than it sounds!). I tried a third punch with coconut milk which had a very unique taste. Overall, I think the punches are the specialty here.

(AN EXTREMELY SMALL GRIPE: They served the punch in huge bowls with ice, and also gave cups full of ice. This led to really messy pouring and spilling. It would be nice if they filled only the cups with ice, or only the punch bowl, but not both!)

I tried a couple friend's cocktails and they were both very strong. I take that as a good sign for a bar.

Overall, I really enjoyed my time at Novela. I am not the biggest bar person, but for some reason I particularly enjoyed going here and can't wait to come back again!
author: Greg J.

description: The bar turns classic named drinks to renamed house specials. I like the atmosphere. Everyone is friendly and mature.
author: Julian T.

description: I went here on sunday 1-10-16 8:15pm'sh, came here for a 80's themed karaoke.  As I entered the bar, I didn't hear any noise from the speakers, initially went to the right side and thought to myself did I attend on the wrong evening, then went to the left side and saw this familiar person, Glenny Kravitz (I haven't seen him since last time at 7 mile house, probably for a good 5 months).  This is a very presentable and upscale bar, with books lined up on shelves.  I ordered three beers (racer 5, blue moon, and anchor steam), $5.00 with tax $.15 and sf emp mandates $0.15=$5.61 and also a cocktail named jay Gatsby for $11.00, tax $1.00, emp mandate $0.33=$12.33, which I thought was pretty good.  Fortunately the two bartenders were cordial/helpful.  I sang 3 songs (escape, white lines, and let's groove), the crowd was dancing and singing along with me.
author: Jer W.

description: Came here on a Saturday night. It was incredibly crowded, making this place feel much smaller than it actually is. There are some seating areas along the side, and the place is decorated like a library. It's tough to get the bartenders' attention with so many people, but when you do manage this great feat, order the Flight of Punches! You get to try 3 different types of drinks listed under "Seasonal Punches" for $12. They're small glasses, but compared to the price of the cocktails, it's a good deal! I tried White Punch (Brazilian cane spirit, lychee, coconut milk, lemongrass, white peppercorn, and lemon). Sounds like a weird mix for a drink? Absolutely. But did it taste good? Surprisingly, yes! Light and sweet, almost like drinking juice.
author: Christina L.

description:
02.25.14 (etc.) | bookmarked 06.05.13

Their punch bowls are not to be missed. Just don't go at it solo! Novela tends to be packed during the happy hour slots, but trickles out after 8:00 PM or so. If you want a great drink but don't want to fight a crowd (and have an amazing atmosphere to boot), swing by after dinner and soak in the ambiance.

Novela doesn't serve food, but a food truck tends to park outside on the regular.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Novela is a great spot. I love the location (as it's conveniently located in FiDi) and interior decor is SO cute. It looks like a swanky library and gives you somewhat of a lounge effect without being super overbearing. It always seems packed and people like to go there.

I've been there on a few separate occasions. I have been there for a birthday party where they had a space roped off. Sounds like you can make a group reservation for your party. The one thing I LOVED was the fact that you could sit down! It's like KEY for girls who complain or die in their heels. So smart on their part, because it's likely someone will stay and not so typical in bars. 

I've been here randomly for drinks on a busy evening and noticed most of the booth space was completely roped off which is somewhat annoying! It could have been a popular holiday party night. Overall, drinks are good...not cheap just the normal price but I think this would be a good place to reserve a group.
author: Priya S.

description:
This place is pretty cute and just recently became the hot spot in SOMA. Its a nice change in scenery compared to the usual John Collins or 111 Minna right around the corner.

Order the punch and try to get to the bartenders at the ends of the bar..they tend to see you! 

Lots of seating, though..overall is a pretty small space so its definitely not the same level of seating like Local Edition.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Great for happy hour after work. The drinks and cocktails are made well and not watered down. The vibe is hip and caters to SOMA / FiDi crowd. Gets crowded at night especially Thurs / Fri / Sat.  I usually go right after work if I want a table or spot to sit with friends.
author: Reynald O.

description: Novela was such a cute bar! The decor puts you in a large bar with a library feel.  The menu also reflects great literature as the drinks are named after some well known characters.  The mixologist knows what they are doing! Great drinks, really nice mixtures.  I had the Huck Finn.  We also shared a cheese plate that had this cheese similar to brie with a hint of lemon? It was really good. We were able to secure a table at 8 PM for a quick drink and plate before dinner! I would love to come back after dinner and see what the vibe is like then.  I can tell this place gets really  crowded!
author: Shalizeh D.

description:
My friends and I have come to Novela twice now.  I like the ambiance- lively, loud, dark, and interesting decor (books/library type).  I also like that you have the option to make reservations for seating- which is what we've done both times now.  

The first time around, we (a group of 4) ordered a few types of the punch to share.  This second time that I went, we (a group of 8) were celebrating our friends just getting engaged!  It was awesome to have a comfortable place to sit to ooh and aah over the ring and to congratulate the newly engaged couple.  Everyone ordered different drinks- some got wine, some got beer- I got the Thai Milk Punch.  Personally, I liked it- it tasted like an alcoholic Thai iced tea, but my friends found it to be a little too sweet.  Overall, everyone seemed very happy with this location, and I think that it's a fun and easy place to gather folks.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
This is a pretty cool place. Novela means novel in Spanish and they've lined the bookshelves on the walls with a large collection of books. The cocktails are all named after popular literary characters, however there are also beers and the bartenders all know how to make off menu cocktails. At 10 dollars a drink roughly, its fairly standard for a trendy SF bar, or even on the cheaper side.  Its no wonder that the place gets absolutely packed and really loud. While I don't like huge crowds and overly noisy places that's no fault of Novela. 

I had a large bag because I had come from work and I got in no problem.  That was nice. The line outside is mostly for checking IDs and the wait was pretty short at 10 on a Friday. Check it out!
author: Huy V.

description:
Amazing concoctions. They do take time to prepare so make sure you order first. It does mean drinks take time to come out but they are a good mix of flavor and strength. 

We ordered a Babette which is like an alcoholic Orange Julius - delicious. We also ordered a minty drink with gin but I can't remember what it was called and was also very good. 

It gets crowded and is fairly hot but the decor is great - mood lit library style
author: Joey L.

description: Nice interior and atmosphere, very lively bustling bar area. Stopped by for a glass of wine with a girlfriend after work. The cabernet they've got on the menu leaves much to be desired however. At $14 a glass, I would hope that it pleasantly surprises me - this one was more of a disappointed reckoning. Perhaps stick to the cocktails? Solid place to meetup with friends and very centrally located.
author: M. M.

description:
Great after work spot to meet up for drinks. Has a cool vibe, set up as a library in the back, tables you can reserve for parties and community tables, windows in the front.  This gets very busy on Friday nights so get here early :). Great spot to meet with your friends and catch up.
Good wine, beer list and tons of specialty drinks!
author: Beth P.

description:
Comfortable seats and atmosphere.

Drinks were mostly delicious. Note: I like sweet things. 
Babette - 10/10
Miss Moneypenny - 9/10
House Punch - 0/10
Gin-Sake Punch - 8/10
Tequila Punch - 6.5/10
author: Kira G.

description: Excellent whisky collection, it is a whisky/scotch drinker's paradise. Great place to hang out with friends in the Mission district. Avoid the cocktails as they were just sugary with little alcohol content.
author: Meena B.

description:
I was simultaneously impressed by Novela's dark, gothic interior and surprisingly reasonable pricing on drinks, especially in high-rent FiDi.  Maybe it's because I recently read a report that stated that San Francisco had supplanted Manhattan as the most expensive city in the US in which to live.  So your humble author had some serious preconceptions of astronomical drink prices.  

Ambling up to the bar, I resigned myself to paying the equivalent of the Gross Domestic Product of Djibouti for a drink; But $10 for a free-poured rocks glass of 4 Roses...?  Well played, Novela.  Are low expectations really the key to attaining true happiness?  Rabbi Jimmy Soul might have had something to say about that.  To wit:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MH_PANCU9oQ

Also probably helps that my buddy and his crew hit this place up multiple times a week and are friendly with all of the servers and bar staff.  Seems like a good pickup joint too:  saw a very diverse crowd ranging from bankers in suits to willfully despondent hipsters asking "What the hell man, no PBR?" but I guess those sorts of things happen in this city all the time.

TLDR Summary:  Central location, reasonable (for SF) pricing and a wide variety of patrons makes this a great place to start or end the night.
author: John S.

description:
If I could give 0 stars I would. Pathetic, lame, and rude employees. Very sad excuse. Didn't want to walk in after bring "greeted" by a jerk! Novella- get a new door man that claims it to be "his establishment" and poor hygiene.  

And he claims "his establishment" is not on Yelp! Oops!!!! Major fail! MAJOR

It's unfortunate to have this first impression of Novella after so many good reviews. Checked this box and DONE! 

#sorrynotsorry
author: Laura P.

description: Beautiful cocktail bar, the decor was gorgeous. The vibe is alright. We went on a Friday night and it wasn't too crowded yet getting a drink took a good 15-20 minutes. Our party got the Calvin O'Keefe ($13.00, fruity, yet sour, comes in large glass with a sphere ice cube that kept it very cold throughout the whole time drinking it) Dr. Aziz, and our other friend ordered a bramble which they improvised with raspberries instead of blackberries, I liked it. We found a couch immediately that fit our party of 5 and we mingled with a group on the end. Overall it's a nice place and the drinks are good yet expensive.
author: Tori M.

description:
Cute drinks named after characters of our most beloved novels.

+ Try the Daisy Buchanan! Sweet and whimsical 
+ I was impressed with the waitress's nimbleness, navigating through a crowd without dropping anything

Debbie Downers
- don't try Atticus Finch unless you like bitter bitter 
- don't come here if you actually want to hear what your friends are saying
author: Christina H.

description: Liked this bar a lot! It is very chill.... only thing is that it takes about 30 minutes to get a drink so as soon as your mixologist comes with your first drink, be ready to order your next.
author: Janet H.

description:
Novela was recommended to me by Mik S. as a good spot to find "rich, Asian tech guys". This isn't what Jessica C. and I were looking for, but we decided to stop by anyway during our visit over Labor Day weekend.

More of an after-work kind of bar and lounge, Novela is a sexy and large enough space for you to hang out with co-workers and friends, or mingle with strangers. We made reservations for 10:30 pm Friday night via Yelp SeatMe, but arrived at 11 pm and seated with no problems. It doesn't seem to me that you necessarily need a reservation however, since whenever tables were free, parties would just grab it before the hostess even noticed.

The guy:girl ratio was heavily favored for females, and the crowd was pretty good looking. The majority of people seemed to leave around 12:30-1 am, but we met some fun people to talk to and ended up staying there until closing.

I got myself a Scarlett O'Hara ($10), which was tasty and consisted of vodka, basil, pineapple gum, yellow chartreuse, ginger beer, and lemon. For $10, this was such a steal. I also got a beer for Jessica C. for $5 and I honestly cannot imagine these prices at any bar in LA, even for happy hour.
author: Ivy W.

description: A great bar in the SOMA district. Really chill atmosphere that looks like a private library. The drinks are smart and literal (pun intended). It's a great place for an after dinner drink with a date. Music is not so loud where you can't have a conversation. The ambience is nice and I will be back. Prices seem to be average for SF drink prices.
author: James N.

description:
Overall I'm rounding up to a 5 for this swanky little cocktail lounge.

The drinks are easily worth 5 stars. They have an extensive menu of interesting and eclectic drinks, including several options for punches that you can buy in varying sizes depending on your group (or desired level of intoxication). The bartenders approach their craft with care and take their cocktails seriously.

For ambiance, I would give 4.5 stars. I love the low lighting and oversized grommeted chairs paired with crystal and industrial style chandeliers. The theme is obviously books, so it feels like your in a James Bond-esque library or study. They have reservations for the seating. I went on a Wednesday, so seats freed up around 6:30-7 when the first wave of happy hour-ers passed.

Lastly, for service I would give 3 stars. The bartenders were great, but the wait staff could have been more attentive. Our table was bussed and our drinks were clearly consistently, so two thumbs up for that, but we had to flag down someone to try and get a new drink, but she wasn't even serving our section. We were there over three hours and I'm still not sure who our server was supposed to be...


All in all a great spot to kick it with coworkers, or to explore blooming chemistry on a first date or meetup. Will come back!
author: Venice P.

description:
Swanky! A novel / literary themed bar. Went during the grand opening so it took a while to order drinks, but worth the wait. Got the Daisy Buchanan $10 (Gin, Galliano, Meletti Amaro, Orgeat, Egg White, Soda & Lemon) and Cognac Punch $10 (tastes like sweet jam, yum).

Definitely a hot spot for drinks after work.
author: Christine C.

description:
Decor's eye-catchingly vibrant with old school touches; service is pretty decent considering it's a SOMA spot (read: servers are polite and professional--and can remember surprisingly large drink orders); bathrooms are clean; no cover; and it's usually busy.

The crowd is pretty homogenous--just think Ruby Skye or Temple club attire, which may or may not be your thing. Ladies are in their 20s to 30s, while the men go from about 20-40s. Cliquey groups are the norm--albeit you'll see schwasted drunks wander from their peeps to start hitting on strangers. Makes for fun people watching!

Another bonus is you'll meet random folks like Jake Shields of UFC fame.

Besides the occassionally long lines and order turnover rate, the only thumbs down I really have is most of their drink menu is overly sweet. There've been a few times we've abandoned cocktails which would have been better named "Sugar with A Spritz of Alcohol" and "Diabetes."
author: Sam W.

description:
Novela started as a 5-star for me...beautiful space! Delicious cocktails! Good-looking staff and crowd! But this was during the soft-opening phase. Since then, word has spread and given lack of post-work drink spot options in the vicinity, it's been swarmed by everyone who works within a 3-block radius. Not a bad thing, but I feel the staff is not equipped to handle high-volume traffic.

When it's packed, prepare to sweat for dear life and wait forever for a drink. Want just a glass of their punch on tap or a beer? Sucks for you, you'll be waiting as long as those wanting to try every cocktail off the menu...in one round. Tied for Local Edition on speed of service and annoying pseudo-hipster vibe (I'm not a bartender I'm a MIXOLOGIST!), slightly higher when it comes to overall vibe...for now. Who am I kidding though? I have and will continue coming here based on convenience...but I'll just remember to do calming breathing exercises and put my hair up before I head over.
author: Jen E.

description: Loved this lounge. The drinks were awesome! The apps were so good (deviled eggs and shrimp and avocado with crostini). It does get really loud when it gets full so don't expect to carry on any meaning conversation here.
author: Donna L.

description: After a horribly stressful day in dental school, I decided to meet up with a friend for a drink at Novela. And wow - was I impressed. One step through the door, and I didn't realize where I was. This is a classy cocktail bar with a modern lite-up library interior, as well as, comfortably large and private seating. I asked for the strongest drink and was recommended the Jay Gatsby - and it was exactly what I needed after a long day. We also tried the Lolita and Leopold, both unique but potent cocktails. Of course, with every good drink there must be some good bites, so we ordered the deviled eggs and charcuterie plate. The plate had a  assortment of 3 cold cuts, nuts, pickles, and bread. With my Russian background, I consider myself a connoisseur of cold cut meat, and I found this to be an ideal lightly salted mix that complemented the drinks. The deviled eggs were pretty decent also. This was a great place to come in for a drink with a small group. And best of all, I left a souvenir my friend bought me on the table, and came back 1 hours later after I realized I left it, and they had held it for me! Excellent service. I highly recommend Novela to anyone - I know I will be back.
author: Nikita K.

description:
I love this place! It's a beautiful venue with friendly stuff. They just changed their cocktail list and I must say it's not helping my wallet at all lol.
I'd recommend to reserve a table in advance especially if you are coming here in a big group.
author: Sara T.

description:
Minus 1 star! First time giving minus!!! I got robed in this bar!!! FYI ** be careful! 

I had a surprise party for my bday in this bar. It was around 40 people, we got a table and we spend $500 or more in drinks. 

I got the table right near the entrance (left side) and I left my birthday gifts on the top of the sofa. It was actually a huge bag with other combined gifts inside of one big bag. We had cake and candles as well. 

So, look! We all got drunk we cut the cake around 10ish and around 11:45 they took away my cake without asking (no one eat the cake!!!) and as well my gift bags!!! They actually stole my cake and my bag!! This was because I was in the bar buying more drinks! So as soon as I got back I asked them where was my cake and my bag (everyone was drunk) and the working ppl say if u like we can bring the cake back but the gift bag (??) disappeared!!! 
I told the security guard at the door (thinking that he could help) and he was very nice saying that he could check since one of the camera was pointed right in the sofa, so I gave my name n number and never got any calls. 
So I tried contacting novella bar thru emails, website and calling (voice message) and no one never replied! 
Horrible customer service, over all they only want you to spend the $$$. Not a good service at all!! 
*** if you like to go to a bar go to local edition: 
http://www.yelp.com/biz/local-edition-san-francisco** this is the bar!!! Better: Good service!!
** (9/7/14) I just came from a trip, sent a message with dates and time, and past 2 weeks from the novela bellow response and still no replies :(
author: Kim K.

description: Nice lounge, very swanky and intimate but super loud. I could barely have a conversation without screaming but I guess that's for everyone inside and that's why it's like that. The drinks are yummy but not strong at all. I guess if you're not looking to get shwasted like me then don't come here haha. But if you're looking for somewhere to chill, then this is your place. The "mix-ologists" at the bar definitely take the time to perfect each drink. There are so many steps in making a drink that it could take a while, but it's worth it. My fave of the night was the Scarlet O' Hara and we also had a few pitchers of punch and the Gin one was really good.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Down the block from my place, this place is one to check out! We came on a Saturday night and there was a line (but no cover, at least!). After abut 10-15 minutes, we made our way in to the busy, but not overly crowded bar. It's a mix of 20-something year old people dressed in business casual. Fun people, good bartenders, and a cool library theme. By this point of the night, we weren't there trying to get at their signature drinks -- we were there to just drink. For about $48, I bought a round of 5 shots and chasers (incl tip).

Everyone seems to be here; I ran into two different friends here that night! Also, met some random guys who seem pretty cool... Well, that story will have to continue another time...
author: Leana L.

description:
This place gives you a very comfy and cool feeling when you walk in. People are super chill and nice. Also saw David Lee here so it's not too shabby :D I've only been to this place twice my whole life and it's certainly not a bad spot to be at. 

I'm not a huge fan of alcohol anymore nowadays so I order very particular drinks and i'm impressed with how well and tasty the bartender makes these drinks. Shots are shots so they'll never change, but the real skill is making a mix drink taste good and not putting in less liquor. Good job guys! 

There's no place to sit if you go late, so I suggest going early and finding a table and then latching onto it till you're done. It's rare that tables open up. Jeans and a V-neck will suffice as dress code, but obviously if you are on a mission to meet new people, dress to impress! It's a somewhat classy place but can be a bit casual as well. 

Tips:
1) Get the punch bowl 
2) Go early to get a table if you have a group!
author: Kevin W.

description:
I visited for an 7x7 event. It was cool, but crowded.   They were offering specially made cocktails with a specific rum or gin.   The drinks had too many ingredients and the recipes were new for the bartenders.   This caused a back up for people to be served. The food served were tasty sliders and garlic shoe string fries.   

The space is actually cool. It would be a good place to come back and hang out with friends. Their cocktail list seemed interesting.
author: Marck N.

description:
This place has such great decor and tasty punch! I never thought I'd enjoy it but I loved the punch flight idea. Tried all of them, but I forgot which was my favorite. Great spot to meet the girls after a long day!

I like the lounge feel and wish there was more seating.  Felt a bit awkward to just stand btw the bar and the tables.
author: Kim P.

description: I'm not a bar person (I don't even drink), but I like this place.  Shoutout to the cute ID checker (bouncer?) in the front!  I had just cranberry juice, but it was the best cranberry juice I'd ever tasted.  It has awesome music, but there is a chill vibe.  It's a little loud, but overall I thought it was worth it for the decor, ambiance and drinks.
author: Alex d.

description:
Great space, friendly staff, and interesting drink selection.  

My drink, "Atticus Finch", was supposed to be the bar's take on an Old Fashioned.  Strong drink, well balanced to start, but a bit sweet at the end of the drink.

I had a sip of the "Sherlock Holmes" -- it was a little too reminiscent of cough syrup.

Note that they do not serve food!
author: Kathryn C.

description:
Went on Labor Day weekend.  Was totally dead.  The place is huge but it still feels homey and welcoming.  The bar staff were pretty attentive although I needed to ask a couple of times for a glass of water.  

Had an Atticus Finch, which was a bourbon drink with earl grey honey and balsamic bitters.  Was delicious.....although I was so shnockered by the time I got there, anything would have gone down easy.  I will say that ending with bourbon makes for a wicked hangover the next morning.  OOF!

Would come back for sure, hopefully closer to the beginning of the night so that I can appreciate it a bit more.
author: Christian C.

description:
Getting drunk and uninhibited, I looked at all the shelves filled with books and wondered, "Are these even real, or are they just empty shells?"

Clambering over a bar stool right in the middle of two people having a conversation, I reached for a book and flipped through it. They are real. Which means that they spent quite a bit of money to stock a bar full of books that no one's going to read. So what was the point of that?

I got the Miss Moneypenny which was delicious, then followed it up with a Sherlock Holmes, which was all full of bad decisions. It tastes like a drunk, watered down root beer. Which makes sense, because Sherlock Holmes, despite his intellect and his uncanny observation skills, was kind of an asshole.

Anyway. Drinks are expensive. There doesn't appear to be a dress code. Why not indulge in your pretentiousness for a little while?
author: Rosy H.

description: Cute little place but a little hard to find. I probably would have walked right by it if it wasn't for my GPS. They have a great selection of drinks. Very cozy and intimate place :)
author: jeannette h.

description: Strong and specialty cocktails, friendly staff, nice ambience. Interesting space .. Reminds me of an old library on one side and modern lounge on the other.
author: Lindsay C.

description:
Came here at 530pm on thus night and managed to grab a table whoohoo!

Bar is really nice with strong cocktails named after Jay Gatsby. Service was good as well.

It starts to get busy after 7pm so come here early if u want to snag a table.
author: Yilin T.

description:
Book smart.

Immediately fell in love with the expansive space and colorfully illuminated bookcases. Mix of tables and couches were a nice touch. Part of a classy vibe throughout.

We sat at one of those tables with a glass of red for her and a Babette featuring a mix of vanilla infused gin, fig, orange and Gran Classico for me. Enjoyed them both.

Could have gone for another but time past quick and we had to head out. Finding out it was $28 after tax and tip made me glad we didn't have another round.

Smart space even if it's not so smart on the wallet.
author: Jason B.

description:
The new poppin place in SoMa these days. It's décor is setup like a library and it's very nicely done. The seats and tables are posh and it's a great place to grab a drink, either for HH or through the night. Although, if you have a large group, I'd recommend reserving one of the tables well in advance as it does get crowded. 

Whiskey neat or on the rocks is what I prefer and I don't normally deviate from that, so I can't really comment on their mixed drinks. They do look good, and from what others were telling me, it's not bad, so have a go if you're into that stuff. 

Fun night and we'll be back!
author: Andrew S.

description: Ladies, it's okay to get your high heels on for this spot, sans tights. I did feel a little under dressed with more clothes on that most of the girls here. It is a fun spot for drinks with reasonable prices, unique libations, and a night out with friends.  I took my friend from out of town and she order a flight of hand crafted cocktails for under $14 dollars.  All decent sized servings, I only liked the Gin-Sake option as the rest were pretty sweet.  The bar was fairly busy with groups of people, and I was able to head to the back bar to order without a line, before the private party started.  My friend and I were lucky to grab a bar table on the side that made for good people watching.  Loved that they used a collection of historical novels (hence Novela) for their decor.
author: Nova P.

description: Came here after work on a Friday to meet up my friends. Went to the bar counter to order our drinks but it took the bartender over twenty minutes to take our order and after that it took him awhile to prepare our drinks. I asked to close by tab but instead he kept it opened -.- talk about good service. Afterwards I had to ask another lady working go grab my credit card for me because I didn't want my tab opened. Everywhere was reserved that day so it was hard to find seats. Disappointed in the service but the decor is nice. I hope you guys up your game in service.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Awesome spot that reeks of cool -- it's like a stylish library that happens to have a cocktail bar in it. The place is packed even on weekdays. I was surprised how full it was for even a Tuesday night.

It isn't so loud you can't hear each other but it's definitely lively. I'd recommend the Jay Gatsby cocktail if you like whiskey and the house punch if you want something sweeter.

Service is attentive and friendly (and fast).
author: Victor W.

description: Love the atmosphere and the choice in cocktails. Always worth the visit with friends or a date.
author: Joji V.

description:
The description I read prior to getting here was that Novela was like a speakeasy. However, after first hitting Wilson and Wilson (now that is really like a speakeasy!), this place does not compare.

Cool interior, decent cocktails, didn't take long to get our cocktails. We arrived here around 11:30pm on a Saturday. Not overly crowded, but definetly a young 20's group.
author: Sarah G.

description: Probably my favorite HH spot in the city. Great cocktails, lively energy but more of a happy hour place than Friday/Saturday night.
author: Justin C.

description: I would give zero stars if possible.. Drinks took over 20 minutes.. cocktail  waitresses were rude and bouncers are entitled.. I was waiting inside for my cab and bouncer literally grabbed my phone and pushed me outside.. I was wearing 5 inch heels and fell over. So rude,. I'll never come back
author: phuong v.

description: I've made a reservation here twice and had a good experience both times. Reservation secures you a place to sit and a waiter service. It's not a table service with a required min. Bouncers are not the friendliest, but that's usually a given. Waiters are great though. The communal bathroom irritated me but then the funny part is I really did end up meeting some new folks because of an interaction in the bathroom.  Cocktails are great and the best part is that they are inspired by authors and novels, (duh).The rainbow lit books and comfy seating makes this place a great option.
author: Hazel F.

description:
Nice new bar for happy hour close by to the office. Drinks are on the pricier side, but not as bad as local edition.

Really did enjoy that huge pitcher of booze we ordered though, had a nice peatyness from the laprhoig but wasn't too overwhelming. And for $50, it was enough for 6 people to have several cup fulls, much better than ordering individual drinks at the bar.

Crowd is the typical tech yuppie/ad-tech crowd so if you're in to that, this is the place for you.
author: Tu T.

description: Nice place to chill in the City. Nice atmosphere and good music. Not too expensive either. Will visit again next time I'm in the city!!
author: Francisco R.

description: I love this place each week I will have a few beers. But this Monday one bartender African American with glasses he talk to me very rude asking me if I wanted another drink or ask better check. I ask for my check but he told give me your card, but if I want to see the receipt first and he answer that does not matter just give me the card. That is not professional, I work in the industry too and always give receipts to customers before calling card.
author: Axl R.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, and I literally dragged my BF here the other night.

Beautiful interior completely ruined by a pretentious, expensive yet cheaply made cocktail list.  Man, I really hate places that make complex cocktails with well liquor.  Like what is the point?  It is uninspired and basically just taking advantage of the mixology trend, but without truly delivering a delicious, worthy cocktail.  Whereas most unassuming people would order a rum and coke, now they can order a rum with plum soda and a dash of bitter clown jizz.  Fancy, huh?

One of the cocktail descriptions sounded so amazing, except it's main ingredient was "vodka."  Just, vodka.  Ok.  That is like ordering a "steak", without any kind of information on what kind of steak you are ordering.  How about going to an expensive restaurant, and ordering "pasta".  There is more than one kind, and each one is quite different when you are attempting to craft a well balanced menu item with the corresponding high prices.  Some people might believe that the addition of other ingredients voids any main liquor, so top shelf is unnecessary.  I disagree.  Other ingredients should balance out a delicious base liquor to create an amazing drinkable sensation, dude!  You are charging good money for these, so give me something great.

Their choice whiskey is usually Dickel, so like one step above well.  This one is easily flattened with the addition of other ingredients and ice.  I'm disappointed when I see Dickel as the main ingredient of a cocktail, and put out by well liquor altogether.

No thanks on some crappy well rum with vanilla infused baby tears and a sprig of mint sourced from heaven.  Still tastes like crappy alcohol.  The bartenders also seem very green and unknowlegable about the craft.  This is not a serious cocktail bar, but they will charge you serious cocktail prices!  Be advised!

Cocktails with character?  Cocktails that taste like crap topped with brandied cherries.

I want to give one star, but the place is beautiful and could be redeemed if they get someone serious to helm their cocktail program.
author: Super L.

description: Drinks were so good here! The decor and layout is nice. I enjoyed the atmosphere I'm not too big on the club scene I came here on a Saturday night and this place is perfect the ambiance is classy and not too loud.
author: viridiana r.

description:
I have never in my life been treated as poorly as I was by Novela managment. 

I wanted to celebrate my birthday at Novela because it is a cool venue with good music and friendly servers. I had been once before and had a great time.

So I wrote to them and booked a table for us. I had to change the number of people about three times, and understanding that this could be an issue I called in to make sure that they where aware of the number of people coming. Woman on the phone was friendly and I looked forward to a great time. When we arrived in the evening I was informed that our table was only ours for 2,5 hours and that we would have to give it up at 10.30. I was very disappointed, this was news to me. Why wouldn't they let me know when they knew this was a Birthday party? It put a damper on the whole thing because there where no friendliness from the woman at the door what so ever. I felt like us being there was just one big nuisance. But we decided to stay because this was the venue my party knew about and where they would show up. So the night went on and we had a good time after all. Then when it came the time to pay the bill, we did not tip very generously because of the way we had been recieved. We wanted to tip one of the servers who had given us great service but she had left for the night. 

I was then approaced by the manager and he asked what the situation was beacuse the tip was so low. I started explaining the situation to him, upon which he halfway into it, interupts me and more or less tells us that we can go and never come back if that is the way we tip.  I can guarantee that we will never be back.
author: Tone E.

description: Cutesy, creative place. The cocktails were really pleasant. I had the Opehlia and Scarlett O' Hara, which were both delicately made and refreshingly imbibed. Everything about this place was excellent except for my date. He is irrelevant.
author: Juliana P.

description: yummy creatively named drinks, but obnoxious on the weekend. stop being so trendy, this is SF, that is not a thing.
author: Archana P.

description:
this place has pretty cute decor, and has a changing cocktail menu seasonally (recently there was a carrot juice cocktail that every one on the team realllllly fell in love with - too bad it was like $14 a pop)...

but, overall just a good happy hour bar with a good scene. the wait times get WAY long if you're there for drinks after work on a thursday and friday, though i dont think it gets that busy on the weekends. after the happy hour crowd, it gets slightly more scene-y, which girls in cocktail dresses and all. im not really into that.

the cocktails are usually on the sweeter side, which is not great for the following morning, so i've never been a huge fan. with that said, there is a good selection of wine and beer. weeee! we've had many good nights here that have ended up in salsa dancing and the like... LOL! 

the WORST thing though, is that they dont have DIET COKE! wtf is that about? UGH.
author: Christina L.

description:
Novela is a great lounge to enjoy a night comfortably.  For visitors staying in Union Square, its only a few blocks away in the FiDi. Their slogan is "Cocktails with Character", though I'm not quite sure about that.

DRINKS- I'm not a fan of the cocktails here. A stiff drink like the Romeo Montague ($11) -which has rye whiskey, root liqueur, and bitters- should be stiff not feel like I'm paging through the Reader's Digest. The Salvatorre Paradise ($13) -tequila, vermouth, grenadine, bitters- fell flat as well. After our failed drinks, we all went to drinks we were familiar with to include Dogfish Head 90min IPA ($8), Jack & Coke ($10), and Sauvignon Blac ($10). Reviews are more favorable for their punch, so that may be the way to go next time around.

AMBIANCE- Novela is sophisticated and comfortable, as a lounge should be. This, of course, is if you have a table. My friend reserved a table the same day and we enjoyed the evening in seating that allowed us to stretch our legs a bit. The wait staff does a great job, courteous and always looking out despite the hustle and bustle in the later hours.
author: Tom R.

description: I like this place. It's spacious, in between casual and classy, chill, pretty, and located in a busy area in SoMa on the corner of Mission and ANNIE st. Frequented by young professionals working in companies/startups around the area. Not really a place to turn up. Decent drinks.
author: Annie S.

description:
Passed by on a Tuesday after a work conference at the Moscone Center and had a seat at the bar while the traffic died down. Great vibe, nice drinks and cool people.
Will definitely be back.
author: Jade D.

description: Probably the best cocktail in SF, very impressed. Had a great night with my friend, great service and cool decorations.
author: Wen P.

description: Novela is def on my list of fav cocktail bars in the city. I love the decor and atmosphere. Any bar with a cute theme has me sold!  Its the perfect place to get drinks with a small group of friends, for a date, or HH with co workers. The drinks are great, the Scarlete O' Hara is one of my favs bc its refreshing and not too sweet! This isnt the place to go if you are looking to get rowdy or have cheap drinks!
author: Hetal P.

description: I think this might be my favorite wine bar even though I've only been there once. It's a library with a photos of writers etc on the wall. The wine I had was decent, looking forward to going back.
author: Tiff W.

description:
The plus side: the specialty drinks are tasty and well-made, and the service is pretty fast, even when it gets busy. There's a wide selection of premium spirits, and they do a decent job on a regular old dirty martini. For women, a big plus: hooks under the bar on which to hang your purse!!! Woot!
The (very slight) downside: it does get pretty crowded in here, and the bartenders can be kind of snide. Think hipster attitude while expecting tips. And it's pricey as all hell. But if you're with your mates, and you don't mind being smooshed against people a little, and you can laugh at the bartender's self-importance, you'll have a great time! Be prepared for a wicked hangover next day ;P
author: Claudia J.

description: Literary themed drinks in a bar decorated with real books on the bookshelves, how fun!! I love that some of the drinks are named after beloved literary characters and the menu changes!
author: Angel G.

description:
Nice ambiance, pretty loud when it gets crowded.  Drinks are good and it seems like the bartenders are well trained.  Staff was friendly. 

Only downside is you might be waiting a while before getting your order in when it's packed.  Price is pretty average and reasonable for a nice and modern lounge/bar.

Would definitely come back if I'm in the area again.
author: Emeric C.

description: I've been here before. Drinks were good. But I came back again and it was closed for a private event, which is totally fine but as a joke I asked the bouncer, not even if I'm cute? And I was wearing a hoodie and a backpack I was CLEARLY making a joke and this asshole was like, no I hate people like you you just made it so much worse, you'll never step foot in here. And went on to elaborate about how he hates people like me. It's a Monday night like give me a break!! This was the rudest bouncer I've ever met on in my entire life (4/11/16 at 9:50pm). He could've easily said sorry no were closed. But instead wasted his breath berating a 5 ft Asian girl with a pack of software engineers behind her. Never going back or recommending this bar again.
author: Ivana W.

description:
Love love love this place! I don't understand why some of the other reviewers are complaining about it being crowded or loud...it's a bar not a real library! Yes music is playing in the background, but it's just for that, background. I recommend making a reservation if you are coming with a big party, c'mon people plan! 

In a nutshell..
-Drinks are AMAZING, fresh and handcrafted. 
-Decor is gorgeous, you have to see for yourself. 
-Live and fun ambiance 
-$1 oysters for Monday happy hours-WIN!

Keep up the great work Novela!
author: Vanessa F.

description: Nice bar in San Francisco. Like the whole setting with novels and lights. Decoration is trendy. Cocktails are named under the character of novels. We had pounch and some other drinks and they are all pretty good.
author: Sophia H.

description:
Favorite cocktail bar in SOMA.

The venue is one of the best in the city if you're looking for a trendy happy hour spot.  There's ample seating room and cool lounge spaces, which can be reserved during busy hours.  The craft cocktails are high quality and the punch on tap is a signature drink.

This place packs a good crowd and is a solid go-to.
author: Nick M.

description: Plenty of space. Decent tequila punch.
author: Inigo M.

description: great cocktails, pretty loud though -- I came with coworkers so it was hard to talk! Really cute decor as well, I'd recommend with friends or on a date.
author: Kaitlyn L.

description: Trendy as hell. Per the San Francisco way, we've got $11-14 drinks here. This place makes the price point worth it. The drinks are unique and delicious. Fun vibe. Great service. Lots of people so reserve a table in advanced if you have a group.
author: Amy C.

description:
Holy expensive drinks dude. 

Really pretty, visually. The walls are lined with lit up books organized by color. The bottles on the glass-shelving bar in the middle of the room are also lit up and you can see them from both sides. It's filled with dark wood and comfortable seats. Even my Juliet Capulet was delicious but the experience made the whole cool atmosphere seem pretentious.

We walked in from the rain and found a seat around 9:30 or 10 I guess, on a Monday. We were neither approached nor greeted with a shout from the bar. We waited and got our own menus. Someone in our group said there's no table service, so we took a minute chatting and perusing the menu before we went up to the bar to order. 

There were three bartenders walking behind the bar. We ordered two drinks from one of them and waited a bit long. There were other people sitting at the bar but it wasn't overly crowded, and didn't feel like a crazy, rushed atmosphere. I turned around and two bartenders were gone, including the one who took our order. Someone else handed us our drinks. Mine - a pisco cocktail, called Juliet Capulet - was $13 + 1.14 tax I guess? Wow. It was also about a quarter of the glass. It was tasty but my blood is not that rich.

My friend asked for wifi info. There is none. I didn't know places existed that still did not offer wifi.
I asked for a pitcher of water for our table (we were about 8).. I got one and no glasses.

We sat and sipped, agreeing we all felt a bit meh about this place and their prices, and decided quickly we needed to go elsewhere. We finished our drinks, and a waitress came over and asked if we needed anything. Too little, too late. If the drinks were cheaper, OR the service was better I would give them more credit. Doesn't even have to be both. People I know have given Novela 4-5 stars, but I didn't feel it. Maybe on a different night customers are paid more attention.
author: Heidi P.

description: Drink servings were small and didn't seem strong but tasted good. Drinks are quite pricey. No happy hour which is lame but they do accept reservations which is needed here being their bar has no seats lol. No full menu just small bites or cheese plates which were eh. Wanted to try it out since it seemed neat and glad I did but won't be back.
author: Mal L.

description: Prices are on par for the area ($10-12), and the service is decent. Bouncers are respectful, servers get your orders right, etc. Drinks are well-made, but do note they are on the sweeter side. The crowd is a mix leaning heavy on mid 20s to late 30s, and consists of mainly techies and FiDi professionals. Service can be molasses slow on Fri and Sat nights, and the more inebriated folks will rudely shove their way through the masses, so it's better to get there early to get some table space, or make a reservation.
author: Andrew L.

description: So this has become my favorite Monday happy hour spot because of their $1 oyster specials. The oysters are so good and my first visit here with my coworker had us eating 36 oysters, plus the meat platter and drinks. They don't really have a happy hour special on their drinks as the prices still range between $10-12 per cocktail. BUT THE OYSTERS ARE SO WORTH COMING FOR! Will definitely be back if the keep the special going. Also, the ambiance of the bar itself is really nice as it's lined with bookshelves and nice chandeliers and giant couches.
author: Becky C.

description:
Been here a couple of times for HH and its a great place. The space is really nice. Like a loungey library type feel?

Get here early though as the place does fill up quickly. The drinks are strong but a little on the expensive side. When it gets crowded, seems like the bartenders ignore you and focus on making drinks for those that are seated and are ordering from the wait staff. Took over 30 min to just get the attention of a bartender. Then he said give me a second..... I understand that you are busy and swamped but my coworkers and I were standing idly by for 30 min and no one bothered to acknowledge us. 

Anyways, the space is really great for small to medium sized groups. You should reserve a spot in advance if you plan on getting an area to sit in. Otherwise there's plenty of room to stand around the bar, which is what my coworkers and I do since we sit all day long at work anyways so we don't mind standing at a bar. 

Oh I saw that they do oysters on mondays from 4 to 7pm so I will be back to try that for sure. Aside from the oysters, doesn't look like they have any other food available so be aware this place is just for good drinks and good times!
author: Christine W.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday and loved it! 

It was trendy, a little upscale with a nice ambience to just hang out and lounge around with some friends. The bar is nice and spacious, sitting in the middle, with spaces to stand or sit all the way around. My friends and I found an unreserved table to just take over for the evening, and were able to order drinks from the table instead of at the bar, which was nice.

The drinks there are really good. I tried the Thai Tea Punch, which surprisingly was very good, yet odd. It tasted like thai tea kind of, but with a twist. My favorite drink that I tried that night though, was the Gin-Sake punch! I normally am not a big fan of Sake, but the drink was sweet and to my liking.

I came on a Friday night around 9, and it was just starting to get crowded; they take reservations though, so if you come with a large crowd, you can try and reserve a table free. If not, it may get a little hard to move around (by the time I left around 11:30).
author: Winnie T.

description: I came here on a Thursday night with a couple of friends .. it's in a pretty poppin area so I'm suprised it wasn't as busy .. we were able to grab a seat .. I ordered one of their punches and it was good .. the decor was very nice .. gave it a fancy upscale feel without having to pay a hefty price
author: Vivian S.

description:
I love the atmosphere. I love books. I love stiff drinks. The fact that there are beautiful winged armchairs to sit on, color-coordinated lit bookshelves and blown up portraits of Ernest Hemingway on the walls is pretty spectacular. Also the drinks are named after famous literary characters, or works and they change every once and a while is wonderful. 

I had the Emma Woodhouse, which is some pretty gin, pear liqueur red drink of deliciousness. It was strong, sweet, a bit tart and oh so tasty. Definitely captured the "essence" of Jane Austen's know-it-all bratty but lovable Emma. 

I would definitely go back, if just to try more of the drinks. Though, it did get crowded and was a bit hard to maneuver through.
author: Joanie S.

description:
The best thing about Novela is the ambience.
I really enjoy the space, with the bar in the middle, the bookshelves on the side and the dim lights.
The bathrooms are also decorated with fun wallpaper.
The drinks are good, the wine list too, and the bar tenders pretty nice.
One thing I am not a great fan of is the type of crowd that you can find here. There are a lot of deuchey dudes, the kind that think bumping on you or pushing you are a great way to meet a girl. 
Overall is a good place to go, especially for groups, since it's spacious.
author: Amira T.

description:
Perfect location. Great vibe. Wide selection of typical and specialty drinks. Dress code isn't strict, but if you don't suit up or roll up in a Tesla or not flashing Tag Heuer, then you best be bringing your own date. Or maybe it's just an observation on a real quiet night.

I'd bring my clients there, but beyond that, there's other spots that are more chic, or with much more character to be crazy about.
author: Richard Y.

description: White leather couches, surrounded by books for walls- very LA-like lounge. Their drinks were pretty good. Try the butterbeer. The place is usually packed on weekdays.
author: Val K.

description: Beautiful decor and a great vibe! Lots of mid 20-30 good looking somethings fill this venue on saturday nights.. They have two bars, one in the center and one in the back right corner.. There is seating available but not if you arrive past 10:30.. There are cases of books available for patrons to read too, hence the name of the place, Novela, novel in Spanish.. The drinks are well made and the bartenders plentiful! The restrooms are open-door with a few large stalls within and unisex. A little strange if you're not used to sharing sinks with the opposite sex but it's definitely a new-age concept.. I would love to return here again as a pre-party spot!
author: Alysia W.

description:
AVOID THIS PLACE!!

I was waiting for my friend the arrive and there was a huge line. I was waiting for my friend by the door where the bouncer is at because I was going to suggest going somewhere else to avoid the line. 

It was a cold night so I took a step inside to not to be cold but the bouncer used his physical power to push me out and told me to stop trying to sneak in. I was not even trying to get in and I was physically hurt. I'm 100 lbs vs this guys was probably 6 foot tall 220 lbs. I wish I called police.

I was so traumatized that I have never been there ever again and neither should you. Because they treat customers as if they are prisoners.
author: Ana L.

description:
Novela is a literary-themed cocktail bar in Soma. The bar is in the center of the establishment and the walls are lined with books, giving the place a library vibe. The drinks are named after famous literary characters: Santiago, Huckleberry Finn, Jay Gatsby. One of us also had a drink named after Dorian Gray (can't remember the exact name!), and it was quite good.

The drinks were a little expensive ($10-12), but it's a cocktail bar in SF so that's pretty normal. There is also a lounge area with couches, but I believe you have to reserve those in advance. There was no way we were gonna get one an Friday night by just walking in. Anyways, cool place overall and definitely comparable to the more-famous Local Edition just a few mins walk away.
author: Nikhil S.

description: Went there last nite to have a drink with a buddy . Ambience is nice but it's too loud and pricey, drink was ok but not for how expensive it was. It also takes so long to order drinks, read the books in the meantime. Mite come here again but I'm not too sure.
author: HD S.

description:
Some things are all in the timing. The last two times I tried to go to Novela were a fail. the first time, my friend from out of town was cleansing and didn't want to do cocktails. The second time, there was a private party in progress. The third time was the charm. 

Every since Novela opened, I have bee cruising by and enjoying the ambience. It's even better inside. leather chairs, t.The soft neon glow, pictures of Papa Hemingway, and lots of glorious books. OK, actually lots of books. I kept staring at a Jackie Collins novel that was right about eye level. Great literature? NO. A great addition to the overall look and feel of the place? Definitely. I just wish Novela was a bit quieter. All those books do nothing to kill the din.  I was with several other people. A group conversation was out. It was better to sidle up to one or two friends at a time. They need some nice velvet drapes, or better yet, some acoustic tiles. The seating is a killer too. it looks fabulous, but isn't really particularly comfortable. The chairs are a bit too low and oversized. If you spend more than an hour or so in them, it will begin to wear on you, unless you are a rather tall man. Then you might not notice a thing.

So, what about the cocktails/ They are pretty good. I had a Roy Hobbs and Hemingway's "Cool Hero" Punch for my libations. Both are guaranteed to put a bit of hair on your chest and some pep in your step. The Roy Hobbs was smooth, and the rhubarb added just the right hint of the exotic. The punch was harder to love. I'm not sure if it was the smokiness of the Arbeg or the floral notes from the Earl Grey syrup, but there was a distinct after taste that only went away about 3/4 of the way into my first glass. I also had sips of various other things (Scarlett O'Hara!), and it seems to me like each cocktail seemed to have just one thing too many. The next time I visit, I might be tempted to go the classic route and just stick with the Old Fashioned. 

Service was good. I really liked how efficient and friendly our bartender was. She managed to handle me, a group of indecisive 20 somethings, and a group of suits wanting to leave in a hurry with the right amount of humor and aplomb. I suspect this might be an excellent place for people watching if you are so inclined. The clientele seemed just a bit eclectic. Novela is a solid 3.5. And I agree with Laura B's assessment that the right drink order puts it solidly in the 4 category.
author: Nicole M.

description:
I loved it and everything about it! Punch flights, great bartenders, books everywhere, great lighting, good people, all you need is to eat first :-) 

The tapes are gone off the walls I was sad about that up until I went to the unisex restrooms which I love! 

They do need more seats but otherwise a lovely drinking experience!
author: Niah N.

description:
Novela has great atmosphere and is pretty clean for a bar that's constantly packed. This is my third time here, and I just discovered that it has 4 bathrooooms. 

The menu categorizes drinks into fresh/fruity and well, strong alcohol. I usually go for the fruity drinks, which are pretty light and sweet. I got Miss Honeypenny today and it tasted like honey water yumm.
author: Vivian W.

description: Beautiful ambience (love the books organized by color), good selection of drinks, and a decent amount of appetizers.  We held our book club meeting here and it was a nice space to sit together, discuss, and enjoy each other's company.
author: Meghan S.

description:
Overly bougie, overpriced drinks, unfriendly bartenders, and a slow moving line for no reason = I will not be back to Novela unless forced against my will. I came for a friend's birthday on a Saturday night since they had such good reviews, there was no cover, and the venue looked classy. Since we got there early (around 10:15pm), there was no line and we were able to walk right in. However, our friends that got there later weren't so lucky. Even though the bar had plenty of space, they took their sweet time letting people in, and it took our friends at least half an hour to get in (they got in line around 11:15/11:30). What's worse were the nasty "Cocktails with Character" that they charge $11-$13/drink- each one I tried was horrible in my opinion. The Jacob Marley (Bourbon, Apple-Infused Alarosa Sherry, Benedictine, Cinnamon Bitters, $11) was overpowered by cinnamon flavor, the Romeo Montague (Rye Whiskey, Root Liqueur, Coriander, Angostura Bitters, Allspice, $11) was bitter, and the Ichabod Crane (Papa's Pilar Dark Rum, Spiced Blood Orange Liqueur, Smith & Cross Rum, Tonic Water, Lemon, $13) was barely drinkable. In addition, they only serve 2 types of vodka (no Grey Goose), and don't have pineapple juice.. what kind of bar IS this? The shots they poured were also super tiny, and they don't even fill up the tiny shot glass all the way. Their bartenders are not friendly at all, and I don't know if any amount of tip will get them to crack a smile. To top it all of, the music they played was dull and awful- I was really tempted to grab a book off the shelf and start reading it since I was getting so bored. We ended up leaving around midnight to go somewhere else fun, and saw there was still a long line of people waiting to get in (the bar still wasn't even remotely near capacity at that point). 

Although the venue itself is nice, I wouldn't think about coming back based on the service, high prices, and nasty drinks. There are plenty of other places in SF I'd much rather spend my money at. At least street parking is available in this area if you come early.
author: Amy D.

description:
This place has a fun atmosphere and fantastic cocktails. 
I need to go back for their happy hour - heard great things!
author: Heather P.

description:
Douchy.
Not the crowd, they were what you might expect.
The bar was douchy.
"Reserved" signs on nearly all the seating.
No seating at the bar, not the worst thing but all the other seats were "Reserved".
There was a common table that sat about 10 which left me without a seat.
It was 5:00 pm.
Lame.
The bartender wasn't doing anything and was eager to make my drink.
She took my order and started to make it, then she went and showed a server how to do something on the POS.
Then she stopped to give someone a hug.
Hello, please just make my drink then go about your other stuff.
Rude, only in SF.
My $13 cocktail was okay, worth about $6.50.
Skip it.
author: Isley T.

description: This is definitely a nice spot! The interior lighting, tables, chairs and overall design is a definite compliment to this place. The low lighting makes the ambience laid back and intimate. Overall a great feel and experience. I enjoyed that they have two full bars' which is real nice. This place speciality are cocktails and they have a nice selection of hard liquor. The cocktails I got were nice and strong! The bartenders are great as well as the staff. Try and come early as this place can get full. 4:30-5 is a good time to get a table and sitting for friends and groups. You can also reserve a table. I recommend coming here for a drink after work. Loved it!
author: J M.

description: Whatever you do...don't get the Flight of Punches.  They're nasty!  I left $14 of drinks on the table.  And so did my girlfriend.   She ordered a different trio. Ambience is great but drinks are overpriced.
author: Donna C.

description:
The decor at Novela is really fun. I love the books and the furniture was comfortable and different. The punch sampler was a great idea to try multiple punches. I liked 2 of the 3 punches, the mezcal one being my favorite. I would go back to order just that. It was smoky and had good flavor.

My main complaint is how incredibly loud it was. I mean I am all for a nice buzzing atmosphere, but between the loud music and being surrounded by people all having "yelling conversations" I literally could not hear the person next to me. I think this is the perfect place if you are looking for more of that type of atmosphere. 

I LOVE that they do table reservations. We booked a table for four for the two hour slot and it was so nice to actually sit and have table service than have to fight for drinks at the bar.

I think this would be a perfect spot for a private party so you could take advantage of the cool setting.
author: Natalie N.

description: Nice trendy joint, I've stopped in twice. Once for happy hour on a Wednesday and on a Saturday night. The drinks are great, I love the punch, and regardless of what you order they'll get it right! The place takes seating reservations and gets packed. If you are posted at the bar and see an open seat...don't hesitate! The decor is great, full of books with accent lighting. The place has a boudoir feel, with the ceiling, chandeliers, etc.
author: John P.

description:
