If it wasn't for a friend's birthday I don't think I would have stayed. The concept and lounge itself is pretty cool. I love books but that's nerd in me speaking. It actually helped they are all real books that you can pull of the shelf and read.  That was probably the only redeeming part  of this bar and the friendly doorman that checked ID.  But the drinks I am sad to say were not great and over priced. I am sorry are we in Vegas because I don't remember ever paying for a single drink in San Francisco for 14 bucks and up.  Then again I don't remember every paying for drinks in SF...lol! That is a whole other story. Back to review.  

Now if you are going to promote your signature punch drinks...it better be good for the price I paid. So I got the tasting flight of the Punches and so did my friend so between the both of us we tasted pretty much all of them. 3 tasting flights for 14 bucks okay. Now between the two of us we had 6 drinks. And not one was finished. We basically had a sip of each and that's all it took for us to decide we didn't like any of them. We had friends try it out and they didn't want any of our drinks. We couldn't even give it away. 

Tonic water with lime...$3.50? I don't know about the other drinks but I would not recommend the punches. Save your 14 bucks and try something else.
author: Christine M.

description:
I've been back many times since my last review, so safe to say that I like it there now. I'm glad I gave it another shot! I usually order the Scarlett O'Hara because I usually love any alcoholic drink mixed with ginger beer.

People here are generally pretty nice and more polite than other places I've been to. It's a chill environment and everyone is just here for a good time.
author: Kathy L.

description:
I finally got to come here! 

I think I will rank this just a little lower on the list than Local Edition.  The Ophelia was so delicious!  But my friends and I ordered two other drink (1 with gin and with rum) and they tasted pretty disgusting.  I'm pretty sensitive towards the taste of alcohol so that was a big no-no. 

Overall, I love the look and feel of the place.  Less casual than the other few bars around the area (Harlot, John Colins, Alibi?).  But the set-up didn't offer that much sitting/standing place.  So if you don't have a table, you will be pretty much standing in the middle of the walk way and blocking everyone.  

It seems like they also have a seasonal/rotating menu.  I can't wait for more delicious drinks!!
author: Emily W.

description: I never write reviews but I feel compelled to note this one - we waited at the bar for 15 minutes and were consistently ignored. People who came up after me were served first and the bartenders didn't seem to care. Service the worst of any bar I've been to in any country, do not attend, the vibe is cool but the bartenders are assholes.
author: Kaya W.

description:
For the fact I wanted a WATER!!! At 1:45 and he couldn't deliver I hate this place. I don't want tap water I wanted to buy my favorite water "Aqua Panna" and he "Chris" wouldn't let me, for the fact that his tills were closed yet his co bartender was poring shots trying to get some tail! 

Thank you to Brooks for taking good care of me! I loved every drink I had, as well as the shots!! I give this place 2 stars for Brooks alone! Thank you for making then experience of San Fran a tad better!
author: Michelle U.

description:
So why do I even bother going out anymore. Ina matter of a few words F this place. I went out last night and was hanging with a few friends. We are out eating and then go have some drinks and wind up here. We go find some seats by the back bar and put our stuff down.  And walk over to the open bar. That one was closed in the back. As we are waiting for the bartender, this bridge and tunnel chick front of us motions toward our seats telling her friend to go sit there. I politely tell her we are sitting there and that when shit hit the fan. This mitch turns to me and says "then you need to go sit there and tell your friend to stop fucking bumping into me with his bag. "It was crowded as hell. Great crowd btw. I tell her it's crowded and people are going to be bumping into each other. She proceeds to be a fucking bitch about the situation. So I admit I engaged by being an asshole, you want to act like an idiot and call me and my friend s names will be a dick right back. She calls me an asshole for telling her to chill so I was like fuck you. I could have easily been the bigger man but this female got under my skin. As we are going back in forth I was trying to be as big of an asshole as I could be because this chick went psycho in 2.3 seconds. Here is where shit got twisted. The cocktailer looks over at her not us but her and was like is he bothering you. 
So a side note, not to pull the race card but I am 6 foot 10 inches and265 I am a big "black" guy. And she was a 5 foot 10 white girl. She goes and tells the security guard and next thing I know I'm being pulled outside and got to explain myself. Now the security guard was just doing his job. No problem he was very professional and when I explained to him what happened he understood she started the mess and was disrespectful to my friends and me. And let me back in. where my problem lies is the cocktailer Katelyn she could have asked us either to stop or go outside or told the security guard we both were cussing each other out. But no just me. I wonder why. What made things ever worse was I was in company of Willie brown. A family friend, it's bad enough I embarrassed myself by engaging in a stupid argument but to be racially profiled in the presence of a civil rights advocate didn't help matters. I take full responsibility for my behavior. But I think the cocktailer handled the situation wrong by taking sides without knowing what the hell was going on. 
when I first walked in I joked and was really friendly with the guard so when he and I was outside talking about what happened he was like the story he was told didn't seem right he was like I find it hard to believe you was super friendly and joking with me and 5 min later you walk in and start shit. Again he was just doing his job. 
I will never set foot in here again. I used to like this place we just had a reserved two tables and dropped over a grand and tipped our waitress 350 in November. Had an amazing time. Was planning another bday for myself next month but I will take my business elsewhere? They don't like colored folks it seems. Well not the whole place just certain people and it's too bad they just lost our business.
its unfortunatecause i like this place a lot
author: Kenneth S.

description:
I reserved a table to celebrate my sister's birthday and wish I hadn't wasted the time to do so, and the money I forked over on drinks. Given that I'm giving this place such a low rating, please bear with me as I give my reasons why as for why this place sucks!

Decor-5 stars. It's a beautiful spot and I love the furniture.

Cleanliness-1 Star. There were some questionable stains/items when we moved some of the couch pillows.

Drinks-2 Stars.  Love the names, but that's where it ends.  My punch flight all tasted the same, even though they were to have completely different flavor profiles.  Cocktails were equally disgusting.

Customer Service-0 STARS.  Our waitress was rude, inattentive, and attempted to charge us a "standard 20% service charge" that is reserved for parties of 6 or more and tabs left open.  We were a party of 4 and had to wait 15 minutes for our tab that was thrown rudely at us, not once but twice.  When I noticed this charge, I wasn't able to flag her down so went to the bar, where the very nice mixologist told me to have a seat while he had her fix it for us.  Instead, she comes barging over and rudely tells me "what's the problem with your check?!?".  When I inquired about the service charge, she continues in her rude tone of "well it clearly states everywhere about the charge". I then ask her to show me where, because on the drink menu it clearly states the charge only applies to 6 or more and tabs left behind. 

Her excuse to being called out on this "oh, well, it must be something new because I haven't seen it before." REALLY BIOTCH?!?! I would think that management would have informed their staff of this type of important policy change.  Makes me wonder how many other people they have scammed and didn't catch on to this extra charge.  After having the tab thrown at me again, I left her a big fat 0 for a tip and a nice note as to "why it's not nice or cool to throw the bill at paying customers". 

With so many places in SoMa, this is definitely a place I have no intention of ever visiting again!
author: Bella P.

description:
I love superficial pretense and the pretentious superficial as much as the next amused douche -- so the perfect pantone paperbacks framing the parlor room with gentle Burtenesque touches (the black-and- white chevron-tiled floor, to match the black-and-white chandelier scheme) really spoke to both my inner AND outer bourgeois pig.

The cocktails were no slouch either. Mixology by 'the book', as it were. But I've got to pick an upper-crust bone with their generic Literary Characters monikers. Holden Caulfield? Jay Gatsby? Atticus Finch? What is this, t-shirts at Urban Outfitters? I would prefer for my libations to reflect my 30th grade reading level. One Odette de Crecy, please. How about a Lazslo-JamFizz? Round 3; the John Shade! Is the Peter Keating peaty? Does the Michael Pemulis really contain hempseed? And on.
author: Liz C.

description: I love love love Novela! Easily one of my fav bars in the city.  Not for booty shakin, but for shmoozin and boozin, i.e. great drinks, good vibe, really nice decor
author: Josie A.

description:
Came here for a birthday party.  My friend and I simply asked the bouncer if we could skip the line since we thought we were joining a group with a reserved section/table for the birthday.  Asked if he had a guest list.

His response was to completely embarrass us by escorting us to the back of the line while yelling so everyone could hear all sorts of crap, mainly revolving around how everyone in line is a VIP and is here for a birthday and we are not special etc.

He was tall, white and bald.  And a total jerk.  It would have been so much easier for him to just say, "No, sorry we don't have a guestlist for parties and you have to wait in line"

Got the punch sampler - all disgustingly sweet and not good tasting.

Ambiance is very cool.

Would never go back due to condescending bouncer and terrible drinks.
author: Ali G.

description:
After hearing about Novela through some friends, I made a table reservation for last Saturday through Yelp Seat Me and received an email confirmation that all was set. On the day before, I received an email directly from Novela that they were double booked, and that my reservation had to be cancelled. As a consolation, they offered to put me first on the wait list, hence bumping this up to 2 stars for notifying me ahead of time. Upon arrival, I was told that there was a low likelihood for getting a table, however, they'll be sure to let me know if one does become available. Since there's two lines (one for no ressies and one for ressies), they should've also offered to let my group go through the ressies line. Apparently, that line gets priority, and my group ended up waiting for more than half an hour to get in.

I must say though that the decor was nice, however, drinks were ridiculously overpriced and not at all tasty. For the ladies, this is the place to be seen, and many are dressed to the nines. I was almost put to sleep by the music from the 70's/80's and some other stuff the first half of the night, but it switched over to something more upbeat around midnight. By then, the place had become packed with pushy and rude people. Turned off, I had to move my group elsewhere to a less pretentious place...

This spot is trending at the moment, but unless improvements in customer service are made, I wouldn't be surprised if it were to fade out in no time. For me, I'm already on to the next one.
author: Kellie C.

description:
Solid bar with a diverse crowd. Really beautiful setting to have a drink. The different punch drinks they have are very good and worth a try. I'm not a punch drinker myself and I was won over. The waitresses and door staff were all very friendly. The bartenders are quick and efficient but focused so don't expect much personality wise. 

I've been here  a couple times and never have a bad time. Bars for me are all about the drinks and the people inside of it. They manage to draw a good crowd with a staff to match. I like the music and how it wasn't terribly loud so you could actually converse too. It's spacious as well so you never feel too closed in. Bathrooms are clean and there are plenty so no line issues. I'll admit I pee a lot when I drink so this is key for me. lol

Anyway if you're looking for a cool bar with a bit of a theme (in this case Novels hence the name) this is definitely one to go to in San Francisco.
author: Joco F.

description: A great venue for getting re-inspired about the possibilities in life. The drinks are quite good, the bartenders accommodating, and the decor is possibly the best in the bay as far as bars go, and I don't have to blow out a lung to make good conversation. It's always a great place to wind down the night, or get it start it off. After a decade of suffering in shabby, shady, shoddy bars, it's nice to see some class coming to the bay!  Well done!
author: Van X.

description:
Really cool concept with books lining the walls. Decor is amazing, and there was no wait to get in on a Friday night (granted, we were coming after finishing up at another bar around 12:30AM).

I took a star off because I felt like drinks were WAY overpriced - we all know SF nightlife is getting more expensive, but it's pretty pompous to charge as much as they do. Even Vegas is cheaper, and they will actually fill your shot glasses up. I semi-seriously believe that if you're not located inside the Wynn, your drinks should not be priced as such. Give me a break.
author: Chrystal Z.

description:
Novella is a super fun bar. The drinks are inventive, delicious, and a good conversation piece (all are named after literary references). The decor is also extremely cool - it looks like a hip library. 

They have an arrangement with food trucks where servers take your food order, bring the order to the food truck, then pick the food up and bring it to you at the bar. This is a great way to get food. And the trucks seem to rotate so there are different things depending on the night.

Novella can fill up, so if you want a table, it's best to make a reservation, though I have usually been able to find a place to sit. It can also get kind of loud, so if you are looking for a place to have a lot of conversation, this is not the place for you.

Definitely worth checking out if you like fun, inventive cocktails and are into hip scenes that don't feel pretentious.
author: Megs L.

description:
I've been here twice, and I love the atmosphere. As people say, this place is swanky and the crowd is great. The music is kind of loud for people to have a real conversation. Nobody could hear me! *sad*

On drinks: 
I like creative cocktails, so I liked the menu a lot. Upon trying:
- Ophelia: This is so good and fruity! I would make this my go-to drink here. If you like fruity, I would recommend this. 
But on the other hand: 
- Veruca salt: WHAT THE HECK IS THIS SUPPOSED TO TASTE LIKE? It was WEIRDLY salty and somehow had this weird smoky taste to it. Where did apricot liqueur go and where did lemon and agave go? Just, so weird. 

If you are feeling like swanky, you should definitely try this place!
author: Wonhee P.

description:
Drinks are great! There was a food truck there (Thursday) as well, which looked delicious, though I didn't try.


Tried their racer draft beer - 8/10

Drink sampler, ginger, margarita, and other which was good...very SWEET!
author: Erik A.

description:
Talk about fancy! I loved this place! We were walking out from the movie theatre and we decided to look for a place to have a quick cocktail. We came across this awesome lounge and decided to try it out. I was awed by the very unique decor! Books all around the place I was I heaven , seriously lol
Head out to the bar, bartender was so nice and attentive, he recommended the Scarlett O'Hara (their cocktails pay tribute to book characters, how creative is that?!) my bf ordered the Veruca salt and then we decided to get some Caipirinhas, (we are in a World Cup mood lol) overall, loved the place, good music, great atmosphere, yummy cocktails; planning on def coming back!
author: Vianney M.

description: Came here with some coworkers on a Friday  afternoon. Ordered the Huckleberry Finn which I loved. Tasted like Orangina spiked with alcohol! It was not very strong and this is coming from a girl that gets a very nice buzz off just one drink. The drinks on the menu are clever and named after fictional characters, such as Jay Gatsby. I loved the ambience here. It got super busy around 6. It was a nice mixed crowd of young professionals and not douchey. The decor was reminiscent of Warby Parker where there were books lining the wall except this was in dim lighting. Note that if you sit in one of the lounge areas, 20% gratuity is automatically added. Not sure if it was because we had a big party? Regardless, this place is awesome for just lounging around chit chatting with coworkers.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Didn't know what to expect but ended up LOVING this bar. 

I experienced sticker shock at the menu. I decided to go with a hero of mine: the Atticus Finch. From somebody who never gets nice cocktails - it was INCREDIBLE! Just the right amount of sweet and bitter. 

The colorful books along the wall looked like they were from the Target teen home decor collection at first. Then I picked one up. Real books? Well played, Novella.

Loved the service. Courtney was super prompt and remembered all of our drinks for the seemingly endless rounds.
author: Ellen C.

description: Came here on a Thursday night with a reservation. So happy we made a reservation because this place was packed.  I like the layout of the place, but it is sooo freaking noisy.  Like uncomfortable noisy.  I think its because of the walls, the sound just gets amplified.  Anyway...that made me sound like an old person.  I had the punch sampler and it was great.  I loved 2 out of the 3 punches and even the 3rd was good.  Service is ok, they look like they hate their lives but they were attentive and we didn't wait long to be served.  I don't know if I would come back here, but its an okay place to get some good punch!
author: Kate F.

description:
To think this was the old Fluid.  What a great change! LOVE!

Style is modern chic.  Clean and spacious compared to other bars out there.  The more crowded it is basically makes a statement that they're doing something right. right?

I did come at a more mellow time of the week; Sunday night.  Very calm and service was quick, to the point and friendly.  Conversations with my gf was at a flow as well as some with the bartenders.  

Will come again and actually inquire about the private area for a possible upcoming event.  I'm curious to see what type of crowd the venue generates during the peak hours of business though.

Will be back!
author: Patricia G.

description:
Novela is a pretty classy cocktail bar and I have to say that I liked it. They don't do food which is commendable and the cocktails will run you about $12 bucks each. I have to admit that I didn't branch out much and only had a few "Billy Pilgrims" but that drink was very good. 

I like that the menu helps you pick a stiff or more sweet drink using little symbols. I for one like stiff drinks so getting something fruity would ruin it for me. 

This place has been around for just over a year and I think they might just make it. Give them a go.
author: Will B.

description:
I love the swanky atmosphere here! I came here for a 5pm Happy Hour so it wasn't too crowded, loud, or busy. Perfect timing. I left around 7pm and the bar was starting to get packed, most tables were full, and the noise level had raised a little bit. I ordered the Scarlett O'Hara and the Tequila Punch. Both were perfect for my taste. 

The decor was wonderful. BOOKS!!! Real books. 

Also- When I left there was a food truck outside. It looked like they were actually bringing food into the bar for the people that ordered. That would be pretty awesome if so!
author: Karen A.

description:
Pretty awesome place.

The concept is a bar with cocktails named after characters in books and is this really nice space. They have some booths and some tables next to bookshelves. Reminds me of like someone's place with a bar. 

Came here on a date (btw, that didn't go well) but I got the Daisy Buchanan and delicious! Definitely will be back to try the punches and some of the other fruity drinks!
author: Nina Y.

description: Gorgeous bar with great cocktails, drinks and a fancy crowd. I'd recommend this for a busy date where you don't mind it being loud. It's right on Mission so pretty close for most FiDi/SOMA people.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Pretty average bar. Known for their various punches. Drinks aren't cheap, but they're not weak either. Pretty loud, normally very crowded.

There's nothing particularly bad about novela but there's nothing that makes it stand out either.
author: Andrew E.

description: I came to Novela on a Saturday night. The decor is cute, books lining the shelves and lots of lounge space. The Pirate Cove was yummy and smooth, with a creative presentation reminiscent of a pirate's mug. I waited a while for both drinks (which is understandable for a busy night) but felt the bartender intentionally ignored me. You can count on the drinks to be consistent in their flavor, as each one is meticulously measured per their recipe.
author: Amanda V.

description:
My wife's & my flight got in late so we were looking for a cool place within walking distance of Union Square to grab a drink. 
This place was awesome. The bartenders were super-nice, chatting us up while they mixed up really fun & interesting drinks.

Another thing I liked about this place was that you could actually hear. There was some music playing but it wasn't overwhelming. Most people were just hanging out, not really dancing but not sitting either.

Anyway - I give it 5 stars for the customer service, fun atmosphere, & unique concoctions
author: Christian H.

description:
Novela is a fun place to start the night. Love the classy library feel and impressed with the shelves and shelves of real books. 

The drinks are ~$12 each and take a good 5 min to make. It gets rowdy and the floors get sticky from the spilled drinks on the usual Sat night. Expect to start shouting at a certain point. It's not a library after all.
author: Yolanda C.

description:
"Oh, hey, did you hear about that new bar where all the drinks are based on literary characters?"

Yes, I did.

I also heard about the bar based on colors, the bar based on Muppets (a lie) and the bar based on the leftover tears of orphans (still to come).

Bars use gimmicks, and whether they work or not depends entirely on the quality of the drinks, the staff and the ambience. No clever idea can mask a subpar experience, though it may work on getting you into the place for a first time.

Thankfully, Novela makes solid drinks. Even though the Huckleberry Finn is made with rum instead of whiskey, and the Atticus Finch tastes sweeter and less defense attorney-like than the name suggests, the cocktails here make sense on a flavor level. All, of course, except for the Helen Keller, who is not a literary character, and whose inclusion as a virgin drink raises some eyebrows. 

The staff are professional and fast, and the space is pretty nice. The only thing I don't care for is the scene; it's quite douchey and packed on peak nights. Come here on a quiet one, however, and you might have an epic time worth writing about (in a novel, you see).
author: Keane L.

description:
A nice place.  But mind you it gets a little crowded.  Was there last friday.  I like the semi dark library feel of it.  
Its quite weird to see a full 100people in suits and dress wear in sf - In sf I expect atleast 20-30% of crowd to wear normal (ready funky!) dress.
Unless you go early or have reservations, be ready to stand!
author: Satya V.

description: dim library in soma setting...a lounging bar to mingle...popular after-work destination since openning...small wait for bar drinks...large bar center...chandeliers hanging...mixed tables, chairs and sofa seating around...waitress service better, but hard to keep track of bill...pitcher of rum punch to share, but finding too watered down from melting ice quick...jay gatsby the favorite...a potent sweet and biter cocktail...mixed crowds of more casual and less suits...fun addition to soma and current trend...
author: Hen A.

description:
I like the idea and the decor of this place. The faux library and big leather couches suggests elegance and class, but the volume (loud!) and atmosphere doesn't match in terms of a place to unwind with a delicately made cocktail. Which is a shame, because it's really pretty and definitely seemed like my kind of place on first inspection. For a Monday evening, it really should have been a bit more chilled. 

On the cocktail front, I wasn't a fan. With a large group of 12, three or so of us didn't come close to finishing our drinks because they were too sweet or way too smoky. I know you guys like to free pour in this country, but a little more care could be taken to mix the right flavours in a cocktail. 

I wouldn't rule this place out for a return visit, but I would probably stick to wine or beer and a much smaller group to be able to hear what is being said.
author: Mel P.

description:
I thought I would really like Novela but let me list the reasons why I don't:

1.  Long lines to get in.  Sometimes it'd take more than 30 mins, which is too long for my patience span.
2.  After taking super long to get in, you come to find out that it's super packed.  Pushed, shoved, and squeezed through, you'll probably get someone's drink spilled on you.  Not fun.
3.  Speaking of drinks, they're not that great.  They all sound amazing in the description and the names are fun, but something just tastes off about each one I've tried.  Points to trying to be inventive but the flavors just don't meld very well together.
4.  The crowd can be full of Asian douches (males & females).  Everyone is always super dressed up with an arrogant attitude and I'm still not sure why.

Decor and ambiance is cute though but I'd rather hop over to Local, which is right around the corner.  Or maybe I'll visit more once a new bar opens up and the hype dies down.
author: Jane N.

description:
My friends and I love to come to this place on Thursday nights!  It's really enjoyable because most of the time, you'll be able to find a booth to sit at with great service.  The bartender actually remembers our normal drinks (Old Fashions) and our preferred bourbon (Bulleit).  It's typically pretty crowded and they sometimes have live bands.  Regardless, you can always hear what everyone around you is saying.  I definitely don't like to go to places where you are hanging out with friends and you can't hear a single thing.

I'd definitely recommend any of the drinks on the menu.  They are all fantastic.  When you have a chance, give this place a try - especially on Thursday nights.  Great for a date spot or to just hang out with friends.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Great place, good cocktails and amazing ambiance. Good spot to share drinks with friends and celebrate different occasions. 

It can get crowded during the late nights on the weekends but the service is fast enough to keep most people happy with drinks.
author: Angel J.

description: The drinks are good, but the bartenders can really use some help and manners. Don't go on a Friday or Sat. Too many ppl, not enough staff and the staff there is overwhelmed and attitude to the max. I would rather not wait 1hr (TRUE STORY) for a $13.00 drink served with a a stunk face.
author: Pawanpreet G.

description:
First off, this place is awesome on the inside. Comfy chairs and good lighting. 
I met a friend here on a tuesday night after work, and it was the perfect place to hang out and catch up. busy, but not too crowded or loud that we couldn't talk

The drinks are fantastic and our server was adorable. I think she said her name was Courtney. We had no idea which of their fancy "mixologist" cocktails to order, but she asked what we liked and chose a couple she thought we'd be into. 

The drinks came quickly and were delicious. I got a "Romeo Montague" which Courtney described as being a new take on an old fashioned. It was really good, but kinda tasted like bubblegum at the end, not bad, but definitely unexpected. 

My friend got an awesome drink, the "Miss Moneypenny" it has mulled vodka in it, and was the best drink I had all night. 

We had a few others as well, and all were very good. 

Overall it gets five stars for great drinks, service and atmosphere. Ill definitely be coming back.
author: Mel M.

description:
Swanky. Trendy. Modern. Loft. Speakeasy. Library. Underground Literary Society. Gosh, I could go on forever. Novela (named after "novel") is a library themed bar for all the literature nerds and literature nerd wannabes. As a proud member of the former, I was thoroughly impressed with the vibe, the drinks menu and the service. 

The drinks are named off characters from famous novels such as The Great Gatsby, Catcher in the Rye, To Kill a Mockingbird and Adventures of Huckleberry Finn. Each artisan cocktail has a lot of craftsmanship and thought muddled into it, with quite accurate portrayals of what those characters would have preferred their libations to taste like. In addition to these delicious specialty drinks, Novela also features a house punch with any liquor of your choice - I went with Gin but a few of my friends did the Pisco and Bourbon. I highly recommend the house punch as it's superficially yummy and deceivingly strong, just as I like it! It's also the best to order several bowls of the punch and share with your gal pals or group of trusty comrades. 

Definitely check out Novela to satiate your next lounge-craving or artisan cocktail search. Happy Drinking Yelpers!

P.S. The venue is quite spacious and very large so although it tends to be crowded, you can still hear the person sitting/standing next to you quite well. That's another bonus point in my book.
author: Priya S.

description: Perfect place for hanging out with friends after work or during the weekend. Drinks are custom made and the ambiance is nice.
author: Tai V.

description: Nice setting, rude staff, rude security guard. The place is called Novela but nothing about it is Spanish. And if you speak Spanish or have a Spanish name you're going to get judged by the security guard. Might as well open a place called Bobs. Not sell American food, and anyone who has an American name will be be scrutinized on why they are there. I don't care if they pay to get rid of this review. Don't scoff at my culture and history if you are using a Spanish name to your place.
author: Juan G.

description:
Not typically my scene, but I ended up here with my family while visiting over the holidays and ended up having a great time. The overall theme of the bar is very vibey and really reminds me of some of the upscale downtown spots back home in LA. While we tried mostly everything, the Salvatore Paradise was the clear winner in my book. Penny, our server was not only extremely easy on the eyes, but also a total sweetheart and quick to bring us our drinks. Especially considering how long you usually have to wait in a place as crazy as this. 

Great spot. Would get drunk here again!
author: Cian R.

description:
Books and booze, my two favorite things!

Featuring rows of pristine hard-bound books arranged by color, I am immediately transported. It feels like the place has swallowed me up with its plush interiors and quirky light fixtures trapped in cages and encircled in glass and metal orbs. 

It is the grand opening and the place is packed. The noise of the crowd is being drowned out by how gorgeous the space is. Every single square foot is covered by people, but I don't notice. My eyes are just drinking in the decor.

The cocktails are named after well-loved characters in literature. And seeing as a lot of the great writers were famous alcoholics, the cocktails reflect just that: strong, opinionated, creative, boozy. Each drink has its own distinct character -- from the feminine tartness of the Holly Golightly to the gritty, smoky Santiago to the sweet and beautiful Leopold Bloom.

They also had punch on tap, which I was planning to taste, but the cocktails were more than enough to keep me happy that night. 

I would have stayed here much longer, but I was starving and they didn't have anything to eat on the menu. Hopefully, they add a literary-themed appetizer list later on. 

The service was friendly, despite being frazzled on their opening night. Everyone was great at explaining each drink and helping us make our orders. 

Novela scores high on concept, character, and content (alcohol, that is!)
author: Racquel N.

description:
This place was just so cute! I love the decor and the atmosphere. I came here after my friend's wedding with the bridal party, the groomsmen and the newly weds. We came a little early so there was a lot of room and were able to sit at the long table. One of the groomsman was also able to charge his phone with one of the bartenders, so that was nice. 

I ordered the Scarlet O'Harra and it was really good! However, I am a total lightweight so I felt it halfway through the drink. I really enjoyed the nice and quiet atmosphere and, all the backdrop was super nice with the books. I heard that usually the lights also change but the night we went, it was only a red/orange color. The bathroom was also interesting, where it was kind of an open kind of individual stalls shared with men and women. The only problem that it was so ridiculously hard to get to the front of the bar and get the attention of the bartenders. Lucky for me, I only need one drink per night to not have to go back to the bar.

I would definitely come back when I want to go to a nice lounge in the city.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
This stretch of Mission St. desperately needed a cocktail lounge like this. My gosh. I was getting tired of descending into the vast expanse of darkness that is Local Edition.

But I still love you Local Edition.

The bookshelves, illuminated with an intoxicating fluorescence, border on the edge of kitsch, but it feels so, so right. The scene felt frantic on the Friday night when I paid a visit, but the bartenders take their time in the kind of way that reminds you to indulge patiently as well.

The Santiago on the menu incorporates mezcal, which reminded me of my last trip to New York City and its Mayahuel. For a few seconds, it had me almost convinced that SF could be just as cool.

HAHA
author: Alex C.

description:
Literary-themed cocktail bar in SOMA. Walls lined with books, an English-lit-themed menu, and a card catalogue acting as a hostess' stand. Thanks to its location, enormous floor plan, and overall swankiness (sexy damask, monochrome floors, unisex bathrooms and chandeliers) this promises to be the Happy Hour spot for FiDi folk for the foreseeable future. But how do the drinks... stack up?

The drinks are named after characters from your fave high school required reading. The Jay Gatsby is bourbon and Islay scotch, marred by just a bit too much amaretto. The Huckleberry Finn fares better; it's rum, grapefruit, lemon, and bitters. It manages to be citrus-y but not too sweet. The leader of the pack in my books is the Santiago. Mezcal and tequila, coffee liquor and bitters. Deep and smoky, with just a hint of sweetness. Just like Hemingway!

If only. On closer inspection the literary theme seems a bit put on. I was confused by the inclusion of some British names in what seemed to be an homage to American literature, and calling a non-alcoholic option the "Helen Keller" is just... odd. Add in a glaring typo (Holy Golightly? C'mon.) and the bookworm in me can't help but be a little let down. Yes, these are the nerdiest of quibbles. I'll go stuff myself into a locker now.

The variety and inventiveness of the cocktails is a nice change from the expected, and the space truly is gorgeous. With drinks from $9-12 they're at least comparable to nearby Local Edition. And the option to order punch (on tap for some reason) gives them a slight edge. Time will tell if this story has a happy ending. 

Obligatory Title Pun: Get LIT.

Menu Readability: Two column card, with a swell cameo logo.

Need to mention: They have a semi-private area in the back with its own bar.

What this place teaches me about myself: Sherlock Holmes made the menu, but Colonel Kurtz didn't? OK, OK, I'll shut up.
author: Vivek S.

description:
Four stars because the ambiance and decor are so damn cool. I love the lit up bookshelves and the chandeliers hanging in metal orbs. All the furniture looks like something straight off Joss and Main; I love it! Plenty of seating space too, accommodating whatever size your group is. The drinks are interesting but not spectacularly creative. I love that the music isnt overpoweringly loud; it was loud but I could still hear and carry on a convo with those seated around me without screaming my head off. 

We came with a birthday cake and candles and were told that on that particular weekend they don't possess any utensils or plates for serving (strange...). Luckily there is a walgreens and 7/11 close by for anything you need. Four stars for ambiance, minus one star for service (they didn't try to help us out at all with the cake). Overall still  a solid lounge, and one I'd go to again to catch up with friends.
author: Joyce H.

description:
New bar! ^____^ 

Kind of crowded when I went, but that's because it was the only bar open on a Monday. There's a little bit of seating, but fills up quick, so everyone else ends up standing around the bar. That's ok though, time to mingle! Can't wait to go back!
author: Jessica C.

description:
This place has my name written all over it.  No really, didn't you see "Jennifer" written all over those walls and Chevron painted floors?

It's like a gorgeous museum, flooded with loads of natural light, and with real books, organized by color on its shelves.  There are beautiful birdcage and industrial/orbital looking chandliers (I just bought one similiar for my bedroom), and lesiurely looking chairs in which to sit on and imbibe their delicious drinks from.

I had the Daisy Buchanan and the two types of punches.  Love that the drins are names after literary characters.  And the punches are brilliant!

Fun place for happy hour, and I'd imagine it's even mor fun when it gets dark out.

I.Must.Go.Back.SOON.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Stopped in with a few friends on a Wednesday night around 9. The space is really beautifully designed with a hip, young crowd. It's a good sized bar, though they tend to reserve a lot of the lounge seating, which limits seating options if you want to hang out for a while. There are both tall tables and lower lounge seating and the sooner os open to anyone. I was drinking bourbon on the rocks, but my friend was drinking martinis which she said were quite good. I'd definitely go back and would say it's definitely worth a stop if you're drinking in the area.
author: Chris G.

description: Loved that they serve punch that you can share. Had the gin sake punch and it tasted like candy in a good way. Not sure if there was enough alcohol in it, but it was delish!
author: Diane Z.

description:
novela is whatever.

the drinks are expensive and don't even taste that good.  they sure do a good job of making them sound good on the menu, though, since they're named after characters in popular books.  from what i remember, atticus finch tasted like shit, and the pippi longstocking was girly and sweet.  i recommend trying the pint by the flight so that you can get a little taste of 3 different cocktails.  it's only marginally more expensive than only one cocktail.

so why am i a regular here?  it's a great place to catch up with friends for a happy hour.  just prepare to shout over the unnecessarily loud music.  there's a lot of room to sit if you're lucky enough to get a table or some chairs.  even if you don't, there's room to stand, and it never gets unbearably crowded.  ALSO, it's in a great location.  not too far from muni / bart, and near where a lot of my friends work.

novela reminds me a bit of bars in the gaslamp / san diego because it actually tries to stick to a theme.  wall of books, caged chandelier, loungey chairs... it's cute or something.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Good venue for work happy hour.  The place fills up as the evening progresses and it starts to get louder, and it gets annoying to have to push through the crowd to get to the restroom.

Decent cocktails and I like how they put a legend on the menu to distinguish strong drinks from the lighter ones.  Price is average for SOMA ($11-$13 for a cocktails).  

Highlight of Novela is the decor.  It's dim-lit, retro, white leather couches, kind of like a speakeasy on a larger scale before it gets crowded and lose the charm.

Not sure if I'd be back for personal get-together.
author: Heidi B.

description:
3.5

Prices are a wee bit higher, maybe $1 less on each would seem justified, and the place is super loud. It's one of those places where you have to use your outside voice, inside. 

Since it was Halloween, they offered some unique cocktails - one that incorporated chocolate bitters, with sherry and another liquor. This was seriously a good, solid cocktail. 

The service was good, as there were two waitresses who came to check on us a few times during our stay. However, my friend has said the service is normally not great and I experienced a fluke. Oops.

It was a nice alternative to 83 Proof where there is an even higher decibel and more people.
author: Kimmie B.

description:
I went to Novela last night, and why a bar would be so horrendous with their customer service with so much competition in the vicinity baffles my mind. 

I think the place is absolutely beautiful, the books/logs are a nice touch. 

The drinks were great.

But I don't know if everyone behind the bar had a bad day or if this is just a trend at this bar, but they were just straight up rude.  

Waited for awhile to be helped at the bar, despite there being barely anybody there (they had had a private event earlier, so the place was pretty empty).  The busboy behind the counter noticed us waiting so he tried to get the attention of the guy bartender (who was busy looking at pictures on somebody's phone), but all the bartender did was shrug his shoulders and sort of shoo him off.  The bus boy then tried to get the attention of the girl bartender, who took our order, while she carried a full on conversation with some other dude behind the bar.  She then tossed our check at us at the end without saying anything.  

I don't understand how people like this are employed in a customer service position.  A few good drinks and a couple of comfortable couches does not justify such rude behavior.  Definitely don't intend to come back or recommend.
author: Ghizal A.

description: Great ambiance, strong drinks, very generous pours on the wine. Love it!
author: Karina A.

description:
Novela has greatness written all over it.  This place will become one of San Francisco's best known cocktail bars.

As you walk through the doors, Novela's decor makes an immediate impact.  You are transported away from the busy streets of San Francisco to a simpler time.  You have been invited into a world of elegance and class.  Novela provides the atmosphere of a modern-day Gatsby mansion.

The drink menu is fantastically creative, and Novela gives each of their craft cocktails a name of literary legend.  http://novelasf.com/menu/

I ordered the Leopold Bloom (hibiscus gin, pineapple syrup, mint) served on crushed ice.  See the photos, on Novela's Yelp page.  It is a work of art.

If you haven't yet been, make Novela one of your next destinations for a night out.  You can even make a reservation: https://www.seatme.com/novela-bar/
author: Brian M.

description:
Literature Shmiterature. You think I'm going to get impressed because you name your drink Atticus Finch? Give me a good drink and I'll call it what you want! But just because you have a fancy name doesn't mean you have to slack on the drink quality...we tried to order fireballs...nope. We tried to order Southern Comfort...nope. There were a couple other nopes thrown in but by then, I was so frustrated, I just started eating the mint leaves straight until someone could figure out what this place had. We finally ordered some mojitos. I'm surprised they didn't name it Julius Caesar or Don Quixote. But by then, I was mad because they didn't have my drinks and the bartender was mad because I ate the mint leaves. 

I really wanted to like this place because I used to watch hella novelas in high school! But I think I'm gonna call "do-overrr" and try it again and hopefully, will return with a better update. Perhaps I need to revisit my AP English books from high school...that's what I get for reading Cliffs Notes...
author: Leena B.

description: Nice bar, nice decor, nice people. Staff was friendly, we arrived about 9ish most tables were reserved but my girlfriend asked if there was any available table to sit and the waitress first said no but a minute later she said we could actually sit at table . Drinks I had were the flight of punches, I got the Pisco, Gin and Vodka all were really good I also got Leopold Bloom, that was also good. Drinks are reasonable price. I would definitely come back.
author: Luis G.

description:
The boys and I have been hearing about this place for a few months now and we decided to check it out after having dinner in the financial district.  We got into line at around 11pm and almost a half hour later we got in and began inching our way to the bar. There were 3 bartenders attempting to serve a crowd 3 deep across the entire span of the bar which, incidentally, I feel could be extended to the other side with a minimal impact to the move about space. They could then staff more bartenders and quickly get their mediocre drinks into the hands of their patrons on busy Saturday nights. On this particular night there was very little room to move around. The crowd was mostly Asian, shorter(I could peer over the vast majority of the crowd that night), roughly mid-20's, and over dressed. I must have seen at least 4 dudes in full suits. 
I have to admit on a weeknight this place could be a cool quaint place to chill out with a small group but there are too many bars in SF to pick from on a Saturday night for me to want to ever come back.
author: Dennis W.

description:
I was extremely disappointed with Novela Bar. I booked a table for 20 friends who were meeting me there for drinks after my engagement party. It was a Friday night, so I was happy to reserve some space. When my fiancé and I arrived at the bar, she realized she didn't have her ID. She was in her fancy dress and didn't have a purse. We are both pushing 40 and haven't been carded in years, so we didn't think about it. The bouncers refused to let her in, despite our reservation and our obvious ages (plus my ID). What's more, some people leaving the bar told me that they didn't have an ID and were let in by the bouncers anyway. Both managers I spoke with gave me the brush off. 

Good for you that your bar is crowded. Doesn't mean you have to be jerks. Luckily a nearby place was happy to have us all.
author: Jason M.

description: I have been wanting to come to this place for a while ever since I learned about their specialty drinks. I came here on a Friday night with some friends and it was packed. It is a very unusual bar in that it's book-themed and even all the drinks are named after the characters in classic novels. Even the furniture and decor make it seem like you are in a vintage library. To be brutally honest, I didn't really get it because I don't see the connection between books and alcohol, but nevertheless, it was interesting. As for the drinks, WOW. I am very picky about my drinks and the cocktails and punch definitely passed the test. I was very impressed. I will say that this place is more of a yuppy dive-in lounge than anything else. Given that there are not too many of those in SF, I can see why this place receives a lot of the yuppy SF crowd. Not that there is anything wrong with that (I was a part of it for the past three years!), but you definitely need to dress up a little if you come by here. If you are in casual clothes, you will definitely stand out and not in a good way. That being said, you don't have to be worried because it's also not a huge pick-up bar. Most people here are coming with colleagues or are already in groups together at individual tables. If you are looking for a lounge-like atmosphere to just drink and catch up with friends possibly before actually going out-out, then this place is definitely what you are looking for!
author: Kunal N.

description:
Great place to unwind after work but if you plan on coming with a group make sure you arrive a bit earlier. This venue generally gets crowded around late evening so prepare for it to be packed. The tunes they play fit in with the lively atmosphere which is surrounded by  books that take you back to the days of Great Gatsby and Ernest Hemingway.  There are creative variations of cocktails that encompass this theme. 

From my experience people who frequent here are friendly and laid back and don't mind you sharing a table if you ask nicely. There are also waitresses who are willing to take your order (on tab) so it'll spare you walk to the bar. I mean who really wants to get out of their seat when you can stay  and have another?

The bourbon drinks they have here are amazing! There's just something about them that makes you want more. I'm not sure I can recall all the embarrassing episodes of getting inebriated here but if I remember I promise I'll update this review with an detailed description of each one. I do however, remember getting my jacket the next day and to my surprise it was safe and sound!!  If I'm in town again I'm pretty sure I'll stop by. I wish there were one of these in the OC but then again it's SF...and all the glory.
author: Jade D.

description: One of my favorite bars in fidi! Went right when it opened, spacious with nice bartenders a great drinks! The Princess Leah was good, one other drink I got (leonardo? Leonidas?) anyways, way too much ice. TOO MUCH ICE. Was literally a snow cone. Besides that, great vibe and the interior of books is so gorgeous.
author: Jane C.

description:
My friends want to go happy hour and so, we decided to check out Novela! There was no line about 5:30pm on a Friday night when we went but holy, it was crowded.

There are about 4 bartenders and all busy making gourmet, made-to-order drinks. The drinks were strong and pretty unique. 

The place reminds me of Sherlock Holmes or a study in an old rustic mansion. Love the book wall decor and chandeliers. There are tables all along the wall and some in the middle of the room for sitting, but come really, really early if you want to sit on a Friday night, otherwise, it's pretty hard to stand for long since no rooms to move around. There are a mixed crowd here but overall pretty business casual.
.
author: Mandy C.

description:
I'm sure most people who frequent Novela have no idea what preceded this noir style lounge -- yes, the former Fluid Ultra Lounge has now turned into super chic Novela. What used to be light up floors is now wood panels (or laminate.. Whatever) and white walls are now transformed into faux library style book shelves.

For the upgrade alone, 3 stars. The troubling part is grabbing a drink even during the early hours of the night. I can't help but study the stress lines that form on the bartenders' faces while trying to swirl this and that, zest a lemon here or there, and still be terribly behind. Pro tip: get a whatever on the rocks or order several drinks once you have the bartender's attention.

Or you can reserve a table like most Yelpers recommend and have a server come to you, but how often do you plan ahead to have drinks?
author: Johanna L.

description:
This is probably the first time i'll ever give a bar / lounge 5 stars BUT, let's see how long it will last! anyways, here's why:

1. No cover charge, just gotta wait for people to leave so you can go in.
2. very nice even ratio of guys and girls, plenty of cute females here.
3. there are no bartenders here, there are MIXOLOGISTS! they're not there for you to scream at, just be patient and they'll get to you. they're all nice too. oh, beer on tap = only $4?!
4. VERY VERY nice lounge. plenty of space to move around and music in the background is not loud but just loud enough so people can still converse
5. people here SEEM to be very open to meeting other strangers. at least for now

keep up the cleanliness and the great service and people would be storming the place
author: Kenny L.

description:
Came with a party of 10 on an early Friday night and had reservations so we didn't have to wait around for a spot. We had our little corner area, but even without reservations the place seemed to have plendy of standing room.

Their drink menu is really unique and has names from great reads so that's definitely a plus! Aside from their specials, they also had a plethora of other types of alcohol including whiskeys.. my favorite! I also want to recognize their drink, the daisy buchannan. This drink had egg whites in it, which seemed really odd to me but apparently lots of drinks have this in it because it creates a nice texture?! Either way, this was the only time I've had it in a drink and it was surpisingly good!

This is definitely a great little spot to hang out at night and on the weekends. Good location, good staff and good vibes!
author: amelia g.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday and I'm sure I broke my neck from all the head turning I did from checking out all the hot woman in there. Seriously, it was like the hot chick goddess just packed all the hot woman in SF into this bar on this one night. It was crazy.

I was under dressed and this place was really classy. Everyone looked like they came from a wedding or something. The bar was really stacked with beer and all kinds of liquor. I loved the decor and I was playing with the firewood logs they had which were actual real logs....made from wood....from trees! I was swinging it around like a lumbar jack but then got in trouble with a security guard who told me to putthe log down or I'd get kicked out of the bar, so I put the log down. The prices on the drinks were reasonable, not too shabby but just a little on the expensive side but who are we kidding? Once you have too many shots, you don't even care how much the drinks costs am i right? No? Okay.....

Overall, great place and atmosphere. I tried to come here again a few weeks after and there was a crazy line outside that wrapped around into the alley. I almost ran into another car because I almost broke my neck again from checking out all the fine ladies that were standing in line. This place is dangerous for necks.
author: Will C.

description: Ugh.  I put a star for the décor, which is nice.  Everything else was pretty much a big no for me.
author: .Vanessa G.

description:
This is a beautiful fun place to have cocktails with a group of friends or maybe the last stop if you're on a boozy date. It's pretty loud and sometimes very crowded.  

I sat with some friends in the front corner on a couch and a couple chairs, our server was lovely and kept up fully stocked on yummy cocktails. We all had more than we normally do and I think the sweet drinks are very much to our liking.  The boys can drink beer if they don't like the cocktails or (in the case of one friend) they don't want to say any of the slightly silly drink names.
author: Poppy C.

description: This place is definitely nice for date night as its a higher class than other places but for $15+ a drink, this place is just not worth it. Yes the atmosphere and the theme of the place is nice but the drinks are just not that good to make this place worth it. Unless I get invited her for a birthday or something, most likely will not come back.
author: G O.

description: I like this cocktail lounge. It has a very nice casual chic vibe to it. It feels very loungy and is set up to look like a study with books on the shelves, comfy couches which was cool. I was there on a Wednesday when it is was not too crowded which is just the way I like it. I was able to have a conversation and enjoy the drinks and not worry about getting elbowed or have to fight to get an order in. I met some cool new folks as well which was nice.
author: Sunil R.

description:
If you're a fan of high school literature, then you'll love the character cocktails they have here, named after specific characters (such as Jay Gatsby and Holden Caulfield). The decor exudes a classy library, with ample amount of couches and seats.

I recommend trying the Punch - $45 for 6-8 people (fills about 8 cups per pitcher). It's essentially like buying a cocktail pitcher for the group. (For you recent college students, think Jungle Juice). I tried the one with Cognac (strong, didn't taste that great) and the Punch printed in the middle of the menu (name escapes me) that tasted AMAZING. 

I'll definitely come back to try the cocktails and to soak up the ambiance.
author: Pam M.

description: Nice atmosphere and excellent creative cocktails. Who could ask for more?
author: Philip S.

description:
Just as I was starting to get tired of all the bars in SF, I came across this place! I was blown away by the decor when I walked in and couldn't help being like an asian tourist and taking pictures of everything. I love the atmosphere here. It's swanky and cool and an awesome place to come wiht a group of friends or on an intimate date.

I'm a sucker for themed stuff. So I thought it was cool that all the drinks were named after characters from famous literature. I got the Daisy Buchanan, which tasted like a pisco sour. My friend got the Leopold Bloom and it was very minty and a little fruit. Both drinks are very strong, which is awesome!

Also, I was really surprised at how nice the bartender was! She seemed genuinely interested in what I thought of the drink and was just very friendly! And I don't usually get that vibe from bartenders in SF.
author: Christina L.

description:
Went on a Friday night and even though it was full of people the energy was positive and everyone was having a good time.  We stood for a little while but once a table opened up, the high backed chairs created a really intimate atmosphere.  The best part of the bar though is the staff!  Everyone was super friendly and efficient.  Our bar tender, Josh, was the best!  It was a super busy night at the bar but he made all 4 of us feel welcome and had the right balance of friendly and professional to make our visit one we will remember for a long time.

The drinks on the menu are unique and coordinate with the theme of a library.  We tried several and found all of them to be tasty and one-of-a-kind.  We leveraged Josh's deep knowledge of his craft allowing him to make recommendations and found that each of his offerings was an experience - one that we sipped and savored.  I'm in love with the "Miss Moneypenny".

I'll be happy to go back any time we're in SOMA.
author: Judi H.

description:
I went to Novela last Friday for after-work drinks. I had a fantastic time.

The ambience was great. The place was alive lots of people yet was still dim enough to be intimate with one or two friends. The interior design was beautiful, replete with ornate light fixtures and sleek, yet comfortable furniture.

Service was probably the highlight. Our server, Courtney, was simply outstanding. She was a great conversationalist and was very attendant to our drinking needs. She appeared whenever we needed her and she brought back our drinks in record time.

Highly recommended.
author: Aj P.

description:
Love the decor, the drinks, the atmosphere. Was able to check out novela for their soft opening last week and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The decor is sleek and modern yet homey and warm. Its larger than most of the high end mixology/cocktail bards with a large bar area.

They offered people at the soft opening free drink tickets to try their specialty cocktails. I thought that was a great touch.

All in all  - i am glad to have a location that is trendy and nice in my neighborhood! 

-S
author: Shadi N.

description:
I came here at 7pm on Thu. This place was already packed! 
Very trendy decor. I loved it! 
We had hard time finding and around 7:30-8pm, we could find a nice comfy couch. 
The music was pretty loud... so we just had to talk loud. :D
I enjoyed their original cocktail: MoneyPenny. I would love to come back and try other cocktails. They sound good and unique. 
There was a food stand right outside of the bar and people were buying them and bringing in. The burger looked pretty good too...wait, it's not for their review. :p
author: Yoshie A.

description:
Overview: 
5-stars for tasteful decor and creative drinks! 

Details: 
Being the huge nerd that I am, the moment I walked into Novela, I grabbed my friend and exclaimed "BOOKS!" --And for the next two hours I continued to gawk at the interior design. Novela not only gives an upscale classical environment a modern, trendy twist, but also successfully captures the current appeal of the whole Gangster Squad/Great Gatsby/combover-fashion-mid-nineteenth-century-coutoure social vibe. I don't know if that made any sense at all, but basically: everyone wants to be fancy these days, and Novela transports you to a fancy place -- one where you can still listen to EDM. 

The drinks are solid. (Check out their menu here: http://novelasf.com/menu/) Definitely get the punch! We got the rum one and it was delicious! (I don't even like rum.) I ordered the Leopold Bloom cocktail and my friends and I agreed it tasted like a flower -- didn't like it. However, a couple of my friends ordered different "citrus foreward" cocktails, and like typical girls, we all appreciated the fruity flavor combos. 

The waitresses are nice. The seating becomes somewhat limited on a crowded night (what's new), but there's plenty of room around the bar to stand. If there's a lull in your conversations, you can stare at the moving lights at the bar, or even grab a book - they're real! 

Recommendation: 
If you're into exploring the city and checking out cool places, Novela will add a nice photo to your album of experiences. Definitely check it out.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
It's a cool spot to grab a drink. I wish I would have gotten to try more but damn it's a costly joint!

I tried the billy pilgrim. It was fine. Not something I'll stick with forever but it was just that... fine. 


Also tried the emma woodhouse. distinctly sweet but still not all that bad. This one was just fine as well. 


There was one more drink but I couldn't tell you which one. That one was fine. 


Overall I'd honestly rate this place a 2 or 3 when it comes to delicious drunk liquid. In hindsight, ordering a macallan neat probably would have served my night a bit better but I was feeling very adventurous. 


Giving it a 4 stars because the venue is really nice and the music is even more nice-wid-it.
author: Michael A.

description: SOLID DATE LIGHTING. Seriously. Caked make-up? Smeared make-up? A little sleepy? Frizz? No problem. Perfectly moody, great interior. Love the books on the walls, the chandeliers and the drinks. It gets loud and crowded though, so bring your outside voice.
author: Kristina K.

description:
If you are looking for a hook up, friday nights at this place is a good place to look.
Me not being allowed such things made it boring with expensive beers. 
But I can not give them a bad review, they are on top of their game. 
The place is new, clean, smart looking staff, all the bells and wistles for SF.
author: Frank J.

description:
Wall-to-wall shelves of books and carefully crafted cocktails named after our favorite fictional characters = possibly one of the cutest bar concepts ever.

The crowd is not as bookish as one would expect, and pretty diverse given its Financial District location. Guys are on the prowl here, which makes for interesting conversation, certainly. On the Friday night I went, it was also packed the eff out, so expect a wait for a drink.

I stuck with gin martinis which were okay, depending on which bartender served you. My friend got an Old-Fashioned and again, I wasn't that impressed. (Still looking for that perfect Old-Fashioned here in San Francisco.)

Would be curious to see what Novela is like when it's a little less busy. For combining two of my favorite pastimes (reading and drinking), though, Novela already wins my vote.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Novela is very cool! I walk by every day and have been waiting for them to open. I've seen the time and attention to detail that they've put into the decor and ambiance. The "craft" cocktails are delicious and the space is wonderful--and I do mean space. It's a great place to meet up with friends and/or colleagues due to the amount of seating and intimate sections that they've created. I'm arranging my next 'meeting' there next week!

Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Shelley C.

description: Gabby c. has got to be the rudest waitress I've even had the misfortune to meet. First, she wouldn't allow my friend to switch vodka for gin on a simple drink. Second, she continually forgot our orders. Most importantly, someone ordered the toast, an hour goes by and we still don't have it. We remind her and she says "oh we're actually out of that. Is there anything else we can get you?" Except by this time, the kitchen had actually closed. She also brings out a plate of tacos and as my friend goes to grab the plate since he ordered some tacos, she yanks it out of his hands and says "everyone's tacos are on here". It was rude and weird. I've never once heard her say "sorry". It's my friends bday, it's a small group, we aren't difficult, we're nice happy people that all work in the service industry, and she completely killed our vibe.
author: Chloe H.

description:
Great place for drinks after work. It gets crowded, and all of the cute lounge areas seem to always be reserved, so if you go with a group, you might want to do that too. 

The drinks are great. They take their time on them and taste them as they go along, so expect to wait a while for your book-themed drink of choice, but know that it will be delicious. My favorite is the Ophelia which is full of berries and really tasty. 

Definitely worth checking out.
author: Brittany P.

description:
"I drink to make other people more interesting"  -Ernest Hemingway

This place has such a cool vibe.  I love the balance of the new/old decor.  It feels modern but with a nod to the 20's.  There's even a library in the back...sorta.  I loved the cheeky quotes in the bathroom.  

The Atticus Finch was amazing.  Looking forward to more than a few more happy hours here!
author: Olivia D.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, I really did.  However,  I don't think any drink, no matter how well-made, is worth the noise and crowd.  Maybe I'm just getting older but when I go to a speakeasy-type bar, I kind of expect to be able to speak with and hear the person I'm with easily.  Novela falls flat on that aspect.

I'll concede that the Jay Gatsby was a pretty good drink.  The Holden Caulfield, however, was not and the Punch was so-so.  Definitely not worth the 20-30 minutes it takes to get a drink.  Reeediculous!

I'll probably be back if a group outing dictates so, but likely I won't seek out Novela on my own.  With such a name and shelves stacked with real books, I almost expected the atmosphere to be relaxed enough that I could grab a novel off the shelf and start reading, cocktail-in-hand.  I should probably lower my expectations of these SF boutique bars.
author: Chris C.

description: A bibliophile's dream for sure, though perhaps minus the crowd.  The theme is wonderfully carried through - from the decor and literary themed cocktails to the dishes that mimic the shape of an open book (so clever!).  However, this joint is NOT for reading, it's for screaming.  You can forget about snuggling up with a book here, but hey, that's what living rooms are for, right?
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I love this place!
WHY:
-Creative  delicious tasting cocktails
   My fave
    Scarlett Ohara: Vodka, basil ,pinnaple gum, ginger beer and more amazingness...
-Great atmosphere! 
-Trendy artistic deco
-Modern tables and big couches for intimate & big groups
-Quick service! Bartenders are right on top of their business for the amount of people they usually get.
author: Doris C.

description: While waiting at the bar on Friday night, I saw two different bartenders being snarky and condescending to customers who were just trying to order drinks. There's no reason to put up with that - there are enough places to drink in the city.
author: Allison P.

description:
Nice lounge bar with good drinks and a laid back atmosphere. Lively, but not overly loud- SF definitely needs more like this!!

Minus 1 star for the d-bag bartender with the ponytail.
author: Sara J.

description: Love the decor in this place...Where else do you find a hip bar whose walls are covered in beautifully arranged books? Extensive menu, lots of seating configurations (chairs, booths, high tables, low tables), beautiful lighting, friendly and efficient service. Cheers!
author: M B.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night.  Great decor and cool theme.  Books (or fake books) on the shelves on the walls and cocktails named after literary characters.    GF had the Pippi Longstocking, which was perfect for her, and I had the Atticus Finch, which was perfect for me.  Great cocktails.. $12+ a piece. Space is really nice in that it's open.  The bar has no stools, so it's pretty open and easy to get to the bar and order a drink.  There's one big table in the middle and everything else is sofas, armchairs, etc against the walls.   

The problem with the open space/setup is that it's a bit awkward.  There's very few places to sit for such a large space.  Most of the lounge areas are reserved.  And even if they're not, you sit somewhere that's open, and they'll come kick you out for a larger group.  It also has the feel of a somewhat classy lounge, where you can sit back in your chairs, but they pump the music just a bit too loud so you can't hear each other.  

Service is terrible.  There are servers walking around and it seems like there should be table service, but they just socialize amongst each other and pretty much ignore the tables.  I can understand if it's super crowded, but it wasn't b/c we were there early.  You have to either go get your own drink or wave the servers to come over if you can ever get them to look your way.

Overall, just kind of seems like a snooty place.
author: Easter E.

description:
Looking for a new lounge to chat with friends while drinking a cocktail? Or into people watching? I've been to a lot of lounges in the SF area, and I felt like I wanted to actually start yelping about them. A Whiskey lover at heart and a bartender, lounges and bars have been my "go to" option since moving to SF: 

Novela is a nice new lounge with leather seats, chandeliers, a nice wall full of library books on your right as you enter highlighted by colors, and a half bar filled with a standard selection of spirits. I can't comment on the cocktails themselves because I had my usual brown, but definitely throwing my two cents in about everything else:  


***THINGS TO LOOK FORWARD TO*** (PROS): 
- 1 women's and 1 men's bathroom (con), but 2 unisex ones right next to it (win!)
- ambiance great for a group of friends who want to talk (a bit noisy though on the busy nights)
- good amount of seating all along the walls ( suggestion to get their early if you want a seat), but standing room is an option (there is also a table next to the bar)
- good date place if you need chatter to break that awkward silence of a first date
- the crowd was diverse for the most part
- drinks were reasonably priced (tired of places charging $12 bucks for Jameson)
- no cover (of course)
- staff was efficient in cleaning up and getting orders, so great service
- Music is not too loud (mainstream/ EDC vibe)
- Ability to dress up or dress comfortably in jeans ( this is for the guys)

*** THINGS TO BE PREPARED FOR*** (CONS):
- bar is only on one side (as oppose to the horseshoe design before when the place was a club)
- too crowded at times where you can't really move or stand 
- there is a little wait if you come late and they reach capacity  
- parking in the soMa, but atleast it's free if you find a meter
- Décor: library decorations were only on the right side with the bar as you entered (tables and setting on the other side)
author: Annie L.

description:
Eh....sorta your typical Soma bar.  Nice inside.  Service at the bar is slow, drinks are pretty much overpriced like most places - so I guess it's not overpriced!?  It gets rather crowded and loud, which is good or bad I guess.

Not really my favorite spot, but a afterhours drink spot for many.

Not a place I recommend to people, but I wouldn't turn anyone away either.
author: Arthur Y.

description:
This place will get better as they figure themselves out.  They were slammed on this particular day, and while there are two bars only pone was open.  When you have people lined up three or four deep at your bar and it takes half an hour to get a drink there's as problem.

Outside of that I actually like the place a lot.  It's got a very cool vibe, lighting and interior are thoughtful.  There are pretty good seating options and the staff that they did have were great once they got to you.
author: Rahsaan M.

description: Gorgeous place! On their opening day, there was red carpet and yummy passed hors d'oeuvres.  The place mimic a high-end library, very upscale. Everyone was well dressed. However, it gets really hot inside and you have to get out to catch some fresh air. The bar is huge and located dead center of the lounge and it's great if you happen to score a table, otherwise, there isn't a whole lot of room to walk or stand. Came here twice and the second time it took us (three girls) 30min to order drinks (because it was super packed and the bartenders were busy flirting behind the bar to keep up with orders). Felt like sardines in there...
author: Vee V.

description: I came in around 8 PM on Sat night for my friend's BD celebration. We had a table, so it was good to be able to sit down and the place was fairly large. After 9:30 or so, the place was so packed/loud that it was almost impossible to talk. That's why I don't like the bar scene. The punch I had was good, but not mind blowing for $10.
author: Yoko S.

description:
Nice atmosphere and of course, great drink for the price. 

The Old Fashioned and Dread Pirate Roberts are superb! Best I've ever had in bars/clubs.
author: Anh N.

description:
This is definitely a FUN place to check out. It's got this hipster vibe to it - from the decor all the way to the names of drinks. 

Drinks are definitely a bit on the pricier side. Beware, some drinks are pretty darn strong. 

I would have to say that the noise level does get a bit obnoxious at times making it super difficult to have any decent conversations. It's a great place to come with friends for a casual night out, but perhaps not for a date.
author: Sharon G.

description:
Loved the atmosphere. Fun people, nice decor, crowded, but not obnoxiously loud. 

The specialty drinks were all very good. I had the Pisco Punch which i absolutely loved. One of my friends ordered the Jay Gatsby which was good, but definitely one that creeps up on you. My other friend enjoyed his Hemingway's "Code Hero" Punch, which was good, but i definitely preferred my Pisco Punch.

They don't have a kitchen, but they have a food truck outside that offers sliders and fries.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
I actually really liked this place. The atmosphere was chill, the drinks were great, and the crowd was fun. 

But the reason the place only gets three stars is because the service was crappy. We had a large group and ordered a lot of drinks, but the waitress refused to keep separate tabs and was super rude when we tried to pay with multiple credit cards. Plus they had all these rules about how we couldn't grab stools from other booths, even though those booths weren't being used and we said we'd return then if and when the people who'd reserved the booth came.
author: Rowena L.

description:
This pretty bar is close to my work, so it's often the go-to for company happy hours. 

The interior is beautiful, albeit seating is sparse. They have an array of great cocktails and punches. My go-to is a whiskey sour and theirs didn't disappoint. 

There's not much to say about an establishment that only deals drinks, but if you're looking for a nice classy place to sip on fancy drinks, give Novela a shot.
author: Kathleen L.

description: Was under impressed with this place! I was really excited to check this place out- the decor in the reviews I had seen really set up my expectations however; the vibe and crowd over shadowed the unique decor. Not sure if it was just an off night but prob won't add this bar to my list.
author: Leslie S.

description: Came back.. I was told the Miss HoneyPenny has been discontinued  no!!! That's was my favorite drink.. I asked he bartender is there was anything similar but he said nope..  So I asked him what he would recommend and he said the Leopold Bloom so I tried it.. It was ok..
author: Lor L.

description:
This is our new spot for happy hour. best days to go are Thursdays. Drinks are certainly overpriced but they have a great selection of cocktails and scotch if you enjoy those. But they are in the pricey side. 

It has a great atmosphere and the people that come to this bar are mainly professionals from the downtown area. I love novela!
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
Literary themed decor? Check
Aptly named drinks? Check
Too many people and not enough seating? Double check. 

Great ambience, yummy drinks, but very crowded on Friday evenings after work gets out. More than 50% of the tables were reserved and no one sat in them for at least 30+ minutes. Bar was very crowded too, so my small group of three hung around a support beam in the middle of the room.  

It is nice that there are two bars in the place and there are plenty of bathroom stalls (all unisex). 

I'll give it another try on a different night.
author: Aneilia M.
