description: Fun bar.  Came here for happy hour on a Friday and it was very crowded.  Bumped into a few friends who happened to be there after work as well.  It's a super convenient location for the downtown location - just don't drive, that was my big mistake.  I also like the decor - lots of books for the library theme but also some modern Hollywood Regency too.  The drinks were pretty good, although I didn't stray too far from the standard so I can't judge yet.  Next time.
author: Vivian W.

description:
Pretty cool place. 
The atmosphere and decor are great.  
They have a good selection of booze and the staff seems to be pretty knowledgable on the different hard liquor.
The bartenders are pretty cool too.  My experience at places that have a lot of complex drinks often have duchy bartenders.  That's not the vibe here.  They seem to be having a good time behind the bar and are helpful.
author: Robert S.

description: Really nice bar with pricey drinks! I had a great time with a group of friends here. The drinks were really good and strong, depending on what you like. It is trendy with a nice interior and plenty of seating available. I only stayed for an hour and there was a steady flow of people coming into the bar but it wasn't crazy packed for a Tuesday evening. All in all I had fun so I will be back!
author: Karen C.

description: Very pretty modern bar with good cocktails. Would go again.
author: Tasha D.

description:
I had really high hopes for this cocktail bar based on the beautifully decorated interior and rave reviews from their soft opening. I came here the first Saturday they opened for a friend's birthday. True to the photos, the decor was spot on. Sexy, sophisticated, and upscale, very similar vibe to Local Edition. However, the space and the bar was a little too crowded and small for my taste, but perhaps it was due to the grand opening craziness. 

I tried a few of their cocktails but they were STRONG! Great if you want to get your money's worth because you know for a fact there's alcohol in it. Not so great if you want something delicious to sip on. I opted for a glass of wine at the end because for some reason they didn't have any grey goose or jameson (???) for the more simple drinks. 

I'll probably have to come back a second time once things settle down. Looks like it would be a great place for a happy hour drink though!
author: Vivian D.

description: 0 stars. Came here with a good fried in Tory Burch shoes that were deemed not "appropriate." This place is a joke. Come here if you like bridge and tunnel crowds, bad service, and self important security guards who act like they are bouncing TAO in Las Vegas.
author: Aman V.

description:
The ambience was ok but the bartenders took forever to make our drinks and the worst part... The two bouncers tonight, the black guy and the middle Eastern  looking one also.. What a jerks ... When I mention we had a table and my friend wanted to come in.. They started making fun of us outside saying :.." Hahhah just because you have a table . Who cares??!""" 
Well, people  come and drink and pay for you to be there , they care you idiots...
 
Bottom line... Costumer service is terrible . I won't ever be back here... Do not recommend this place
author: Liz G.

description: Did a private event buyout here. The space is fabulous, the staff is great and drinks are amazing. The only reason I didn't give five stars is because of all the fees they have on top of the bar minimum. It felt like there was a new fee every time I inquired about another aspect. Overall great experience though- the event coordinator was amazing to work with.
author: Amy B.

description: Great place! Has the vibe of a fancy hotel bar. Real books on the walls for that library feel...which i thought was a neat touch. Places to sit are pretty nice... think leather couches, satin pillows... but most likely if you get by 10 you're not getting a seat. I got the gin, blueberry drink that comes in the cool metal glass. Loved it! Bartender was friendly and fast. People tend to be more dressed up here... think big groups of people in suits and heels and dresses. So not your typical polar fleece flare that u see in a lot of SF bars but both vibes are great depending on what your into... the only awkward part was the couple hogging up the whole couch and making out... get a room! I would come again though. Remember that ur going to be playing around 12-14 bucks for a drink and it might not be too strong... it's for the vibe not for buzzing!
author: Sandra P.

description:
Love the ambience here... so chic and modern. they have a library theme going on with lit up bookshelves along the walls and the drinks are named after book characters.

it gets pretty busy on weekends but it's a nice place, but if it wasnt busy, it probably means its not a good bar.  I also like their drinks; they're very uniquely flavored
author: Priscilla T.

description:
Oh, we had such high hopes, but...

We visited Novela for a birthday night cap fairly early in the night on Saturday, June 8. The bar wasn't busy at all, and was fully staffed with 4 or 5 waitresses working the floor and four bartenders behind the bar. 

Which all makes me wonder why, on Monday morning, I'm still waiting for my cocktail. 

The bar itself is pretty, though the library/book theme is watered down, making the bar seem no more special than the next nice cocktail bar. The menu looked impressive, but for some reason, at 9PM they were ENTIRELY out of EVERY punch on the menu.  

And after waiting some 10 or more minutes to be served, then another 10 or more minutes after not receiving our order, I asked for my card back and we left. The staff was polite, but clearly lacks the kind of cohesiveness that makes a great bar. Maybe because it's new? Maybe because they're indifferent towards customer service? 

Who knows... but that night just wasn't their night. 

In the same area, you're much better off visiting Fifth Floor or wandering the distance down to Rickhouse.
author: Jeff Z.

description:
Newish bar / hipster throwback place on the block. Good drinks which are priced in line with the new vibe of these places ($11-18 is common per drink). Limited selection of scotch, but has quite good mixed cocktails. 

Go on Thursdays night around 9-10pm if you enjoy hanging out with young Asian girls (who doesn't right? j/k). Overall a good vibe and attractive crowd. If I was single I would probably come here more often, but right when people are doing shots I am likely sleeping or eating a leftover donut in my underwear. Don't be like me.... go out... go here I guess. 

Enjoy.
author: Oliver L.

description:
I had bookmarked this place a while ago and finally got around to stopping in for happy hour yesterday.

At around 6pm, they suddenly turned the music WAY up like we were in a club or something. I didn't understand that. I had to shout to talk to the friends sitting across the table from me. 

I ordered the Atticus Finch and it was yummy. Service was slow. It took forever to get the check and then even longer to get our cards back. While we were sitting there waiting for the check/waiting to get cards back, they came over and put a 'reserved' sign on our table while we were still sitting at it. I know you want to save it before someone swoops in and takes it when we leave, but you could do that when you hand us the cards back. Or just move quicker so we can leave like we want to.
author: Gina G.

description:
So swaaaanky!!

One of the first things you notice when you walk in is the floor-to-ceiling bookshelf on the right side with illuminated books (and moving lights).  
This is a library themed bar with plush vintage seats, crystal chandeliers, and overall class.  It's a good place to sit (or stand) and catch up with friends.

The drinks are great too.  A pitcher of the Hemingway's Punch is good to share.  I liked how it wasn't too sweet (unlike how other bars do it).  I tried a couple of the other drinks which I don't remember, but I don't think you can really go wrong with any of them.  All of the cocktails have names based on famous characters from literature, and it seems like they cycle through their drink selection from time to time.

Overall I really enjoyed this place.  It's also a good place to people watch.  The crowd was interesting: a mix of yuppies and awkward nerds (I mean you can tell these people don't normally don't go out at night).
author: Jeanne L.

description: The ambience is nice, Novela is great for a Happy Hour but not so sure about the party/night scene. Lots of dudes trying to hit on girls (and they do so in weird ways; needless to say, the SF single scene is weird!) but overall, a decent option for SF nightlife. They will however kick you out at 2am.
author: Siv L.

description: Drinks are amazing here. Love the atmosphere, really cool interior. They have shelves along the walls filled with books and couches. Novels has a really speakeasy vibe going on. There are a few couches as well and chairs with tables all around. I love the pippy long stocking drink! A bit fruity, just like how I like my drinks. The bartenders really put in effort in handcrafting each drink. A+!
author: Laura T.

description: This place is truly amazing. Great location, the ambiance is nice, quiet and comfortable. The drinks are great and very creative to name them after authors and movies. Service is great, they are very friendly here.
author: Melissa E.

description: Cool bar. Great decor & GREAT service. The music was awesome. The bar specializes in punch. The cocktails are interesting- had one with bell pepper, orange & chile. The food is just small plates, mainly just a few selections. The crowd was well dressed & nice looking.
author: NG D.

description: This place is awesome! The decor is very Great Gatsby, which is also the theme of the names of most of their cocktail. The drinks are delicious and very well balanced. Went with a group of ladies on a Friday night, and a bartender named Ernson made us all some of the best cocktails we've ever tasted!
author: Emily N.

description:
Convenient location.  Clean.  And tons of space and places to sit.  And good crowd as it seems like everyone I know from out East comes here from time to time.

Pretty much my place for getting drinks.
author: Daniel Y.

description: Drinks are named after authors and novels. Always full and difficult to find a place to sit or talk.
author: Jim N.

description: Cool theme! Like the library look and cocktails named after literary characters. Genius how the bookcases "glow". Great time!
author: SoCal S.

description:
Summary: interior decor is SO EXCELLENT (classy & throwback & modern at the same time!), but the drinks were really quite bad :( come for the ambiance, but skip the mixed drinks.

Swung by on a Monday night with Jen L. to celebrate my joining her ranks by becoming a Yelp Elite. Wahoo! This has been on both of our lists for a long time, since we're both bookworms and the promotional photos of the neon color-coded library setting have been tantalizing. We moseyed in around 8 pm, and it was quiet and casual. From the neon lights and dark wood interior, we assumed it would be really loud and clubby when corwded, so we were happy to find plenty of open seats and took a long tour around the small bar before settling down in two high-backed arm chairs along the library wall.

We studied the menu and were enthralled by the literary inspirations for the drink names. She went for the Sherlock Holmes, and I ordered the (gin) punch. They were pretty... but they were really. quite. bad. The Sherlock Holmes tasted like medicine: maybe that's the birch beer? It had a strong bitter taste. Blech. And while my gin punch was not bitter, boy was it sweet: candy cloying sweet. Double blech. This was a HUGE letdown after all the hype.  Maybe it's just me, but I thought we ordered the most appetizing drinks on the menu (everything else sounded like a weird combo), so I'm really not interested in laying down more money to try something that will likely be even worse than what I tried last time.  The drink-making definitely does not match up to the hip interior.

I would give this place 2 stars, but the interior is really great and I might be willing to come back again if I ordered wine or beer.  It's another "scene" that doesn't deliver on drinks, but at least the scenery is easy on the eyes... I can imagine it could be quite popular for girls' night out since there are huge crystal chandeliers and cute seats. But now I understand why my husband was VERY meh after he came here with coworkers a few months ago. Work on your mixology!
author: Hannah C.

description:
Alright, there are only a few really good cocktail bars in SOMA is this is one of them. The only other place I think would give Novela a run for it's money is Local Edition right around the corner. 

I've been here about 6 times, once for happy hour after work, and then mostly late on weeknights or weekends. The crowd is pretty trendy, an interesting mix between the tech scene and the finance scene in SF. It's fancy and a little more upscale than other places in the area, without attracting the douchey types, so it's fine by me. 

The whole place is themed to be like a library, books line the walls and a room in the back that feels like a smaller study. If you can get past the crowds to the back, you'll be surprised to see there's another bar. Always check that back bar first since the line is almost always shorter.

To top it all off the drinks are named after some of your favorite characters like the Jay Gatsby or the Hellen Keller. Now maybe those names command a slight premium, you'll find most cocktails on the menu run you $10-12.
author: Brad M.

description:
is it cheating if I haven't really gone out a lot in the SF area? 

I did love the ambiance. Didn't get to try any of their specialty drinks -__- embarrassing i know.

It was walking distance from where we were staying, The Palace Hotel.
I would say everyone is in their 30s. Some people were really dressed up and some were casual. 

I'd be back :)
author: Jenny F.

description: This is the new 5a5, Jones, aka Asian hangout on Friday nights.  Not sure how I felt about that when I first walked in.  I had heard about this place for a couple of weeks and can see why it's popular - good location, good drinks and good sized venue.
author: Chris L.

description:
I give it a three star because they don't have snacks/food for happy hour. I was sad when I got there looking for food on the menu.

The only drink I would recommend is probably the Daisy Buchanan. Made perfectly delicious! Do not get the flight of punches! It's no beuno!
author: Annie H.

description: This place is nicely decorated and pret ff y nice overall...I do like the punch and house bourbon, little pricey but usually worth it
author: Aaron E.

description: Love this place.  Great original cocktails which are based on characters from your favorite books.  Definitely try the Christopher Robin for a refreshing gin cocktail.
author: Ryan B.

description:
High-level takeaways/observations:

1) This place is a sausage fest on Fridays (if not most nights), aka tons of thirsty guys who are too obviously and openly on the prowl for you ladies. You'll notice it right when you enter. 

2) Drinks are pretty watered/juiced down, so try opting for one of their "stronger" drinks like the Romeo Montague. 

3) Really cool library/lounge-y environment to catch up with friends

4) Lots of Asians. I don't mind it, and again it's just my general observation every time I've been there. I guess I add to that if you find me there. Heh!
author: Tiffany H.

description: This is a cute bar. Every drink is based off of a book which I think is very interesting. Drinks are tasty. Although I had 2 of the same drinks made by different bar tenders and they tasted different =(. Bartenders are very friendly. This bar is very busy but same goes for most other bars in sf right? I suggest making a reservation. Unless you want to stand. IF you order food. You need to get it at the bar as well.
author: Angelina N.

description:
Added the list is another good cocktail bar that everyone can enjoy.

You can dress up and dress down like either side of Market.

The decor is tasteful and nice, and the couch are large and comfy. 

Well made cocktail at $10 each is fair, beer during happy hour is cheaper.

Great HH place, just a little hard to hear each other as the acoustic are not the best.
author: Alice C.

description:
I was fully prepared to hate this place as some obnoxious FiDi annex best suited for neighborhood startups to host their app launch parties, but it was actually pretty great. The interior is nicely appointed, and the drinks are amazing. You can really taste the much-touted freshness of the ingredients.

Novela's also an unlikely bargain. A flight of three punches for $14 is pretty much three cocktails for $14. Some might consider them very slightly on the small side, but they... wait for it: pack a PUNCH. (Sorry for punning.) A flight for me and a cocktail for my lady friend only cost $26 and got us sufficiently buzzed.

Minor complaints: the noise, even if you're away from the bar, is trying. Our waitress must have been new because she neglected us and had to be reminded to bring the water we requested.

Pro tip: if you don't want to wait in line, and you know when you'll arrive, make a reservation via their website. It's easy, and if you do it early enough in the day, there are plenty of slots available.
author: Barry E.

description:
Cute drinks named after book characters. I tried the Daisy Buchanan (interesting, but not memorable) and Pippi Longstocking (fruity but weak). Initially I ordered a Sherlock Holmes but the bartender actually said "That's my least favorite drink to make," and convinced me to switch to Pippi. Not sure when it became acceptable for bartenders to complain about customer drink orders-- I ordered from the menu for crying out loud! In any case, I wasn't blown away by service.

The crowd here is full of FiDi people in their 20s. Nothing wrong with that, but it is way overcrowded (I went on a Saturday night). 

Points for the cute decor and innovative drink names, but I'm not a huge fan.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Atmosphere is nice but they charge you for buckets with ice cubes. Drinks are hardly to be found in your glass unless your looking for ice cubes.
author: Christian P.

description: Great place to meet up with friends. Tasty drinks. Docking one star for the music being toooo loud,  my throat hurt next morning from yelling over the music.
author: Tanya T.

description: What a fantastic place to hang out after work! Oyster Happy Hour Mondays in this literature lover's den is a must! The seats are so comfortable, drinks are great (and mad props for including Game of Thrones characters among the other book-named drinks), the books are real (and often signed!) and the music is fun and diverse (70's, 80's, 90's classics). I also saw a lot of tables reserved for larger groups so it seems like this would be a good spot for group functions. I will definitely be back.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Excellent. Love the setup and atmosphere of this place. Wandered here after an entire day of partying and needing a place to go that wouldn't charge cover like a club.

The line when we showed up was the length of the building. It moved quicker than I thought though: we got in within 25 minutes or so. If you haven't made a reservation, there's not too much space to sit, besides the long wooden table up front near the bar. It was good rest for my hiney!

We got 2 sets of punch, one a spicy tequila punch: boy this was spicy! Good though, very strong, and maybe not suited for some tastes. We also got another fruity punch.. that one got me quite drunk.

The restrooms are oh so fancy here, except for how the stalls are kind of randomly laid out. There's one room with 3 urinals, another that's for guys with one toilet, another unisex, and 2 female ones, all coming out of the same sink area. A bit confusing and hard to hold a place in line for.

I pulled a couple books off the shelves to look at them: I think I found Harry Potter and some Michael Crichton.

Music is kind of terrible though and not suited for dancing. But that's not really why I'm here.

The people here are pretty cool, I think there was some kind of... dressed all in white party going on? They wouldn't let us keep our Santa hats on though from Santa con. Meanies.
author: Michael W.

description: Niiiiiice.  Great upscale ambiance.  Uber trendy.  Delicious Old Fashioneds.     None of the bartender attitude you get at some upscale bars.  No bar stools and limited seating is about the worst thing I can say.  And for those that literate among us the books lining the walls are real!  One of my favorite bar destinations and so very close to the Marriott Marquis (which has a terrific bar on the 39th floor but is always overcrowded).
author: Allan S.

description: I appreciate the attention to detail in creating drinks that match their literary namesake's era and personality. Novela is a fun place for happy hour and gets really packed on a weekend night. Definitely worth checking out!
author: Vinitha R.

description:
Ambience is definitely the focus here but they do it well. There are lots of fancy drinks, prices are up there but not too high. The people are generally pretty dressed up, but it seemed totally cool to show up in a t-shirt. The walls are lined with novels (and I'm pretty sure a few novelas as well) and there are birch logs underneath the bookshelves, although I have no idea why. 
I would definitely recommend it if you're looking for a fancier place to grab a few drinks. Great for an after work wind down (or wind up!)
author: Sam W.

description: Out visiting San Fran on on a Sunday night. Rolled up at 8pm local time. The J Gatsby and house punch are beyond strong. Attentiveness of staff leave something to be desired, but in terms of strength and quality of drinks, novela exceeds. While I may not return, it was a good experience all things considered (being a Sunday night).
author: Brandon J.

description: Novela is hands-down my favorite  bar in the city. First off the books which line the walls are real, which shows how much dedication was put into the business. Second (and more importantly) the drinks are incredible, but also seasonal. You may not find your favorite drink year-round, but the replacements will be just as worth trying!
author: Irina P.

description:
This is a message to the owner of Novela:

Are you tired of running a failing club? At 9pm on a Saturday night, is it completely dead? Are you seeing your dreams of success go up in smoke?

I want to help you. I like good places to get a cocktail. The cocktails are good. The decor is sweet. 

The service? Dog shit fucking awful.

I'm sitting there with my girlfriend for 15 minutes and not a single server has talked to us. Are they all on smoke breaks? No. They're comparing bikini tans. Seriously. 

I go to the bar. One bartender is telling another about a dream he had where he fell into a circus train. The gentleman next to me sat patiently. We nodded to each other. He was hoping not to be impolite I suppose; you wouldn't want to inconvenience the bartender with your order or anything so he continued sitting idly. 

There was thankfully one bartender on point. He was very helpful despite his unmotivated compadres. Served up some nice drinks too, despite my verbal displeasure with the service. 

Anyway, save your bar, fire the turds, and lets make this thing happen.
author: David D.

description:
This is a very very beautiful place and I love being here, but the flights were only disappointing - bitter herb-y with artificial syrup taste. It is a risk to take when you order flights of punch I guess! 

As for the crowd, overall I like that it's a really good mix of people. They added to the line up of books against the walls and the fun lighting.
author: E K.

description: Came here for a happy hour with some old co-workers on Thursday for the first time.  This place was really cool!  Very trendy and upbeat.  Drinks were strong, a little pricey but of course you expect that in downtown.  Majority of the crowd is dressy with a few casual folks, but most are stopping by after work.  I would definitely come back, great venue to grab a few drinks.
author: Mike M.

description: Great atmosphere and drinks!! Great bartenders had fun during NYE and loved the prohibition feel! My boyfriend and I dressed up via Gatsby style and so did the rest of the crowd!! A must!
author: Gabriela W.

description: Went with a group last night.  Our waitress seemed upset with the world.  We thought it was just us; until the group next to us commented they were leaving because the service was crappy.  She was a blonde with a pixie haircut.  The other waitress was nice when we asked for another round of drinks.  Music was too loud considering it's not a dance club.
author: Lisa K.

description:
I've passed this place a few times on a weekday and it always look popping. It was really packed Saturday night, I took somebody's yelp advice and went to the bar in the back, and it took me probably 4 hours to get a drink (kidding, but it took ridiculously long). The bartender was pretty slow and she climbed up the back bar to grab liquor from a high shelf which is unprofessional, but it was kind of cute. I ordered a Mary Poppins and it was pretty good, but I tried my friend's Ichabod Crane and that was even better! 

Bathrooms are somewhat unisex. Stalls are pretty nice. The overall decor of this place is beautiful, I was really surprised that when I picked out a book from the shelf that it was a real book! I got pretty lucky and was able to grab a seat and table. 

I felt slightly underdressed coming here, since I saw guys wearing business suits and girls wearing nice dresses and heels. The crowd here is mid to late 20s mostly I think, so I felt pretty young. The music selection was pretty random too, I recall a Journey song, but you can barely hear the music anyways since the sound of people chatting is really loud.

Overall this place has a nice ambiance and good drinks!
author: Karen D.

description:
Nothing like a chic and tastefully decorated bar in Soma.
This place had a great feel and of course the location is wonderful (minus the parking situation but its sf)

Def. coming back!
author: Yas G.

description: Like many bars in SF, Novela would be easy to walk passed without noticing as the entrance is small and unassuming. My friend who lives in the area recommended we stop in for a quick pre-dinner drink on a Wednesday night when it was only mildly full. The interior was absolutely adorable. This is one of those bars that I could comfortably stay at for a fun evening. The bar room is lit by pretty chandeliers dispersed throughout the room and books line the wall of the interior and are color coded with lights shining on the shelves to allow the colors of the books to shine brightly. The floors are black and white tiled and the entire scene makes you feel like you're in a 1920's movie which is appropriate as the names of the drinks are inspired by famous literary authors of that era. What makes this bar so comfortable to spend a good deal of time is is how spacious it is. Tables and chairs aren't squeezed into any open slot so that the integrity of the space is kept. They have a long U-shaped bar, lots of bigger tables and couches for bigger parties and two person tables as well on the outskirts of the bar. My friend and I had a bit of trouble initially finding seats so we ordered standing up at the bar. We both went for the Vianne Rocher which was an interesting vodka-based drink with passion fruit. Every sip ended with what tasted like a bit of chili powder. I could never quite get used to the taste but I enjoyed the atmosphere so much that it compensated for the drink. Once a table opened up one of the nice waitstaff let us know about it and we stayed for a while and did some people watching and dog watching - dogs were allowed in - before heading off to dinner. I'd happily return to try some of their other drinks and enjoy the music and beautiful interior of the bar.
author: Julie H.

description:
I've always preferred going out for drinks at around 7-9PM on an average day.  I had to meet a friend at Novela around 10:30 PM on a Sunday.  I wasn't sure how the scene was going to be but I did keep in mind that this place closes earlier on Sundays (last call was before 12).  The lounge was not at all crowded so I was able to be served drinks quickly.  I tried a couple cocktails (one fruity and one "stiff" drink).  I preferred the fruity drink even though I'm not much of a "lady cocktail" consumer.  it simply had a better flavor - sweet and a touch of thyme.  I then tried 3 flights.  The bartender said he'd remake the drinks if they weren't satisfactory.  They were OK, nothing outstanding, but for $14 I didn't think I'd bother having any of them remade.  Even the one that reminded my bf of ginseng but reminded me of stale socks was tolerable.  *glug glug* Waterfall.  I'm good.

I'd recommend Novela because it's clean, spacious, and accessible.  I'm not sure if it's my favorite spot for drinks but it's by no means sub-par.
author: Amber R.

description: A beautiful bar, went with people from out of town and they thought it was great. Had the "sample size" punch great way to try multiple drinks.
author: Cris S.

description: If you like waiting a month for your drinks to arrive this is your place. I am sorry I am a simple man with simple drink orders. I went early in the evening as in 4:30 the place was dead but waited forever. My wife did like the drink that had some kinda infused vodka. But good lord son just pour the drink, you shaking the drink for ten minutes did nothing. Good but slow
author: Bob U.

description: Overswanky, overpriced techie bar. Not my scene but if you love the whole 20somethingtechhipsterindie vibe, it'll probably blow you away.
author: Cecilia A.

description: The cocktails, food and space are soooooo great but the place is sooooooooooooo loud that you cannot hear a goddamn thing anyone is saying to you unless they have their lips pressed against your ear and they are screaming. The insane noise issue might be resolved if they didn't play music soooo loud and didn't cram so many people in but these are among the best cocktails I have ever had in SF.  They have seasonal cocktails and it sucks when they have new waiters who won't get you a drink that is no longer on the seasonal menu--like this one drink they made out of muddled grapes that I had 4 of in one setting but the classic cocktails that never get rotated out are also really good.There's one with carrot juice called the Christopher Robin that's sooooooooooo good and you can pretend like it's healthy because of the carrots.  Food is good too the shrimp and avocado toast, deviled eggs and tacos in particular!
author: Free P.

description: This place is a nice spot to hang out after work or even for a nice date.  The spot has tons of room and is nicely located in the financial district. The one thing I loved is that they had a key legend to denote which drinks were still and which were fruity. This let me choose the best drink for me. And the drink I got was definitely very still and gave me a good buzz with just 1 drink (Atticus Finch).  The decor goes with the book themes as the name of the lounge suggests. Everything about this place oozes out coolness.
author: Norman C.

description: Favorite new bar and my new go-to spot for drinks with friends or a date. The ambiance is classy, love the walls of books, and the drinks are great. Only downside is waiting in line to get drinks, which can take awhile (if you're a guy ;)
author: Alex H.

description:
Very cool well designed bar.  Good flow and lots of nice bar space.  Loungy seating in the front.  Good crowd and they know how to make drinks.
Good for groups or a cozy couple.
author: Ric S.

description: Great HH spot! Especially if you work in the financial district.. The drinks are swanky, the bartenders are friendly and the place is super hip... Nuff said..
author: Monica S.

description: Old fashioned + any other scotch/whiskey/bourbon is perfect here. Great ambience and it never seems to be overly busy, which is always a plus.
author: Akshay B.

description: Was assaulted by security as a taxi driver falsely accused me of owing him 3 dollars -I wasn't even in the bar or going there they came outside - just goons looking for something to do
author: chandler s.

description: The punches are all delicious and the waitress was super cute.  But the music is SO loud and after 5:30 the whole place is filled with nerds wearing Google glasses.  All I could hear in my head was a cacophony of terrible music and "Peacock.  Peacock.  Peacock.....OK Peacock".  That's the kind of crowd a place like this will attract, I probably shouldn't mock.  They had no small bites of any sort, and in order to get a seat you have to make a reservation - three star for the ability to make a reservation though!  That's about all I have to say about this.
author: Cori D.

description:
It is a very nice place for cocktails.

Great for chatting/hanging out/happy hour.
author: Moto B.

description: Super cute spot. Love libraries, love cocktails. The hemingway punch was definitely the best, and everrrrryone was jealous they didn't make that choice themselves. It gets crazy crowded though, since people seem to have discovered this hot little bar in soma. Purrfect for a drink after work.
author: Vivian H.

description: Bar is pricey but u will get good service . And bartender from Mexico City is very nice and friendly. Thanks. Want to come back again
author: Daria I.

description: This is one of our favorite places for happy hour! Very strong and yummy cocktails, great atmosphere and people. Things to note: no seats unless you come early or reserve, no food served so come full, service gets slow when busy. But there is a food truck (MeSoHungry) outside on Thursdays; they take cash and cards; very friendly staff.
author: Uma M.

description: I absolutely love this place. If you want a cool glam place to sit and enjoy artisan cocktails, I highly recommend Novela. Recently they started having $1 oysters which makes it even better. Definitely one of my favorite places in sf to grab drinks!
author: YL B.

description: I like books and I love Novela. First of all the interior is beautiful. I like the floor plan and that it is spacious. The seats by the windows are good for people watching on Mission street. Those comfy chairs by the bookcases are good for relaxing and taking in a good scotch or bourbon. I love the drink concoctions and literary names. Novela also has good events, like the World Cup viewing party and the 49ers viewing parties. This is my classy spot in downtown for drinks.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
Great atmosphere and ambiance.  

The Atticus Finch is a good drink - nice and spicy.
author: Alan T.

description: One of my favorite bar/lounges in SF. Great ambiance and great service/drinks.
author: G K.

description:
How have I not reviewed Novela yet?

I came out for Novela's opening a few months back, and it's a great case study in a bar that developed a cult following within minutes. Everyone I know loves the colored library theme, and best of all, they're real! Take one off the shelf and get lost in Great Expectations while you sip your cocktail. Speaking of cocktails, the three-whiskey punch is what it's most famous for, and with good reason. They do run out on busy nights, and it's a little on the strong and bitter side for something that's pink, so order with...proper expectations. (See what I did there?)

The back bar is typically reserved for private parties, and weekends can get pretty packed in here. Try it out midweek if you like a calmer scene, but I haven't taken anyone there who hasn't loved it.
author: Kevin B.

description: Great vibes! Love the crowds it at tracks, young professionals! The music is good and the staff is fairly nice. Expensive drinks, better to come hammered before hand... Their Jameson shots are $9 each.. Really? A bottle is worth 3 shots.. But I guess you pay for the ambiance.
author: Justin B.

description:
Came here on a friday for some happy hour with a friend. The place is nice but it get's really packed around 6pm. My friend and I were lucky enough to get some stools near the communal table and stayed there for a while. If you don't want to be standing all night then I suggest coming early or hover around people who are sitting and look like they are about to finish. This place is known for the punch and I have to say that it was pretty tasty. 

The atmosphere was nice and the place is classy so coming here looking like a bum is going to make you feel pretty out of place FYI.
author: edward k.

description: Kudos to the owner (or whoever is responsible) for the fantastic design concept of this bar. Its swanky, interesting, and who doesn't love perusing shelves of books. The drinks were good (not the best in the city) but good, and I loved the whole nerdy book character concept of the drinks. As many bars around this area, the crowd veered towards douche (bummer) so we may be hard pressed to return. I could also see this place turning into a cluster come Friday night, seeing that servers seemed to be MIA (or avoiding us like the plague) so we had to stand in line at the bar for libations. If you're in the area its worth checking out, just not sure its worth driving out of your way for.
author: Ritu K.

description: This place has a cool concept. All the drinks are named after characters in famous novels. Also the decor has shelves with neon colored books. There are two bars here. Our waitress was very friendly. The drink I had was the Santiago. The waitress did mention the punch was good as well, but I didn't get a chance to try it.
author: Lisa T.

description:
I love a good place that gives a nod to the literary nerd (but oh how I cringe at the arrangement of books, great idea but how would one ever find a book?! AND IS THE CARD CATALOG ACTIVE?!). Sorry, it needed to be said. 

Aside, I think it's cute and while I could be saying that because the cocktails are named after literary figures and I'm officially in love with the Leopold Bloom and Holly Golightly, this place fills up fast. Then the service slows down and then all of a sudden you're sitting there wondering why all 5 of your friends got served so quickly at the bar when you placed an order for 3 drinks 15 minutes before they even walked in. Love the place but it's not without it's minor issues but they are the same as any popular bar in the area.
author: Shauna S.

description: My friend and I have planned to come out here for a while and finally stopped by on a friday night. it wasnt so busy when we got in but later it got the more people came in! pretty hard to find a seat due to alot of tables being reserved but we eventually found a couple chairs. i usually dont order mixed cocktails but everytime i go to a new spot i end up trying their specials. we ordered the Emma Woodhouse and Scarlett O'Hara. i thought both were really good, not too sweet. The library theme i thought was brilliant, the lighting was nice too. Im from Sacramento and i will make sure to visit this place again and maybe order that famous punch!
author: Christian D.

description: Books and colored lights aside, the drinks are great here.  Make a reservation and drink in style.  Especially love the cocktail names.
author: Patrick S.

description:
I heard sooo many good things about this place and had to check it out for myself! 

Came here to catch up with some old friends and good thing we did because 7x7 was throwing an event. I booked a table 30mins before arrival, super easy and they even called/texted me to confirm. Arrived on time, got my table and waited for my friends. This place started to get packed within a few mins. Lemme just say the decor of this place is super trendy. There's colorful bookshelves lights all around and swanky chairs, the crowd was very "yuppies" that night. But that's what you get for happy hour in the FiDi/SoMa area so it wasn't bad at all. Also, all the hostesses were female and super sweet! 

Anywhoo, I ordered a mojito which was good but too sweet for my liking. We wanted to order food but I guess they don't offer that yet (hope it's coming soon)....But Luckily, 7x7 was hosting an event, so caterers were coming out of no where with platter of tiny fries, sliders, and cocktails. They were super nice and it was all free (kudos to that). 

Also, Ploom vaporizers and gals were coming around asking people to demo their tobacco which was Awesome! I loved it and might possibly buy one. I tried the peach tobacco flavor (MMmmm!). 

Overall, a great experience at Novela. I would definitely like to check out this place again without an event to see if it's lively!
author: Julia K.

description: This place is all style and no substance. If you want to drink mediocre cocktails with a bunch of normal people in an atmosphere that can't seem to decide between old school and appletini, this is your place. Everyone in our party of five was disappointed with his or her drink, except the guy who ordered straight rye whiskey.
author: Chris C.

description: had a fabulous time here at my friend's bachelorette party! we didn't get to sit on the pretty side with the rainbow uplights and books but it was nice cuz we got our own tables and seats and only two of us had to sit on the table! we got a round of shots and got sufficiently plastered. the frequenters are mostly asian and look suuuuper young. made us feel old. service was given with a smile and good. bathrooms are co-ed but nice and clean.
author: Jan Y.

description: Celebrated my birthday here and it was everyone's first experience at Novela. Definitely upscale but everyone loved the drinks and the atmosphere! A little on the louder side compared to similar places like Local Edition but it was very fun! Drinks were tasty and not "girly" as many male guests feared. All in all a good place for a group or celebration.
author: Sameen F.

description: I had contacted Novela 1.5 days before I was told to plan an event for 25 people coming into town for a meeting! Can you say stressed out?!  But I found Novela on yelp and called spoke with Seana  who was fabulous! She worked with me on such short notice and we were able to pull off the event seamlessly.  Venue is beautiful and the whole thing was a hit. I highly recommend this venue for corporate events in the FiDi area- would happily call them again for any future event I am planning.
author: Tina K.

description: Awesome atmosphere, delicious spirit drinks, and bomb Hummus and Pita Bread!
author: Jesse M.

description: I love the decor and ambiance of this cocktail joint, evoking the souls of our literary giants and fictional characters. Although I consider myself more of a Holly  Golightly, the Daisy Buchanan cocktail was divine. I hope they rotate menus around so we can taste all the wonderful characters!
author: Shakti P.

description: Twas the last day of my job (sad to leave but happy to go) - What do you and a bunch of your girls do??! YOU FREAKING GO CELEBRATE THE START OF A NEW BEGINNING and of course, it has to be at a new bar we've never been to. Knowing how OBSESSED I am with the whole Great Gatsby thing (sadly, there was a new menu already.. *tears) we decided to come here. Our server was extremely nice and even allowed us to have samples of the punches before we actually ordered. My favorite was the pisco and the gin-sake! Both were very refreshing and absolutely tasty! You really can't taste all that nastayyyyy alochol and it gets you feeling a good buzz. I just wish there was less ice in the punch - felt like the drink got watered down. Overall, had a good girl's night out with delicious drinks!
author: Betty P.

description: Novela is a beautiful bar. The moment I stepped in, I knew I wouldn't want to leave. The interior is lined with shelves of books, lit from below by rainbow lights. The seats are plush and mesh perfectly with the rest of the spacious bar. And their drinks! Their drinks are named after famous characters from classic novels. I had the Veruca Salt, which is made with apricot-infused mezcal and some other fruity notes. I tried some of my friend's Christopher Robin, a carrot juice and gingery drink. Overall, we had a great time at Novela. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because the bartender was snooty when we asked her if she had anything special for my friend's 21st birthday. I'm sorry you're "not that kind of bar".
author: Anna N.

description: Great place, swanky and very cool atmosphere. Service is alright, pretty hard to handle when it gets crowded. Got the Hemingway's punch in a pitcher and it's pretty worth it - despite the overwhelming amount of ice. Seating is comfortable, make a reservation to get a guaranteed seat though. As far as lounges go, this place is pretty amazing with great seating and tasteful lighting. Definitely recommend, it is a little upscale so the cocktails and such are pricier at $12 or so.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I was walking a colleague back to her hotel room when we passed this place that I had never heard of.  It was buzzing inside and had a nice little speakeasy feel so we decided to have a couple of drinks.

The cocktail list is inventive and there are some very nice bottles on the shelves.  We had two drinks and both were good.

The place was filled with what seemed like a mix of locals and out of town folks on business trips due to the proximity to so many hotels.  I'm sure if your office is in the area and you are looking for cocktails after work you would be very happy here.

The bartender was helpful and informative and the place is large and comfortable.

All in all, a very nice bar if you are in the area.
author: Fred S.

description: 11/19/14 10:42pm. The establishment is beautiful. Never again! Our cocktail waitress (blond bimbo with fried bleached hair) was the worst ever.  She was not liking her job and had the ugliest attitude. She obviously hates serving people. We had to ask her 3 times to take our order.  When she finally took our order it took 22 minutes (I timed her) to get our drinks and 2 out of 6 we're wrong. We told her that 2 we're wrong and she rolled her eyes.  She finally came and brought the 2 correct drinks 9 minutes later.  I thanked her and then she didn't reply and rolled her eyes once again.  Now.... This is when I was done with her and the establishment. Be warned!   This place sucks!!! I will get the word out to all my colleagues!
author: Jay S.

description: Love this place. It's very intimate and fun for a date. The charcuterie and cheese platter are delicious!
author: La Tache T.

description: Beautiful and live ambience. We went there on New Year's Eve earlier but they were closed, bummer. Finally made it on Hubby's birthday. The drinks are hand crafted. Simple and easy menu. Good snacking choices. The seats are comfortable. The only weird part was that we were standing at the bar for full 5 mins before we were asked for the order. Bar tender was busy cleaning glasses or something. But other than that, we had fun.
author: Madhuri D.

description: My new favorite hang out spot. Love this place! Very dressy and upscale. I will be back very soon. Drinks are very tasty, the Ophelia was sweet and delicious.
author: Carrie Y.

description: hands down one of the classier happy hour locations in San Francisco. It has great cocktails, a good vibe, and a good looking crowd. There isnt much more that you can ask for when it comes to choosing a place to grab happy hour with your co workers or where to take a date for a late night drink after dinner.  Also heard they have oysters on monday nights which I have to check out being a huge oyster fan!
author: Dmitriy G.

description: Sexy interior and lighting, doesn't take forever to get a drink, not overly crowded, and yummy cocktails. I LIKE!
author: Diana K.

description: Trendy but definitely fun. Not sure if this is an Asian bar but the other night it was about 80% Asian. Decor is nothing impressive especially in SF but it is more than nice. The bar is small but seems spacious. Service was friendly and drinks were good.
author: Binh D.

description: This is not your sticky counter, tacky burn out bar scene--Novela's literary themed lounge has a Gatsby-ish library feel and all was right with a few delicious Miss Money Pennies!
author: MissM R.

description:
I was really excited to check this place out, went with a group of friends on a Friday night. The line was ok, but it wasn't very packed inside. There were tables and sofas available at 11pm.

Bartenders were friendly (nicer than Local Edition)

friends and I tried the following:

Sherlock Holmes: like a pisco, really good a bit sour but good 
Jay Gatsby: a manly drink, if I had taken another sip I'd be on the floor!
The Helen Keller: I thought I was drinking a cocktail, but it was a blend of juices hahahaha really good would try it again!

Ok now the Santiago, oh boy. it tasted like charcoal. enough said.

I love the decor and music, would love to go back!
author: Kiran J.

description: This is my go to spot for both happy hours as well as the weekends.  I moved from NYC, and can honestly say this is one of the only places in SF that gives me that NYC like sophisticated and high-end feel I miss so much.  The only thing that beats the decor and crowd, is the drinks! They're amazing and better than any run of the mill Mixology place you seem to see everywhere these days...every time I go I try a new one and love it (but you have to try their selection of punches).
author: Sebastian Z.

description: I've been coming to Novela ever since they opened last year and the place just keeps getting better. They have seasonal drinks which are amazing. Currently their Gin sake drink is a must try! The decor is gorgeous with their novel lined shelves and sexy wall paper. The bartenders are friendly and the servers attentive, even during busier hours. If you want an classy place to meet friends with amazing drinks and a great ambiance, Novela is the perfect spot.
author: Trinity K.

description: I just went to this spot for the first time and I loved the entire look and feel. The drinks and staff we're amazing.
author: Marisa H.

description:
This place had the weirdest atmosphere...rock music then country music? mixed with upscale faux library decor? very confusing. 

Good table service. Servers were nice. Flights of punches were good to share as they were very sweet. Friends enjoyed the Jay Gatsby.

I probably wouldn't return based on the atmosphere.
author: M L.

description: Novela is nice in concept in quite good in terms of location as the area is lacking a good cocktail bar. That being said it has a less than perfect place most times I've been.  The cocktails are pricey but id stick with just the classics. Gets way too crowded for the staff to handle at times as well. Good spot if you're looking for a lovely cocktail spot with a more refined atmosphere / decor.
author: Milan T.

description:
I recently tried to hold a meetup here. I had called and emailed and did not hear back. We still went anyway, there were 16 of us. Unfortunately there were two other parties there and the place was way over crowded and too loud, had I known that would have been the case, I would have taken my 16 girls elsewhere. 

The hostess was apologetic but that didn't really help our predicament. And since it was the night of the final NBA game it was a super duper pain in the arse to find another spot for us to go. 

That being said, the drinks were DELICIOUS. I tried several punches and they were all fantastic. A few of the girls got mixed drinks that I of course demanded to try and they were grand, as well. The servers were quick, good looking, professional. 

Besides the lack of communication which I chalk up to it being am unexpectedly popular place in such a short amount of time, my only other criticism would be the lack of happy hour and the price of drinks. Take it down a couple bucks. (=
author: Dee H.

description: Loved the cocktail selection and the decor, a really fun bar. 3 stars for two reasons: First a waitress was serving us (decently enough) then decided that her reserved seating was filled so that she would stop serving the high tables... fine, but she kept our card and never told anyone she wasn't coming back, 0 communication. It took an hour to get our cards back because no one could find her/knew what she did with them. Second, we head to the bar to get drinks and it took 20-30 min each time. I'm not exaggerating, it was ridiculous.
author: Melanie M.

description: The lounge is pretty alright. I don't really get the decor, but it looks good. Large enough space to actually lounge, and some bartenders here are really good. Can be crowded on a weekend night..I prefer a weekday.
author: Ali H.

description:
The decor in this bar is fantastic! A color coordinated library of books covers one entire wall.
The bar features a number of seasonal punches, including the one that I had with pisco as the base. It was delicious. I'll definitely be back here soon.
author: Teryll H.

description:
Went to the Grand Opening yesterday and what a transformation Novela has undergone.  I can't believe I used to go to this place back when it was Fluid!  The ambiance and decor is great.  I love the details and attention they paid to the smallest of things.  The lighting, the books, the wallpaper, is all beautiful.  When you see the books on the bookshelves, it may look as though the lighting is coloring the books but look closely and you'll notice that the book themselves are colored and the lighting is highlighting the colors.  The clear see-through bar with the colored lighting is also a nice touch.  With plenty of seating throughout, I could definitely see this as a go-to happy hour location.

Unfortunately, as it was the grand opening, the drink orders took forever.  It didn't look like they had a soda gun and my vodka tonic tasted different...  I shared a punch pitcher with some friends and that was a little too sweet for our taste buds (tequila).  I don't believe they have any fresh juices and only syrup flavors so my greyhound was very different to what I am accustomed to as well.

They serve food but didn't have a chance to try that; I'm sure I'll be back in the near future.
author: FrancEs K.

description: I'm glad I didn't stand in line too long for this place. For a place that was so overly hyped, wasn't really sure what the hype was about. Nice decor though.
author: Diana Y.

description: Very cool lounge.  The  drinks are super yummy!!!  I like the vibe here.  The wait staff was very attentive.  We tipped her extra for being so nice!!
author: Jane P.

description: Came here to meet an investment group from China. Great place to meet, chat, and chill.
author: Johnson H.

description: Beautiful lounge, very swanky! The place was pretty packed and it was incredibly loud. Not because of the music, but probably because everyone speaking over each other. My friends and I grabbed a table near the bar, which is nicely decorated. Drinks were good - not a shots kind of place, but more for cocktails so I decided to be a big girl and got the punch. Haha
author: Jackie M.

description: I came back here and tried the Moneypenny. That's a great girly drink if you're into sweet (but not sickeningly so) drinks!
author: Aditi J.

description: Delicious drinks, beautiful space, but too few bartenders and too little noise dampening. Couldn't hear my friend less than a half foot away. Bad for dates, good for booty calls, I guess. Or your in-laws. Or the RNC. Really any circumstance where NOT hearing your companion is a positive.
author: Vivienne P.

description:
Dear Novela, 

It's a Saturday night. It's packed. You're a boutique bar serving 'mixology' drinks to willing customers like us at $18 a pop. No issues there. My writing you is to address something every food and beverage establishment should lay out to staff before opening doors and that is keep things classy and leave egos at home. Friend orders a vodka soda. You do not stock the mainstream brand and so you substitute with an organic vodka. Drink arrives and tastes not as strong, somewhat watered down. We ask the bartender, an Asian male managing the bar in the backroom, 5'8" tanned, tatted neck, spiked hair, whether he could sample the drink served and tell us if it's that way or needs more vodka. He looks at us as if we don't know how the drink is served, felt insulted  then whispers something to his two sous mixologists and the 3 avoid us like the plague for the entire 30mins of standing there. Finally when the crowd dissipates the younger of the staff explains that the drinks are measured and they can't do anything about it. Again not willing to sample the drink. Meanwhile said Asian bartender is topping off other friend's drinks while looking at us. Did we not tip $4 to an $19 drink? All we wanted was an explanation. Apparently not only do your cocktails have character but your waitstaff too. 

- Disappointed.
author: Everett C.

description: WAY TOO CROWDED! Are you supposed to wait till someone gets your drink order or go up to the bar? I was a little confused. The drinks were great and it def had a trendy/lounge atmosphere which I was diggin but the noise level was CRAZY! haha I wasnt drunk enough for this place.
author: Brittini S.

description:
Pretty reasonably priced drinks given the upscalish ambiance of the place and the mixology type alcoholic beverages. 

As a scotch lover, I enjoyed the Jay Gatsby.  

As a fruity drink, I liked Miss Moneypenny.
author: Victor T.

description: Punch on tap way too sweet but cool ambiance. Enjoyed the books.
author: Briana B.

description: Novela is a really cool place to grab a hand crafted, mixology forward drink. With that said, yes it is more pricey for that drink but hello... you're in the financial district and the cocktails are above average. The place gets crowded and has a strong lounge feel to it. The decor is what brought me here but the drinks have made me a return customer all the way from Walnut Creek. Being a lover of books and booze, you can't go wrong with Novela!
author: Heather M.

description: Cool place, great atmosphere. Not all bartenders are not the best when it comes to attitude, but they make good drinks so meh. Good spot to hit in Friday or Saturday.
author: Heidi L.

description: Great place for happy hours, good drinks and good ambiance - filled with books
author: Astha S.

description:
Trendy new after-work spot. Came here with a bunch of coworkers to celebrate promotions and whatnot. 

It's extremely busy (at least for the moment) - not a whole lot of available space. Cool literary theme that covers both the neat decor and the drink menu.
author: Robert K.

description: Love this place! Ask for Suzanne. Best cocktails you will ever have. She is scientific about all the drinks she makes and is super acknowledgeable about all the options at Novela
author: Caroline M.

description: Lovely lovey decor!!! Very cool SOMA bar with refreshing delicious drinks named after book characters.  My husband and I stopped by after work on a Friday and most the tables were taken but I did notice tons of empty tables with "reserved" signs on them. I'm not really sure what that was about but we didn't bother to ask since we grabbed a table as someone was leaving.  Service here is good and the bartenders are very knowledgeable, we got a history lesson on whisky during prohibition which was fun.  I'll definitely be back, maybe next time with some girlfriends or a few co-workers.
author: Shondra G.

description: This is a super swanky bar that makes you feel like you've been transported to another world, especially with all the literature themed decor and drinks! I loved it! Their drink menu can be overwhelming since all the drinks look so good, but the bartenders there were really helpful and knowledgeable. The bartender that helped me, I think his name was Josh, helped me find the perfect drink for my tastes. He made me the best Alexander Supertramp!  and I ended up drinking it all night. I'll definitely be back. Great service, superb atmosphere, just what I like for having a relaxing night with my friends.
author: Ilana R.

description:
Last night was my first visit to Novela and I will definitely be back.

First, and most importantly, I want to comment on the service.  This establishment was very busy, but the service didn't miss a beat.  My bartender, Josh, was quick, efficient, and most importantly attentive.  I didn't have to wait long at all for drinks, and every drink I ordered was a well crafted cocktail that was very well priced.

Second, the ambience.  This establishment provided a very high-end, relaxed feel at very reasonable prices.  Novela is a great place to enjoy a few cocktails, hang out with friends, and meet new people.  It attracts a diverse clientele and provides for a very enjoyable atmosphere.  The decor gives this establishment a unique personality of its own creating an experience that you don't get at your typical "bar".

This will definitely be a regular spot for me!
author: Chris E.

description:
This is my first review, and unfortunately its a negative one. There are a few things anyone wants in a good bar:

1. Ambiance: Novela had a great ambiance. I really liked the library theme and the decor. I also liked how it wasn't so loud that I couldn't talk to the other people in my group. This is where the positives end. 
2. Service: The bartenders were rude to multiple people in our group. I asked one bartender if they served off the cocktail menu the entire night and her snappy answer was just that "this is the cocktail menu," as if I didn't know that already. See below for another example of how they were rude. 
3. Drinks: Their drinks were sub-par at best. Their flavors were too strong and didn't blend well with the alcohols. The Salvatore Paradise was far too smokey and when a friend of mine asked to change it, the bartender said "we don't waste alcohol" and just added some soda water to it for her. She ended up throwing out the overpriced drink ($12). I got the Daisy Buchanan for $14 which was far too sweet for my taste and had a tangy aftertaste. I had to force myself to finish it because I couldn't imagine wasting that money. 

In the end the only reason I had a somewhat good time was the fact that I had awesome company, but none of us would ever return to this place again. There are far too many good bars with much better service to waste our time on overpriced drinks here.
author: Nayna L.

description:
you know how every great nba team has a big 3?  novela has them too - josh, ernson, and ulysses (not sure if it's spelled correctly).  these three dudes...amazing bartenders.  their drinks are always consistent with speedy friendly service (given this is a craft cocktails sort of place).  when it's slow an they have time, they'll always ask genuinely, "how's it going?"  

you can go to local edition...but you won't get the same service and tasty drinks they offer at novela.  if i were you, i'd go here.  where else can you get an amazing old fashioned made by THE big 3?
author: Daniel M.

description: deducted 1 star because the drinks were a little pricey. I'll definitely be back even though there are so many other choices nearby. Nothing in particular stands out but that's only because there are some many equally great options just steps away from this place. Great for a date night cocktail or catching up with coworkers too. Which was the reason for my first visit.
author: Angelica M.

description: Very unique craft cocktails here.  Its a bar, no loud music.  Walls are decorated with lots of books... can get your smart on while you drink!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
The theme of the place is a library. It is a hybrid of modern-speakeasy ambience.  If you are the kinds who likes to have a table and have a nice relaxing conversation without too much shouting this place may not be with you. However, you can reserve a table before hand and the place has a very good energy which is good for a place like this.
We had a few cocktails suggested by the bartenders(gin sake punch, old fashioned to name a few) and on the whole none of them were bad. They ranged from decent to very good.  
The place can get pretty crowded on weekends and it may take forever to get your drinks after this. This was one bad thing here!!But that is the problem with most places like this. So I am not complaining.

Overall it is a nice place to go for a few nice cocktails with a group of friends and get on to a good level as the alcohol level is decently high!!
author: shreyas c.

description: Best bar in SoMa! The Dr Gonzo cocktail is the way to go... super friendly staff, Courtney was our server the first time we went in, she made us feel super welcome. Also a great food truck outside that has sliders and sweet potato fries. We'll definitely be coming back.
author: Eli P.

description: Great atmosphere, decor, and vibe. It's a little older crowd if that's what you are looking for. Great for happy hour or a mellow weekend night out.
author: M M.

description: Came here on a Saturday night. Decent crowd, tasty drinks. Chique atmosphere and open space. Retro decor with a library/study theme. I do want to check out their event nights!
author: Zara S.

description: Wandered in here after a Giants game last season & it quickly became one of my favorite bars in the city. The decor is awesome and I loved the laid back but classy ambiance. The drinks were yummy and the bartenders were great, especially Josh. Hit it up next time you're around the area! Worth a trip for sure.
author: Leah H.

description: Very nice lounge bar, great drinks and friendly service. I think the bartender's name is Josh, this man makes a mean drink.
author: Pete P.

description: Great atmosphere, incredible drinks and a very good time. SF is loaded with bars but there are few where you can get a good deal, fantastic service and have some wiggle room. The bartenders were polite, attentive and more willing than most to make drink recommendations and suggest other fun places to explore. I had the best Moscow mule ever made there by Josh, one of the more lively bartenders in the city. I highly recommend swinging by for a drink'
author: Nikita O.

description:
Novela! I tried so hard and so often to love you! But your horrific customer service keeps pushing me away.

I can forgive random, frequent closures for private events, though these always seem to happen on nights I've made my way to your door. Argh.

And the one punch I was able to try due to slow service was indeed delicious! I appreciated the fresh-grated nutmeg on top. It was funny how you had your music so loud that the bartender couldn't hear our orders, though. Why hobble your own staff? 

I tried to bring a group to you, Novela. I emailed you and talked with Irina about my options. Make a reservation through the website, she said, and I did. But only 5 days beforehand I read through your email newsletter that you're closed that night! You did not call to tell me that my reservation for 10 was canceled. You barely apologized on the phone. You owe your customers proactive service when canceling their reservations. 

Know what else is disappointing? The nominal literary theme doesn't extend to proofing your own menus-- the misspelled "Holy Golightly" drink was on your menus for months. It's the little things. 

I cannot love you. I tried. I'm done.
author: Maddie G.

description:
Bravo on looks -- I like it.  It is spacious, found a good use of books and wood (though I would not want to be in the building if a fire breaks out ... though who would?), plenty of seating without feeling too crowded.

Loved the live music.  Bouncer was also super friendly and cool so added bonus. Enjoyed the drink names (named after literary characters), and really enjoyed the Ohara.  Approximately  - $10 a drink.

Low key nights are very enjoyable - Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday.  I cannot attest to the weekend nights.
author: Mel E.

description: The atmosphere was great, the drinks were great! I think the noise level a little high, and although service was great when I got there, as it got more crazy it was a little slower. At all times the servers were still very nice and helpful.
author: Sylvia B.

description: I've only been here once, but the place left a definite impression on me - it's cute! There are tons of books lined all along the shelves built into all the walls and the bar is situated in the center. My friends enjoy coming here after work and I can see the appeal. It's a popular venue so it does take a while to get a drink. I personally waited for 15min before getting my Daisy Buchanan. I'd recommend ordering from their cocktails with character menu seeing as it is their unique theme.
author: Charlotte Z.

description: If you reserve a table for a certain number of people, be aware they don't actually provide seating for that number. Also, the drinks at the Novela are always tasty but the customer experience is always lacking. It feels like they are doing you a favor for letting you buy drinks there. Made a reservation for a table for 12 people, was seated in a space that comfortably fits 8, we squeezed in 10 but could not squeeze in the other 2 people. When we asked if we could get another chair we were reminded that Novela doesn't actually guarantee seating when you reserve a table. The table next to ours said they weren't using their chairs and offered them to us but the hostess / manager (not sure what her role was) told us chairs could not be moved from one table to another. When one of our guests (who hadn't heard that conversation) asked and borrowed a chair from another table the manager was incredibly rude to him and snatched the chair back. It was mostly the negative attitude and weird inflexible rules that turned us off.
author: Ben V.

description: I love Novela and I am a regular. It is an awesome place, perfect for Happy Hours and some type of celebrations. Drinks are great, ambiance is amazing, service is also top notch! What else can you ask for? I would totally recommend it instead of any other place in the city, five stars all the way!
author: Vadik A.

description: Cool spot. Nice cocktails. Bartenders looked  pissed off on this Saturday night for some reason, but didn't bother me. My Manhattan was a bit too sweet for my liking, but kept swishing around the huge ice cube for a while and sipped. Overall worth a visit.
author: Chris C.

description: I celebrated my birthday here and it was a lot of fun. I suggest to make reservation at yelp if you're a party of 8 or more. It's pretty easy. The crowd is young and vibrant. We ordered the punch and it's super yummy. My favorite one was the Cachaca! Awesome spot to hang out with friends or bring a date.
author: Maricar F.

description: I love the experience of Novela. The theme, decor, menu, and music. The library classical thing it has going works and it is definitely worth trying the various cocktails. It is probably the only place that I deviate from my typical vodka rocks or vodka soda cocktail. The menu of drinks and food is expertly put together and it's hard to go wrong. I love the names of the cocktails too, named after classical novel characters. I had my birthday in the back room and it was really damn nice. Check it out if you haven't been, return if you have!
author: Olivia O.

description: Punch on tap and great apps....whaaaaaaaat?!  Love this place's ambiance and drinks. A must if you're in SF on any occasion.
author: Farkhanda Z.

description: After attending the soft opening this past weekend I can honestly say these guys did an amazing job. The venue is beautiful and you can see how much creativity and hard work went into every inch of this place. The drinks and service were also great, the staff was very attentive and friendly. The crowd and atmosphere is exactly what this city has been missing. Definitely will be coming back.
author: Alexander K.

description: Love this bar! The ambiance is awesome & the drinks are creative & tasty. I will definitely be back with my friends.
author: Amber S.

description: Trendy, cute and a whole lot of fun. Fit out like you're being naughty and holding a party in the school library. Drinks were good and atmosphere was amazing! Went on a Saturday and stayed until closing!
author: Nathan Q.

description:
i don't really remember the last time i actually gasped when i walked into a bar/lounge. novela is gorgeous. there are walls of books (THEY'RE REAL!! at least...they're books. i didn't dare take anything down to inspect the pages) lit up in different colors, lots of plushy couches and areas for seating, and the space itself is huge! this is definitely a good place to go if you have a group. 

i didn't get to try any of the punch, but my two STRONG cocktails were enough for me for the night. i hate the taste of alcohol and prefer my drinks to be refreshing or sweet, so i went with the daisy buchanan - frothy and milky - and the helen keller with a shot of gin (the helen keller on its own is non-alcoholic...wopwop). the bartenders here are really nice and handled the huge opening night crowd very well.
author: Stephanie C.

description: For a lounge type bar, i was impressed. The ambiance was amazing. Nice and dark so you cant see anyone's ugliness and they had amazing lighting! The wallpaper of legs were not bad either as it actually complimented the whole theme of the place. The seating had gorgeous enormous seats that made you feel like you were some VIP at the club, and the bartenders were friendly and actually saw you (even w/o any cleavage). I would recommend it as a good spot to go to after a long day of shopping :)
author: Ladonna A.

description: Damn, this place is hopping. There is so much talent here, and the bartenders work their butts off. A lot of Asians frequent this place, even though it's in the middle of the newly gentrified SoMA portion. Parking is a hassle, but I highly recommend you get the seasonal punches if you can wrangle a spot and get in. Walking around and ordering drinks is a mess with so many people, and flagging down a table is also a bit of a bear, but man, there is A LOT of talent here. Prices are fairly standard for what you're getting, so it's not a huge hit on the wallet for the area. I would say the only thing I don't like so much about this lounge is how crowded it can get, but you can't really control that. People aren't rowdy, and everyone looks pretty spiffy here, so dress up and drink up. The beer selection is pretty good too (draft and bottles), but these aren't pint glasses you're paying for. It's a 12-ounce pour.
author: Danny C.

description: I have been wanting to try this place for a while and when i finally did l was very happy. The drinks were awesome especially the 3 whiskey punch. Also our server Natalie was great and really made the experience.
author: Jeremy R.

description: I like the theme and decor, and the fact that they have plenty of seating if you make a reservation. The drinks just aren't that good though.
author: Liz L.

description: Great place to party...had a blast here. the drinks were awesome and strong...exactly what i was looking for. Great decor and a fun atmosphere. Ill be back soon
author: Justin A.

description: Novela is by far the best bar in the city! Yummy drinks and awesome staff. Happy hour and weekend fun? Yes please! GO! You won't regret it!
author: Natasha G.

description:
Found this place on yelp and thought it was a great place for GNO.

Made a reservation for 10:30 for 6 people

Seated promptly at 10:30, my group decided to grab a drink while waiting for our table as we were a bit early for our reservation. Our server didn't actually arrive to our table until 11:12 and that was after I had to get up and locate the hostess twice regarding the absence of our server. Would have been a bigger deal if we didn't already have drinks but since we did it wasn't..so since we had approx. 45 minutes to look at the menu we were ready to order as soon as she arrived... we went with the bowl of punch. We found the punch (vodka based) to be incredibly sweet, it honestly taste like syrup puree. I ended up asking the server if we could switch it our for something else... it was that bad. ****Being that i was a server/ bartender for 7 years i think its incredibly important to educate the customer, if you know that the drink a customer is ordering is sweet, how much trouble is it to give someone a heads up? ( customer service) In hindsight we ordered punch, punch is a sweet drink so next time we will ask a bit more questions before committing to 45 ounces of sugar water. When we talked to our waitress she did say she would see what she could do and the manager offered to take 50% off and we did ask for some sparkling water to dilute which helped ...a little...but it was a struggle. Honestly the thing that bothered me the most was the waitress said to us when we asked: "why didn't you tell us it was so sweet"? the waitress responded  "well you seemed like you knew what you were ordering and its punch so I'm not even going to defend it" uhhhhhhhhh.... well we did have 45 minutes to look at the menu so yes we did know what we wanted to order. Also thats a bit rude

Overall I think Novela is a great place to have a few drinks and hang out, good music, ambiance but i would suggest stay away from the punch and go for a cocktail or a glass of wine.
author: Sylvia S.

description: Wow. Horrible service. Rude bartenders. Smells like wet rag.
author: Jessica Y.

description: My favourite cocktail place it has amazing cocktails:) the bar tenders are friendly and they know well what they are doing ! There is always space to sit and the environment has some nice decoration! I love the chandelier in the cages :) definitely recommended x
author: Maria G.

description:
It makes me sad that I've moved out of SOMA with all these fun new places opening up.  It's a good sign when I'm at the same bar two Fridays in a row, was there last Friday and heading back again tomorrow.  Really like how big the space is and the mix of tables and the big bar in the middle.  There is this really cute bar area nook in the back with the coolest looking chandeliers, I have a soft spot for neat lighting.  The drinks are well made, had quite a few Jay Gatsbys and pitchers of rum punch.  I'm hoping it was just because it was opening week but the bartenders were not very efficient in collecting money - my drink was made and then he went on to make 2 more people's orders before coming back for my money...it's a super crowded bar I'd like to move away so other people can order, you don't want to be that girl just standing there with the drinks!  The pitchers are hard to deal with if you don't have a table so booked a table for this Friday, Jen, the private events girl,  was really easy and nice to work with in reserving a table, great customer service and quick reply back.  Not sure if there is food regularly but saw a few people noshing on some finger foods, will try to check it out tomorrow.
