Note to self: if your drunk friends suggest hitting up Henry's Hunan afterwards be soberish enough to say No!

See you guys at Novela!
author: Jen C.

description: Attended the soft opening at the end of May! This place has a very cool vibe! I really enjoyed the theme, books on the walls and the character inspired cocktails. I had the Daisy, it was amazing. The tables are great, very intimate and chic. Plenty of places to sit and a good bar area. Interesting co-ed type bathroom, sinks/mirrors are shared. Great drinks, great atmosphere and great location - definitely going back!
author: Colleen M.

description: Seriously amazing drinks. They do an amazing job at recommending if your unsure of what you would like. Like no joke, they are amazing and make amazing drinks. Cool environment, and great service. No food but what more could you want with an awesome (and this is awesome!!!!) bar!!! Highly recommend!!!
author: Zoe D.

description: This was a nice hipster bar that is very reminiscent of the Commonwealth in Downtown Las Vegas. Everything in the bar is fun to look at. From the decorative books lining the walls to the wallpaper to the fancy liquors on the fancy shelving over the fancy bars. It gets PACKED and therefore, very warm. They have a cocktail menu with specialty drinks and they are ALL delicious.
author: May Y.

description: Great casual first date and group spot!
author: Sadia A.

description: Finally a truly classy spot in SOMA!! I have been twice already and both times proved to be a great experience. Cocktails are creative and delicious, service is friendly, and I love the literature them. I highly recommend Novela!
author: Amy O.

description: Amazing cocktails and punches. Perfect place for Fridays if you wanna see some men in suits and some girls in dresses! ( YES they do exist in SF! Not everyone goes to bars with hoodies, jeans and sneakers). I have been there 4 or five times. And last time I got invited to their first year birthday, an amazing block party with live music and truck foods.
author: Niki N.

description: Super Chic lounge! The decor is all done beautifully and there is a lot of sitting space, which makes for a great experience. The cocktails are great too, perhaps a little sweet, but the menu has icons indicating the strength of the drink. The punches are good, also a little sweet, I wanted to try the house punch, but it was the grand opening and they were sold out so ill have to go back for that. All of the staff were very friendly and it was a good crowd, lots of people straight off work from the financial district. I'd be interested to see what it's like later in the evening or on the weekend. I've already got plans to go back next week :)
author: Gloria B.

description: Novela feels a little stuffy, and it's a bummer they don't have food. I kind of appreciate how all their drinks are pretty hardcore though - there are a few girlier (sweet) drinks, but most are really strong and assertive. Several times I've been there with people who order something and it isn't what they were expecting at all (both in a good way and a bad way). I like how they push your limits!
author: Emily M.

description: Worst service ever! WILL NEVER EVER GIVE IT A TRY AGAIN!!! Especially the bartender is not professional AT ALL!
author: Katrin L.

description: A beautiful, classy place with a  very charming and welcoming atmopsphere. Great staff and good drinks menu. The punch selection is delicious!
author: Marina Z.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE. It is beautiful on the inside, and you can tell they paid attention to so many small details. I love that the drinks are named after major literary characters, and the whole vibe is very charming but hip. I would definitely come here for pre or post-dinner drinks (except on Fri/Sat), no food. 

I ordered the Pippi Longstocking (which I loved!!!) and the Pisco Punch (which was alright, I probably wouldn't order it again, but it's just not my style.). 

Can't wait to work my way through the rest of the cocktails :)
author: Margaret L.

description:
Two types of bars & restaurants in the world:  those with class, and those with TVs.  Novela is the latter.  

We roll in early on a Sunday and are the only patrons to the left of the bar.  Several huge TVs are ablaze with sportsball and ads for depends.  Upon asking to turn off the TV directly behind us, I'm told the manager or owner wants them kept on.  Is that so, fahrenheit 451?  Is the owner here?  Well, no, but they live across the street and might peer in through their window.  Ok, slavish tools.
author: dark l.

description: I'm torn about Novela.  I've been here a couple of times and I had a nice time. The crowd was pretty chill, and the decor of this place is cute.  BUT I had one of the grossest cocktails here!  I really couldn't drink it, and I don't say that often.  I guess if I come back here I'll get my fill on drinks at Local Edition down the street first...
author: Pam S.

description: This is officially my favorite bar/lounge in San Francisco. I love the library theme, the overall classy decor, and how their drinks are named after literary characters like Huckleberry Finn and Sherlock Holmes. The rainbow display of books along their shelves are real, filled with text. Fun fact, Harry Potter lives on the shelves. Great place to catch up with friends or to mingle in a larger group. They play good music too!
author: Cathy L.

description: I have been here thorugh a friend of mine's suggestion. It was a Friday afternoon. It was very crowded in a good way -young professional crowd.  decoration is very pleasant and the drinks are decent. I am not sure if they worth $13 but they are good. Music is fine. I would go again after work for couple of drinks.
author: Ali C.

description: All I really can say is WOW! The transformation from Fluid to Novela is absolutely stunning. I could not be more impressed and more happy to have a new happy hours/ lounge to go to.
author: jessika b.

description: If you love cocktails and mixology, this is definitely your place. Their cocktail menu is fantastic and inventive, and their punches are delicious! Great decor, people and vibe -- definitely worth checking out!
author: Jack P.

description: I've never been here... And I don't know why!  So cool, Downtown/FiDi/SoMa, good blend of volume, cocktails, and the crowd is diverse.  Definitely be back.
author: Brett B.

description: I've only been here after hours. The first time I went I wasn't impressed, the second time I went it was packed. I enjoyed the company I was there with both times. It's a cool place probably for an early evening with friends. The second time I went there was a line but it moved pretty fast. HAHAH of course I always try to cut ;) Works sometimes.
author: K T.

description: The drinks are amazing! I also love the set up of the place. Definitely get their house punch if you're a whiskey person...it's so good! The best bar I went to while in San Francisco! Definitely a must!
author: D V.

description: Solid cocktail bar with a good happy hour.  Get a little loud so be prepared for noise.
author: Anand A.

description: Great concept bar that I was really looking forward to enjoying.  I have been here many times and the lines are always ridiculous and prices for cocktails are just too much for what they are.  Also, the bouncers in the front take themselves a little too seriously. Lighten up and crack a smile bro.
author: Ronita J.

description: Great new addition to the area. Classy vibe, good music and great drinks. We walked in on a Thursday night. It was crowded, but not over crowded. The staff was very helpful in getting us situated and finding us seats. The Juliet Capulet was my fave. Made with Pisco and chamomile, it was light and refreshing and not too sweet. Definitely going back to this spot!
author: Caren K.

description: I happened by with a friend the week it opened and popped in. Wow. Love this place. Great decor, great service, plenty of space. A+.
author: Peter Y.

description: Terrific vibe with the books, music, and layout. Friendly bartenders (Taylor was terrific the entire night, helping out our entire group). Thank you for bringing an LA/SF fusion bar to our area!
author: Erik C.

description: Very impressed by this place.  The crowd consists of young professionals and the atmosphere is classy, elegant and hip. Drinks are great, bartenders are lovely.  A nice place to get together with a group of friends.  Or a nice place to booth hop and talk to the different crowds of people.
author: Priscilla S.

description: This used to be a cool place but it got really B&T and a little Hood. Such a same because there aren't many great lounge bar with great cocktails in the area.
author: SoCal Foodie M.

description: Friday happy hour was a blast the only draw back were the drinks as they are a bit pricy but the ambiance was great for after work. Reserving a table is a definite plus if needed and sharing the punch bowls, now that is a fantastic deal to share with close friends or make new ones
author: Shirley P.

description: Went here for happy hour, super cute and love the loungey and not clubby feel. All 4 of us ordered the tasting of 3 punches. None of them were particularly good, way over thought, but I really liked the concept of tasting a few drinks. The prices are great and the food truck that comes was really good. I will definitely come back but will stay way from the punches! I also tried a cocktail off their menu and it was very good.
author: Amber M.

description: I really enjoyed this place. I took a candidate here at 5.00 on the dot and we snagged a great place at the bar. My pro tip: the best drink is the non alcoholic one listed- add a shot of fancy vodka and you are in for a treat.
author: Danielle V.

description: Good drinks, love decor. Call in ahead of time if you want to reserve a table.
author: Julie R.

description: This bar is a welcome addition to the area, especially because I love rum and fruity drinks. Loved the dark, romantic interior and the literary references throughout the cocktail list. $14 for a flight of decently strong punches is a good deal- but they were all wayy too sweet (-1 star). There have to be at least 50 grams of sugar in one flight.
author: Pria P.

description: Ok. beautiful decor. drinks are good. crowd is financial with some marina mixed into it. it is always very crowded. there is a food truck in front of it for HH .. not a bad place. sometimes too pretentious.
author: C A.

description:
I've been here 3 times in 3 weeks. The atmosphere is chill, but it gets a little crowded.

The main reason for the low rating goes to the door man holding the line. There is no method to his decisions even though he says its a one in one out policy. Not even sure why he mentioned that policy if the bar itself was not too packed when I got in. I guess it is to create a line, but standing in front of the line for 30 minutes on 2 occasions just to get in does not sit well with me. Especially, because he just lets in his friends as they greet him in front of the line (this is not a ratio thing as most of the ones he let in were men).
author: Rich G.

description: Novela is one of my places to grab drinks in the city. It's a great lounge type ambiance. I'm over the crazy clubbing days. I prefer going to a nice place where we can just chill, talk, and enjoy quality drinks.
author: Richard P.

description: Novela is cool new spot to lounge with friends or take a first date. I didn't try any of their literary named drinks but didn't like that they didn't have Henne or possibly ran out? Whatever the case, Novela has potential.
author: robert c.

description: Our server Tara was so accommodating and cool and funny. I had so much fun here and drank delicious drinks! The music is awesome, 60's soul music, and Tara made it that much more fun! Really cool bar, cute drink names and amazing decor!
author: Krystina C.

description: yes yes to Nerds and tech people tryin' to get down on a Friday night , super loud but amazing spot .
author: NAEL K.

description: It was cute but it pigeon holes itself as a bar to go to see and be seen. The waitresses were all a "type" and the patrons seemed rude. Not someplace I want to go to relax- too bad because some of those drinks were rockin'
author: B S.

description: Okay, nice looking place, good bartenders who can make real drinks.  On the negative, the techie guys who hang out here may be making bank, but do they have to wear backpacks to a bar?  And what's with the large majority of seating areas being reserved?  Walk-ins not good enough?  That aside, it's a fun place to wind down...when you find a seat.
author: Mark Z.

description: Are you freaking kidding? Incredible name + incredible drinks = ridiculously delicious bar. Came here to meet my friend and came out of here a believer. I decided to choose the Hemingway Punch which was literally  famazing (part fantanstic, part amazing) - it was as if Hemingway made it himself. The place is pretty cool and trendy although the bar is awkwardly not in the middle of the place or at least it feels that way when you walk in but nonetheless that does not take away from the incredible ambiance. I literally feel like in a telenovela show, drinking fancy drinks and just waiting for someones gf to walk in and find their bf speaking to another girl - then snap - everything gets real. You must come here if you love delicious drinks, do not come here if you are an introvert. You're welcome.
author: Pablo P.

description: The waiter could have been more attentive... or remotely engage my group, but the overall experience was good
author: John M.

description: Went here for an after work drink. Great drinks and vibe (loved that I didn't have to wait to get in).  Had the Pippy, was a great refreshing drink, a little on the sweet side but good none the less.  Will be frequenting it often.
author: Sheetal P.

description: Our server was great.  She was attentive - even as the place got crowded - and very apologetic when I got an allergic reaction to the Tequila punch!  They didn't list a key ingredient in the cocktail - Nutmeg - which evidently I am a bit allergic to!  It was REALLY loud.  Terrible acoustics but the drinks were tasty and the decor really cool.
author: Courtney D.

description: Crapy service !!!! I had to wait almost 45 min for couple drinks. Good luck to get bartender's attention !
author: Christian V.

description: Came here on Friday night around 7PM. We had a reservation for a table, and I guess it was a good thing, because the place was pretty busy when we got there. The place is dimly lit, and is decorated really cool! The back wall has what looks like a big bookshelf with books. I couldn't get close enough to see if it they were real books or not, but nevertheless it looked amazing! We were seated at the table, and I have to say the chairs are really low, and the table is really high. It was a little awkward for me to sit, and I feel like I am pretty average height. About 30 minutes after we seated, the place got extremely loud. It was so hard to carry a conversation with the person I was sitting across from. We ended up leaving after a couple of drinks, because we couldn't hear each other at all. I wouldn't mind coming back here, but I think I would just sit at the bar where the person is closer to me, so I can hear them.
author: Mitoon D.

description:
The decor of this bar is nice. It has a lot of space for standing around and a few tables and chairs. I really like how spacious each toilet stall was but black toilets make me nervous because you can't see if anyone took a dump/vomit and not clean after themselves, especially in a bar. 

I came here during the soft opening and the bartenders were terrible at making drinks. This place is trying to be a mixology bar but the drinks weren't blended or balanced well. When the bartender had trouble stirring two drinks simultaneous I began to worry. Then maybe the owner or someone walked by and he took a sip and said the drink didn't taste right, so my bartender kept trying the drink to check if the taste was correct..she basically drank half the drink since she couldn't get it right. I think she gave up because the drink tasted terrible. Then we gave them another try by getting the draft punch sampler, we figured you can't screw up a pre-made drink. We were wrong..you can screw up punch, it was so sweet it tasted like simple syrup with food coloring. I also don't think they use much alcohol in their drinks because I was drinking prior and felt the alcohol kicking in but when I got to Novela I started to loose my buzz...not cool especially when your drinks are $10. Was hoping to end the night on a good note but ended disappointed.
author: Victoria C.

description: The bartender Josh is the man - there is absolutely no place with better cocktails. This is our go-to spot for everyone to meet up on Friday and hit the city. Great vibe, great people, I recommend it highly!
author: Chris G.

description: Great place. Great drink menu. I recommend going during happy hour otherwise it's a bit pricey
author: Harpreet K.

description: Cool bar, it's busy and big. The music was quite good, the crowd was lively and having a good time and the drinks were all book/author themed which was cool, but most of all they were well made and came pretty quickly.
author: Ash S.

description: Came here a couple of weekends ago and this is def. a great place to come after work or to just chill with friends. The vibe as you walk in is a very relaxed one with the walls covered with bookshelves. The layout of this place is rather interesting with two sides to this place but the bar only facing one side... would have been nice to have the bar on both sides for easier access (one star off for this). Other then that, the bartenders are really chill, the bouncers are really cool and work with you to get your party in. As I was not drinking that night, I can't say much for the drinks but my friends stated it was pretty strong. I would def. come back again for either an after work get together or pre-party scene.
author: Imran M.

description: Recently attended a 30th birthday celebration at Novela, and I must say I L O V E the crowd.  It has a good mixture and everyone seemed a lot older than 2 I (Thank God)!  Great place to have Happy Hour after work, place was packed and happening by 7PM or so.  A lot of people were in dressy/trendy work attire, great friendly crowd enjoying drinks on a Friday evening.  I am planning another visit soon.  Unfortunately, I didn't get to try any of their specialty drinks.  I will write an update as soon as I do.
author: Nance V.

description: Great spot.  Good vibe.  Classy atmosphere.  Cool crowd.  Good amount of people but not packed where it's uncomfortable.  Awesome drinks.  Definitely a new spot worth checking out.  It's got a great vibe on Saturdays too!
author: Nelson W.

description: Fern bar oozing heterosexual bridge and tunnel vibe. The fake book store decor might charm an analphabet but to anyone with a splash of education it is just downright tacky. But what the heck, maybe you'll get lucky, if you know what I mean.
author: Daniel E.

description: Good volume of music + beautiful, young people + fun cocktails = a very chic, new place to go to!
author: Ronald T.

description: Overrated. I've been here a few times and even though the ambiance and drinks are good, it doesn't offset the fact that the bartenders are unfriendly and take way too long to make the drinks. Also, the layout is weird and it's overly crowded when you enter
author: Virg L.

description: The atmosphere is really great.  I liked the vibe of the crowd.  I give it only 4 stars because our drinks weren't very good.  We ordered book themed cocktails and they were both terrible.  They may refined the menu in the past month but it wasn't good about a month or two ago.
author: Kacie M.

description: Trendy speakeasy decor nice place to hang out. Bartenders were super busy hard to get drinks. I'd definitely go again for the relaxed environment.
author: Jazzy B.

description:
This place is so classy looking!!!! I love the decor at this place; everything from the look of the bar, to the lighting structures, all the way down to the look of the chairs!!!! My first thought when I saw the big chairs was, "wow I could totally curl up in one of those and fall asleep, they look so comfortable!!!"

Anyways, came here with a few friends after dinner on a Tuesday night. This place was poppin'!!! Who would have thought that people actually go out and have fun on a Tuesday night??? Not me!!!! We were able to snag a table and we ordered the pitchers of punch. Man!!!! Their drinks are strong but weirdly tasty. 

I was very impressed with all the drinks we ordered. We had a very attentive waitress who kept checking up on us every so often; JOSIE IS AMAZING!!!! 

I will definitely be visiting place more often!!!!
author: Natalie C.

description: Great place for some after work drinks or a good meet up spot.  If you have 4 or more people, do yourself a favor and order the bottle of old fashion they make.
author: Manny g.

description: Great place to grab drinks but it can sometimes be a little loud.
author: Amy S.

description:
The space is amazing and stylish. The seats are comfy. The drinks are well-crafted and unique. The servers were FANTASTIC and attentive but Amanda the hostess was incredibly rude. Like, condescending, unhelpful, and borderline uppity. We made a reservation online, which she impatiently told us they didn't have. She proceeded to be irritated that we still wanted to be seated somewhere and obnoxiously told us that they could maybe seat us somewhere until another real reservation came in. She treated us like street urchins and didn't even come close to a smile. This was also right at 7 when they had JUST opened and were virtually empty. We were told that the other reservation would cause us to be uprooted at 9:30. Okay, that's fine. Over 2 hours was more than enough time to enjoy our yummy literary themed concoctions. 

At 8:50 the same rude hostess came back and plopped a sassy "reserved" sign on our table as if to remind us what second-class citizens we were. We all wanted to lay her out. She was also browsing her cell phone at the hostess stand and we even saw her ignore customers that came through the door. Meanwhile, our two servers were cheery, helpful, and efficient. Novela, get rid of this terrible hostess. She creates a super negative first taste in your mouth that not even a Jay Gatsby or Atticus Finch could rinse out.
author: Danielle K.

description: I absolutely loved the theme of this bar! I enjoyed the book-style decor and character-named drinks so much that I wold venture to come here solo. I had a small group and was glad I made a reservation as the place filled up quickly as soon as it was 5:30. (Though it never got too loud that i could not hear others in my group speaking) The drinks were a tad pricey to me, but this is San Francisco, and the selection of drinks and novelty of the bar was a fair trade in my opinion. I would have liked a few more snack/appetizer selections, but my group did order the Charcuterie plate and I thought that was reasonably priced for the variety it provided. My group commented on how surprisingly good everything was. Needless to say, I will be coming back here!
author: Liz O.

description:
This place is amazing. I came on a Tuesday night with my brothers just to check it out. The decor is amazing, has a real "speak easy" feel and I personally love that. It completely sets the ambiance of the whole place. 

All the employees are wonderful and very helpful if it is your first time there, and with the wonderful drink selection they had their suggestions really played a big part in our night. We ordered a pitcher of the Cognac fruit punch and we did not regret it one bit. The flavor was amazing. Not only did it do its job to give you a buzz but it was refreshing. 

Its official this will become our weekly go to. Thank you again for a great time everyone at Novela.
author: Ray P.

description: Awesome bar-lounge! Very cool concept, Great atmosphere, great service, excellent cocktail. For sure one the best venue in SF! Love it ;)
author: Manu E.

description: Wow. This place sucks. Talk about no loyalty. Kicking out a group of polite professionals that patronize this place on a regular basis because you don't allow dancing and the impolite waitress that obviously took out her bad day on us. So on your not so busy Tuesday or Wednesday nights we'll take our business elsewhere. Good luck!
author: Melissa M.

description: Cool venue, tasty punches, horrible customer service. I ordered a $10 drink, paid with a $20 bill and only received $9 in change. When I inquired about the missing dollar, they said it was because of tax. I mentioned that sales tax isn't 10%, the bartender gave me a laugh and carried on. Later, when sitting with a group, we had a $90 bill and $18 gratuity was included. When I mentioned that 18% of $90 was in fact $16, not $18, the server said that the 'people in the back' calculate tips and there was nothing she could do about it. I didn't care about the few extra bucks she was giving herself, but to overcharge a customer and then act like there was nothing she could do to fix the situation was an insult. Frustrated, I paid the overcharged bill and left. I will not be returning. Posted drink prices should include tax, and if you're going to auto include 18% gratuity, make sure your math is correct.
author: Ion F.

description: I LOVE THE DECOR HERE! It caters to my nerdy and OCD needs. Novela is one classy place, the lighting is kind of dim so it's really nice and intimate. Great place to take a date and unwind after a long day. I love how they stay true to the theme here, even the drinks have a literary slant. I got the Juliet Capulet, not a fan of the character (come on killing yourself for a guy you met 3 days ago? not the best move there) but I was a fan of the drink! To sum it up, love this place, great drinks great atmosphere, just wish it were closer to work.
author: Amy M.

description: So great, we always start our nght off here! Josh, our bartender was amazing. He definitely makes an effort to make everything perfect. Will be back soon!!!
author: Angie K.

description: Considering that I was shot three times here while at work and the owner continues to ignore it, I'll give it one star. Big ups to the coke head owner John Park. Too bad he wasn't around while people were looking for him. Would be nice if the owner could help pay his "family's hospital bills" instead of putting coke up his nose or paying for strippers, but guess that's his Novella. Look up Aug 27 2011 same address.
author: Sarah S.

description: Great atmosphere and solid drinks. Made a reservation at was 20 minutes late and hostess was kind enough to hold the table until we got there.
author: Naomi L.

description:
I had an extremely bad experience at Novela last night! I wanted to share this with everyone, this is the reason I got a yelp account! 
Last night we were there, after a while I was talking to my friend in front of the bar and when I wanted go back so called security person detained my ID, accused me that it was fake (Even though my jacket was inside). Since he doesn't have a right to detain it, I called the Police, when they realized I called the police another guy came and wanted to give my ID back. He said police is very busy so you'll need to wait more than an hour for the police to come. I wish I could wait for the police but I took it back. In 3-5 min police arrived and told me they cannot detain my ID and when they do they will be accused for theft. By the end, the guy who gave my ID back apologized me however, so called security person didn't apologized and he was proud for this fact. He was very very rude!! 
Of course I don't want to claim everyone is like that at Novela but for their brand they should take some actions for their rude security person because his attitude was unacceptable!
author: Nurcan S.

description: Classy lounge/bar , the music is a little low but love the ambience ..give your self a reason to dress up for a drink out on the town
author: Manoosh M.

description: yeah their drinks are different. so what? the hostesses / waitresses are completely bitchy. i asked about their birthday specials and table reservations and they just told me to email the website. i did and got no response. my friend did and they responded to her a week later. then never again. my friend asked me, do you still want to have a party here? HELL NO. why would i willingly give my money to people who clearly don't give crap that you're interested in their establishment or not? what a total pain in the ass just to talk to someone. i don't care how cool their layout is, it ain't worth it. i chose Mr. Smith's instead and got a way better deal.
author: Pamela B.

description: Make a reservation or you and your party will be stuck walking around with a pitcher and no space to sit or stand. Speaking of their pitchers... Excellent. They generally offer a taste before you order one so you might as well take a sip of one of their 6 well-known blends before dropping $45. That said, totally worth it. Great atmosphere and perfect for a small post-office happy hour.
author: James W.

description: Amazing drinks. Great service. What more could you ask for? I would recommend this place to anyone. The drinks named after your favorite novel are the best!
author: Blake M.

description: Good drinks, nice ambience and friendly staff.
author: Molly C.

description: Was here on Sunday. Solid cocktails, but something was just a bit off. I think the space may be a touch to vast for the feeling I think they are trying to evoke.  The cocktails were great, we had the gatsby, the sherlock holmes, and the atticus finch. All drinks were yummy, but my friend and I found the bar staff lacking essential knowledge, and really was just trained to make drinks. All in all a good weekday, sunday evening spot.
author: Jenny E.

description: Eric was the highlight behind the bar. Mixology at its finest! Grab a spot in his section and watch him work it!!
author: Arman D.

description: While the drinks and atmosphere here is wonderful, I can't give this place more than 1 star out of principle.  I've come here twice and they have charged me more than the receipt each time.  For instance, I charged $10.88 + $2 tip once, and my credit card bill showed $13.88.  While I don't care much for or want to spend the effort to dispute a dollar, it is still a dishonest practice that has to stop. For the sake of Novela, I do hope that this problem is unique to me and affects no one else.
author: Josh Q.

description: Trendy vibe, good looking people; over priced and watered down drinks
author: R C.

description: probably one of my favorite bars in the city. the vibe is great but it gets REALLY crowded on weekends. the huck finn drink is absolutely delicious if you don't mind girly drinks haha. definitely excited to go back to try their punch!
author: Louis O.

description: I've walked by this place a million times during the day but have yet to make it out to SOMA for the nightlife. I plan on going this weekend with some friends so I can let you know how it goes but I'm writing this review because I just met a lovely bartender, Josh who works there. I met him at Philz Coffee recently and found out he bartends there! So I asked him about it and he told me all about the menu and the vibe and was so nice! I can't wait to try out their unique cocktails and go out for a fun night at a bar that actually does table service.
author: Jen M.

description: It's a super cool bar. Drinks are a bit expensive. One shot is like 11 dollars.
author: Kate J.

description: Nice vibe with good seating.  Would only come after work for happy hour.
author: around town e.

description: Currently my favorite lounge in the city. No cover, good drinks, good crowd, good music and the bouncers aren't douchebags.
author: Minh N.

description: Cool looking bar. Clearly filling a gap in SF because it gets really crowded. Good for groups.
author: Ingrid R.

description: Denied entry because I didn't have my ID with me (I'm above 40y old...). I suggest giving the dog at the entrance some training on manners and how to interact with people. We came for a birthday party ready to spend money. Will not come back.
author: bob r.

description: this is a new place with a lot of potential.  the drinks are good, the atmosphere is good, the seating is decent.  however, the space feels lopsided and uneven, with all the people (because it gets packed) squashed in on one side of the place, logically, the side where the bar is.  the bathroom is past all these hoards of people, so you have to squeeze your way past them to the back, and then fight your way through the crowd to get out again.  it takes forever to order a drink if you aren't there first, and don't make the choice of leaving your tab open, you'll have to wait forever in line just to close it out.
author: Seymour D.
